jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE

The ECMC Innovation Lab is an incubator for new products and initiatives at ECMC Group and its affiliates. We develop next-generation solutions that empower students to succeed in all types of higher education.

WHAT WE DO

Based in Washington, D.C., we’re part of a growing and powerful ecosystem of ed tech innovators, policy experts and decision makers during what can only be described as a transformational moment for higher education. We are working to increase transparency in college costs, empower students to make more fully informed decisions about financing their education and advance innovative models for success in career school training.

Chief among these projects is our work to continuously enhance College Abacus, the “Kayak.com of college cost comparison” – a free online tool that allows college-bound students and their families to calculate and compare personalized, bottom line costs across 5,600 colleges in one, centralized place. To further expand the reach and impact of College Abacus, we have developed and now operate a suite of complementary partner tools: Pell Abacus, which is designed to address the unique challenges facing low-income students applying to college, and Spanish language versions of the two tools, College Ábaco and Pell Ábaco.

As part of our work to support ECMC Group’s overarching mission of helping students succeed and achieve their academic and professional goals, we are also focused on seeding and nurturing creative approaches to improving student outcomes across our national network of Everest and WyoTech career college campuses.

HOW WE DO IT

We use design, technology and research to make the promise of higher education more attainable.

Our Lab follows the Human-Centered Design process in order to build products and processes that embrace the strengths of students, give them ownership over their decisions and empower them to reach their goals.

ABOUT THE FRONT END DEVELOPER ROLE

The Front End Developer will join the Development team in building consumer-facing products related to education and finance, as well as continuing to develop CollegeAbacus.org.

The developer will work in a team environment in the design and execution of rich, interactive web and mobile applications. The developer will manage front-end assets, develop unit-tests, debug issues/bugs, document, implement and maintain custom or legacy code while adhering to the standards within the department and company.

ABOUT THE EDUCATIONAL DESIGNER ROLE

The Educational Designer will work primarily with our partners at Zenith Education to creatively impact career and technical higher education. Using the Human Centered Design process, the Educational Designer will research, synthesize, ideate, prototype and ultimately implement innovative solutions to critical challenges faced by students at these schools – potential project range from making schools more supportive for non-traditional students and rethinking job placement, to aligning teacher best practices and reimagining the role of alumni. The Educational Designer will own and drive these projects under the guidance of the Lead UX Designer.

ABOUT THE UX DESIGNER ROLE

Under the direction of the Lead UX Designer, the UX Designer will have a hands on experience taking a product from research to implementation, will own a product and make critical decisions. Our agile team eagerly takes on new projects with varied skills, requiring self confidence and an eagerness to learn. Working directly in the Human-Centered Design process, the UX Designer will work with multiple projects across various mediums, including but not limited to web design, app design, print design and systems design. There will be room for growth and mentorship with work that has substantial impact on unemployment, student loans and making schools affordable and attainable for all students.

jobs.title: Node / Angular / Javascript Engineer
jobs.content:
As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

To help us achieve our goals, we are seeking Node Software Engineers to join our team. You will leverage your knowledge to develop new consumer focused products using modern Engineering such as Continuous Integration and Deployment. As a developer at Weight Watcher, your code, designs and decisions will be highly visible, and will directly impact and delight lots of users. 



What you will do: 




  • Program daily in node.js, AngularJS, Express, Jade, Bootstrap and others.

  • Build out restful endpoints and lightweight aggregation layers.

  • Build out unit tests and other automated tests.

  • Build out new features and iterate on existing features.

  • Design and implement low-latency, high-availability and performant applications 

  • Enable analytics via tag management and logs.

  • Help define architectures and design patterns.

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Answer technical inquiries on code base and product Lead the way with writing programmatic unit tests.

jobs.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring a core team that will build a new product technology platform from the ground up. The new platform will be a vital part of the company’s transformation and its reimagined product offering. From technology selection and architecture to team structure and processes, the core team will take on the challenge of building a new Micro Service Architecture that will power Weight Watchers over the coming years.

What you will do:



  • Design and build new core micro services that will power our products and partner integrations.

  • Build Restful and Asynchronous Endpoints.

  • Design and build persistent solutions using NoSQL technologies such as Cassandra.

  • Design and build caching solutions.

  • Integrate with downstream systems using messaging platforms such as RabbitMQ.

  • Build/Integrate with LDAP/OpenAM and enable secure integration with Oauth.

  • Build services that have been designed with Big Data in mind from the ground up, enabling powerful data mining.

  • Use AWS and Rackspace cloud infrastructure

  • Build unit and integration tests.

  • Using modern CI/CD techniques, you will ship product very regularly.

jobs.content:
Live who you are. That’s our philosophy. At Corcoran we build our business around this very human truth — making every effort to understand the hopes, dreams, and unique personalities of our clients. Then we use that understanding, and all our resources, to find homes that go beyond the checklist, and even the wish list, to that wonderful feeling you get when something just feels right.


The Agent Experience team builds features and mobile-first products that empower agents with best-in-class technology to deepen their relationships with customers, improve their workflow and efficiency, and expand their business. Corcoran is dedicated to nurturing, supporting and attracting the top real estate agents in our markets. You will be at the center of that mission.

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.content:
Summary of the role



Lead the project team through the definition and planning phases and then monitor and control the project to completion.


Projects are typically belonging to the class 3 of the Project Portfolio (Medium Projects).



Main responsibilities



• Advise and assist project team members in the application of project management and Agile methods, tools, techniques, standards and processes
• Lead the adoption and measure the adherence to Agile practices throughout the project life cycle 
• Orchestrate the (virtual) team for the tribe
• Handle the interface outside the virtual team - functionally and technically
• Define Tribe release strategy and roadmap
• Manage priority changes and impacts on tribe delivery roadmap


• Act as a facilitator, and provide accurate recommendations (functional, technical, organizational, etc.) that fit in the constraints of his/her scope
• Identify (and share) and follow-up with the dependencies, internal and external
• Identify (and share) and process all the risks and opportunities
• Escalate any situation that require senior/executive management attention or decision making
• Promote the bottom-up, top-down and transversal communication. As such, the reporting activity is a key part of this role, especially within the scope/time/cost area, and as well risks, functional, technical, organizational aspects
• Monitoring project progress to track and anticipate any deviations (scope, time, budget, ... ) while executing the plan agreed with the line organization/s.


• Create and execute development work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements. 
• Manage the day-to-day operational aspects of the development.
• Ensure management of project controls (risks, issues and dependencies).
• Review project deliverables and ensure they are of the appropriate level of quality, on time and within budget in accordance with the project plan.
• Observe team performance and ensure proper training and coaching
• Specifically provide agile training and coaching
• Promote and encourage knowledge sharing
• Handle resource capacity planning and budgeting
• Participate to the processes and tools improvement
• Provide leadership and guidance to coach, motivate and lead team members to their optimum performance levels and career development

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
The development team at onPeak is looking for a developer who loves all things database.  We don’t just want someone to administer backups and configure user accounts.  We want someone who can do low level performance tuning and optimization of stored procs.  Someone who sits in the land between devops and development with a mind for databases.  Automation surrounding the deployment of schema changes, performance optimization in AWS EC2, caching layer optimizations are all examples of responsibilities of the job.  This person should swim in SQL, marathon in mongo, and relish in redis and not be afraid of some complexity and getting their hands dirty.


The Database Developer (Web Application Developer) role first and foremost responsibility is the performance, scalability and reliability of our data layer.  This is primarily our MSSQL cluster which drives multiple high availability web applications, but also includes redis caching layers, Amazon Redshift datawarehouses, and mongoDB session databases.   This position would also be deeply involved in database versioning systems and automated deployment of schema changes.


This position will report to the Director of Software Development.


Our small team of 10 is super casual.  Even Jake from State Farm is a little formal for our office.  Our team is all friendly and enjoy regular game nights, movie outtings, cook offs, etc.  But if you are the loner type that is fine by us as well - nothing social is ever manditory.  We all think it's a top priority to actually like coming to work.  


Our prevailing technological philosophy is a combination of simplicity and automation.  Never do by hand what a machine can do better and with fewer errors.  Pair programming for newer devs, and code reviews through pull requests are some of the ways we like to introduce and teach people about our application stack.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:

Universal Laser Systems is a world-class leader, pioneering the future of laser technology by creating innovative solutions that enable people to bring ideas which positively impact the world, to life.  Be a key part of Universal’s dynamic Marketing team.  We are looking for an exceptional Web Architect/Sr. Developer who will lead in this role.


Are you a Web Architect/Sr. Developer, looking for a phenomenal and exciting opportunity? Do you love the upbeat feeling and excitement of a start up with the security of a tenured company? Do you enjoy working with a collaborative team of developers AND working on your own as well?

If this sounds like you, keep reading...

We are targeting a highly-motivated Web Architect/ Sr. Developer to join a high-performance team to build out a brand-new, next-generation corporate web presence.  You must be a strong contributor with a high-quality mindset, be able to adapt quickly to leverage emerging technologies, and utilize your demonstrable experience and dedication to ensure that our customers are delighted by and excited about our products. The Web Architect /Sr. Developer will work closely with the Marketing Operations Manager, other designers and developers, and IT as part of an agile team.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - Online Travel Technology
jobs.content:
Large scale, modern technologies -


Our services are built around a core of django, postgres, and redis, with millions of people per day using some aspect of the system. On a monthly basis, millions of individually customized (solicited) emails are processed in our celery queues. The javascript frontend is built using backbone.js and nunjucks, with a modular design enabled by TypeScript. Building, testing, and deploying to any of our environments are as simple as pushing a commit to a git branch.


We like to keep our technology up-to-date. In addition to product and business development plans, we have a technology development plan: for instance, the next evolution of our architecture is to move components of the system into Docker containers to make deployment even easier.


All of the technology is built and maintained by this small development team, so from day 1, software you write will be used by people from all over the world.



You'll be a core member of the team -


Individual growth is important to us. We schedule time every week to explore an interest or learn something new. Our switch to nunjucks came out of this research time, as did our migration to Docker. Team members have also used it to do everything from learning new data science techniques, to playing with the office HoloLens. We also take time each day to discuss what we're working on, and even pair program from time to time to teach each other about parts of the codebase. There's no risk of stagnation in this job - in a few years you'll still have cutting edge programming skills.


Quality is important: We build automated tests for both the back- and front-end of our software, using both the python unittest framework and the Mocha javascript test framework. If a bug does slip through, we prioritize it - the end result being that we often have no known bugs.


We're a close-knit team located in the gorgeous Flatiron building in Atlanta and have a variety of challenging work on our plates. A typical day can consist of everything from optimizing the fare prediction system in the morning to putting the finishing touches on a CSS animation in the afternoon. Lunch is often spent at one of the many adjacent restaurants, discussing the fine points of quadcopter racing. Our work spans multiple technologies, cultures, and languages (both programming and spoken), so we value high quality communication and a continuous process of learning from each other.



Make travelling easier -


Volantio improves the end-to-end airfare marketing/search/purchase process for some of the worlds biggest airlines, from being honest about prices in ads, to delivering emails that only contain real fares that you actually care about. If you've ever seen an anger-inducing email from an airline with prices that are a blatant lie: we fix that, with the recipient happy to see our messages and asking for more.


Our airline partners like what we do so much that some have even made tv advertisements to promote their use of our software.

jobs.content:

Enrollment is currently underway, and space is limited. Apply today!


http://www.cooksys.com/fasttrackd-stackoverflow/

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (m/f) - Durham, NC/USA
jobs.content:
commercetools is one of the world's leading providers of cloud-based e-commerce technology. On the basis of a highly available platform, complex retail models across all sales channels and for all devices can be implemented. By means of an extensive e-commerce API, existing corporate processes and technologies are connected flexibly. For our Durham based tech office we are looking for a talented Senior Full-Stack Developer who’s supporting our Technical Director in our new tech hub in downtown Durham, NC. Up for a new challenge in the growing e-commerce industry? Join our team!

Responsibilities:

  • Work together with our Technical Director North America on projects in different areas with focus on full-stack development
  • Independent handling of special IT projects
  • Assuring support our US customers and partners together with your growing team
  • Support the Technical Director and our German Systems Engineers/DevOps team with admin and ops tasks (such as deployment automation, working on accounts, CDN, security, logs, etc.)
  • Help to organize and conduct technical trainings to our partners
  • Support in the architecture and estimation process for new projects
  • Support for technical pre-sales meetings

Requirements:

  • Finished degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering or comparable education
  • At least three years of practical full-time work experience in a similar role
  • Knowledge of common programming languages (imperative and functional, preferred in Java, JavaScript/ES6)
  • Fast learner with a quick perception who’s willing to get an understanding for our e-commerce platform
  • Enthusiastic to dive deeper into the DevOps world
  • Outstanding problem-solving ability as well as very good analytical skills
  • High hands-on mentality
  • Aspiration to constantly improve yourself and learn new technologies and concepts
  • Very good English language skills
  • Team player with good communication skills, high reliability and a good dose of pragmatism
  • Entitled to work for any US employer
  • Availability ASAP

What we offer:

  • 100% coverage of the employees health care premium, vision and dental insurance of a basic plan
  • 401k (retirement savings)
  • Some pre-tax benefits through the PEO
  • Great team of highly qualified and motivated Software Engineers who work with a mutual respect and appreciation, take responsibility and evolve together
  • Work on and with Open Source Software
  • Joint decisions regarding tools and approaches
  • New technologies (Java 8, ES6, React.js, Webpack, GraphQL, microservices, asynchronous IO, reactive architectures, etc.)
  • Attend (and organize) internal trainings, workshops, tech talks as well as hackathons, meetups and conferences
  • Challenging and meaningful projects in a company with over 10 years of history, which has became with their innovative commercetools platform one of the technology leaders in the growing e-commerce business
  • Long-term and strategic stability by being a 100% subsidiary of REWE Digital (part of the REWE Group)
  • Growing, international company with three offices in Berlin, Munich, New York City and Durham
  • Collegial, open working atmosphere and scope for new ideas
  • Healthy feedback and error culture and a climate of mutual appreciation
  • Modern workplace and technology (e.g. MacBooks) in a stylish co-working space in downtown Durham
  • Flexible, family-friendly working hours and the possibility of working from home
  • Free water, coffee, tea

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thrive Bioscience is building the machines that make stem cells. As scientists get closer to using stem cells in humans, there is an ever increasing need to automate the process of making, modifying and growing stem cells. Thrive's mission is to deliver that automation.


Thrive's instruments involve robotics, image processing, fluid handling, refrigeration / heating and centrifugation. These are complicated devices that manipulate living cells.


Thrive's founders, management and board each have decades of experience building and growing successful, technologically innovative companies. We work with world-class scientists at leading institutions to develop the instruments and software they need to push their research forward.


We are looking for a software developer to join our engineering team. You will help us build a dynamic scheduler that manages cell culture plates, reagents & other resources in these innovative robotic cell culture systems.

jobs.title: Jr. iOS Developer
jobs.content:
About the Role


We’re looking for a talented Jr. iOS Developer to join our growing Brooklyn-based mobile development agency. You’ll work with our Clients, Designers, Project Managers, and other Developers to create cutting-edge codebases for our clients’ diverse native mobile applications.


The people who thrive in this position can switch modes easily between solo efforts and team projects, and can overcome a wide array of coding challenges. They enjoy the rigor of producing high quality code that’s at the forefront of industry innovation. They’re thorough, detail-oriented, and take pride in their work. We are these things, too.


Working at App Partner


Fact is, the kind of people who work at App Partner could work just about anywhere. They’re smart. They’re creative. They’re fun. They’re engaged. And they take a ridiculous amount of pride in doing what needs to be done to make sure our clients get what they need, when they need it. So why do they choose to work at App Partner? Simple. Because we get it.


We get that most people want to work in a great office in a vibrant neighborhood like Brooklyn – not some office park in suburbia. We get that work needs to be fun, vibrant and exciting – but never distracting. We get that transparency, communication and opportunities for growth matter. A lot. And that free snacks don’t hurt, either. We get that work is a big part of your life, but it’s not your whole life. And we get that smart, creative people want to be around other smart, creative people. Think you have what it takes? Apply and let’s talk.


Responsibilities:



  • Create, modify, and test high-quality code

  • Work from specifications drawn up by our Sr. Developers or Head of Development

  • Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, developers, and strategists

  • Take ownership of the projects you’re assigned

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Growth Engineer at Trello, you'll be driving company growth at the intersection of product, engineering, marketing, and data. We'll be working together to build features and run experiments to improve acquisition, engagement, retention, revenue, and virality.


We're establishing a team that brings together people with a range of skills to break down metric-based goals into small components, iterate on experimentations in those areas to generate improvement, and to share those improvements and knowledge with everyone at Trello.


Key Responsibilities:


As a member of the growth team you'll decide what you work on to meet the goals we have as a team. Some of the things you might be responsible for:



  • Collaborating with the team and using your experience, intuition, and analysis to decide where we should focus next.

  • Developing and improving our tools for experimentation.

  • Implementing analytics to find where users are engaging, what they're interested in, what works and what doesn't.

  • Improving our data pipeline and reporting to enable us to make better decisions.

  • Working with the rest of the team to to implement features and experiments across marketing pages, our web app, and emails.

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer - Platform Team
jobs.content:

You must be innovative, flexible, self-directed, and able to design and write efficient, reliable and maintainable code. The ability to function at a very high level in a fast paced environment along with a team of very talented engineers is essential.


You will maintain high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and provide technical leadership whenever necessary for successful project delivery.

jobs.title: NoSQL Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49255



There are some common yet complex problems application teams at Bloomberg face - challenges of large-scale data storage, low-latency retrievals, high-volume requests and high availability over a distributed environment. Our group, Foundational Services, aims to create standardized solutions to these challenges by building core services and technology frameworks for enterprise-wide use.

We are building these platforms using NoSQL open source technologies. But, when it comes to latency and high availability, these technologies often don't meet our service expectations in their off-the-shelf form. We want to change that. That's why we have been making novel open source contributions to technologies such as Apache HBase and Kafka. We introduced the notion of Standby regions in HBase, allowing for High Availability Reads, and championed features such as improved caching, multi-tenancy support and the HBase Spark connector.

If you are passionate about distributed systems, have seen them behave in production and have interacted with the open source community, we'd like to talk to you about an opening on our team.

We'll trust you to:

  • Get to know development teams across Bloomberg and understand their application requirements and access patterns
  • Help teams working with HBase, Kafka or Cassandra architect their applications from schema design to performance tuning and failure analysis
  • Identify feature gaps in the technologies and work with the open source community to co-design and co-develop those features and bug fixes


You need to have:

  • Experience designing and implementing low-latency, high-scalability systems
  • Strong experience with systems-level Java - a thorough knowledge of garbage collection internals, concurrency models, Native & Async IO and Off-heap memory management is a must
  • Experience troubleshooting complex distributed systems in a production setting and providing patches in a timely manner
  • Proven open source community interactions


We'd love to see:

  • Upstream, accepted open source contributions to HBase, Cassandra or other NoSQL technologies


If this sounds like you, submit an application and check out Bloomberg's Github: https://github.com/bloomberg.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Software Infrastructure C++ Developer
jobs.content:
Every day, over 4,500 developers rely on us to build the core foundation required for their applications. We build libraries that touch a wide range of technologies including real-time data-processing infrastructure, application frameworks, communication middleware and development tools. We are engineers who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable and testable code that can mold quickly to new business initiatives.

You'll need to have:
  • 3+ years of experience programming in C++
  • A strong understanding of data structures and algorithms


We'd love to see:
  • Knowledge of operating system fundamentals
  • The ability to work across Linux/UNIX
  • Experience working with distributed systems
  • Familiarity with network-layer protocols such as TCP/IP and multicast
  • An understanding of the entire software stack from the UI layer to databases
  • An interest in open source technologies and the latest trends in engineering


Feeds Infrastructure: We develop a distributed high throughput and low-latency messaging platform in C++, primarily for Linux. The platform is complemented by a framework and toolkit that underlies the company's global feed handlers. Our systems support the reliable receipt, processing and delivery of high volume market data to the Bloomberg Professional Service from exchanges around the world, handling over 60 billion unique messages per day.

Ticker Plant: Our team is at the heart of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low-latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting-edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable.

Data Distribution (API: We build and maintain the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low-latency market data and news across the globe via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). We use commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework: We are building the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features.

Systems Core Infrastructure: We provide the tools, services and APIs for other Engineering teams across Bloomberg. Our deep knowledge of UNIX/Linux allows us to create useful tools and platforms for software engineers while improving performance and stability of the entire infrastructure. Examples include: a process management service that can restart and monitor running programs, an exception-handling service that manages core dumps and provides useful crash reports to programmers that also includes application-specific trace and metrics- just to name a few.

Bloomberg Application Services: The BAS group provides core infrastructure for server-side development and message exchange. We provide libraries, tools and processes that implement a service-oriented architecture based on a message-routing paradigm. BAS provides location transparency to service clients, encapsulates routing policies and algorithms in the network and delivers a common, scalable and robust platform for application software. Almost every Bloomberg function and backend process depends on the thousands of services our platform supports.

Systems Applications: We provide tools for other Engineering teams. Some of these include a software deployment system that helps programmers deploy in stages to minimize risk, a tiered data store and retrieval framework and a general purpose job scheduling system. Our goal is to make programmer workflows as efficient as possible. Our systems include: framework for cache management to increase applications speed, disaster recovery using cluster of databases, system to manage the release and enablement of functionality and additional software development and deployment tools.

Market Data & News Feeds: We develop highly reliable, low-latency feed handlers for real-time market data. Our software processes data streams from a global network of exchanges, contributors and news agencies including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), London Stock Exchange (LSE) and Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE). Our real-time data provides the foundation for a range of Bloomberg Professional applications that empower market makers.

Data License: Data License is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, requiring our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Systems Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:53185



Our Team:



Bloomberg systems are fast and reliable and we're the team that makes that possible. We build middleware - the software infrastructure designed for creating large-scale, fault-tolerant applications that run on thousands of machines throughout the world. We're two dozen C++ programmers building a complex infrastructure using a variety of programming paradigms such as RPC, publish/subscribe and message queues. With thousands of clients depending on our infrastructure solutions, we are looking to grow our SRE team. That's where you come in.

What's in it for you:



As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) working on this critical infrastructure, you'll focus on automating everything from build and deployment to reaction and remediation to outages. You will work on all aspects of this end-to-end system to support the Bloomberg API.

We'll trust you to:

    • Take responsibility for deployment after Beta for Bloomberg's messaging and multicast services-Ensure level 1 support for production issues-Automate everything from reaction to outages to quality checks for new builds-Provide feedback to developers to make this infrastructure increasingly resilient


You need to have:
  • 3+ years of experience as a software engineer or developer working on high availability, large-scale distributed applications
  • Excellent programming skills. You don't need to be a rock star C++ programmer, but you need to know at least little bit about C++ and you do need to be a great programmer in other programming languages such as Python, Ruby, Perl, Scala or JavaScript.
  • A strong understanding of the UNIX/Linux command line
  • A passion for performance excellence and an engineering mindset
  • Previous experience with data, statistics and latency numbers
  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience




We'd love to see:

  • Strong leadership skills
  • Prior experience as a systems performance or site/systems reliability engineer
  • Extensive experience working with fault-tolerant approaches in a large-scale distributed environment with high performance systems
  • A deep understanding of Internet and networking protocols, including IP multicast (PGM)
  • Knowledge of network analysis and performance and application issues using standard tools (Tcpdump or Wireshark)
  • 2+ years of Chef, Puppet or Ansible system configuration experience (error handling, idempotency, configuration management)
  • Experience with virtualization and Infrastructure as a Service models
  • The ability to handle periodic on-call duties as well as out-of-band requests


Our infrastructure is built to fully automate deployment and operations using Chef; developed and open sourced at https://github.com/bloomberg/chef-bcpc. We want to work with others who are passionate about automation and community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community. If this sounds like you, submit an application, and check out some of our other open source contributions:

https://github.com/bloomberg/nginx-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/zookeeper-cookbook

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Python Developer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:50176



The Content Generation and Distribution team is responsible for Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to our customers, who include key financial players that rely on our software. Our system delivers a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, fixed income, indices, FX, and futures and options. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. We make data available to our clients via various delivery mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.
What's in it for you:

As a developer on our team, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies such as Python, C++, Perl, Java, Javascript, SQL, RabbitMQ, Celery, Git, Jenkins, Robot Framework - whatever it takes to get the job done. Our work atmosphere is fast-paced, spirited and friendly.

We'll trust you to:

  • Design and develop new software within the industry's leading reference data product suite
  • Enhance our software infrastructure to improve the reliability and computational efficiency of our content generation and distribution technologies
  • Interact with various programming groups across Bloomberg as part of the development process


You'll need to have:

  • 3+ years of current Python development experience
  • Experience developing software in a UNIX environment
  • Understanding of Python, including code organization and testing


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with compiled languages such as C, C++ or Java
  • Experience building both small scripts and large systems in Python
  • Working knowledge of development tools such as debuggers, memory profilers, and performance measurement
  • Relational database experience
  • Excellent communication skills


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Enterprise Solutions Developer
jobs.content:

Our Team:



The Enterprise Products and Services (EPS) team is a new and growing area of Bloomberg. We build state-of-the-art software to support product implementation and client-facing tools that allow clients to manage their data distribution, users, applications and respective permissions. Our product has the potential to have a tremendous impact on the market. Our solutions offer cost effective, customizable and innovative alternatives to clients. We are solving old problems in a new way and bringing healthy competition to a well-established market.
Our day-to-day includes a wide range of development opportunities, from front-end to back-end to data warehousing. As part of our team, you will be exposed to a variety of domains and technologies, learn continuously and contribute new ideas starting day one.

We'll trust you to:

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Analytics, Trading, and Execution Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:50212



Every day, trillions of dollars pass through the Bloomberg Terminal. As a result, hundreds of thousands of financial professionals turn to our 500 applications to manage their portfolios, execute their trades and analyze the markets. As engineers, we're the ones who build the applications our clients rely on to not just stay informed, but stay ahead of the market. We connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. The applications and infrastructure we build embody the speed, agility and financial data that make Bloomberg the go-to for financial professionals across the globe.

You'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and take ownership in growing our industry-leading applications. You'll be able to lead projects, partner with the business and meet clients to understand their workflows. We work primarily in C++, but we believe a smart engineer can learn any language with some ramp up time. If you're from a different OO background but you're willing to learn C++, we still want you to apply. We have opportunities in all phases of the SDLC, so if you want to make an immediate impact and work on the financial world's toughest technical challenges, apply today.

You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java
  • Strong problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with multithreading
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript
  • Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
  • Interest in the financial markets


When you apply, tell us which of our teams you'd like to join. Here are snapshots of each one.

Trading Solutions (TS)



TS empowers the biggest players in the financial world to manage their portfolios, execute and settle their trades and make decisions that move the markets. Trillions of dollars pass through our systems on a daily basis so our applications need to be fast, accurate and scalable. Our integrated platforms interact with a number of agencies and governments around the world, and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them. We are full stack engineers who specialize in everything from the UX to server-side development and are always looking for new ways to make our products better. As engineers, we live at the intersection of technology and finance, so you'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and suggest new ways we can lead the industry.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics



We build a highly scalable and available system that processes billions of data points per day. The scale of our product (more than 250,000 analytical runs per day) imposes technical challenges around the stringent availability, throughput and responsiveness metrics on our system. Portfolio Managers use our system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. To keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product, we're constantly looking for ways to improve using new technologies. If you're interested in high performance distributed systems, a modern software code base and are looking to build new products using the latest technology, we want you on our team.

Tradebook



Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform that trades equities, futures, options and FX trading around the world. We're developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to more than 120 liquidity venues globally. This year, we are building our next-generation system that leverages Bloomberg's expertise in data and analytics to optimize algorithmic trading. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and help us break into more markets. You'll work some of the industry's smartest engineers to shape the future of brokerage technology. To learn more about our product, check out our blog at http://www.bloombergtradebook.com/

Equity Trader



We're building the best trading platforms in the financial markets. We offer an end-to-end ecosystem that provides market insight through advanced real-time alerting, the analytics that traders need to make quick informed decisions and the tools they need to automate their workflows. We build the trading interfaces that provide access to markets across the world through more than 5,000 liquidity destinations. Our complex system handles millions of transactions per day, which are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis. Clients rely on our advanced technology to power their trading decisions and stay ahead of the markets.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities Trading (FICC)



We're the engineers behind the global FICC product that facilitates dealer-to-client trading, liquidity and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. FICC is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, we've evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. We build multithreaded and distributed services, which have high transaction rates, and we work on everything from infrastructure design and implementation to database management and user interface development.



Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Polyglot Developer - Trade Ideas
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49120



Trade Ideas' is a leading research and investment platform in a niche market used by high profile customers. It can be used to exchange investment ideas and recommendations in order to demonstrate their stock-picking skills. Our robust set of tools help people to create and share research, estimates and proprietary data in a cost-effective and straightforward way.

This is a unique team in Bloomberg as you will have the opportunity to really get to know your customer base and their needs. This means that you will genuinely have an impact on their workflow and see the tangible difference you make. You will also work closely with your dedicated sales and product teams to ensure you're delivering exactly what is needed.

We're continually developing and improving our offerings, which is where you come in. Our engineering team are looking for a creative, enthusiastic and motivated individual to help design, build, and realise the next iteration of 'Trade Ideas'.

We'll trust you to:

  • Quickly deliver high quality code and effectively roll out new features using an agile methodology;
  • Convert requirements from your business partners into usable product;
  • Help us design and develop a new Microservices architecture as the team continues to move in this direction;
  • Be truly technically agnostic. You should love to identify the right technology for the task at hand.


You should have:

  • Strong knowledge of TypeScript/JavaScript or Python. Both would be fantastic;
  • Proficiency in C++;
  • Strong collaboration skills. You will be working with many people - colleagues, internal Bloomberg clients and external customers.


We'd love to see:

  • That you're comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum environment;
  • Exposure to Test Driven Development;
  • Familiarity with design principles such as DDD and patterns such as Event Sourcing;
  • Familiarity with scripting languages, Bash for example;
  • You're self-motivated with strong teamwork skills and like to "get things done".


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer - Contractor
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:53033



Here at Bloomberg New Energy Finance (or BNEF for short), we provide leading analysis, tools and data for decision makers making an impact in the energy space. We help clients stay on top of developments via our comprehensive web and mobile based platforms.

Operating with a start-up mentality within the larger enterprise, our responsibility is to develop & deploy cutting-edge software that meets the needs of our high profile customers.
We're seeking a high-energy and talented front-end software engineer with strong technical and programming skills to join our team and help refine and expand our customer-facing web pages. This detail-oriented role involves building website layouts and user interfaces in HTML, CSS/Sass, and AngularJS, including integrating data from various back-end services and databases.

We'll trust you to:

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
  • Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
  • Be responsible for maintaining and scaling out the site
  • Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends
  • Cooperate with web designers and product owners to match visual design intent
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  • Collaborate within an Agile, multi-disciplinary team
  • Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues


You'll need to have:

  • Strong exposure in web programming
  • Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS/Sass
  • Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, particularly AngularJS
  • Thorough knowledge of how web applications work including security and session management
  • Knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
  • Creative problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience working in a Continuous Delivery environment
  • A real passion for standardisation, style guides and process efficiency
  • You can demonstrate a deep understanding with AngularJS 1.X
  • You have familiarity with PHP


If this sounds like you:



Apply if you think you're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Mobile Developer - Android
jobs.content:

Imagine the challenge of helping the worlds finance professionals work from anywhere. Making that all important trading decision walking between meetings. Looking at up-to-date market news whenever they glance at their mobile device, explore in-depth market analysis, or getting instant notifications on critical market moving events. jobs.title: Experienced Java AngularJS Developer
jobs.content:
We are a custom software development organization, developing software solutions for our clients to fit their specific needs. Our immediate need is to develop a single page, data-driven web application for a state agency. Key tech we're using is:



  • AngularJS

  • The Spring framework or Spring boot

  • RESTful web services

  • JPA - as implemented by Hibernate

  • MySql, Postgresql, or Oracle

  • Gulp / Grunt


These low-friction, flexible tools allow us to quickly build the solutions our clients need. 


The web app to be developed will track complaints against child care providers, and integrate with various data feeds. Tasks performed by the app are



  • Complaint intake

  • Complaint review

  • Notification of the correct department(s) to investigate

  • Recording results of investigations


The application is a green-field, short-term project that must be completed by the end of September. PWW will provide support to this position by:



  • providing UX wireframes

  • providing photoshop design files

  • Project management support

  • Technical support from our talented and knowledgeable internal development team.


We have more work beyond this specific project and are looking for a long-term relationship with the right applicant.

jobs.title: Chief Software Architect
jobs.content:
If you are a highly motivated and visionary software engineer and leader who is passionate about challenging the status quo, and get excited about designing and architecting a frontend and backend cloud platform to make this happen, we are interested in talking to you.


You would be joining an early stage startup and you would be considered a co-founder of the company.


You should have the demonstrated ability and desire to not only architect a robust scalable platform and to write the code for parts of the system, but also to help build out a world class team and contribute to the leadership of a fast growing start-up. You would manage project goals. You would work with others to understand the vision and the conceptual framework of the envisioned platform and to break it down to practically implementable, scalable modules that elegantly interface with each other.


Your specific job responsibilities would be to:



  • Architect definition of a complex web-based software platform with transactions to back end databases, locally and remotely, through secure connections

  • Develop a concise and robust API for the backend core that the frontend and user apps, developed in a high level programming language, can use

  • Define the milestones and timeline for development of the platform

  • Initiate and implement the best development practices and systems

  • Define the test methodology and QA methods for proper deployment

  • Manage and contribute to the backend and frontend development of the platform

  • Write backend code for cloud applications, create robust and scalable high-volume production applications

  • Work closely with others to ensure we are building the optimal platform for the desired vision and on time

  • Quickly develop prototypes for demonstrations and beta customer launches of the whole or parts of the site

  • Ensure that the platform is scalable across features and changes in technology

  • Ensure that the platform is amazingly user-friendly and is a delight to use!

jobs.title: Junior Front End Developer
jobs.content: Our continued success has created the need for an experienced Junior Front End Developer to help shape the future of the web....

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
ABOUT Your Role:

We are looking for a Senior Front-End Developer with a demonstrated track record of innovative thinking, technical mastery, and peer guidance. You will work in a collaborative Agile environment, and as a Senior Front-End Developer you will be involved with setting technical direction and collaborating on new ideas, as well as realizing these ideas in code.

ABOUT Your Contributions:

Mentor other developers on your team. Participate in conversations about the design and architecture of our web platform. Develop responsive and elegant cross-platform functionality. Research new technologies and approaches to solve problems and improve existing systems. ABOUT You:

4+ years in a front-end web development position, with at least 1 year of that time in a position of seniority High levels of skill with HTML, CSS and JavaScript Significant experience building templates using a server-side templating engine (e.g. JSP, TWIG, Handlebars, EJS, ERB). Familiarity with at least one server-side MVC framework (e.g. Spring, Django, Rails, Express) ABOUT Us:

About.com is by far the largest network of expert content on the internet, providing nearly 90 million monthly unique users with outstanding, intent-driven, actionable information. A top-20 US website as measured by comScore, we feature over 3 million articles, across 11 verticals. We are the premiere expert-driven resource on the web, with nearly 1,000 topic-specific experts.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for Ruby on Rails Developers who have a broad set of skills and are not afraid to try new things. Lightspeed’s products span appliances, mobile apps, and networking, all the way up to cloud-based SaaS/web applications. You will translate business requirements into high quality software designs and will contribute from software architecture design to implementation.


The Minimum You’ll Do:



  • Write test-driven, clean, readable, and efficient code to achieve the proper detailed objective

  • Analyze software performance and take action to correct deficiencies

  • Clearly document any programming-related information

  • Mentor and perform basic training to lower-title developers as needed

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our dynamic team of innovators hard at work building the future of education. From our offices in Seattle and San Francisco, we make it possible for people everywhere to learn what they want and do what they love.


Founded with the belief that world-class education can (and should) be available to everyone, CreativeLive connects photographers, crafters, musicians, and entrepreneurs of all walks of life with top-notch learning from industry leaders. Whether a weekend warrior or the newly full-time freelancer, CreativeLive gives students the tools and the encouragement to make it happen, whatever "it" might be for them..


CreativeLive is looking for talented lead and senior engineers with at least five years of professional experience to build a new agile team in our Seattle office operating under a principle of "aligned autonomy" with our San Francisco technical teams.  You and your team will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • extending our container-based deployment system

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes


Lead engineer responsibilities additionally include:



  • taking ownership of definition, scoping, and timely implementation by the team

  • identifying and escalating risk

  • leading by example, not by words

  • mentoring and leveling up the team


Some of the things that would make you a great fit for our team:



  • You embody creativity, positivity, and exploration, and are inspired by our mission.

  • You are an active contributor in the technical community.

  • You care deeply about code quality, performance and execution.

  • You understand that software engineering is a team sport.

  • You're passionate about learning and sharing what you've learned.

jobs.title: Senior.Net Developer
jobs.content:
ATSG Corporation is seeking a Senior or mid-level .NET Developer, responsible for a variety of UI, business layer and backend development tasks across new projects and projects in maintenance.  This developer will utilize a broad array of technologies, but must have a solid grasp of .NET (C# Preferred), SQL Server (T-SQL, table design, OLTP design), ASP.NET, HTML/CSS and some exposure to system administration (IIS, SQL Server, Source Control).  This individual contributor will work collaboratively within the project team, participating in the full system development life-cycle, and working closely with top-level stakeholders.


This is a small, agile team of cross-functional talent – each member of the team has a responsibility across design, development, documentation, testing, securing, configuring and releasing software into the environment. Innovation and fresh thinking is appreciated at all levels; however, the team is also expected to operate cohesively and support the overall direction of its leadership.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Zoomdata SDK
jobs.content:
Reports to VP of Product


We at Zoomdata recognize that today’s “big data” is tomorrow’s normal data, and it shouldn’t take a Data Scientist to make it useful.  Zoomdata allows all users to explore and gain insights from a wide variety of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye.  We turn data into knowledge, and we do it with an evolving, real time perspective.


“API First” is one of the newest trends in enterprise software today.  It is no longer sufficient for a product to only have a nice end user experience (UX).  Modern products must also have a great Developer Experience (DX).  As the API Product Owner on the Platform product management team for Zoomdata, you will help drive an “API First” philosophy for our platform product offering. 


You will be responsible for defining and driving the definition of the “what” of our APIs, while working closely with our engineering teams as they implement the “how” of our platform strategy.   As part of the Zoomdata product team, you’ll be working closely with various stakeholders in the company and our customers to identify and productize key API scenarios.  In short, you will ensure Zoomdata has a great and well thought-out API Developer Experience (DX).


You will own…



  • Being the subject matter expert at Zoomdata for current and upcoming market trends in API adoption, through client interaction and other market research

  • Defining and Designing APIs that developers will love for each layer of our platform

  • Coordination with documentation and developer community product owners to deliver API documentation and samples that ensure successful adoption

  • Evangelizing our APIs at conferences, on webinars and through blog posts

jobs.title: Mobile Architect
jobs.content:
We are seeking a talented Mobile Architect to join our distributed Product Development group. This is a full-time development position with a close-knit distributed team.  We are looking for a strong project manager, a self-driven problem solver who is motivated to deliver kick-ass results.  


We currently support native apps for iOS and Android, with other devices of all sizes and shapes still to come. We’re looking for someone with the expertise to support our current apps, and the foresight to adapt as our needs grow and change.



  • Collaborate, communicate, and innovate the design and implementation of technical solutions within the AudioAddict portfolio (di.fm, radiotunes.com, jazzradio.com, rockradio.com, classicalradio.com).

  • Ensure that application designs meet nonfunctional requirements (e.g. performance, concurrency, scalability).

  • Oversee the proper implementation of projects through coding and code reviews, and deploy code to the app stores.

  • Analyze product/business requirements, create and implement flexible, scalable implementation designs.

  • This is a hands-on role.
