jobs.title: Software Engineer- Javascript
jobs.content:
The Video Cloud Studio is a sophisticated suite of web applications for uploading, managing and publishing video.  We're looking for smart, passionate developers to build the world's best front-end web application experience and the services around it.


We are a young and rapidly growing product looking to expand our team. We are looking for an accomplished developer who wants to be a technical leader for video on the web, and a critical contributor to our online service. We’re looking for someone smart and nice. Someone who learns quickly. Someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit, and the drive to take a product from great to amazing.



About You We don’t care much about years of experience or knowledge of particular technologies. We do care that we enjoy working with you, and that you will write high quality, resilient features, and will delight our customers no matter what it takes.


We use a Backbone.js, React.js, Node.js and Mongo stack, hosted in AWS, so either experience or interest in learning these technologies is important.


Responsibilities




  • Contributing to the Video Cloud studio, a modern and sophisticated family of Single Page Applications.




  • Experimenting with, evaluating, and building on emerging web technologies




  • Researching and experimenting with new web technologies as they emerge




  • Producing software that will be used by a wide range of companies and passionate users





Qualifications




  • MS/BS in Computer Science or related background




  • 2-3 years of front-end development experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and related JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, React, or similar technologies




  • Strong communication skills




  • History of disciplined test-driven development




  • Experience building scalable web applications




The Perks


We offer a fun work environment, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement. We also offer unlimited vacation — and expect you to use it.


We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Senior Project Management Leader
jobs.content:
Senior Product Management Leader


<h2< h2="">


We’re looking for a product management leader for Brightcove’s flagship Video Cloud product line. Video Cloud provides the core video backbone for leading media companies around the globe and powers the online video marketing for some of the world’s top brands. As the leader of this group, you will lead a team of product managers as we chart the future of online video.



About You



  • You have a proven track record creating and managing successful B2B SaaS products

  • You are a clear and compelling communicator that can work with peer execs and engineering leaders to drive company success

  • You love meeting with customers and prospects to discuss their needs and driving the conversation at industry conferences and forums.

  • You have demonstrated experience managing and mentoring a team of product managers

  • You have a passion for online video and direct experience managing technology products in the rapidly evolving media industry



Responsibilities



  • Work with other leaders in Brightcove to increase Video Cloud adoption in both current and new customer segments

  • Manage a team of product managers responsible for the core components of Video Cloud

  • Work with other members of the executive team to identify, evaluate, and prioritize new business opportunities to grow Brightcove’s business.

  • Drive the quarterly and annual planning process for Video Cloud by gathering requirements and priorities from customers and stakeholders.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back End
jobs.content:
The Brightcove engineering culture is tailored to software professionals who enjoy solving challenging product development problems. The team you'll be joining is a small, self-organized Agile group. We use a light-weight development process that balances craftsmanship with execution.  We strive to build engaging products with features that will delight our customers.

Our team takes pride in achieving high uptimes and quality-of-service with low operational overhead.  Team-members double as experts in operating the systems that they build.  We are continuously shipping code -- several times a day.  Everyone is encouraged to contribute to meeting our operational goals through robust, scalable designs, software quality, customer-facing service metrics, and DevOps automation.


THE ROLE


We’re looking for a developer to help us transform the Video Cloud content management system into a scalable, cloud-based platform with rich, developer-friendly APIs.  The Brightcove CMS holds the central catalog of information for Brightcove’s flagship Video Cloud product.  This CMS is a high-performance metadata management repository with integrated search capabilities.  You’ll be on a team responsible for designing, developing, and operating a fault-tolerant, low-latency system that currently handles over 5M updates and nearly 200M reads each day, with peak rates of around 5k writes and 10k reads per second. Our throughput continues to grow, having nearly doubled year-over-year for the past few years.

We look for people people we can learn from; people who are creative, passionate, and curious; and people who know how to get things done.



ABOUT YOU



  • You have 3+ years of experience building large applications in multiple languages (We mostly use Java/Groovy, with some Ruby, Python, and Node.js sprinkled in).

  • You have experience developing and deploying software at high scale.

  • You understand the basics of scalable SaaS systems.

  • You are familiar with Linux, basic SaaS security, Amazon EC2, REST, and API design.

  • You understand the principles of software craftsmanship. You write clean code, even when working on extremely hard problems. You unit test everything

  • You’re familiar with different types of data stores for handling large volumes of data with high levels of traffic.  We’d love to talk to you about the tradeoffs between in-house and hosted Mongo solutions, Dynamo/Cassandra/Riak, and when and how to use different kinds of caching.


ABOUT US


We offer a fun work environment, regular hack weeks, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement.  Our offices are located downtown, right on Fort Point harbor, with a fully stocked kitchen, ping pong and foosball tables.  We also offer unlimited vacation — and expect you to use it.


We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Tier 2 Technical Support Engineer - Development
jobs.content:
Technical Support Engineer - Tier 2 Development



Description


Are you passionate about working directly with customers and immediately impacting their success? We are looking for an exceptional person to join our Customer Support team in providing efficient and accurate technical assistance to ensure complete customer satisfaction for our growing customer base of online video publishers. The ideal candidate is a dedicated problem solver, passionate about rich media technologies, and a proven customer advocate. We are looking for someone who is highly motivated with strong technical experience, excellent written and verbal communication skills and high enthusiasm for customer success.


Responsibilities will include working directly with customers via phone and email to respond to technical issues, providing escalated technical and triage support for other team members, and actively contribute to our online community and knowledge database for up-to-date customer information and solutions. This individual will also work closely with our Engineering, Product Management and QA teams to increase customer satisfaction by providing critical feedback and assistance for product enhancements. As a member of Customer Support, the candidate will be part of a Global team interacting closely with Support offices in the US, Europe, Australia, Korea, and Japan, as well as with customers around the world.


Working for Brightcove will give you a unique opportunity to join a fast growing company and play an integral role building products and online services that promise to transform the media industry and change the way people all over the world watch video.



Qualifications and Required Experience



  • College degree (CS degree preferred)

  • 3+ years work experience in online technical problem solving

  • Excellent communication skills and strong customer focus

  • Proven analytical / problem solving ability

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively, both written and oral

  • Demonstrated ability to lead and manage initiatives to completion.

  • Proven ability to work with the team to quickly and calmly resolve technical issues.

  • Solid understanding of internet technologies including browsers, networking, firewalls & proxy servers

  • Demonstrated ability to learn new skills quickly.

  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team.

  • Required to be flexible, detail oriented and organized with the ability to multitask.

  • On-call availability



Technical Experience 



  • Strong technology background with a comprehensive knowledge of Internet, Mobile and Digital Online Media technologies such as networking, servers, etc

  • Proficient in web-based technologies, including HTML, XML, FTP, JavaScript, CSS

  • Proven experience with CDN services (Akamai, Level3, etc)

  • Proven experience with Cloud computing (AWS, S3, Cloudfront, etc)

  • Proven experience with Online Advertising servers and implementation (VAST, DFP, Freewheel, etc)

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of RESTful API use, data collection tools, developer support experience

  • Familiarity and working knowledge with rich media applications and mobile SDK development or testing

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of Java; experience in Android development a plus

  • Meaningful experience with online video and of video encoding applications

  • Exposure and working knowledge in at least one other programming language including Objective C, PHP, BASH, etc



Location


This position is based in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.



Why you want to work for Brightcove


Brightcove is the leading online video platform. Media companies, businesses, and organizations worldwide use Brightcove to publish and distribute video that reaches more than 135 million unique viewers every month. We've worked hard to create a company where talented, passionate people can thrive in a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration. Working at Brightcove gives you the chance to reshape how media is published and consumed worldwide while you develop your skills, grow your career, and have fun.

jobs.title: Android Software Development Engineer II -comiXology
jobs.content:
Android Development Engineer



ComiXology, has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before.



We are looking for an Android Development Engineer to join our mobile Android development team to help us undergo a refactor of our current Android and Kindle Fire/Fire Phone apps, and thereafter work on integration projects with Amazon’s systems and help to implement innovative consumer features. Our goal is to provide exciting, innovative and diverse work to keep both our staff and consumers engaged. We promise you will not be bored; in fact your efforts will directly impact our millions of users who rave about our products as much as we do.



What You’ll Do:

· Join a team of software engineers responsible for the design, development, and testing of the comiXology Android and Kindle apps, and participate in the design of underlying RESTful APIs

· Help define UI/UX and promote best practices within the Android ecosystem

· Take on daily challenges providing creative problem solving recommendations

· Mentor and contribute knowledge to the rest of the team and the organization

 

Who You Are and What You Do:

- 3+ years experience working with the following technologies:

- Java and the JDK

-Extensive knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

-Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

- Writing multi-threaded apps

- Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

- Application submission/provisioning process

- Debugging and analysis skills using ADB

- Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

- Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control - Git preferred

- Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change -

Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.

- Degree in computer science or equivalent degree



Would Be Great, But Not Required:

· Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

· Have worked with OpenGL or the NDK and high performance graphics code

· Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

· Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop and Amazon Mobile SDK (Kindle Fire, Fire Phone)

· Experience with protocol buffers

· You tell great jokes

· You enjoy Bagel Breakfast Wednesdays

· You have some experience developing for other mobile platforms (iOS, Windows Phone, etc.)

· You’re a fan of comics!

· Are an inspiration for innovation



About Us:

ComiXology, an Amazon.com, Inc. subsidiary (NASDAQ:AMZN), has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before. ComiXology’s Guided View reading technology transforms the comic book medium into an immersive and cinematic experience, helping comiXology become a top ten grossing iPad app in 2011 and 2012 and the top grossing non-game iPad app in 2012 and 2013. Offering the broadest library of comic book content from over 75 publishers - and independent creators as well - comiXology will not stop until everyone on the face of the planet has become a comic book fan.



comiXology is an EEO/AAP employer.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer, Amazon Flex Android App
jobs.content:
Amazon Flex is a new program at Amazon that supports Prime Now in offering one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers.



Our transportation technology group is responsible for designing and implementing software that makes the delivery of these items possible in one hour or less. Our software has to take into account item, delivery associate, network and environmental constraints to provide a fast delivery experience for our end consumers.



The Amazon Flex Mobile team is looking for Android engineers to help build the next generation of Last Mile delivery experience for our delivery associates. We operate globally to support many region specific use cases and challenges such as varying network connectivity, including no connectivity (offline), performance and latency, varying devices, business complexity, Geo-fencing, real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing and optimizations and many others.



If you're passionate about Android development, want to build one of the most innovative, high performance mobile applications, this team is for you. We are just getting started, are very much in that start-up (It's Day 1) mode! This is your opportunity to get in early on a brand new product and influence the future of where it goes!

Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications.

5+ years of software development experience with the following technologies:

o Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK

o Expert knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

o Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

o Experience writing multi-threaded apps

o Expert knowledge of Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

o Experience with the application submission/provisioning process

o Expert level debugging and analysis skills using ADB



Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control

Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change



Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.



Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.



Experience with databases.



Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop



Experience with protocol buffers



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer - F/M/V/D

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo.



What will you help us create?



The Role:

As a Sr. Software Development Engineer - Cloud, you will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative consumer electronics products. You will work closely with an internal interdisciplinary team and outside partners to drive key aspects of product definition, execution, and test. You must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment.



The ideal candidate has current and extensive experience developing and building distributed systems and applications. The ideal candidate:



• Has in-depth expertise working with distributed systems and understands how they are deployed.

• Enjoys working side by side with partners, colleagues and teams on tough problems

• Is highly effective and thrives in a dynamic environment with multiple, changing priorities

• Knows what is important when shipping products to customers and has been through the process from start to finish

• Is comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership and never shies away from a challenge

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

• 7+ years of experience doing hands-on software development

• 7+ years of coding skills in JAVA

• 4+ years of current experience working with Distributed systems or applications.

• 3+ years of experience in REST architecture for web services

• 3+ years of Data analysis and debugging skills

 



• Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field

• Experience with working on AWS services(S3, DynamoDB, EC2).

• Strong communication and interpersonal skills

• Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs

• Proficiency in the tools of the trade, including a variety of modern programming languages (Java, C/C++, Python) and open-source technologies (Linux, Android, OpenGL, Eclipse)



Lab126 is part of the Amazon.com, Inc. group of companies and is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer - Digital Store Platform
jobs.content:
The Amazon Digital Payments Tech Team’s vision is to delight our customers with the best payment experience in the world! To achieve this vision, we are in search of a talented technical leader and craftsman who builds robust software that scales as well as client facing features which are intuitive and simple to use.

Our team takes a world-view of payments for all of Amazon and builds highly customized and seamless payment experiences for our global customers. This focus on geography and customer requires working on different technology such as Android, Amazon Fire, and backend platform systems in order to meet the needs of our customers. Our backend systems are always available and guarantee that our customer’s orders are never lost and always processed even when our dependencies are unavailable. Our team is highly motivated and in need of a senior engineer who can take the technical reigns of the team and steer them in the direction of our vision.



You are a technical leader and craftsman with a proven track record of successful delivery. You are someone who will enjoy the challenge of working on complex and highly disparate technologies - from front-end Android development to backend highly distributed systems. You are security conscious and continually analyze software for potential threats to safeguard customer trust. You are interested in a high career-growth opportunity. You enjoy building software that brings smiles to our customers.


  • Excellent written and verbal communications.

  • BS in Computer Science or related field.

  • 8+ years of relevant professional software development experience: designing, developing, and delivering software written in Java, C#, or C++.

  • 1-2 years Android, iOS, or Windows Mobile experience.

  • Knowledgeable in Object-Oriented design patterns.

  • Experience building highly scalable and distributed systems.




  • Relentless customer focus.

  • Experience building payment systems.

  • Experience in designing and developing large scale, high traffic applications.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills and enjoys working in a highly iterative, agile, and open team environment.

  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science.

  • Strong understanding of system performance and scaling.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Amazon's eCommerce Services Group is looking for highly motivated web developers to join the Amazon Tax Software team to create new generation of user experience to manage the complexity of indirect tax rules & regulations across the globe. Work for the Tax Software team and get a chance to touch the full spectrum of Amazon technologies!

Web developers in eCSG tackle challenging problems in



  • Scalability: A lot of people shop here!

  • Robustness: If a core service goes down for a minute, so does the world's largest ecommerce site!

  • Latency: Load a page slowly, lose a customer!

  • Security: Customer trust is our most valuable asset!

  • Usability: A small improvement in usability at our scale means many more satisfied customers!


So if you want to stretch your web development muscles, power user experiences that drive customers to the world's largest ecommerce site, touch a wide spectrum of applications and features, and engage your entrepreneurial chops, come join our team!



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 3+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, and problem solving

  • Proficiency with Java or an equivalent OO language

  • Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Responsive Design, web services, etc.



  • Experience building large-scale web applications

  • 5+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Experience developing AJAX interfaces with AJAX libraries and frameworks (e.g. ReactJS, JQuery, AngularJS, etc.)

  • Experience with MVC frameworks, Rails or Spring desired

  • Understanding of web services technologies such as REST, SOAP, HTTP, JSON

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks

  • Strong customer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive

  • Passion for building a rich and innovative user experience

jobs.title: Software Development Manager - Metadata and Configuration Platform
jobs.content:
The Metadata and Configuration Platform (MCP) team is responsible for developing technologies that enable Amazon software application teams to:

  • Rapidly evolve data definitions and business rules to adapt to changing business needs;

  • Minimize operational disruptions by enabling dynamic evolution of metadata and configuration data;

  • Discover and leverage metadata across the enterprise to maximize reuse and decrease maintenance costs.


We are part of the Amazon.com e-commerce foundational technology team, which means our software powers one of the largest e-commerce engines in the world. If you want to be part of a team that makes a difference on a large scale, this is it.



We are looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive, and experienced Software Development Manager (SDM) to refine and drive the direction for the metadata and configuration management services, libraries, and tooling. The candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, understands the metadata modeling space, and will help us help the business innovate quickly and safely.



As the manager for the team you will be responsible for understanding the needs of our existing customer base (currently hundreds of internal customers) and what new features we need to build to attract new customers (up to thousands). You will be responsible for defining the strategy and roadmap for our technologies as required to deliver on our mission both in the short and long term. To do this, you will lead a team of engineers to perform cost-benefit analyses to determine the approaches that yield the maximum value for the minimal investment, evaluate the alternatives, and plan and drive the delivery of improvements. You will be responsible for hiring and providing career development for your team.



Successful candidates will have a proven track record of leading teams to develop highly distributed systems using Agile and incremental delivery methods. You will also be responsible for ensuring the ongoing operations of the services that your team builds.


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

  • 7+ years of relevant engineering experience

  • 2+ years people management experience

  • Experience with OOD and object oriented languages

  • Experience managing teams through the entire development, deployment, and operations lifecycle

  • Agile project management experience

  • Experience providing career development to a team of engineers

  • Ability to build high-performance teams




  • Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered incrementally to customers

  • Deep hands-on technical expertise: knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong business and technical vision

  • Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

  • Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions

jobs.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed desktop computing service in the cloud. Amazon WorkSpaces allows customers to easily provision cloud-based desktops that allow end-users to access the documents, applications and resources they need with the device of their choice, including laptops, iPad, Kindle Fire, Android tablets, and zero clients. With a few clicks in the AWS Management Console, customers can provision a high-quality cloud desktop experience for any number of users at a cost that is highly competitive with traditional desktops and half the cost of most virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solutions.

To If you like to work in massively scalable distributed systems, networking protocols for real time presentation remoting and opportunities to work on multiple client technologies then join our team to help build Amazon's Desktop-As-A-Service offering! We aim to bring a desktop experience to modern form factors (mobile, desktop) with a native experience for end-users, and a simple and cost-effective way to provision and manage these desktops for IT administrators, leveraging world’s largest public cloud!



As a member of Workspace development team, you will have opportunities to work on several technology area from Workspace core service that provisions desktops, provides secure access to the provisioned desktops, develop and optimize network protocols for display and IO remoting and client software on IOS, Android and Windows, on various form factors. You will also build functionality that allows admins to scale their fleet, and manage it effectively. You will work on challenges such as reducing the time it takes to provision virtual desktops, enhance the management capabilities of the console while maintaining its simplicity, building internal and external APIs, and building tools for data collection, analysis and monitoring to improve customer experience and smooth operation. From a customer point of view, it is an opportunity to delight our customers in both experience and simplicity. From an engineering perspective, it is a great opportunity to build distributed systems, using industry leading AWS constructs such as EC2, EBS,


  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

  • 8+ years of industry experience managing large scale software application products.

  • The ability to dive deep to understand all layers of a web services technology stack

  • Work experience with project management tools.



Experience building client applications for mobile and desktop environments.

jobs.title: WDE II - AWS Website
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Our team builds and runs the suite of systems powering http://aws.amazon.com/. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.


You will find challenges at AWS to keep you interested and growing. You will contribute rich JavaScript, HTML, and CSS components that simplify content authoring and enable rich presentation. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

So, practically, what does it take? What do you need to know?

jobs.title: Amazon Web Services, Marketing, Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Join us as we create the premier website for all users of Amazon Web Services. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail of our site -http://aws.amazon.com - to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.

You will find the challenges at Amazon to keep you interested and growing. You will move seamlessly between writing efficient code that scales (without bugs) and helping stakeholders see what’s possible. You will actively mentor junior engineers through code and design reviews, and by personally modeling the highest standards. You will calmly and quickly create elegant solutions to difficult problems. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

jobs.title: CMS Engineer
jobs.content: In AWS marketing we do things big. https://aws.amazon.com has thousands of pages being updated by hundreds authors being translated into a dozen languages. Our goal in engineering is to facilitate the creative, iterative, and data driven creation of content. As a CMS engineer, you will be helping to translate the experimental A/B tested HTML, JS, and CSS into the CMS framework so the experiment can be made big. You’ll need to look and think deep to tease out the similarities between multiple requests so you can be the right kind of lazy, write it once, use it often.

jobs.title: Website Pricing TPM, AWS Marketing
jobs.content:
The AWS Marketing team is responsible for providing a first class web experience for our customers looking to find out more about our services. Every visitor to aws.amazon.com is our customer and it’s our team’s job to build and iterate (and iterate again) on a world-class website that raises the bar. Every member of our team strives to be as innovative and agile in the field of web design and development as AWS products are in the field of cloud computing.


As a Pricing TPM for AWS Marketing, you will be responsible for the overall program of displaying pricing data on our public facing web properties. In this role, you will drive and deliver multiple complex pricing related projects. You will provide project leadership, anticipate bottlenecks, mitigate project risks, quantify the impact of making trade-offs, and balance business needs against technical constraints. You will provide technical leadership that gets software applications built and integrated into the aws.amazon.com ecosystem. You will work closely with stakeholders across various design, software and business teams to identify and drive innovative solutions that achieve business goals and align with long term product roadmaps. You will also work both our internal engineering teams and manage external vendors to build out these solutions with a focus on high operational excellence.


A successful candidate will be well versed in what it takes to take a large scale, high traffic, high impact marketing website to the next level. This role requires having a proven track record in delivering website projects plus excellent problem solving, project management, and communication skills.


Responsibilities:



  • Be a guardian of world-class customer experience for your deliverables: continually raise the bar on functionality, flow, consistency, usability, and simplicity

  • Manage and deliver web marketing projects from inception to launch to maintenance

  • Build and maintain a complete project schedule, make it constantly visible to management and key stakeholders, and drive projects through to completion

  • Act as the technical interface between the business and the software development/web design teams. Understand the product and know the right questions and whom to ask.

  • Run in front of the software development team, helping define user stories, research appropriate technical solutions, and provide guidance to the team regarding architecture, design, and priorities

  • Translate feature requests into technical specifications and influence design and architectural decisions

  • Work with the business to scope technical software projects with an understanding of website operations (maintenance, deployments, analytics)

  • Help make the right feature trade-offs to ship software without compromising customer experience or business relevance

  • Engage with many teams across the company, evangelizing the team and your project, building relationships and helping identify existing components and technologies that can be leveraged to deliver on our goals

  • Represent the technical team and deliverables to senior leadership across the company

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.content:
Delivers project management support for the Software Professional Services organization to ensure accurate, timely and cost-effective professional services are delivered to satisfied external customers.  Coordinates cross-functional teams through meetings and progress measurement activity, which bring distinct, specific Professional Services projects to completion on time and within budget.  Supports our large enterprise migration projects for Exchange Server and Active Directory.  We offer a competitive quarterly professional services bonus to our employees.

Role Responsibilities

–        Manage the full project lifecycle under general supervision of a PMO or Program Manager
–        Responsible for assembling project team, assigning individual responsibilities, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedule to ensure timely completion of project or program
–        Must be familiar with associated platforms, relevant product capabilities and project objectives, as well as the role and function of each team member, to effectively coordinate the activities of the team
–        Organizes the project and creates necessary management plans (scope, risk, communication, etc.) as well as work breakdown structure, leads the definition of activities, activity sequencing, duration estimation, resources planning and schedule creation.
–        Monitors and reports regularly on progress against plans, proactively managing risks and issues during project execution to ensure customer satisfaction
–        Maintains and updates project plans, schedules and other project documentation
–        Ensures a consistent application of all Project Management and delivery methodology processes, tools, and documentation. Ensures that all program and project artifacts are retained in a central, standard repository. Works with PMO to continually improve delivery tools and processes

Requirements

–        8+ years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experience
–        3+ years of successfully managing and leading projects with a high degree of technical complexity within large enterprise infrastructures
–        Previous experience managing Active Directory / Exchange migrations or implementation of Identity and Access Management solutions
–        Strong knowledge of Microsoft infrastructure
–        Experience working remotely and leading remote resources
–        Must be able to travel up to 20% to customer sites

Preferences

–        PMP Certified
–        Microsoft Project
–        Bachelors’ Degree or advanced degree highly preferred

Why work with us?

–         Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.
–         When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.
–         Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.
–         We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential.
–         Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
SecureWorks is a global leader in providing intelligence-driven information security solutions. We play an important role, as no organization in the world is immune from cyberattacks and the nature of the attack is changing every day. Internet security is a problem that will never be solved. Unlike point products that address a specific technology issue, we attack the problem holistically by analyzing threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures, and develop solutions using best-of-breed technologies to protect our clients. We are one of the best in the world at understanding the threat. In short, we give our clients an early warning capability.

SecureWorks was founded in 1999 and headquartered in Atlanta, Ga., with offices in all the major security markets around the globe. We have more than 2,000 team members, and partner with more than 4,200 clients in 59 countries to keep the bad guys out of their networks. We’ve been consistently recognized by industry analysts, readers’ polls and as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for managed security services, worldwide.

Role Overview

The Senior Software Engineer will be a key member of the IDS/IPS engineering team, responsible for designing, developing, and testing software in a multi-platform environment using cutting-edge technology. The engineer will work with system administrators, security analysts, product management and clients to ensure we produce high quality products that exceed expectations. This is a challenging and also very rewarding position where interesting projects in security are implemented in order to protect our clients from Internet intrusions.

Role Responsibilities

-Responsible for the design and development activities associated with software using a range of applicable technologies (e.g., programming languages, compilers, assemblers, debuggers, other tools) for products used in local, networked or Internet-related computer programs.
-Participates in product development in all stages including planning, design, development, testing, implementation and post deployment support
-Manages or utilizes software that is built and implemented as a product, using best-in-class development process/lifecycle management
-Drives idea generation for new software products, or for the next version of an existing product
-Works with the team to develop, maintain, and communicate current development schedules, timelines and development status
-Reviews requirements, specifications and designs to assure product quality; develops and implements plans and tests for product quality, scalability, performance assurance

As a managed security provider, SecureWorks expects its employees to understand and apply commonly -known security practices and possess a working knowledge of applicable industry controls such as NIST 800-53. Employees will be expected to acknowledge their security responsibilities in writing prior to gaining access to company systems. Employees will be required to maintain a working knowledge of local security policies and execute general controls as assigned.

Requirements

-Must have strong communication skills and be project-oriented with ability to work with minimal day-to-day direction
-Must be highly motivated and willing to work in a team environment
-Strong in-depth knowledge of C/C++, bash, python, make, perl
-Familiarity with JAVA programming language, and well-versed in enterprise database solutions
-Strong understanding of Networking and GNU/Linux in general
-Understanding of current technologies including open source technologies
-Experience with relational databases
-Solid analytical and problem solving skills and willing to take on projects under deadline

Preferences

-Linux admin skills with grub, system, rpm experience
-Linux Kernel driver experience is a huge plus
-Experience with performance tuning of applications
-Technical knowledge and understanding of distributed systems
-Information security knowledge
-Proven development, design, documentation and review experience

Location: Atlanta or Possibly Remote

SecureWorks is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind:  SecureWorks is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at SecureWorks are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. SecureWorks will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. SecureWorks encourages applicants of all ages.

jobs.title: Senior Product Management Consultant
jobs.content:
Dell Software empowers companies of all sizes to experience Dell’s “Power to Do More” by delivering scalable yet simple-to-use solutions to drive value and accelerate results. Dell Software Group’s portfolio now includes the products and technologies of Quest Software, AppAssure, Enstratius, KACE and SonicWALL. We are uniquely positioned to address today’s most pressing business and IT challenges with holistic, connected software offerings.

Role Summary

Participate in the direction of Dell Software’s data protection product(s) to ensure a competitive market advantage and champions the development of new solutions to meet market opportunities consistent with the organization’s short- and long-term goals and objectives.

Role Responsibilities

Participates as a proactive member of the Dell Software Product Management team and contributes to the company as follows:

– Meets or exceeds short- and long-term revenue results for assigned product.
– Takes accountability and resolves any issues preventing the achievement of timely, quality, and cost effective results.
– Takes strategic risks toward achieving operational excellence
– Maintains high standards of excellence, strong work ethics and legal compliance.
– Creates and maintains an accurate and up-to-date executive overview of product(s) including market, financial, and strategic data analysis to ensure effective communications of goals, key issues, and progress towards objectives.
– Develops accurate and timely Market Requirements Documents (MRDs) that contain feature functionality descriptions to be used by development team and Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) to assess the validity of a proposed feature or new product offering.
– Conducts market analysis to determine product relevancy and adjust course as needed consistent with desired company goals and objectives.
– Develops prototypes and mockups of new versions, workflows, etc.
– Creates and delivers training materials for support and sales.
– Provides necessary content to external customer Product Marketing team to ensure effective product collateral materials to support short- and long-term revenue objectives.
– Collaborates with other areas of the company (Development, Support, Marketing, etc.) to ensure efficient operation of product development and release.
– Works with management to set revenue forecasts.

Qualifications

– Experience equivalent to a 4-year education with an emphasis in technology, product marketing or management.
– 5-6 years of experience working in product management function within the data protection space or similar space with a proven track record of sales and marketing results.
– Implementation experience of data protection products.
– In-depth understanding of the data protection and storage products in the market today.
– Excellent interpersonal and communications skills, including verbal and written communications.
– Must have effective networking skills in order to establish relationships with customers.
– Travel 15% on an annual basis.

Why work with us?

-Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.
-When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.
-Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.
-We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential.
-Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work.

jobs.content:
SecureWorks is a global leader in providing intelligence-driven information security solutions.  We play an important role, as no organization in the world is immune from cyberattacks and the nature of the attack is changing every day.  Internet security is a problem that will never be solved.  Unlike point products that address a specific technology issue, we attack the problem holistically by analyzing threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures, and develop solutions using best-of-breed technologies to protect our clients. We are one of the best in the world at understanding the threat.

In short, we give our clients an early warning capability.  SecureWorks was founded in 1999 and headquartered in Atlanta, Ga., with offices in all the major security markets around the globe.  We have more than 2,000 team members, and partner with more than 4,200 clients in 59 countries to keep the bad guys out of their networks.  We’ve been consistently recognized by industry analysts, readers’ polls and as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for managed security services, worldwide.

An Automation Engineer facilitates business activities by automating common tasks that need to be performed on client premises equipment. Common tasks involve data gathering, configuration backups, and password changes. Tasks involve interacting with multiple platforms. A passion for efficiency and excellence in service delivery contributes to the employee’s overall success in this role.   • Design automation logic
  • Write expect and perl scripts to perform tasks

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Software Engineer will help design and implement features in a cloud-based web architecture.  Must be able to participate in a highly collaborated and innovative team.  The Software Engineer is expected to be results-driven and self-motivated, and he or she should have experience with JavaScript, HTML, and software engineering principles (GR 42)

This person will design and implement web user interfaces that are functional, intuitive, and elegant.  These user interfaces will be in a single-page application that is part of a new cloud-based solution that uses Javascript, Typescript, CSS, HTML, ReST services, Java, AWS, and other emergent technologies.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work with team members to create innovative solutions to various feature requests.

  • Jump into various complex code-bases, understand them quickly, and develop features in a fast-past environment.

  • Work with stakeholders to refine the requirements for new features with an emphasis on creating a great user experience.

  • Actively participate in a highly collaborative Agile development process to meet delivery dates and other goals.

  • Demonstrate the ability to be thorough and detailed oriented in looking at all aspects of the solution including: localization, licensing, scalability, memory management, bandwidth, latency, automated testing, security and compliance.

  • Write unit tests and work with QA team to ensure quality testing.

  • Stay current with industry developments and new trends.

  • Understand & comply with HIPAA Security and Privacy Law

  • Adhere to Interactive Intelligence Code of Business Conduct and Ethics

jobs.title: Teamwork Desk Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Job


Come help us build the best HelpDesk software in the world. The product we built handles millions of support emails a month for thousands of companies. Join a small team of talented developers, doing what we love every day. You will be writing code most of your day :)



What started out initially as a single web app has evolved into an architecture with many small services working with message queues, in-depth metrics, monitoring and logging. We need you to help us build some of the incredible new features we have planned and continue developing this architecture.


Our Tech Stack



  • Go (we love Go)

  • CoffeeScript

  • KnockoutJS

  • RabbitMQ

  • MySQL

  • Redis

  • ElasticSearch

  • AWS EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, CodeDeploy, AutoScale

  • Docker


Meet some of the Team



  • Brandon

  • Yannick

  • Peter


Some things published by the Team



  • Teamwork Engineering Blog


    • Building Desk

    • Spam: You Shall Not Pass

    • The Go Experiment

    • Go Learn


  • Github (insert open-source stuff we’ve released in desk)


    • stripehelper

    • s3pp

    • tnef



We care about all our teams, and they care about when their teammates will be online, what their timezone is and where they will be working from. When you apply we will ask you about where you intend to work from. We will also ask you whether or not you are open to considering spending some time in our Irish office, if you would like to work remotely, if you would like to relocate or if you're already here and ready to start work at Teamwork HQ in Cork, Ireland.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developers
jobs.content:
Here at Teamwork.com we've gone as far as we can with Cross-Platform Technologies for our mobile apps.  But it's just not good enough.  We want to take advantage of the very best that each platform offers.  It's not enough to be able to just get stuff done with our apps - we want them to be so good that people become addicted to using them.


So we're going fully native and we're putting together the best mobile team in the country to do it.


If you're a die-hard iOS or Android developer, this is your dream job: No legacy code, and the freedom and resources to do the best work of your career.


What We Expect:



  •  Strong attention to detail.

  • Willing to learn. You must have an open mind, be able to pick things up quickly and enjoy working with passionate people.

  • Fundamentally, this position is for a senior developer role, so we want to see that you've made some beautiful apps that you're proud of.


Ideally we'd also expect you to be familiar with the list below, but the main thing is your portfolio. Show us with the stuff you've done. Definite bonus points for putting together something using our API (http://developer.teamwork.com) - doesn't matter how small. 


What we we're not looking for:


 Ninjas. (Although if you want to do some martial arts in your free time that's fine too.)

jobs.title: Experienced Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Citrusbyte is a software development company which believes in using simple tools to solve all types of problems. We work closely with designers, engineers and our clients to create and improve products of great quality. We have considerable experience building custom systems for both startups and enterprises - check out our portfolio for more information about our clients.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.

Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.

We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.

We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

Skills & Requirements:

  • Smart, gets things done.
  • Passionate about software development.
  • Excellent communication / consulting experience.
  • Open minded and always learning
  • Experience working in a distributed company

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Architect and build web applications.
  • Work with product designers and clients to clarify requirements.
  • Plan and prioritize work in a collaborative remote team.

jobs.title: Lead QA Engineer
jobs.content:
GolfNow, a division of Golf Channel is the internet's largest online tee time reservation service, trusted by more than 1.5 million golfers. Using leading-edge technology, GolfNow provides more ways for golfers to stay connected to their favorite golf courses and tee times through the web, e-mail and mobile applications. As a partner to golf courses, GolfNow provides turnkey solutions to their operations (www.golfnowsolutions.com) with the main areas of focus on:
  • Online marketing and distribution of tee times
  • Web hosting, development and customer management solutions
  • Revenue optimization, database expansion and other course products



Software Quality Assurance Engineer Lead is responsible for Test planning, design, execution and Automation for various GolfNow.com applications and subsystems.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Perform software quality assurance, including black box testing, white box testing, user acceptance testing, and maintenance regression testing

* Automate tests using available and open-source tools and technologies.

* Code in standard Object Oriented languages like Java

* Understand and script using standard scripting languages like Perl, Shell, JavaScript.

* Learn and employ automation tools like Selenium, Ruby.

* Evaluate testing and inspection plans for projects of varying technology, complexity, and size

* Develop and document test scripts, test cases, defect tracking and reports

* Create and maintain manual and/or automated test scripts, test data, and other deliverables related to the software quality assurance (SQA) process

* Review log files and other run-time documentation for defects and issues

* Analyze the results of software tests and provide results for use in development code inspections and group reviews of project deliverables

* Detect, document, and track system defects throughout the SQA process

* Under direction of product management, participate in user acceptance testing * Perform maintenance regression testing

* Work with development teams to support and implement applications

* Other duties as assigned

Minimum Requirements:
* 4 experience as a QA Engineer or related position in a collaborative, team-driven software engineering environment

* 2 years experience automating or extending a test frameworks

* 2 years coding experience with standard Object Oriented languages like Java

* Experience with e-commerce and transactional systems

* Familiarity and/or programming experience with .NET and web-based technologies

* Excellent SQL and data skills

* Understanding of configuration issues related to software development; UNIX experience

* Experience maintaining test environments, automated testing tools, and other resources in support of SQA process

* Team player with strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills

* Familiarity and understanding of "Web 2.0 technologies" - e.g., Javascript, AJAX, Web Video

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer-Broadcast IT
jobs.content:
Part of the NBC Sports Group family, Golf Channel is a multimedia, golf entertainment and services company based in Orlando, Fla. In addition to its high-quality news, instruction and original programming, Golf Channel is home to more live golf than all other networks combined. Our coverage includes PGA TOUR, LPGA Tour, NCAA National Championships, The Open, Olympics and a slate of other worldwide tours and events. Golf Channel continues to connect the world to golf through a wide array of digital and lifestyle services including: Golf Channel Digital platforms, GolfNow, GolfAdvisor.com, Golf Channel Academy instructional facilities and Golf Channel Amateur Tour.

The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for software and database development. In collaboration with Engineering and IT teams, the Senior Engineer will recalibrate/create workflows and processes to be implemented throughout a fast paced, sports broadcast environment

Job Duties
  • Design, code and debug applications in various software languages
  • Engage with manufactures and vendors to create and implement workflow designs.
  • Plan, lead and manage development projects
  • Mentor junior engineers and review code
  • Analyze business requirements for system infrastructure
  • Integrate new and antiquated software with existing system's design and development
  • Telnet network programming and computer security
  • Integrate systems and networking for device control and function
  • Utilize API's and proprietary programs to streamline work processes & establish needs assessments
  • Integrate and develop new and existing systems using various software languages
  • Implement hardware and software system upgrades to existing servers
  • Support, maintain and document software functionality
  • Implement localization or globalization of software
  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation


Any and all other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent field
  • 4 years of software/code development or related experience
  • Experience in application development using Visual Studio, C# and ASP.NET.
  • Experience in SQL Server Administration and deployment.
  • Intermediate to advanced skill level in reverse engineering, testing and troubleshooting
  • Knowledgeable in Java, .NETJSP, JavaScript, Web services, SOAP, XML, MySQL, UNIX, Linux, AJAX, Windows, Apple ,MVC and HTML
  • Willing to work weekends, holidays, and shift work as necessary


Additional Job Requirements
  • Interested candidate must submit a resume/CV through www.nbcunicareers.com to be considered
  • Must be willing to work in Orlando

jobs.title: Software Engineer I
jobs.content:
GolfNow, a division of Golf Channel is the internet's largest online tee time reservation service, trusted by more than 1.5 million golfers. Using leading-edge technology, GolfNow provides more ways for golfers to stay connected to their favorite golf courses and tee times through the web, e-mail and mobile applications. As a partner to golf courses, GolfNow provides turnkey solutions to their operations (www.golfnowsolutions.com) with the main areas of focus on:
  • Online marketing and distribution of tee times
  • Web hosting, development and customer management solutions
  • Revenue optimization, database expansion and other course products




Software Test Automation Engineer I is responsible for the design and creation of Automation frameworks and Automation scripts for various GolfNow applications and subsystems.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Create and Automate tests using available and open-source tools and technologies.

* Create Automation and Code in standard Object Oriented languages like Java

* Understand and script using standard scripting languages like Perl, Shell, JavaScript.

* Learn and employ automation tools like Selenium, Ruby.

* Perform software quality assurance, including black box testing, white box testing, user acceptance testing, and maintenance regression testing

* Evaluate testing and inspection plans for projects of varying technology, complexity, and size

* Develop and document test scripts, test cases, defect tracking and reports

* Create and maintain manual and/or automated test scripts, test data, and other deliverables related to the software quality assurance (SQA) process

* Review log files and other run-time documentation for defects and issues

* Analyze the results of software tests and provide results for use in development code inspections and group reviews of project deliverables

* Detect, document, and track system defects throughout the SQA process

* Under direction of product management, participate in user acceptance testing

* Perform maintenance regression testing

* Work with development teams to support and implement applications

* Other duties as assigned

Minimum requirements:
* 1 year of experience as a QA Engineer or related position in a collaborative, team-driven software engineering environment or 4 years CS or related Bachelors degree.

* 1 year of experience automating or extending a test frameworks at work or school.

* 1 year coding experience with standard Object Oriented languages like Java.

* Familiarity and/or programming experience with .NET and web-based technologies

* Excellent SQL and data skills

* Experience maintaining test environments, automated testing tools, and other resources in support of SQA process

* Strong written and verbal communication skills

* Team player with strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills

* Ability to work under tight deadlines

jobs.title: Database Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Profile:


Our Houston-based database team sets the global standards for data solutions. We don’t want people to maintain the status quo; we want people who creatively propose and develop new and better ways of doing things. Seismic imaging requires sophisticated systems for managing high-performance computing resources and large volumes of data. Our existing and next-generation systems make heavy use of ORACLE object-relational database technology to support large distributed databases that are optimized for fast and reliable transaction handling. As a database software developer, your primary role is to design and develop these key systems.


This role allows you to work as part of a geographically dispersed team to engineer and develop terabyte-scale systems. Our world-class data center has lots of resources and lots of computation to do, so resource scheduling is a big development priority. We also like forward-thinkers, who are constantly planning how to improve the scalability of our systems to meet future needs. Indeed, particular emphasis is on the scalability of the systems in light of anticipated step changes in the volumes of seismic data processed and the related computational demands of seismic imaging. Partner with our agile teams focused on HPC infrastructure and algorithm development to design and support the crème de la crème of seismic imaging computing at CGG worldwide. We’re a global team, and your work impacts the globe.


Must have current U.S. work authorization or qualify for sponsorship.  *Please note:  New H-1B visas are no longer available for 2016/2017.

jobs.title: Web Software Developer PHP
jobs.content:
Job Profile:


Be a part of a global team responsible for the design, development and support of key web applications at CGG. Functions of our existing web applications run the gamut – from production applications interfacing with our high-performance computing environment that deals with massive amounts of seismic data, to applications for human-resource processes that support our employees (e.g., learning and career development, absence management, team directories, etc.).  The global web development team is also responsible for developing and maintaining various productivity tools, including tools used for data management and secure portals for client collaboration. The bottom line: we have numerous cutting edge applications to ensure our web engineers are challenged and interested in their work. 


Emphasis for this position will be on server-side coding in addition to front-end design.  A strong coding background and a desire to be very hands-on are critical to the work. The role will require you to develop, enhance, and manage new and existing web applications. You will interact extensively with users to understand requirements from a global user base and design innovative solutions to meet user demands. You are expected to maintain a high level of application and data integrity. Our standards are high, but you have the autonomy to devise your own creative solutions using the best tools available.


Must have current U.S. work authorization or qualify for sponsorship.  *Please note:  New H-1B visas are no longer available for 2016/2017.

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
About ChefHero


ChefHero is a commerce platform for food service. Food retailers can order and pay for all their supplies in one easy place.


About You

As mobile developer you should have experience developing in Android, with some apps publish on the Google Play Store. You also have to have experience using RESTful API to communicate with the backend, and integrating third party services. You are not a designer, but you will know that design and user experience is extremely important to the success of our product. You have to feel comfortable to work also on the backend.

Your Responsibilities

  • Implementation, deployment and testing of assigned projects which adhere to internal coding standards and practices
  • Proactive communication of needs, blockers, pertinent information
  • Development and maintenance of technical documentation for projects
  • Development and maintenance of unit and end to end testing suites
  • May lead specific projects within the engineering team
  • Report directly to CTO
  • Work directly with designer to convert the design into code
  • Necessary Qualifications
  • B.S. Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years software engineering experience
  • 4+ years of software engineering in Android(Java).
  • Strong foundation in Object Oriented design
  • Experience using RESTF APIs
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work with multiple concurrent goals
  • Ability to work independently but know when to ask questions
  • Must have built and released at least 2 apps on Google Play Store
  • Must have experience writing test cases and automation scripts
  • Must be able to design a component from requirements, covering all steps.


Bonus Qualifications

  • Strong declarative programming
  • Strong React skills
  • Strong React-Native skills
  • Experience with SASS
  • Experience with Google Cloud
  • Experience with Firebase

Benefits


Stock options in a fast growing company. Lunch and Dental insurance. Great vacation policy!

jobs.title: DevOps Developer
jobs.content:
The DevOps, Developer - PHP, Linux will be responsible for building automated data collection processes and tools for business users to interact with our core data content platform.  The role will work closely with product owners and development teams to develop automated workflows that make critical data content available through Genscape’s delivery channels. The candidate should have broad experience in web scraping, extraction, and data manipulation.  Solid experience in developing against a variety of databases, understanding, and modifying data models will be essential for the position.  The ideal candidate will also have experience leading remote support development teams through the software development cycle.



This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who:



  • Loves data and working with data based systems

  • Has systems administration experience coupled with application support

  • Enjoys working with various departments within the business and collaborting with various technical and product teams

  • Is extremely detail oriented and passionate about ensuring data content is received and delivered effectively.



A typical day in the life of a DevOps, Developer - PHP, Linux will include the following:



  • Relentless focus on availability and automation of content collection to product teams and customers

  • Develop tools and processes to allow business users to interact with content collection systems

  • Design, develop and operate a content technology platform that integrates and eventually consumes disparate one-off content collections systems resulting from acquisitions

  • Identify and pursue potential performance, reliability, and process improvements

  • Collaborate with a global team of developers operating with an agile methodology to reach development goals.

  • Take part in our team to provide Content Collections operations support and incidence response in order to meet customer SLAs.

  • Learn and implement new technologies to handle diverse, changing data sources and to meet complex customer data demands

  • Perform data analysis and modeling that covers content, technology and operations activities

  • Monitor and maintain the health of the collection systems and push the envelope to maximize consistency, reliability and performance.

  • Follow and investigate technology trends and make recommendations as they apply to the strategic business objectives

  • Collaborate with Genscape shared services and product teams to start, maintain, and evaluate data collection processes and systems.

jobs.title: Network Engineer
jobs.content:
The Genscape network team designs, implements and supports networks that provide services to our employees and customers.  The team supports the data networks that our corporate facility and branch offices rely upon for business applications.  The team is based in the Genscape Corporate Office in Louisville, KY. Successful candidates for the Network Engineer role must have a ‘can-do’ attitude and essentials skills in the areas of leadership and development of team mentality and guidance of less experienced personnel. Someone with strong communication skills when dealing with management and customers, as well as documentation, leadership, and mentoring traits and techniques would be a good fit for this role.



A Day in the Life of a Network Engineer on our Team:



  • Installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of Cisco routers, Cisco and Nexus switches, and ASA firewalls.

  • Configure and manage ASA and FortiGate firewalls.

  • Configure and manage wireless networks. 

  • Diagnose and resolve network outages.

  • Configure and manage DNS and DHCP Servers.

  • Configure and manage a Cisco VoIP System.

  • Analyze network traces/packet captures to identify root cause of network performance issues to recommend/implement corrective actions. 

  • Participate with teams in network planning and design, and document network architecture, standards, and procedures.

jobs.title: QA Automation Lead Engineer
jobs.content:
Summary description of duties:


The candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of an end-to-end integration and test framework with a heavy focus on supporting a fast paced agile software release process. As developers generate software packages encompassing new features, improvements and bug fixes, it will be the candidate’s responsibility to iterate the software through automated/manual testing and verify all requirements are met. This will entail working closely with developers to minimize the time to detection of defects and ensuring the delivery of production software. As a lead, the candidate will be responsible for understanding the effects of architectural and design decisions, taking a central role in the implementation of test and automation frameworks, and directing the technical efforts of junior QA engineers. Candidates with strong software development background and experience leading QA automation teams are preferred.

jobs.title: Forensic Software Developer - Entry Level
jobs.content:
You would provide support in the form of application development, scripting, debugging, and software development expertise to a digital forensic lab and malware reverse engineering section. You would maintain existing software and develop new software to customer specifications.


At Cipher Tech Solutions, Inc. (Cipher Tech), we take great pride in supporting some of the most mission critical work in the Department of Defense and the Intelligence Community. The majority of our company is comprised of extremely talented software developers who write production tools which directly support one of two missions: Digital Forensics and Malware Reverse Engineering.

Digital forensics is the practice of extracting and processing evidence from computers, phones, tablets, cameras, flash-drives, and just about any other form of digital media. The results of our work are then used to support federal and military law enforcement, counter intelligence, and counter terrorist activities.

Malware reverse engineering is the practice of analyzing extremely advanced malicious code. The goal of a reverse engineer is to understand how the malicious code works and determine facts such as:



  • How did it infect the victim's computer

  • What kind of information it is seeking to steal

  • How is it communicating with the author (actor)

  • Who that actor might be


If you would enjoy waking up every morning, using your keyboard to help protect National Security, this is the job for you!

  • Continuously develop our big data architecture stack to ensure we stay ahead of the pack.

Essential requirements:

Life at trivago is...

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator  Microsoft Exchange / Skype for Business
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Do you get a real kick from good server practices? Do you know Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business as well as you know your own family? We’re looking for an expert System Administrator who can take responsibility for our internal communication tools to make sure that our 1,000 plus employees stay connected.
