jobs.title: Senior Engineer, Data Science and Analytics
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world’s best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.





Position Description:



The Senior Engineer in Data Scienceand Analytics is an enticing role, which will contribute significantly to the team's ability to support advertising sales and marketing within Comcast. In this role, the individual will leverage advanced skills and experience in mining structured, unstructured and transactional data, and develop analytics that will drive advertising insights and strategy across linear and video-on-demand (VOD) platforms. Given the ever-changing industry, the majority of analytical projects provide new and innovative opportunities to use big data in ways that support leading edge initiatives. Projects may include predictive analytics in determining effective and efficient advertising, targeting select segments, as well as analytics providing ROI on new advertising strategies. Additionally, there will be key projects involving the development of segmentation and propensity modeling, utilizing internal, external and third party enhanced data.





With every project will come opportunities to work with other engineering, research, marketing and BI teams across multiple areas within the company. The role requires significant expertise in mining, joining, and analyzing data from multiple environments. Therefore, a strong background and level of experience is needed with Hadoop, Hive, Python, R, Linux, Java, SQL, and related skills/tools. In addition, excellent analytical skills required including advanced statistical and data mining techniques.





The Senior Engineer will be a significant member of the team, working closely with his/her manager to collaborate on current and upcoming projects, discuss data requirements and resource needs, and designing effective approaches to working with all necessary data. In addition, he/she will participate in meetings with the business to discuss, define, design and deliver analytics that will significantly impact both the company and its clients in the advertising industry.





Job Summary:

Leads engineering functions as they relate to the planning, design, integration, test, deployment and support of products. Assists with testing and operational activities. jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






Summary:

The EPS Regional Operations Engineering Enterprise Network Engineer-2 will primarily be responsible for the staging, implementation, and support of the Comcast internal enterprise network infrastructure and 3rd party vendor connections. Additional duties will include performance engineering, real time analysis and network optimization. The Comcast enterprise network combines the following services data, voice, and video-onto a single converged IP infrastructure. The Network Engineer-2 will interact with our internal Comcast customer across all business units.





Job Responsibilities:

Perform sustained engineering duties to support Comcast enterprise network applications data, voice, and video.

Monitor network capacity, plan and implement market augments as needed.

Exercise sound judgment during site design, network configuration, and network activation to ensure efficient use of funds and time, with minimal service impact.

Manage the performance and reliability of a converged network.

Assist in efforts to automate internal processes/tools for departmental engineering tasks

Provide operational escalation support, including periodic On-Call support focused on isolating and resolving network outages.

Participate in assigned interdepartmental technical projects

Build relationships with assigned business units through regular communication and site visits.

Communicate applicable design guidelines and provide guidance to business units to ensure compliance.

Provide network metrics/statistics as requested.

Other duties as assigned.





Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience





Experience:

2-5 years of hands-on experience with network infrastructure design, implementation, and support.

Understanding of the high level design criteria for managing a large converged data/voice/video enterprise network.

CCNP/JNCIP certified or equivalent on-the-job experience.

Explicit hands on experience configuring Cisco/Juniper switches & routers via command line.

Requires a proficient understanding of IP routing and switching protocols (OSPF, ISIS, BGP, STP).

Requires a proficient understanding of IPv4, IPv6, QoS, VSS, GRE, Spine/leaf architectures, etc.

Working knowledge of MPLS/VPN technologies.

Knowledge of IP Telephony and Telecom Technology a plus.

Scripting skills: Perl/Python and MySQL.

Extremely organized individual with strong troubleshooting skills.

Solid business communications skills, both written and verbal to effectively interact with internal business units and external vendors.





Core Responsibilities:

- Determines and implements corporate communications network and information technology standards.

- Troubleshoots and resolves complex network issues.

- Determines and documents internal telecommunications systems.

- Establishes and maintains network performance objectives.

jobs.content:

Job Summary:

Responsible for operating, managing and supporting high profile Commercial customers and network services as well as associated infrastructure in a 7/24 environment. Examples of infrastructure include but not limited to routers, switches, CMTS, etc. Day to day operational responsibilities includes pro-active monitoring, isolation, triage and resolution of all network outages/impairments. Serves as operations support for various regions, vendors, internal/external organizations. Drives standardization and service focused instrumentation. Contributes to the command and control network related activities focused on restoration of outages, clear and concise communication across Comcast/Commercial customers and rapid restoration of network services. Works and directly leads external vendors, third parties, and associated fix agents, when necessary, to address issues across the network, peering arrangements, inter-operability issues, etc. Works with limited supervision and direction while executing associated functions and responsibilities. Follows all operational practices and independently determines/develops approaches for non-routine solutions. Receives general direction in area of focus.

- Proactive/Reactive monitoring of Comcast's Commercial Network Core/Edge devices using various Element Management tools (Spectrum, Ericson Experience Manager, SevOne, etc) to isolate and troubleshoot all network related issues



- Process all customer calls/emails and take ownership of issue until resolution



- Troubleshoot network outages, network latency, or CPE failures



- Setup dispatch and troubleshoot issues with local field operations to resolve customer/network related issues



- Direct efforts so as to maintain service Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) within regional or contractual standards



- Advanced Knowledge of Networks: Local Area Network (LAN), Wide Area Network (WAN), Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)



- Advanced knowledge of: Carrier Ethernet, Cell Backhaul, DOCSIS Standards, Ethernet over HFC



- Advanced knowledge of network technologies on: Open System Interconnection (OSI), Layer 1/2 protocols, Internet Protocols IP; Routing Protocols OSPF, MPLS, IGP, IGRP, E/BGP



- Scripting knowledge



- Open and update Tickets using: Remedy, MetaSolv, Cramer



- Good Analytical/Communication/Troubleshooting Skills



- Ability to provide on the job training to new hires as and when required

jobs.title: Senior Algorithm Engineer
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.

- Explore state of the art prediction methods

- Clear communication of code design and implementation

- Work with product managers for fast paced feature development





Skills:

- Linear Programming and Optimization techniques

jobs.title: Software Engineer 2
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






As part of a team dedicated to Comcast's video playback experience, you'll have direct impact on the consumer experience of watching video over the web. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and realtime analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Combine your software engineering skills with the latest web and mobile technologies and come work as a Software Engineer at thePlatform, the leading online video management and publishing company.



Skills & Requirements

B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

3+ years experience

Passion for HTML5 and Javascript development

Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

Familiar with a scripting language

Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

Experience with version control tools such as git.

Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

Experience with multi-threading programing

Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.

Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.

Comcast is seeking a professional to join a Testing and Quality Management team. jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





The Customer Interaction Systems (CIS) team is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with application frameworks that facilitate the customer sales and service experience across multiple lines of business. Our software helps serve current and future Comcast customers.



Comcast is seeking an experienced software engineer responsible for designing, developing and maintaining Comcast's tools and service framework. The ideal candidate will have a strong Java background and web development experience. This individual will work in an agile environment, relying on strong problem solving and communication skills. As an experienced Software Engineer, they will be a technical leader on the team, having a large amount of input on technical design decisions and serving as a liaison to our stakeholders, primarily other development teams.





Core Responsibilities

-Producing technical designs and documentation at varying levels of granularity

-Writing production-quality, tested code

-Performing code reviews

-Collaborating with our technical operations teams to provide outstanding customer service

-Working with business stakeholders to understand their roadmaps and identify critical technical capabilities that need development.

-Partner with collaborating technical teams to ensure our systems are delivered with a focus on quality.

-Resisting the accrual of 'technical debt' in our systems.

-Working with product development teams to assist them in meeting their business goals through judicious application of CIS technologies.

-Mentoring more junior members of the technical staff.

-Building proof-of-concept systems or conducting exploratory experiments with new technology.

-Serving as an ambassador of CIS technologies to the broader technical community, both inside and outside Comcast, via a combination of authorship of technical papers, journal articles, and/or blog posts; and delivering presentations at technical conferences, meetups, user groups, etc.

-Keeps current with technological developments within the industry.

-Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews

literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of

assigned projects.

-Other relevant duties as assigned.





Preferred Qualifications:

-7 years of relevant work experience, including extensive programming experience and strong object-oriented skills.

-BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.

-Experience with Java and associated frameworks (Spring or Spring Boot)

-Excellent software development skills, in a diverse set of programming styles (procedural, objected-oriented, functional).

-Experience developing service oriented architectures and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.

-Experience with high-scale, distributed web service development (hands-on experience with RESTful web services)

-Experience with Agile development methodologies and practices (refactoring, TDD, pair programming).

-UNIX/Linux background: facility with command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts a plus.

-Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols.

-Familiarity with data serialization formats like XML, JSON and protocol buffers

-Familiarity with NoSQL data stores like Couchbase, Node4j and Elasticsearch

Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.

In this role you will collaborate with other developers, designers, testers, tech-operators and business managers to develop features for the website. This includes building prototypes, translating UX design documents to web pages and stylesheets, API development, automating functional and unit tests as well as writing development and design documentation. The primary responsibilities will include developing in JavaScript, CSS, HTML with some Ruby on Rails. You must be able to pick up new languages and technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands.

- Experience in caching especially in HTTP compliant caches



- Fundamental understanding of the HTTP protocol





ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS:-



- Experience with Ruby/Rail



- Experience with Agile/Scrum



- Knowledge of source control systems (Git)



- Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Deployment tools (Jenkins)



- Experience with automated web application testing tools (Jasmine, Teaspoon, Cucumber)

- DevOps experience

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Delivery Engineering Team
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






Visible Worldis looking for a talented, experienced, and versatile Software Engineer to work in our Manhattan office. We are looking for a self-starter accustomed to working in a dynamic atmosphere, creating reliable and cutting-edge technology. As a member of our Delivery Engineering team, you will be working on custom development and deep integration of our and customer technologies. Interacting with our customer's technical peers, you thrive using a broad variety of technologies to deliver and deploy top quality production-grade systems in fast paced environments.





Responsibilities

- Design and implement custom software solutions that seamlessly integrate with and extend our services into our customer's environments.

- Help discover technical requirements of new products.

- Develop test and integration approaches and environments.

- Work with our customers to test new developments and prepare them for deployment.

- Work with our Operations team to develop operational documentation and product documentation, and assist when troubleshooting production problems.





Qualifications

- BS or equivalent in Computer Science or related discipline.

- 2+years work experience.

- Solid grasp of a variety of computer languages, including javascript. Knowledge of c/c++ a plus.

- Experience with software development for Linux systems.

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

- Independent non-linear thinker who can route around obstacles and can come up with creative solutions.

- Dependable team player with strong communication skills.

From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary





We are seeking an ETL, Hadoop developer with strong understanding data warehousing and the Big Data Hadoop Ecosystem (HDFS, MapReduce2, Accumulo, Pig, Hive, HBase, MongoDB etc.) to work within a DevOps team. This position will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, tuning and the deployment of software solutions within the Hadoop Ecosystem. The developer will work closely with the administrators and application teams to insure business applications are highly available and performing within agreed upon service levels. This position will also work closely with business, architects and other development teams.









Key Responsibilities



-Troubleshoot and develop on Hadoop technologies including HDFS, Hive, Pig, Flume, HBase, MongoDB, Accumulo, Tez, Spark, Storm, and Hadoop ETL development via tools such as Informatica, Pentaho.



-Software development in a collaborative team environment using Scrum Agile methodologies, primarily using ETL data ingest/egress frameworks.



-Translate, load and present disparate data sets in multiple formats and multiple sources including JSON, Avro, text files, Kafka queues, and log data.



-Participate in designing, building, installing, configuring applications that lend themselves to a continuous integration environment.



-Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed design.



-Participate in analysis of data stores



-Ensures solutions developed adhere to security and data privacy policies.







Required:



-1-3years of ETL data integration development and Scrum Agile development



-1-2 yearsof Big Data Hadoop Ecosystem components (Sqoop, Hive, Pig, Flume, etc.)



-1-2 yrsof Hadoop architecture, storage and IO subsystems, network and distributed systems



-Understanding of data warehousing concepts



-Familiar with open source technologies and libraries



-Knowledge of scripting with shell scripting (Bash, PHP, PERL, Python, etc.)



-Understanding of versioning, change control, and problem management





Desired Skills/ Experience:



-Understanding of RDBMS technologies and SQL language; Teradata and Oracle highly preferred



-Knowledge of java virtual machines (JVM) and multithreaded processing



-Knowledge of NoSQL platforms



-Experience with open source management tools (Pig, Hive, Flume, Thrift API, etc.) including participation in the community



-Large scale data warehousing



-Data Quality, DataCleaner, etc.



-Understanding of high performance and large Hadoop clusters

jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Senior Designer User Experience





Team Overview:

The Sales & Marketing UX team is transforming how new and existing XFINITY customers learn about offers and enjoy our services. We're focused on improving the customer experience with enhanced flows, smart features and self-healing solutions while building a foundation for long-lasting relationships. Our Emmy-award winning UI delivers entertainment across our customer's devices in ways that are engaging, fun and fully satisfying.



Position Description:

The UI/Visual Designer will have a hands-on role in the design of xfinity.com. You'll help shape product benefits around user needs to create engaging and intuitive user interfaces with sales driven results. As part of your day-to-day, you'll collaborate with team Creative Directors as well as sales, marketing, brand and engineering leads. You'll help drive the delivery of digital applications that feature outstanding user experience and elegant design aesthetics.



Core job responsibilities:

- Take responsibility for the user interface: identify problems, propose solutions, recommend implementations, and execute UI solutions to improve the user experience.

- Create pixel-perfect, world-class user interfaces and original, eye-catching visual design.

- Deliver high quality work on tight schedules in a dynamic, agile product environment.

- Produce interactive prototypes for internal experimentation and usability testing, and test UI in a rigorous, data-driven way.

- Demonstrate a command of usability and accessibility standards in partnership with visual and interface design disciplines and principles.

- Have a broad experience and a deep understanding of users to recommend UI features that solve customer needs.

- Write intuitive style guides and design specifications with a focus towards engineering implementation.

- Support, communicate, course-correct, and revise through the development phase.

- Maintain a critical eye and an obsessive attention to detail.

- Help us make it new, while keeping the experience in the larger family. We are reinventing the design of the site and have a lot of opportunity to explore style and interactions.

- Demonstrate the ability to solve design problems, from both a usability and visual perspective



Qualifications:

- A portfolio that showcases several recent e-commerce designs is required for consideration. Mobile site/mobile phone and/or tablet apps designs a plus

- Minimum 6 years of UI and visual design experience within a digital agency or product team.

- Experience leading development of comprehensive and versatile digital design systems.

- Significant experience in iconography, symbol design, and data visualization.

- Expert typesetting and typographic design skills.

- Deep knowledge of cross-platform web/mobile usability standards and UI specifications.

- Understanding of design and technical capabilities/limitations of leading email and browser technology.

- Skilled in taking a project from exploratory and conceptual version, through to final production assets.

- Proven ability to multi-task and execute against multiple projects running in parallel paths.

- Ability to collaborate with copywriters and business stakeholders for successful marketing related launches.

This is a senior position within the SE Data Service organization reporting to the Senior Manager of Software Dev & Engineering. The Data Services group has responsibility for enterprise analytics/Big Data analytics across Comcast. The position is specifically responsible for the architecture and development of stream-based applications leveraging the Enterprise Hadoop platform.





Collaborates and partners with technical and business teams to present and define, strategies, requirements, road-maps, budgets and solutions. Prepare and present gap analysis for technology and business solutions up to VP level.



The Big Data Integration / Solution Architect must have strong understanding and hands-on experience with the following software components: Hadoop Hive, Pig, Flume, Sqoop, Storm, Spark, Kafka, Accumulo, HBase, Java, Memory Caching and UC4





-Provides technical direction for diverse and complex initiatives and is accountable for a variety of tasks to architect and deliver solutions that exceed customer expectations in content, usability, accuracy, reliability and performance while assuming a leading role within agile teams (both on-shore and off-shore)



-Interprets business strategy and develops organizational objectives to align with this strategy. Typically influences multiple teams of professionals.



-Works across technical and business team in order to harmonization data asset



-Has experience building highly available, high volume, fault tolerant transaction processing engines that span multiple locations



-Experience using caching technology for real time data enrichment/transformation



-Candidate might have worked in one or more roles (e.g. System Architect, Data architect, Application Architect, Solution Architect)



-Knowledge in big data methodologies and best practices required



-Strong verbal and written communication skills required



-Effective interpersonal relations skills, ability to effectively collaborate with others and work as part of a team required



-Skills in navigating a large organization in order to accomplish results required.



-Ability to initiate and follow through on complex projects of both short and long term duration required



-Excellent organizational and time management skills required



-Excellent analytical and problem solving skills required



-Works independently, assumes responsibility for job development and training, researches and resolves questions and problems, requests supervisor input and keeps supervisor informed required



-Participate on interdepartmental teams to support organizational goals



-Performs other related duties and tasks as assigned



-Punctual, regular, and consistent attendance





Required Skills/Experience:



-Advanced Degree in technical discipline and/or equivalent technical experience (e.g. 10+ years of architecture experience with data integration and data warehousing; 3+ years of big data platform architecture)



-Experience working with large datasets (petabytes)



-Experience architecting and maintaining highly available applications



-3 to 5 years' experience with Hadoop architectures



-Experience working as solution architect supporting Platform as a Service



-Experience with continuous integration, test-driven/behavior-driven development, and agile, scrum development methodologies



-Experience collaborating and partnering with technical and business teams to present and define strategies, requirements, road-maps, budgets, and solutions



-Experience designing logical and physical architectures



-Experience influencing teams of senior technologists



-Experience working in an Agile development methodology in a data warehouse environment



-Ability to work effectively across organizational boundaries



-Excellent oral, written, analytical, problem solving, and presentation skills



-Experience with managed services and on-shore / off-shore development

jobs.title: Vice President of Engineering
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






The Vice President of Engineering reports to the Chief Technology Officer. The role entails managing and growing the Engineering department. The Engineering department consists of a handful of engineering teams that focus on a specific technology domain (UI & Workflow, Core Data Platform, Optimization & Algorithms, Big Data, Advertising Delivery). Each team is run by a Tech Lead. Teams work in an agile manner, with monthly sprints.





Specific Responsibilities include:



- Personnel management direct or indirect supervision over all Engineering staff (developers, Tech Leads, QA). This includes hiring, coaching, and talent development.



- Program management and Execution manage plans, timelines, and interdependencies between different engineering teams.



- SDLC Manage and improve the Software development and release process, with special attention to automated testing, DevOps, and scalable development.



- Technical Leadership interface with Product Management and other business functions.





Professional Qualifications:



- BA in Computer Science or related discipline required,MS or MA degreein Computer Science or related discipline preferred.



- 12+ years of previous experience in a leadership in Engineering position, overseeing at least 35 Software Engineers



- Deep experience with agile development methodologies, automated testing, release processes, etc.



- Experience with managing "matrix development organizations" (multiple engineering teams / domains, and multiple end-to-end products)



- Experience with managing Software Development across multiple technical platforms, including C#/.NET, Linux, Python, Javascript/Node.js, Hadoop.



- Experience with developing and maintaining Cloud-based software platforms (SAAS).





Personal Characteristics:



- Strong People manager



- Passion for managing engineering organizations, and bringing them from "start-up mode" to more scalable development process (without losing the "startup mentality").



- Ability to successfully negotiate effort, timelines, features.



- Team player.



- Openness to learn, and foster continuous innovation.



- Work ethic highlighted by willingness to "roll up the sleeves" to get into the details required to get the job done.



- High integrity

The Voice Control Platform (VREX) is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with advanced NLP technologies for searching and discovering any type of content in the entertainment catalog available.



The Voice control Platform needs an UX software engineer to develop tools to help monitor, configure and maintain the infrastructure.

You will work with other engineers and researchers with backgrounds in advanced fields such as natural language processing, information retrieval, and knowledge representation. As a key member of the team, you will help design, implement and test various components of the system.



Comcast T&P encourages career development with regular opportunities for training and programs for innovative cross-team projects such as week-long Hackathon and job rotation programs over the summer.

jobs.name: Federal Home Loan Bank of San Franicisco

jobs.title: Release Engineer / Reliability Engineer
jobs.company: Federal Home Loan Bank of San Franicisco
jobs.content:
Purpose:   


The Release/Reliability Engineer will work side by side with the engineering, development, and platform teams and be primarily responsible for automation for the administration of our hybrid cloud services. The individual will bridge the gap between development, operations and infrastructure. This role will help facilitate tasks needed to keep the product delivery, availability, and performance optimum. 
 
Major Accountabilities: 

• Lead efforts in automation, continuous deployment, and configuration management.
• Manage and maintain the primary customer-facing application environment.
• Actively participate in Engineering Scrum and design meetings to drive quality releases.
• Contribute to planning efforts for disaster recovery, capacity expansion, and system upgrading within our hybrid cloud.
• Work with configuration system and infrastructure management.
• Monitor applications with Application Performance Monitoring tools.
• Code in one or more of several popular programming languages.
• Produce and maintain documentation on installations, incidents, and procedures requirements for systems.
• Research new promising technologies, strategies, and ways to solve technical issues.
• Work across IT functions and collaborate effectively to deliver complete technical solutions.
• Perform ad hoc responsibilities as needed.


Skills/Knowledge:


• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Accounting, and Finance, or a related field, or equivalent work experience, is required.
• Minimum 5 years hands-on experience in designing, developing implementing and supporting business applications.
• Successful Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment platform implementations with products such as Jenkins.
• Configuration management using CloudFormation, Chef, or Puppet on Windows and Linux.
• Proficient in logging tools such as ELK or Splunk.
• Experience in using Application Performance Management tools (New Relic and AppDynamics) to resolve issues.
• Working experience with JIRA and Confluence project agile tracking documenting tools.
• Experience with IT SOX compliance and risk management requirements.
• Coding experience with Ruby, shell scripting, or Java.
• Understanding of operating systems, application security configurations, and best practices in Windows and UNIX environment is required.
• Ability to take the initiative to pursue assignments, responsibilities, and support requests to a logical and final solution and to employ SDLC standards is required.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• ITIL foundation training or other service management training is a plus.


Culture & Benefits:


• We are a conservative company, and we've been around for a long, long time.So we are very well established and secure.The culture is relaxed and professional.
• Your managers get that you want to work on mind-stimulating projects and make an impact, and we have great tools/resources.
• You will be working with extremely intelligent, sincerely kind and supportive co-workers throughout the Bank.
• We actually truly offer work-life balance.
• We offer amazing benefits for you and your family.
• We are big on training and development.
• We are located in the heart of the SF Financial District. It doesn't get more beautiful than this. However, there are times when you and your manager will arrange working from home as well.


The Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. We value and actively seek to recruit, develop, and retain individuals with varied backgrounds and experiences reflecting the full diversity of the communities that we serve.  It is the policy of the Bank to comply with all applicable laws concerning the employment of persons with disabilities.

jobs.title: Data Automation Software Engineer
jobs.content:
dfxMachina is building the automated factory operating system -- not just modernizing, but fundamentally changing the way objects are made.  Our ex-Apple founders have deep manufacturing industry insights and connections, and we're building a dynamic team of data-driven engineers who see inefficiencies as opportunities and want to build technology that touches and improves millions of objects each day.


The Data Automation Software Engineer develops and deploys scalable, non-task specific machine learning, computer vision, and other data extraction/correlation algorithms to generate insights about our customers’ product and manufacturing processes. He or she works closely with our web development team to run these algorithms on our cloud database and push actionable insights to our customers.  


In this role, the Data Automation Software Engineer will explore and implement ways to automatically generate useful findings from our customer’s data.  He or she will employ the latest machine learning techniques in clever ways to find meaning in the noise of data – and in the process build out core-tech for dfxMachina.  We are looking for someone who can identify powerful applications of machine learning and/or computer vision, and write the code required to deliver highly accurate and repeatable results for our customers.


What You’ll Do:


- Architect and implement a framework to automate the extraction of useful information from manufacturing images and parametric data.


- Develop a toolbox of production-ready primitive algorithms that can be applied to many different products without custom tuning, and measure their performance on real data


- Quickly prototype and iterate on new algorithmic concepts, and help prioritize which to pursue based on customer needs.

jobs.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you will be part of a team developing Getaround's next generation of Connected Car technology. Leveraging our Getaround Connect™ in-vehicle device, you will help deliver new services to our customers and simplify the car sharing experience using the smartphone. We’re looking for an experienced, strong engineer that can design for scale, wrangle through data, optimize systems, and has worked with different varieties of NoSQL databases. Your role will include building and supporting cloud infrastructure, architecting, building web APIs and tools. You’ll need to take ownership and pride in your work which means you understand the need for code quality, elegance, and developing robust infrastructure. If you are a quality hacker that enjoys a fast and furious startup environment, lives on overdrive, and can chart your own course, then apply now! 


What You'll Be Doing



  • Developing core infrastructure that supports all other engineering  teams

  • Developing APIs, systems and services for Getaround Connect™ platform

  • Provisioning and maintaining clusters of servers that will support petabytes of data

  • Building out newly enabled features for Getaround's Connected Car platform

  • Monitoring system uptime and errors to ensure a high performing and reliable product

  • Building tools that will allow us to manage millions of connected cars in real-time

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Industry Leading Product
jobs.content:
Make an impact someone else's work day, literally all day, every day! You will contribute to Acordex's cutting edge tablet software that makes our customers' day more enjoyable and more efficient. 


Your Team


You will be part of a team that is out-innovating established competitors who are a fifty times our size. We have a small and very talented group of engineers that you will find either stimulating or entertaining, depending on how the day is going. In the end, it is very important to us to have an environment where we actually look forward to coming to work every day.


Responsibilities


Your primary responsibility is creating new software that is rock solid, performs well and is easy to use. This includes:



  • design innovative software that balances cost and performance to meet customer requirements

  • write software predominantly using HTML5/JavaScript (taking advantage of Closure Compiler where appropriate) and PHP, with additional opportunities in SWIFT or Java running on tablets

  • solve complex customer problems that are beyond the expertise of our very engaging and hard working support staff


The software you create is absolutely crucial to our customers; they literally cannot complete their day's work without it. Since Acordex software often interacts with other software from third parties, our customers sometimes rely upon you to look beyond the confines of your own software and contribute to an understanding of their environment. Unlike at large corporations, you will communicate directly with customers.


This is a full-time, permanent, on-site position at Acordex Imaging Systems, in North Andover, MA, during normal business hours.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer on Social Learning Platform
jobs.content:
At Pathgather, we build things right because we believe that learning matters. Modern companies can't afford to provide the same tired, low-quality experiences they've been using for the last few decades. Our enterprise learning platform is used by some of the largest companies in the world like Qualcomm, Walmart, and Twitter to help their employees find great learning content from any source, share knowledge with their peers, and track their progress towards career goals - and we've wrapped it all up into an experience that employees actually love to use.


We're growing in a big way and are looking for experienced engineers to join our frontend team to help make enterprise learning better. You'll be working on our React (and React Native) apps and responsible for everything from architecture through implementation and testing.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer on Social Learning Platform
jobs.content:
At Pathgather, we build things right because we believe that learning matters. Modern companies can't afford to provide the same tired, low-quality experiences they've been using for the last few decades. Our enterprise learning platform is used by some of the largest companies in the world like Qualcomm, Walmart, and Twitter to help their employees find great learning content from any source, share knowledge with their peers, and track their progress towards career goals - and we've wrapped it all up into an experience that employees actually love to use.


We're growing in a big way and are looking for experienced engineers to join our backend team to help make enterprise learning better. You'll be working on our platform, integrations, API development, and much more - and will be responsible for everything from architecture through implementation and testing.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you interested in connecting clients with insights based on massive data? The Brand team evaluates over 100 billion transactions a day, in real-time determining how to respond. As a full stack engineer you will be responsible for building web applications that deliver clear and powerful insights into how we are making these decisions to our clients. You will own the development of new features from design, implementation and testing to release. The most important traits of the Brand team are ownership and executional excellence. Here, you can say “I built that” and know that everyone can depend on your results. For example, we recently built the new Search Powered Audience (SPA) product and provided it to 100s of clients to run campaigns 24/7. This started as a hackathon project and within a year has grown to be a core product on our team, reliably serving many of our clients.


Your typical work day may include:



  • Releasing new features to provide insights and allow configuration of large campaigns

  • Working with internal and external clients and project managers to gather requirements and ideas for new features

  • Participating in or leading design review and brainstorming sessions

  • Creating APIs and services to power the UI

  • Mentoring other engineers

  • Presenting to clients, at conferences, in journals, or writing about your work on our blog

  • Improving deployment, testing, monitoring and operational tools and processes

jobs.title: Senior Modeling Scientist, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to appropriate audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in modeling scientists with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems.

You will work within a world class modeling group of scientists and engineers that spans multiple product teams and collaborates closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.



RESPONSIBILITIES




    • Design, develop and operate statistical models and algorithms to deliver performance at scale

    • Investigate system issues, identify root causes, and design solutions

    • Prototype solutions and conduct data analyses to solve large-scale inference and control problems

    • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new products to delight our customers

    • Implement algorithms for production systems responsible for real time audience targeting on Real Time Bidding (RTB) exchanges

    • Work cross-functionally with other teams to develop best practices in campaign setup, execution and optimization

    • Be part of on-call rotation (about 4x a year)- we build and operate our own products!

    • Generate and review proposals for further research and development directions

    • Participate in machine learning study group and present findings to stakeholders as needed

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer, Ad Reporting
jobs.content:
The Advertising Reporting Team is responsible for building industry-leading reporting solutions for Quantcast’s advertising clients, providing rich insights into their advertising campaigns and audience.


We are looking for a senior full-stack engineer who has significant experience with both client-side and server-side Web technologies. You will be leading the development of brand new, innovative reporting features to deliver an intuitive user experience and service architecture for our large and rapidly growing advertising client base.


The right applicant will be a versatile technical leader, deeply interested in technology and finding the best solution for a problem, as well as redefining the problem to make our software best-in-class.


We currently use AngularJS, d3, SASS, Java, and the Play framework.


Responsibilities




  • Define, code, test, and deploy new features to our reporting suite with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.




  • Utilize latest HTML, CSS, and JS techniques to produce highly-performant, informative, and beautiful user experiences for clients.




  • Work cross-functionally with UX, Product, and other Engineering teams. Contribute to the product definition, UI, and system design processes. 




  • Evaluate feasibilities and effectively manage project scope and time.




  • Continually evaluate and instill best practices into the development process, including automated testing, code organization and style, and application architecture.




  • Provide guidance to other team members and mentorship to junior software developers.




Requirements




  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field




  • 5+ years of web application development experience




  • 2+ years in a senior software development role




  • 2+ years of JavaScript experience in a client-side MVC framework




  • Deep understanding of web technologies and their implications, from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript through to the back-end technologies that support websites




  • Experience building responsive user interfaces for the Web




  • Bonus: Professional experience with AngularJS or d3




  • Bonus: Professional experience with Java or the Play framework




  • Bonus: Open-source project contributions

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The GNF DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the design and ongoing management of the production, development, and disaster recovery environments, to include Windows, Unix, storage and backup technologies. The DevOps engineer will be asked to design, participate and lead enterprise level projects. Daily responsibilities will include the automation, management, monitoring, performance tuning, and the resolution of IT system problems. Must be able to interact with multiple project teams, manage simultaneous projects and provide team presentations.

Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.
• 7-plus years of Information Technology experience in systems administration and engineering.
• 3-plus years of experience with senior-level Unix and storage engineering duties.
• 2-plus years DevOps/”infrastructure-as-code” experience.
• Experience managing change, implementing new processes and best practices in medium/large-scale mixed Unix/Windows environments.
• Experience with Amazon Web Services as a platform (AWS).
• Ideal candidate will have experience working in the Pharmaceutical Research/Biotechnology industry.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Deluxe OnDemand™ is transforming content sourcing, processing and distribution.  With our advanced video workflow management and turnkey content-supply solutions, Deluxe OnDemand makes it easier for service providers to offer premium content quickly and cost-effectively across more devices.  Deluxe OnDemand addresses a range of customer requirements to optimize or supplement existing VOD workflows, support IP-VOD applications, expand VOD/SVOD libraries, and quickly launch EST services and 4K UHD.  Our cloud-based solutions are a more scalable, cost-effective, and futureproof alternative to building-out new infrastructure.  Deluxe OnDemand is commercially deployed by leading cable, telco, and OTT providers.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a company in the hottest industry that offers an exciting, challenging and dynamic work environment.  We focus on innovation, creativity, and cutting edge technology.

Due to unprecedented growth and increasing demand for our services we are seeking Senior Ruby on Rails Developers with 5+ years of RoR development experience to work out of our Solana Beach or Burbank, CA facilities.

If you are interested in joining a disruptive entertainment company that pushes the envelope and definitely cares about providing a great working environment for its employees, then apply immediately!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

  1. High caliber colleagues and projects.
  2. Fun and collaborative environment.
  3. Well established Entertainment Company working on exciting new things.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Own major aspects of product functionality from back-end algorithms to front-end user experience.
  • Work closely with stakeholders and peers to develop software that meets the business objectives of the organization.
  • Make significant contributions to ensure a cohesive and integrated team, defining and advocating engineering best practices.
  • Writing superb code and associated unit/acceptance tests.
  • Think about how you can best tailor a user experience, but you must also be capable of creating highly scalable infrastructure.

What You Need for this Position

MUST HAVES:

  • Ruby on Rails
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • JavaScript
  • REST APIs

STRONG PLUSES:

  • Modern JavaScript (Ember, Angular, etc.)
  • Test-Driven Development
  • Github
  • Amazon EC2
  • Heroku

What's In It for You?

  • A very competitive base salary
  • 401(k)
  • Vacation/PTO
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Select the hardware and equipment you want to get your work done!

We offer competitive pay and benefits program, including: medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), company health screenings and more.

To view other open positions and for more information on our company, please visit our website at

http://www.bydeluxe.comDeluxe is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for a talented and motivated System Engineer to join our growing team. As a Systems Engineer you will be responsible for developing and implementing automation solutions for rapid deployment and scaling of applications across a multi­cloudinfrastructure.
_____________


Responsibilities
_____________


- Development and testing in system shells and SCM tools to automate management and deployment of applications to the cloud.
- Configuration and customization of continuous integration environments and processes.
- Analysis and troubleshooting of deployment and configuration setup of SCM and cloud platforms.


______________


Essential
______________


- 4+ yrs administering systems and developing automation scripts
- Good knowledge on Linux/Windows systems administration. Red Hat / Microsoft Certification is preferred.
- Good knowledge in at least one programming or scripting language. Ruby / Python is strongly preferred
- Good knowledge in at least one system shell language. Bash / Powershell is strongly preferred.
- Good knowledge of setup, configuration and deployment of applications to web and application servers. Apache / IIS / Tomcat are strongly preferred.
- Good analytical/debugging skills.
- Must be a quick learner and a team player.
- Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and prioritize work accordingly
- Highly motivated and self directed professional able to work in small teams
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills


____________________


Additional Experience
____________________


- Knowledge of systems administration and shell scripting in both Linux and Windows is strongly preferred
- Knowledge of continuous integration systems for deployment and release. Jenkins / Bamboo is strongly preferred
- Knowledge of IT automation tools, configuration management and devops platforms. Puppet / Chef is strongly preferred
- Knowledge of public cloud platform and cloud services. AWS / Azure is strongly preferred.
- Knowledge of virtualization and cloud platform stacks like OpenStack / Cloud Foundry.

jobs.title: Technical Support- Europe (Remote)
jobs.content:
The GitHub Technical Support team is looking for full-time team members located in Europe! This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. This is the current list of countries in which we are set up as an employer in Europe, so legal working authorization is required: Austria, Croatia, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Ireland, Netherlands, Scotland, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

GitHub users work 24/7, so you'll occasionally need to adjust your work week to help cover a weekend or holiday (don't worry! We strongly support flexible schedules that let you to take care of the important things in your life).

When GitHub users have questions, they contact Support and we help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. Technical support handles a wide variety of inquiries including questions about Git and GitHub workflows, GitHub Pages, our API, and our desktop applications. Support also works closely with the engineering team to track down bugs and improve our documentation.

The most important characteristic of our support team is that we love helping developers. GitHub is a place for people to work better, together. Our job is to help. Support treats users the way we'd want someone to treat our friends.

Our support teammates have excellent writing chops: stellar grammar, charming written personality, and the ability to explain complicated things simply. We measure our success in swiftness, accuracy, and clarity.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Current legal working authorization
  • Stellar English and grammar skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills – you might not know all the answers but you know how to find and communicate the solution
  • A strong sense of empathy – you are attuned to hear the question behind a question
  • Technical experience and exposure to programming
  • Customer service experience
  • A unique writing style and voice

BONUS:

  • Will love developers and GitHub as much as we do
  • Could effortlessly explain how Git works to a non-developer
  • Have remote customer service experience

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

jobs.title: Account Support- Asia Pacific (Remote)
jobs.content:
The GitHub Accounts Support team is looking for full-time team members who are based in Asia Pacific. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. This is the current list of countries in which we are set up as an employer in Asia Pacific, so legal working authorization is required: Japan, Australia, and New Zealand.

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Agent - North America (Remote)
jobs.content:
More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so the support team is growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. We're looking for Enterprise Support Agents in North America (US and Canada) who will answer incoming phone calls, triage issues, and help provide solutions.

The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company.

GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities:

  • Take in-bound phone support requests
  • Triage incoming support tickets
  • Work collaboratively with other support teams
  • Manage communication around customer tickets
  • Troubleshoot and help solve highly complex support tickets
  • Escalate issues to other support engineers and managers as applicable
  • Work with our Engineering team to prioritize issues and development
  • Work with our Documentation team to improve customer-facing resources

Qualifications:

  • Must have current working authorization to work in the U.S.
  • Knowledge of Linux servers
  • General understanding of how modern web applications work
  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers
  • Ability to clearly write and orally communicate technical information
  • Ability to review and understand code (Ruby / Bash)
  • Must have a workspace conducive to answering phone calls
  • Prior experience providing technical support
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Strong empathy for GitHub users and GitHub Support

Bonus points if you have:

  • Technical experience (QA, documentation, systems administration, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Git and GitHub

jobs.title: Business Systems Analyst - Financial Systems
jobs.content:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Financial Systems Analyst to join our new Business Systems team to manage, scale, and expand our Financial systems and technology.

The Business Systems Team is a new addition to GitHub that's developing new ideas to help scale the company as it moves to the next level. Tasked with the exciting challenges of the growing company, you will be expected to find new capabilities, recommend best practices to our business parters, recommend business systems of choice, and drive their implementations and integration.

The Role

GitHub is the gateway for software development. Our impact and customers are global, and so is our vision. We're looking for someone who will materially advance our business and culture.

Your role will be the administrator and gate-keeper of our Financial Systems, assist in building out our vision for business systems including business process designs, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance. We are ever-evolving and improving so you will be on the lookout for ways to enhance our internal processes and how to impact those improvements in our systems.

You'll partner with other awesome teams here at GitHub, such as Finance (Accounting and Strategic Finance), Product, Sales, Marketing and Engineering to transform their challenges into systems-driven solutions. Collectively, we're a resourceful bunch that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matters, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team.

Our primary customers are our internal business partners. We like to make sure they are set up to be successful by assisting in general change management during the introduction of process or system changes. Training and documentation is key though we're tactful in how we roll these out to keep us all nimble and focused on executing.

This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to the Business Systems Manager, Financial Systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Administer, design, and scale our Record-2-Report and Procure-2-Pay processes and systems (GL, PO, AP, AM, RevRec, Financial Reports)

  • Assist to build business systems roadmap to include business process design, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance

  • Build cross-functional partnerships in order to translate business requirements into systems-driven solutions

  • Support continuous improvement and evaluate impact and prioritization of individual projects

  • Document end-2-end business processes, maintain best practices, procedures, and controls established within the internal financial reporting systems

  • Collaborate with leadership across all functions to drive decisions and execution plan

  • Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to security, compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions and efficiencies

  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2-3 years of work experience in Financial or related systems administration

  • Experience working with Netsuite, Zuora, CallidusCloud, SFDC, or Coupa

  • Proven track record of cross functional collaboration

  • Knowledge of financial reports (balance sheet, income statement, cashflow)

  • Ability to work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment with some ambiguity and a need for directing energy and thinking

  • Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

  • Self-starter and ability to multi-task while performing a variety of complex tasks

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.
