The Mobile Banking Developer III will primarily be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining the Digital Banking/Mobile Platform. These duties include developing and maintaining the Digital Banking Platform including middleware, Apple iOS client, Android client, Mobile website client and HTML 5 web client.


PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Discover & Watch
jobs.content:
Twitch has over 100 million users, and the Discover and Watch team is responsible for helping them connect with content they love on both live and recorded video. We’re building a number of features to make Twitch the most compelling destination for gaming video this year. Recently, we launched Clips and our HTML5 Video Player, and we’re just getting started.

We’re looking for engineers that love delighting people with incredible products and user experiences. On this team, you’ll work closely with our other engineering and product teams to craft a beautiful and engaging product, collect feedback, and iterate quickly. We value expertise in building applications for the Web, comfort working throughout the stack, and an understanding of product concerns.




A TYPICAL WEEK




    • You’ll brainstorm with designers and product managers to understand our video strategy and prototype new products

    • You’ll lead backend and frontend engineers to define the architecture around these products and ship an MVP, balancing product and engineering tradeoffs

    • You’ll collect data with our data scientists and plan subsequent iterations on these features with product managers

    • You’ll define engineering best practices, mentor junior engineers, and participate in code and design reviews

    • You’ll help our support team triage bugs, respond to user feedback, and fix production issues

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Search & Discovery
jobs.content:
We deal with some of the most challenging problems in the industry. Our scale and speed of our growth forces us to experiment with techniques and technologies only the very biggest websites ever need to use. If you would like to work in a challenging engineering environment where every new project is a learning opportunity, you've come to the right place. The Search and Discovery team at Twitch is looking for strong, technical engineers to help build upon and improve the user experience around finding new content. You have to have a knack for re-using existing technologies and understanding how to apply those in crafting the right recommendation systems. We have lots of users and lots of data to work with, so this will be fun and challenging. Ideally you have experience and wisdom from building large AI and Machine Learning systems around search and recommendations. A strong interest in doing so would be fine too, provided you are a stellar engineer.


RESPONSIBLITIES




    • Design, build, and maintain scalable search services, recommendation systems, and newsfeeds.

    • Cultivate engineering best practices within your group and engineering

    • Participate in code and design reviews.

    • Mentor and cultivate junior engineers

    • Participate in design and architecture sessions with other product and team leads

    • Providing engineering input into our product planning and scheduling processes

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.content:
Twitch has achieved significant and consistent growth in audience (all organic traffic growth), engagement, and number of broadcasters streaming content.  Our company has a proven management team and strong technology.  We offer our business customers a wide variety of tools to market and sell to these audiences, tools to help them develop better products, and research services to provide in-depth understanding of the gaming and entertainment markets.

We are looking for a detail-oriented, customer service focused Account Manager with media experience that will work hand in hand with the sales team. The Account Manager will be a crucial member of a growing team that will support sales in meeting its objectives and providing best in class customer service to clients, both internal and external.  Light travel may be required and the position will report to the Director of Client Services.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Insertion Order Management
  • Work with the finance team on any new client approvals
  • Enter IO into Order Management System
  • Verify accuracy of Internal IO and client insertion order
  • Be client facing point of contact to ensure smooth execution and delivery
  • Clarify any questions Ad Operations may have about the campaign

  • Client Management
  • Provide highest level of customer service to clients, both internal and external
  • Assist in pre-sale pipeline management, reporting, and opportunity accuracy in CRM system
  • Keep sales apprised of all key issues, updated and relevant data throughout campaign process
  • Work with Ad Operations to troubleshoot live campaigns
  • Assist Ad Operations with running weekly or ad hoc reports for campaigns & clients
  • Work to manage custom programs with other departments, also key contact for client communication

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3-5 years of online media experience
  • Excellent written, presentation and oral communication skills
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • Deep understanding of the video game industry
  • Able to proactively troubleshoot and problem solve quickly and though the proper escalation process
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office: PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
  • Works well with others in high-energy environment with minimal supervision

Bonus Points

  • Work experience in online media
  • Previous agency experience

Perks

  • Full benefits, including medical, dental, vision and life 
  • 401(k) savings plan with a company match
  • Corporate gym membership
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Flexible time off policy
  • Top of the line technology to help you build your own workspace

About Twitch

Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at http://twitch.tv.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Digital Product Designer
jobs.content:
Who we are…


We’re an eclectic and multicultural team working on a very big and important challenge. We’re empowering the professionals who are responsible for helping you get a mortgage, get it done faster, cheaper and more effectively.


This is not a social pizza ordering live video app, we’re changing how $23 Billion (capital B) dollars worth of mortgages are transacted each year and we think that’s dead sexy . We move fast and we're not afraid to experiment while we work towards our goal of being the Canada’s leading loan management system. We’re well backed and gearing up to make a serious splash. We’ve doubled our team size in the last year and plan on doing so again this year. It won’t be easy, but that’s why we’re looking to have only the smartest minds riding shotgun with us.


Who you are…


As a core member of the Design team, you will be a part of the entire product design life cycle, from proposing initial concepts to ensuring we ship high quality features. You will be expected to contribute to all aspects of design, including product design, interaction design, and visual design. You are self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous work environment.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence
jobs.content:
Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence (BI)


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Software Engineering



JOB FUNCTION:



The Software Engineer will join our BI Tech team to create and support business intelligence applications for internal and external customers. If you are a successful fit for this position, you enjoy working independently with minimal supervision; you are good at collaborating with designers and end users; you have good analytical skills, strong communication skills and a positive attitude.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Develop BI data models.

  • Work with other software engineers to manage and deliver data sets.

  • Design and maintain existing Qlik applications

  • Tune existing Qlik applications for efficient performance.

  • Maintain and ensure SDLC process and proper tools and standards for company BI development.

  • Work closely with the Product team to design external BI applications.

  • Work closely with stakeholders to design and maintain internal BI applications.

  • Train stakeholders on basic BI use and best practices.

  • Maintain BI source and source history.



QUALIFICATIONS:



  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business or equivalent.

  • Minimum of 1 year experience with Qlik application design, charting, set analysis, scripting, testing and debugging.

  • Experience with basic SQL scripting

  • Experience with data modeling and Business Intelligence applications, concepts and patterns.

  • Experience providing training for users, internal and external customers.

  • Strong knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle

  • Familiarity with multiple 3rd party BI offerings to assist in evaluations as needs arise.

  • Familiarity with software and data security needs.

  • JavaScript, CSS experience preferred.


About comScore: comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is the cross-platform measurement company that precisely measures audiences, brands and consumer behavior everywhere.


comScore completed its merger with Rentrak Corporation in January 2016, to create the new model for a dynamic, cross-platform world. Built on precision and innovation, our unmatched data footprint combines proprietary digital, TV and movie intelligence with vast demographic details to quantify consumers' multiscreen behavior at massive scale. This approach helps media companies monetize their complete audiences and allows marketers to reach these audiences more effectively. With more than 3,200 clients and global footprint in more than 75 countries, comScore is delivering the future of measurement. For more information on comScore, please visit comscore.com.

jobs.title: Android/iOS App Developer
jobs.content:
Detroit Labs OnSite is looking for native Android and iOS developers to join our existing automotive app development team.


We’re building a native mobile app that will be a companion to consumer vehicles that will be on the road in 1-2 years. We’re writing greenfield code, implementing designs created in 2016 that incorporate the latest and greatest features and interactions.


Our teams are small and lean, and every member is encouraged to engage in discussions about application architecture and direction. As a mid-level/senior developer, you will be expected to help facilitate these conversations and guide the team to collectively make final decisions.


This role is with our OnSite business unit; successful applicants will work with existing developer team members for a period of time at our Detroit location, and then transition to working at the client site in the Detroit metro area. This is a full-time salaried role with full medical and dental benefits, 401k matching, monthly team outings, and more.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back-End
jobs.content:
Alar Software is Hiring Backend Engineers


We are looking for experienced software engineers to help build out our platform. We're aiming to aggregate logistics data enabling customers to operate more efficiently and connect them with other logistics companies. We believe we're on to something big, but to get there we're working through complex problems in a complex domain. We're attacking those problems with an unconventional approach (event sourcing with a twist) and dealing with big data to boot. This isn't a run of the mill MVC app. Because of this complexity, we're limiting our search to two kinds of people: experienced engineers who can bring structure to the chaos as we grow, or those applicants who can make up for lack of experience with passion and creativity. Please don't apply unless you can demonstrate one of these somehow.


A little about us


We are not a typical startup. We're the skunkworks offshoot of an existing logistics company - we founded this startup to address logistics challenges we've faced since we started that company nearly 20 years ago. It turns out most of our competitors face the same problems, and the industry at large isn't making much progress to solve them. So the solutions we're developing are targeting real problems with real monetization potential. The founders have a good understanding of both the logistics industry and programming - so working with us isn't going to be an exercise in dealing with a pointy haired boss. We believe in solid development practices that avoid technical debt, and want to focus on product quality above all else. We also believe in independence and accountability - I'm not looking to add 'babysitter' to my job description.


We've been trying to tackle these problems in some fashion for many years, but development only really picked up in the last year. Right now we've got a remote team of 10, but we're looking to build a local team here in Chicago - the complex nature of the problems and the domain means we're really going to benefit from having a solid core group with lots of facetime.


Our stack


Primarily C#. Working to get our backend running on akka.net, although we're also considering Scala as we gain more experience with akka. Also a bit of postgres, some simple mongo for non-critical functions, and ASP.NET.


What You ll Do



  • Help design the core architecture that will drive our platform

  • Tackle problems unique to integrating big data


Compensation



  • Competitive base salary

  • Stock options

  • Medical, dental, and other benefits

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description
We're looking to hire an Android developer to join our team working on PSPDFKit Android, our recently released PDF framework for Android. PSPDFKit is the leading PDF framework on iOS. It's used by Dropbox, IBM and Evernote, and we want PSPDFKit Android to match and surpass that level.

You willâ¦
  • Make architectural decisions that will impact hundreds of apps for years.
  • Write code that's readable, cross-platform, well documented and has meaningful tests so shipping new releases can happen often and without fear.
  • Help and improve our PDF Viewer app written in Kotlin.
  • Build new features and fix existing issues.
  • Spend time to get things ârightâ, not to hack something up quick.
  • Collaborate daily with the whole team (Android, iOS, Support, Backend, Design) using Slack, GitHub and Google Hangouts.

Our ideal candidate
  • Has experience both with the Android SDK and NDK, using C++, Java (RxJava is a plus!) and Kotlin.
  • Has developed Android apps with a great user experience throughout.
  • Has a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
  • Has a good command of English for writing documentation and occasional blog posts.
  • Has worked remotely and understands the different challenges of a distributed team.

What you get
  • Room for personal and professional development.
  • A motivated team and a thriving work culture.
  • Numerous planned company events throughout the year.
  • The freedom to set up your ideal work environment.
  • Flexible working hours and vacation policy.

You should include these in your application
  • A writeup explaining who you are as a programmer. Sample questions you might want to address: How'd you get started? What projects have you enjoyed working on? Which have you disliked? What motivates you? What surprising things have you learned about yourself since starting to program?
  • A piece of code that does something you find interesting, and an explanation of why. (It doesn't have to be your own code.)
  • Links to online profiles you use (Github, Twitter, etc).
  • A description of your work history (whether as a resume, LinkedIn profile, or prose).

To apply: Send application to jobs+android@pspdfkit.com

jobs.title: Graphics Specialist

jobs.title: Full-Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
Description:


The Full-Stack Developer is responsible for developing and maintaining responsive, intuitive web applications for our products and internal tools. As part of the development team, you will develop and maintain new applications, as well as support existing applications for our clients and internal users.  Strong candidates will possess a self-starter attitude and exceptional communication skills.


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Works with latest technologies such as Aurelia, Typescript, Angular 2, and ASP .Net

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer - 100% New Development - AWS - Cambridge, MA
jobs.content:
We are building a new service in the The Amazon Web Service (AWS) Cambridge Development Center located in Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA and are seeking a talented and passionate Software Development Engineers (multiple openings for mid to senior level Developers).

As a Senior Software Engineer in this office, you will design and build a new service that will accelerate help large, enterprise companies migrate their computing to AWS. Delivering a reliable and high-performance service at AWS scale requires engineers with extraordinary technical expertise and boundless creativity. At Amazon, we also expect engineers like you to interact with customers, to understand our business goals, and to innovate rapidly, delivering high-quality and ground-breaking functionality.

What does it take to thrive as a Senior Developer at AWS? You need to be creative, responsible, and curious while working with others to move quickly in turning code into customer solutions. You’re excited about rolling up your sleeves, implementing big ideas, and learning from those around you. You want the opportunity to grow your technical and professional skills while helping AWS grow. You relish the opportunity to dig into challenging operational issues and to help customers build the next generation of web applications. You’re somebody who knows how to be both productive and have fun with others.

jobs.title: Software Engineer: Data
jobs.content:
Postmates runs one of the largest real-time delivery fleets in the country. Building a software platform that is reliable, scales and stays agile under demanding product needs is a serious technical challenge. Postmates isn’t just another ad platform or mobile app for delivering static user generated content: We have real customers paying real money for a real service, all under an hour.


As a Data Engineer, you’ll be part of a team responsible for the integrity and accessibility of all of Postmates business-critical data. You’ll contribute to our data-pipelines, our analytics tools, and our data science and machine learning infrastructure, as well as help design and scale our architecture to meet future needs. You’ll work with teams across the organization, making sure that engineers have the tools to generate and store data and that business and data science consumers have the information they need at their fingertips.


We’re looking for engineers with a proven track record of shipping high-impact tools. We care much more that you understand how to build simple, clear, and reliable tools than you have experience with any given toolset or pattern. We love learning, and we expect that you will learn new things and teach us new things as we build out the Postmates data infrastructure.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build tools that make our data pipelines and surfacing more reliable and easier to use

  • Work closely with backend engineers to roll out new tools and features

  • Triage, identify, and fix scaling challenges

  • Discuss cost-benefit analyses of short-term needs vs long-term scaling

  • Educate product managers, analysts, and engineers about how to use our tooling to answer hard questions and make better decisions


REQUIREMENTS



  • You have a curiosity about how things work

  • You’ve built large-scale data pipeline and ETL tooling before, and have strong opinions about writing beautiful, maintainable, understandable code.

  • You’ve worked professionally with both streaming and batch data processing tools, and understand the tradeoffs.

  • You have designed and maintained distributed systems and understand and look out for common pitfalls.

  • You understand the challenges of working with schema-based and unstructured data, and enjoy the challenge of collecting data flexibly and accurately.

  • You have extensive experience with at least one RDBMS platform, and advanced SQL skills in at least one dialect (Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc.)

  • You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to product managers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.

  • You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.

  • You love it when things work, you understand that things break, and when things do fail you dive in to understand the root causes of failure and fix whatever needs work.


BONUS POINTS



  • A Masters degree (or higher) in a technical field (C.S., Math, Physics, Engineering…)

  • Experience building full stack web tools

  • AWS development and operations experience (EMR, s3, data pipelines, etc.)

  • A solid math and statistics background

  • Experience in small start-up environments


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salary

  • Generous stock option plan

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance

  • Choice of computer and gear

  • Snack filled kitchen

  • Awesome work environment at a company with a huge vision

  • Killer office located in Financial District just minutes from BART, Muni, AC Transit, and SamTrans

jobs.title: Java Instructor-D.C campus
jobs.content:
If you live and breathe code as your craft, find joy in helping other people learn, and want ample time to pursue freelance, personal projects, or open source work, then this job was custom-made for you.


What we believe in:


First and most importantly, here are a few of our values when it comes to teaching someone how to be a developer:



  • Thinking over syntax - We believe syntax is the easy part of programming and that we are successful when we’ve helped someone learn to think like an engineer.

  • Quality over quantity – We’re interested in training true professionals, not getting as many people into our classes as possible.

  • Real projects over scripted assignments – People learn programming best by tackling hard problems with a mentor, not following a list of steps and taking a quiz.

  • Emphasis on open source – We deeply value the open source mindset and intentionally create and contribute to open source projects.


What the role and responsibilities look like:


Our instructors serve as lecturers and mentors to our students, helping them learn to think like engineers and hone their skills in a programming discipline. You’ll also help define and refine the curriculum to stay current with cool new stuff. Have a look at the courses we’ve already launched.


You’ll teach three, 12-week semesters each year. The remaining 16 weeks you’ll only have light duties for The Iron Yard, such as curriculum updates and interviewing students for future classes. Beyond those things, you’re free to work on whatever you want (such as personal projects, open source projects, or products that we’re building and launching as The Iron Yard). And, of course, you’ll want to take some well-deserved time off.

Each class will be no more than 15 students per instructor, and you will have a campus director to take care of all the non-teaching-critical parts of running a program.

Outside of teaching responsibilities, you’ll be an active part of the development community in your city (hopefully you already are).

If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! jobs.title: MTS, Front End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.



eBay Checkout Experience team is seeking a highly motivated individual to join as amember of technical staff.This Front End Software Engineer position will require the candidate to lead our development efforts and work directly with our business partners to research, develop and deploying next generation web and mobileWeb applications on multiple technologies for high volume transaction environments. The candidate is expected to be effective as an individual contributor,team player,and a champion for results and incremental improvement. In addition to this, the candidate will be expected to have an excellent grasp of designing and implementing frameworks and architectures based on internal and external standards




  • Design and deliver highly scalable multi-tiered distributed software applications

  • Leading teams of software engineers on projects on and off-shore

  • Work with other Engineers, Managers, Product management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles

  • Performing analysis and fine tuning of page performance and reliability

  • Mentor and guide developers in coding and design methodology and page performance

  • Flexible approach to analyzing technical issues and clearly communicating recommendations/solutions

  • Support site rollouts and available for on-call duties to resolve site issues

  • Proficient in agile development methodologies



About eBay:



eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.




  • Design and deliver highly scalable multi-tiered distributed software applications

  • Leading teams of software engineers on projects on and off-shore

  • Work with other Engineers, Managers, Product management, QA, and Operations teams to develop innovative solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles

  • Estimate engineering effort, plan implementations, and roll out applications with cross-functional impact

  • Lead product initiatives and recommend improvements

  • Develop and support projects throughout all phases of the development life cycle

  • Performing analysis and fine tuning of page performance and reliability

  • Mentor and guide developers in coding and design methodology and page performance

  • Conceptualizing, coding, deploying, and iterating on next generation prototypes

  • Flexible approach to analyzing technical issues and clearly communicating recommendations/solutions

  • Proficient in waterfall and agile development methodologies

jobs.title: Platform Architect
jobs.content:
Platform Architect



Gumtree - Richmond, London



eBay Classifieds Group is a creative leader in online classifieds, with twelve brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities - whether it’s a sofa, a car, a dress, job, an apartment, a concert ticket, or financial services. As the world leader in online classifieds, we pride ourselves on knowing the markets we operate in - our success is the result of tailoring our sites to the subtle distinctions of each market. Our sites have become a part of the local culture in many countries and play a big part in the lives of our customers.



People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. We are in 17 countries across all continents and with our twelve unique brands - 2dehands.be/2ememain.be, alaMaula, BilBasen, Close5, DBA, eBay Classifieds (eBay Classifieds and eBay Kleinanzeigen), Gumtree, Kijiji, LoQUo, Marktplaats.nl, mobile.de, and Vivanuncios - offer online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities around the world.



Gumtree is part of the eBay Classified Group. Founded in London in 2000, Gumtree is today the UK’s leading classified site, with over 14.5m unique visitors every month and over 9.5m app downloads. The platform enables people to trade everything from cars to home items and find jobs, local services, community events and even somewhere to live.



Job Responsibilities:



The Platform Architect will report directly to the CTO. As Platform Architect you will be operating cross-functionally, providing leadership to ensure that agreed architecture, principles and practices are followed. Being responsible for ensuring alignment between architecture and the business, like ensure that the platform is structured around business capability - This requires a distinct focus on collaboration with domain experts and partners across the whole business.



As we continue to grow our business and our offerings, you will need to ensure that our architecture and technology offering scale with and drive, our business.




  • Previous experience with an eCommerce technology company as a lead architect.

  • A desire to execute on the current platform strategy. And to research current software design and architecture patterns. At the same time continue to evolve it to keep our company ahead of the industry.

  • Execute on a ‘divide and conquer’ architecture strategy - build and lead a team of architects around this.

  • Collaborate and lead engineering teams to ensure that implementations are consistent within our defined principles and standard methodologies.

  • Collaborate with product owners, domain experts and partners across the business to align between architecture and business.

  • Collaborate with Site Operations to align platform strategy with operational concerns - leading towards a DevOps culture.

  • Collaborate and knowledge share with senior architects, technology leaders and business partners across eBay Classifieds Group.

  • Identify opportunities for engineering productivity improvements and directions, and evangelize them successfully.

  • Identify gaps in skills/knowledge required to satisfy the overall technology needs of the development team and the business.

  • Lead, coach and mentor engineers across the whole technology team.

  • Strong interpersonal skills, intellectual curiosity, real passion for problem-solving, and comfort with ambiguity.

  • Experience with mobile/multi-device development.

  • Intense experience with agile work style like Lean Start-up, Kanban and Scrum.

  • High energy and a desire to work in a results-oriented, fast growth company that never lost its start-up spirit.

  • Fluent in English

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.

 

Our Team:

 

Have you ever wanted to work on a platform that creates / edits more than 50 million ecommerce listings per day? It’s what we do for a living!  Without us, there’d be nothing for sale on eBay and we need your help to make it even better! This role will have you contributing at the very core of eBay’s selling platform, to deliver an engaging selling experience for more than 25 million sellers across 22 nations, who collectively generate billions of dollars in revenue quarterly. Performance, reliability, scalability and accuracy are of utmost importance as this area of work is at the absolute top of the funnel for all of eBay’s massive e-commerce ecosystem.

 

Technical expertise, curiosity, commitment, pride, respect, teamwork and good communication skill are what we’re looking for. We expect someone with solid computer science fundamentals, a strong drive for results, thrives on continuous innovation, dreams big, self-starts, learns fast, gets things done while having fun.

 

As a staff software engineer you get to own large functional areas of the product and deliver features in a timely manner using best of breed design and coding principles. You will be expected to work in a fast paced Agile environment with a talented group of peers and be able to estimate projects and deliver them on time. You will also be expected to contribute to the overall engineering excellence of the team and the organization. You will have opportunities to participate in seminars and attend training to learn new technologies or improve your skills. For this particular role, we are looking for talented engineers who have existing knowledge in Scala or are open to coding in Scala in addition to Java. You should also be open to coding in Nodejs application layer when needed.

 

Job Qualifications:




  • Bachelor's degree/equivalent with at least 7 years of industry experience developing highly scalable distributed platforms and services in Java or Scala.

  • Hands on experiences in Java/J2EE, SOAP, SOA Services, Design Patterns, OOA/D, Data Structures, XML, REST, JSON, SQL.

  • Experience with unit testing frameworks, Git, Jenkins, NoSQL is preferable but not mandatory.

  • Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.

  • Ability to own features and work with product management and quality engineering to deliver robust, scalable and performant software using best of breed design and coding principles.

  • Ability to scope accurately and manage tasks in an Agile/Scrum environment and handle production rollouts and issues.

  • Team player and can do attitude. Familiarity with front end coding in Nodejs is desirable.



eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.

jobs.content:

Here at Gumtree, we take pride in well-designed working software with a rewarding user interface. As a Front-End Engineer you will work closely with UX professionals, designers and back-end engineers to create snappy, intuitive interfaces.



We would expect you to have:




  • A proven track record (min. 3-4 years) in web development and Front End engineering

  • Proficiency in Front End engineering skills including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript.

  • Good knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery (Preferred) or Mootools

  • Experience in dealing with cross-browser issues (Preferably including mobile)

We would be even more excited if you also have:

  • Significant experience in creating responsive designs using HTML 5, CSS3 and Media queries.

  • Strong understanding of JavaScript patterns

  • Strong working knowledge of optimization techniques (both in file weight and perceived/actual rendering speed) and performance measurement

  • Experience with React.js and Flux

  • Experience with accessibility and screen readers

  • Experience with CSS architecture such as OOCSS or SMACCS

  • Experience with CSS pre-processors like SASS or LESS

  • Experience or knowledge of JavaScript task runners such as GRUNT

  • Experience with Test Driven Development and Continuous Integration

  • Experience working in a Java back end environment (Maven, Tomcat)

  • Agile/Scrum development experience or appreciation of what agility is about

  • Experience working with templating languages e.g. freemarker or handlebars

jobs.title: Senior Delphi Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for experienced Delphi developers to join us in developing world class software in the Family Entertainment industry.  Our software is used worldwide by arcades, water parks, bowling centers and movie theaters. The software you will be working on has tight integration with hardware such as turnstiles, cashless systems and advanced payment devices. We love and use mobile and have a strategy heavily focused around Android and Firemonkey. 


We are a company of about 60 people, though you will be joining a small team of 5 developers who work on this group of products. 


Our ideal candidate has many years of experience in Delphi or strongly competent in Delphi with many years of experience in other object oriented languages.  We are not looking for drag-and-drop coders.  You should know and have demonstrable experience in writing to interfaces and architecting maintainable code.  You will sometimes be asked to document your work for end-users and often chip with with QA during the testing cycle.


You will be expected to have an opinion on the right way to tackle a problem and be able to defend it.  You must be a mentor to the rest of the team but be accepting to the fact that you have things to learn as well. You will be tasked with finding obscure problems in very complex code and recommending solutions that don't only involve starting from the ground up. 


Experience in the Family Entertainment industry is preferred but the ability to quickly understand domain knowledge is required. 


This industry is fast paced and weekend based.  As such, your job will often require long hours or chipping in to help on the weekends. 


Ideally the developer we select would relocate to Meridian, MS to join our on-site development team, but remote is an option a developer that is a perfect fit.


All applicants will be required to code a small Delphi application to our specification (approximately 1 to 4 hours) as a qualification to be interviewed.

jobs.title: Web Development Lead Instructor, Principal Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Galvanize is seeking Lead Instructors to teach full stack web development in an intensive, 6-month course. At Galvanize, we don’t just teach, we guide. We use data-driven instructional design to differentiate for students’ diverse personality types, habits, and learning styles. We immerse students in an agile development process from day one to help them become the best developers (and life-long learners) they can be.

Full Stack Instructor curriculum includes these topics and more:

Learning how to learn - tools, habits, and mindsets
How the web works
Version Control
HTML and CSS
Programming fundamentals in Javascript
Test Driven Development
Node.js
Server-side frameworks with Express
Client-side frameworks with Angular
Responsive Design
APIs
Algorithms
Interview Skills





AS A WEB DEVELOPMENT INSTRUCTOR AT GALVANIZE, YOU WILL:




    • Lead lectures and class activities and support students during project work.

    • Plan daily lessons and assess students on an ongoing basis

    • Identify and schedule relevant guest speakers

    • Assist in student placements process

    • Give curriculum feedback to the instructional team

    • Help develop internal student tools.

    • Provide students with a meaningful training experience in the classroom.

    • Work alongside gSchool staff in providing prompt feedback on student progress.

    • Guide students through development of a final project that will showcase their web development abilities to hiring managers.

    • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.

    • Teach and plan a full work week, five days a week, for 24 weeks

    • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.

    • Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of turning their ideas into actual web application.

    • Contribute to local evangelism, admissions, and nurture activities, such as attendance at meetups, speaking at conferences, leading workshops, etc.





EXPECTED EXPERIENCE:




    • At least 5+ years of advanced JS, Node experience

    • Fluency in the following topics: HTTP, Rails, JavaScript, SQL (PostgreSQL), HTML ; CSS; databases

    • Experience working with agile teams – pair programming experience a plus.

    • Thrives in a continuous feedback environment and welcomes feedback from students and other instructors

    • Previous background in teaching and/or mentoring aspiring developers – or a deep interest in giving it a try. 

    • Eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of web developers.

    • High performing current immersive instructor desirable

    • Great communication skills





PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:




    • At Galvanize, we strive to providing meaningful professional development opportunities to all of our employees. Here are just a few of the ways you will continue to grow and “level-up” as a developer and a teacher:

    • There’s no better way to learn than to teach! You’ll be amazed at how much you’ll develop skills you thought you were already an expert in just by helping students and planning lessons.

    • Opportunities to work with and learn from other data science and web development instructors in a highly collaborative and intellectually rich environment. Rub shoulders and cross-pollinate.

    • Keep your skills sharp with the option to work with our expert services arm, Galvanize X, on industry web development and data science projects. Previous projects have involved: Machine Learning; Deep Learning, Data Engineering and Architecture, Applied Statistics and Statistical Modeling, Web Development Ruby on Rails, Angular, Ember, React, and Node.js and Express. 

    • Become the best instructor you can be with ongoing training and support.






Galvanize provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Executive Assistant (Mandarin Speaking)
jobs.content:
About Us:

Tea is the second most consumed beverage in the world after water. Rich in tradition and ritual, tea also has the ability to transform our body, mind and spirit. Teforia will combine the knowledge of a tea master with the best in modern technology to transform the tradition of tea into a modern sensory experience.

Our stunningly-beautiful connected machine intuitively understands the best infusion method for each tea varietal, reading each tea package and automatically initiating the optimal brewing recipe. Teforia makes the delicate, complicated process of infusion a simple, enjoyable experience and produces a perfect cup of tea every time.

The Role:

As the Executive Assistant in Teforia’s Mountain View headquarters, you will have a direct and influential role in the company’s daily operations and ultimate success. With your ability to enhance the efficiency and output of each of the company’s top executives while simultaneously keeping the office running smoothly, you will be a key player in Teforia’s future.

You Will:

  • Directly support the CEO, CTO, and CMO in a variety of administrative and operational tasks
  • Maintain Mountain View office services by organizing office operations and procedures, controlling correspondence, designing filing systems, reviewing and approving supply requisitions, and facilitating clerical functions
  • Coordinate event logistics, including rental booking, catering, transportation, etc.
  • Help support the SF satellite office as needed
  • Maintain office efficiency by planning and implementing office systems, layouts, and equipment procurement
  • Design and implement office policies by establishing standards and procedures, measuring results against standards, and making necessary adjustments
  • Keep management informed by reviewing and analyzing special reports, summarizing information, and identifying trends
  • Protect privileged and confidential information through diligence and discretion
  • Facilitate communication within the company and with outside vendors, stakeholders, and partners--including communication with Taiwanese partners in Mandarin
  • Contribute to team effort by accomplishing required results as needed
  • Adapt and learn new things in a constantly changing environment.

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 2+ years in executive administrative support experience, or similar
  • Previous experience with vendor management, ordering, and operational office functions
  • Top-notch organizational ability with a particular focus on calendars/scheduling, travel arrangement, task prioritization, and follow through.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication
  • A curious nature with an interest toward continued learning
  • Ability to speak fluent Mandarin

Bonus Points:

  • Experience supporting multiple people within an organization
  • Previously worked as an Office Manager or in a comparable role

What We Can Offer You:

  • Market-competitive salary and fantastic benefits
  • Equity in a strongly-backed startup with huge potential
  • A collaborative team of driven and motivated individuals in a fast, exciting startup working environment
  • Tea, lots of amazing tea!

jobs.title: Principal Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:

EverString helps build new pipeline and increase conversion rates with the only account-based, full lifecycle, predictive platform for B2B sales and marketing. The EverString Decision Platform identifies a company’s ideal customer profile, and then finds the prospects that best fit that profile, both inside and outside the existing pipeline. EverString’s SaaS platform provides Predictive Scoring, Predictive Demand Generation, and Predictive Ad Targeting, empowering marketers with the full potential of predictive analytics and applied data science. EverString is backed by leading investors including Lightspeed Venture Partners, Sequoia Capital, IDG Ventures, and Lakestar.

EverString’s work environment is grounded in the principles of introspection, innovation, and a one-team mentality. We are dedicated to the well-being of our team members, and we provide strong mentorship, daily lunches, weekly happy hours, in-house workout classes, and a commitment to supporting your personal and professional growth.

The Role:

EverString is looking for an experienced full stack software engineer to join our engineering team in San Mateo, CA. As a member of the engineering team, you will get an opportunity to build a world class SaaS-based predictive analytics application. You will contribute to the full web application stack - JavaScript (Angular.js) for user interface, and Python for server-side development. You will collaborate with platform and data science teams to deliver cutting edge big data and analytics solutions to our customers.

You Will:

  • Develop state of the art SaaS applications to provide predictive analytics insights to 1000’s of enterprise customers
  • Contribute to the architecture and design of our products and platform
  • Designing high-performance RESTful web services that meet strict performance SLAs
  • Deliver high quality and scalable code with automated test coverage
  • Collaborate effectively with team members and product management
  • Be part of a fast-paced agile team

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 5+ years industry experience, with a focus on SaaS development, big data, or both
  • Experience building web services using Python and Django or Flask, or Ruby on Rails
  • Experience working with large datasets (Big Data)
  • Strong grasp of Object-oriented design, CS fundamentals, and programming fundamentals
  • Proficient in schema design and SQL tuning on RDBMS and/or Data warehouses
  • Comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced startup environment
  • Team player with good analytical and communication skills
  • Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly

Bonus Points:

  • Experience building and shipping products using a JavaScript framework (Angular.js, React.js, etc)
  • Exposure to distributed computing platforms like Hadoop, Spark, MongoDB, etc.

What We Can Offer You:

  • Market-competitive salary plus equity
  • Robust 401(k) plan
  • Healthy catered lunches and dinners, and a fully-stocked kitchen
  • A Fitbit Charge HR to participate in challenges & win prizes
  • Ergonomic workspaces and stand-up desks
  • Exclusive partnership with Equinox offering supplemented memberships
  • Generous PTO policy
  • Team off-sites and weekly happy hours
  • Onsite yoga and meditation classes
  • Flexible working hours
  • Semi-annual company-wide non-profit volunteering
  • We support charity fundraisers for causes important to our team
  • Dedicated to building our company and growing locally in San Mateo

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
As a Wegmans Developer you will have the opportunity to work on front-end web apps and back end systems that are heavily integrated and customized. Using the full stack of Microsoft technologies, in the .NET framework with C#, you will be part of a team developing business applications that help our employees work smarter and faster.  These applications are essential to the success of our 45,000+ employees across six states as we grow our business and help customers.



As a Supply Chain Systems Application Developer, you will work on two primary projects supporting our Logistics teams as they look to continuously improve their operations.  In support of our Transportation Department you will work with a team that is ready to go live this month with the second phase of a multiyear project.   You will be implementing functionality to support inbound planning, outbound planning, dispatch, fleet maintenance, driver pay, yard management, appointment scheduling, internet bids and auto payment/claims.


Your work efforts on our Warehouse Delivered Cost project will help improve accuracy.   Together with the team you will write a processes to perform calculations and enhance existing applications that use and display those calculations. Experience with TFS, SSRS, SSIS and MSMQ is preferred. 



If you are someone who enjoys collaboration, solving complex problems, and implementing solutions, then this could be the job for you! If you have at least two years of experience, apply today to become part of this exciting team.

jobs.title: Applications Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for an Application Support Engineer to work cross-functionally with DevOps, Software Quality and Data Engineering to manage, support and optimize the systems delivering big data for one of the largest whole genome sequencing facilities in the world.



Tasks and Responsibilities


The Application Support Engineer will be responsible for the support and enhancement of HLI’s core platform technology.  The candidate will interact not only with other team members in supporting and building different components of the system, but also with scientists, bioinformaticians and non-engineers.  The candidate must be conscientious, detail oriented and be dedicated to seeing tasks through to completion.  Above all the candidate must have a passion for learning and technology.

jobs.title: Software Design Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for a Software Design Engineer in Test to ensure quality application systems development of HLI’s core platform technology supporting “omics” and bioinformatics analysis. 



Tasks and Responsibilities


The Software Design Engineer in Test candidate will work closely with the quality and engineering teams to develop automated tests, execute software test plans and procedures compliant with software testing ISO standards.  The ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in current test platforms and strategies including testing software in Cloud (AWS), Windows (C# .NET), Web (Node.js Angular.js) and Linux (C/C++/Python) environments.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for creating complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the largest franchises in the games industry. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand our systems and add value to WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for managing the infrastructure behind very complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the industry's biggest game franchises. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand the Hydra platform, and ensure an efficient and stable environment for WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Own automation of the infrastructure platform

  • Work on incorporating Agora Games’ engineering practices into infrastructure operations

  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug problems, live, on very complex systems

  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Back-End Developer
jobs.content:
At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring.  We encourage new ideas and experimentation.  No part of the code base is off limits.



Olo is revolutionizing the customer experience at these restaurant chains, and we're looking for talented engineers to join our team and help achieve this vision. As part of the team you will play a significant and visible role in helping us scale one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will design and develop integrations to a variety of third party systems that make up the restaurant technology ecosystem. While primarily focused on our back-end, the position requires contributions throughout our stack.



You'll work with a smart, passionate team dedicated to delivering amazing products using modern tools and technologies such as .NET 4.6, ASP.NET MVC 5, TeamCity, GitHub, Octopus Deploy, and heavy use of OSS.



This is a full-time position. We are open to remote U.S. candidates.

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer
jobs.content:
(QA, Software Test Engineer):



We are currently seeking a Software Test Engineer with a strong manual testing background who has understanding of SQL and basic scripting knowledge to work closely with our Development and QA teams in Chicago or Naperville office. This person will sit in our Integration team and is responsible for testing the Fieldglass application in order to maintain product quality. The successful candidate will work closely with developers and other analysts and apply analytical and problem-solving skills to ensure that the code is working per specifications.

Responsibilities Include:


  • Write and maintain tests utilizing basic scripting techniques

  • Fluent in Excel pivot table, charting, and basic macro writing

  • Demonstrates understanding of the different browser idiosyncrasies and how they can affect application behavior.

  • Writes functional requirement documents to support new/changed functionality and works with stakeholders to obtain signoff.

  • Develops test plans and test strategies.

  • Manages defects and works with development team to provide resolutions.

  • Collaborates with offshore testing teams in India.

  • Complies with various process controls throughout the SDLC.

  • Supports business and call center teams in understanding system functionality.

  • Supports the production release process, which includes the ability to work late nights and extended hours approximately once a month.

  • Plays an integral role in the entire software development lifecycle including participation in design sessions, defining functional requirements, working with development teams, testing, and preparing code for production deployment

jobs.title: Entry Level Developer / DBA
jobs.content:
(Product Development, Entry Level Developer / DBA):


We are currently seeking an Entry Level Developer / DBA who will work in a team and with developers in system engineering, performance optimization, troubleshooting and database design. This is an on-site position and will be located in our Naperville office.


Responsibilities Include:



  • Collaborate with Developers on Database design and participate in database capacity planning.

  • Create T-SQL scripts to perform complex functions such as de-normalizing OLTP data into de-normalized reporting structures, archiving data, data slicing etc.

  • Collaborate with DBA team members to manage production and operation databases.

  • Physical SQL Server Installation for both stand-alone and clustered instances of SQL Server.

  • Support includes production, operations, staging and Disaster Recovery sites.

  • Create PowerShell scripts for task automation.

  • Identify performance issues and suggest resolutions. 

  • Evaluate and recommend database tools.

  • Take part in 24x7x365 DBA On-call rotation.

  • Review SQL code and recommend optimizations while enforcing best practices.

  • Support security initiatives including SQL auditing and audit evidence preparation.

  • Deploy database upgrade scripts to Production environments as dictated by the application release schedule and needs of the business.

  • Create and maintain documentation for processes and policies.

  • Provide ongoing database support/review in the production environment.

jobs.title: UI Java Developer
jobs.content:
(Product Development, UI Java Developer):


We are currently seeking a UI Java Developer, to work within our growing Product Development team. The Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering software modules and components of varying size and complexity related to the UI technologies. In this role, the candidate will collaborate and interface with Team Leads from different departments during all phases of the SDLC. The Developer will maintain and support product features in the Production, Pre-Production, and Operations environments. This position is located in our Naperville office.


 Responsibilities:



  • Create the design specifications for development from approved business cases.

  • Execute unit and system testing of the design once the solution has been developed, and work closely with other team members to successfully deploy the code to production.

  • Performs impact analyses of new features or changes to existing features within the Fieldglass application

  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data and application through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution.

  • Analyze and translate functional specifications and change requests into technical specifications.

  • Develop, test and implement program logic.

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
Since 1996, Electric Pulp has focused on developing cutting-edge interactive solutions. We’re looking for a designer who can help us continue to produce top-of-the-line digital experiences for fun and sometimes demanding clients. So if you're great at what you do, and what you do happens to be designing interfaces for the web and mobile, we want to hear from you.

We prefer that you are or could be local to Sioux Falls, SD, but don’t let your location stop you from making contact. We understand that the right fit might not live here.

About The Job

As a designer at Electric Pulp, you will be integral to the success of the project, working with designers, clients, project managers and developers to create elegant user interfaces and ensuring that they are carried successfully through to completion. You’ll need to know all about grids, responsive design, and mobile-specific requirements. We’ll expect to see some examples of such in your portfolio.

In general, we believe that design needs to solve problems and be beautiful at the same time. Your work should do both with gusto. We’re looking for pixel perfect, as well as purpose perfect.

While design is the core function of this role, there are a few other things that we'll be looking for:

  • Ability to work well with others
  • Ability to professionally communicate your design ideas to the client
  • Self-starter tendencies (especially important if you're out of the area)
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Dedication required to meet a deadline
  • Interest and proven history of learning/creating new methods and approaches
  • Ability to write effectively and without typos

This position is available now, and is already loaded with work, so you'll need to hit the ground running. As a result, it'd be best if you had some serious chops when you walk through the door on the first day. Skills and experience required are as follows:

  • 4+ years as an interactive designer
  • Experience working with clients
  • Experience using Sketch
  • Expertise in typography, composition and color theory
  • Expertise in using grids for layout
  • Knowledge of responsive design and all it entails
  • Knowledge of mobile design
  • Experience creating site architecture and navigation structures
  • Experience creating logos, icons and graphical elements
  • Firm understanding of HTML & CSS
  • Familiarity with Photoshop, Illustrator and Invision
  • Photo processing and color treatment experience a plus.

This is a full-time salaried position with benefits:

  • Paid time off for vacations or illness
  • SimpleIRA Retirement Account with matching
  • Robust Healthcare Coverage
  • Dental Plan
  • Optical Discounts
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Work Laptop provided
  • We use Slack
  • Bike Program
  • Competitive Ping Pong environment
  • Free pop (That’s soda, for you coastal types.)

We’re very serious about our work, but the team is cool, the projects are fulfilling and the Fridays allow for casual attire. As do the other days.


So if this sounds interesting to you, send us a note about why you want to join the team. Include your resumé, your portfolio and examples of your work in the wild. We'd also take a glance at interface work you've Dribbbled, if you're into that kind of thing. We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: C# Programmer
jobs.content:
We currently have an opening for an entry level C# Programmer for product development, client implementations, and sustainment of Cobalt’s products.  Our products are mobile and browser-based CRM applications that make substantial use of web services. This position will play a primary role on our cross functional SCRUM team, and candidates must be interested in working closely with a small team of technical individuals to produce excellent quality products and implementations while focusing on code re-usability and flexibility.


This full-time position is based at our headquarters in Alexandria, Virginia.

jobs.title: Internal Software Developer

jobs.title: Application Support Engineer
jobs.content: This highly motivated person will be the primary point-of-contact to assist our Microsoft CRM and Salesforce clients with any post-deploy issues or technical support questions.  The Support Engineer is responsible for managing support cases from start to finish ensuring each client gets their questions resolved as quickly and as accurately as possible.  This position will troubleshoot web-based applications for Microsoft CRM and Salesforce utilizing Internet Explorer, SQL Server, and the .NET framework.  We're looking for a person who loves computers, enjoys nit-picking the details and contributing to a team. We only offer customer support during normal business hours, so we're not a 24 hour call center.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer

About the Opportunity:


The Senior Software Engineer will be part of the core engineering team at ServiceTitan.  This person will lead major integrations between ServiceTitan’s SaaS platform with other SaaS platforms (i.e., partner platforms).  A deep fundamental knowledge of APIs, Webhooks, and .NET are needed to help design and build these major integrations.

jobs.title: BlackRock Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
This position is for a Java Web Developer that will be responsible for the design and development of CRM Client Intelligence reporting and BI solutions. The Client Intelligence team empowers sales and client service teams to research, analyse and report their data to grow revenue and gain deeper operational insight. The individual must have a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and extensive experience building multi-tier applications. The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem-solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.             



  • Java Web Developer to build out custom reporting and BI with visualization solution for CRM 

  • Contribute to the delivery of high quality software solutions

  • Analyze, design, code, test and build scalable and multi-tier web applications

  • Provide ongoing support and maintenance of the current environment and user base

  • Employ industry best practices, such as unit testing and continuous integration

  • Proactively identify and suggest improvements to software designs

  • Demonstrate strong understanding of business purpose and key stakeholders of Client

jobs.title: BlackRock Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Desk Analytics team in Portfolio Management Tools (PMT) builds and supports client APIs to access Aladdin services (a technology platform for BlackRock). Currently APIs are packaged in 2 main products: Aladdin Tools for eXcel (An Excel Add-in, ATX in short) and its Python version (ATP). ~1500 users within BlackRock and BlackRock Solutions’ external clients are using those tools globally to build their own tools including various reports, fixed income prices and bespoke workflow tools (e.g. custom portfolio management tools.) Key user groups include Investments (portfolio managers, researchers and traders), RQA (risk management group), Client Services, Operations and various external Aladdin clients. Given such broad responsibility for the firm, the team also faces with fixed income desk in SF and London to provide technical help on idiosyncratic nature of business to improve efficiency and reduce operational risks. It's a small (6) yet high caliber team where developers are split in San Francisco and London.     



Given the multi-asset class nature of the platform and the wide diversity of portfolio mandates modeled, we are searching for a Sr. developer that will be exposed to cutting-edge challenges in the constant effort to keep the platform current to the financial markets that BlackRock participates. The developer will be responsible for development & supporting Portfolio Management Tools. 



  • develop various client APIs for data and fixed income analytics in either Python or C#

  • work on all phases of software development including coding, documentation, testing and release

  • create strong partnerships with front office portfolio managers and BlackRock Solutions team members

  • implement project deliverables that meet businesses requirements, audit/control requirements and are aligned with business and technology strategies

jobs.title: IT Service Manager
jobs.content: Under the general direction of the EAIS Professional Services Manager, provide high level technical direction, management and oversight; strategic technology planning; and analytical support to departmental clients. Identify practical applications of new technology. Relate technical capabilities to business and program goals. Represent client needs to the campus on Information and Education Technology (IET) matters. Oversees all aspects of computing resources including planning, organizing, and directing of IT activities; systems administration, database administration, network administration, environmental monitoring and facility-wide security systems; help desk support services and technical support; and hardware and software purchasing.

jobs.title: Applications Development Programmer
jobs.content: Under the direction of the IET Application Development Managers, develop on teams such as middleware infrastructure, enterprise applications and web development in support of the UC Davis Campus, UCDHS and wider UC system. Work on projects that are complex, include mission-critical applications for students, faculty and staff. Provide analytical, development, testing, implementation, documentation, and maintenance support for applications and infrastructure.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
A Senior Full Stack Developer familiar with each layer of software development technology. Responsible for designing, developing and modifying website solutions and services. Own the quality of their work and enforcing code integrity throughout the team. In addition to writing amazing code, Senior Software Developers innovate and inspire by leading the charge, pursuing new technology, and executing at a high level.


Located in Palm Beach Gardens, Bankrate has a fresh, fun, and creative environment you won’t find anywhere else. If you have a strong will to learn and educate and are motivated by opportunity to help grow our team, then we'd love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Accountant
jobs.content:
Senior Accountant – Corporate Division

Role Description

The successful candidate will be a member of Bankrate’s Corporate Division accounting team.

Key activities will include creating journal entries, accruals and account reconciliations as well as assembling supporting documentation.  Assist in production of financial statements and prepare and provide auditor specific support on a quarterly basis.

Candidate Description

Experienced accountant with a strong record of academic and professional achievement.   Candidates must possess very strong general ledger accounting and system skills (US GAAP, ERP systems and Microsoft Excel).  Candidates must have a very strong process orientation and enthusiasm for leveraging technology. The successful candidate must be capable of working and communicating with people across all levels in our evolving organization.

Business Skills

  • Critical thinking along with analytic and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple, high priority projects.
  • Superior attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team.
  • Ability to meet monthly and quarterly closing deadlines.
  • Flexible and the ability to take on new tasks.
  • Ability to exercise mature judgment.
  • Articulate ideas clearly and to the point.

Technical skills

  • Good understanding of US GAAP
  • Exposure to SEC filing requirements ideal, but not required
  • Experience with ERP systems (NetSuite a plus) and strong advanced proficiency with Excel

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of progressive hands on accounting experience
  • SEC, publicly traded company experience preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting.

jobs.title: Solutions Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.


As our solutions engineer, you'll ensure the 2 million work submissions we receive each month are processed as quickly & efficiently as possible. You'll write & maintain Ruby code to quickly process client data, communicate with US & Kenyan staff to diagnose & debug our online software platform, and liaise directly with clients to clarify & resolve data delivery issues.


We write tested, continuously integrated, peer-reviewed Ruby/Rails/AngularJS code. We're vigilant about staying up to date with the latest releases of all our frameworks & tools. We run our platform on Heroku, store code in GitHub, continuously integrate with CircleCI, monitor with New Relic, and use Pivotal Tracker to keep our agile workflow flowing.


While we'd prefer applicants to work from our San Francisco office, we'll consider remote US applicants willing to work on the Pacific timezone. This position is ideal for a junior-to-intermediate developer who likes fast-paced programming environments, boasts solid written & spoken English skills, and wants to help alleviate poverty in underprivileged communities across the world.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
GameDuell is Germany`s largest game site and compares itself to the best game sites in the world. In order to meet these high standards, it is not only extremely important to implement new features, but it is also necessary to continuously optimize the platform.


As a Java Developer at GameDuell, you will find a high-traffic Internet platform with more than 500 million monthly page views. The IT architecture of GameDuell is based on Java EE and allows on the one hand horizontal scaling and on the other, a high availability and robust experience for customers.


Your tasks



  • Implementation new and the expansion of existing internationally competitive software

  • Develop the tournament and game logic

  • Create solutions for managing customer and money accounts and loyalty programs

  • Integrate our gaming experience on Facebook and mobile applications

jobs.title: PHP Web Developer
jobs.content:

We are located in downtown Providence and we provide parking. No commute to Boston or 128!


What you'll be doing:



  • You will be responsible for full life-cycle development of multiple websites and modular web-based applications.

  • You will consult with other members of the team to design, build and manage the systems integrated to the website.

  • You will work in an Agile development environment.

What's in it for you:

  • Casual, relaxed atmosphere with a results- driven mentality

  • Competitive compensation structure

  • Comprehensive benefits package

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Come help us build world class software that's fundamentally changing veterinary medicine.   Pet Partners, located in Saratoga Springs, NY, owns and operates veterinary hospitals across the United States and we’re growing fast!  We are looking for a Software Engineer with strong coding and SQL experience. Your responsibilities will include working on our RESTful API, flash reporting pipeline, enterprise integrations, and intranet site.   This position reports directly to the Chief Information Officer.


We support several different electronic medical records applications based on MS Windows and SQL Server for our practices and reporting.   In addition we rely on an open source, Linux-based stack for internal development that includes Elixir and Phoenix, Postgres, Docker, and continuous integration via Team City.  We have servers on premises, collocated, as well as on AWS.  The ideal candidate for this position is a great developer who is also comfortable writing and optimizing SQL.

jobs.title: Vice President of Product

• Be our Yoda of product management, providing wisdom, vision and guidance to the team.
