jobs.title: Principal R&D Quality Engineer/Project Manager, Predictive Analytics
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

     

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Job Summary:

Identify innovation via predictive analytics for one of the largest Information System at Abbott Diagnostics. Responsible for working with a  cross-functional team to develop, prioritize and maintain a product roadmap. The responsibilities would also include converting the roadmap into an executable product backlog by providing functional and analytics specifications and design.

Primary Job Function:

Leads product development core team members responsible for producing quality engineering deliverables including specification development, risk management, process and test method characterization and control plan development.

Consistently, and on an ongoing basis, develops and applies advanced theories, methods, and research techniques to the investigation and solution of complex technical problems.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.

Analyzes, evaluates, and plans methods of approach to and organizes a means to achieve the solution of complex technical problems.

Conducts investigations of considerable complexity pertaining to the development of new designs, methods, materials, or processes, and investigates possible applications of the results.

May provide technical consultation to technical staff.

Applies the results of reviews of literature and current practices relevant to the business; uses results to determine strategic technical direction.

Position Accountability/Scope:

Establishes and defines the theoretical bases and principles which should apply, the empirical test procedures to be used, and the estimated time, expense, and manpower for completion.
Reviews project progress and evaluates results.
Reviews, generates, and approves related inputs such as FMEAs and specifications.
Evaluates vendor capabilities to provide required products or services.
Specifies equipment, materials, and supplies required for the completion and implementation of technical projects.
Plans and directs major technical phases of projects within a specific area.
Provides technical direction to and coordinates the efforts of engineers and technical support staff in the performance of assigned projects.
Provides input to the manager on staffing decisions and future strategies and goals.
Leads or enables project completion.
Interfaces with product team members, manufacturing quality and medical affairs, Development managers, operations and business unit managers.
Communicates with outside decision makers in a manner appropriate to the goals of the communication.

Minimum Education/Experience:

Bachelors degree in a science, statistics, engineering discipline or ASQ Quality Engineering certification with six to ten years work related development experience and 2 to 4 years of Quality Engineering specific experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Expertise in Predictive Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, Mathematics and Statistics

Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence technology

Experience in Product, Feature and Functionality grooming

Familiarity with one or more software programming language and databases. E.g. C++, C#, Java, Oracle, SQLServer...

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Contribute to the design and development of software applications, firmware and device drivers for embedded microprocessors under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements. Works on software design, coding, and validating embedded software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices Exercises judgment in coding following the software designs and conducting investigation activities following defined methods. Develops productive internal/external working relationships.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.Design and implement programs in current application and firmware programming languages (e.g., C-Sharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). 2.Development of the test protocols for the purpose of design verification and validation of the system software. 3.Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and detailed design specifications for implementation of software designs per Abbott design development process. 4.Assist in the evaluation of selected designs through testing and full documentation of the results. Work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercising judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management

Note: This job description describes the principal and main elements of the job. It is a guide to the nature and main duties of the job as they currently exist, but is not intended as a wholly comprehensive or permanent representation.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:

BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.MS degree ideal.

MINIMUM TRAINING & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

2 yrs experience in software engineering. Solid knowledge of software engineering principals. Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development. Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards. Experience in design, engineering, and testing of software contained in medical devices developed under the FDAs regulations for 510(k) or PMA products is preferred. Technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills is essential. Minimum of 2 years of structured software development and/or Object Modeling Design experience. Minimum of 2 years of solid programming experience using current programming languages (e.g., CSharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). Experience with software development life cycle processes is highly preferable. Good troubleshooting skills is highly preferable Testing experience of software based systems is highly desirable Experience on multitasking in RTOS and/or Windows OS software design and development is highly preferable. Experience on Internet technologies (web development, application servers) and database design is a strong plus. Experience on device driver and low level device interface design and development is a plus. Knowledge and experience on RF software design, device driver configuration, and test is a plus. Experience in Com...

jobs.title: Sr. BRI Manager
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function:

This position is responsible for all phases of the risk intelligence cycle, from identifying emerging security risks and collecting intelligence, to analyzing, collaborating, and sharing intelligence. The position is responsible for using analytical techniques to identify trends and forecast the potential direct or indirect impact to Abbott's assets worldwide: people, facilities, and operations. The position interfaces with Company personnel across multiple business units and countries, and offers proactive and reactive recommendations to mitigate identified risks. Reports to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

This position is responsible for managing a global team of business risk intelligence staff in providing strategic risk analysis and developing risk mitigation strategies to prevent and minimize the companys exposure to risks. Additionally, the Sr. Manager assists Global Security Leadership in implementing programs and strategies to ensure safety of employees, assets and special events security. The position also serves as a liaison with private sector counterparts, law enforcement and government partners.

The position is responsible for managing the Abbotts travel safety program. The position overseas and coordinates preparation of strategic assessments, presentations and updates to senior management.

Position Accountability/Scope:

The position includes both a domestic and international scope and is accountable to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Minimum Education:

Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience required. (Masters Degree preferred).

Minimum Experience/Training Required:

8+ years of experience with a major public or private sector security organization. International work experience and previous global risk and analytical experience are highly desired.

JOB FAMILY:

Administrative-Other

DIVISION:

GES Global Engineering Services

LOCATION:

United States - Illinois - Abbott Park

ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS:

WORK SHIFT:

Standard

TRAVEL:

Yes, 20 % of the Time

MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE:

No

SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES:

Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day), Keyboard use (greater or equal to 50% of the workday)

Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Women/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join a rapidly-growing startup, venture-funded by Andreesen Horowitz!


You'll be developing core components of our litigation infrastructure, an online platform for legal teams to review, analyze, and collaborate on millions of documents.


Tackling litigation with technology is a surprisingly deep challenge, and it requires a lot of computer science, including machine learning, data visualization, search, distributed systems, databases, real-time collaboration, nifty user interfaces, and more.


We're looking for generalists. We value great CS fundamentals, native ability, and humility, over experience with any particular platform, technology, or specialization. If you happen to have a specialty, we'll put that to use -- but we won't restrict you to that area.


We care a lot about finding the best engineers, writing correct software, using the right tools for the job, and avoiding dogma, and as a result we've been able to build quite a bit sophisticated technology with a small, talented team. It's the kind of culture where you'll own serious features, write great code, learn a huge amount, and have a lot of fun. Also, you'll get to participate in our plans for world domination -- always a nice bonus.


We code primarily in Java and Python but dabble in several other languages.

jobs.title: QA engineer with strong dev skills
jobs.content:
We need a QA Engineer with great dev skills


We’re a FinTech company that just raised more than $7MM to disrupt a $100Bn market.  Sorry if that’s  a little vague, but we’re sort of in stealth mode. We're running hard and working fast and need to be responsive and agile as all get-out. A key part of moving fast is making sure our product meets a high quality bar. (People get very nervous if the company to which they're entrusting their financial future can't make their own website work right.) We need a QA engineer who's comfortable at every part of the job: manual UI testing, black box acceptance testing, whitebox exploratory testing, test automation, and continuous integration. We've made a big investment in test automation, but we need to take that - and our quality bar in general - to the next level. Another way to put it: you need to be able to read and write code as well as you can write and execute test plans. 


If you're interested, reach out!

jobs.title: Senior Web developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Web Developer to create new features. If you’re a web developer looking for a consumer focused team, an agile empowered team structure, and a direct way to tie your work to revenue, then this is the right team for you. You will be responsible for implementing new features, working with a partner to integrate code, and helping validate other team members features. You will be responsible for designing solution and implementing that solution using the latest web technologies and frameworks. 


Role Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):



  • Create features that meet the needs of a world-wide audience.

  • Ability to quickly come up to speed on new technologies and leverage past experience to solve new problems.

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

  • Be an advocate for a great end-to-end consumer experience. Understand how your features impact the overall end-to-end customer experience.


W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time.

jobs.title: Software Developer to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work in this role?



  • Cool opportunity to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program; to be in on the ground floor engaging the world with this new technology.

  • Working to take holographic video to other outlets, get really high end creators such as MTV, Disney, Nike to make holograms for video application.


  • Qualifications:



    • This is a relatively self-driven role

    • We need someone that is used to dealing with real time hardware systems and gathering and integrating data from that and controlling a system like that.

    • Computer Science Degree is preferred

    • Disqualifiers: Too much JAVA is not good; database applications would be a red flag because the coding there is high level and not close enough to working with the hardware.

    • This person needs to have experience optimizing programs that work with hardware/components and paying attention to performance, they will need to be aware of the bottlenecks in the system

    • Best vs. Average: Somebody that has worked in a production studio, worked for capture systems and have been exposed to content production a video stage or motion capture stage.

    • Performance Measures: A successful performer will provide robust solutions and minimal revisions would be a high performer; understanding or ability to work with production clients that may not be technical at all, like a director listen to them and what they need and be able to interpret that and help them meet their need. There will be a social component to this and to the right candidate it will be very appealing, it would be a bad fit for a lot of engineers.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Wanted


Exceptional professional with 2+ years of experience, solid programming skills, and a knowledge of database concepts to improve our existing technical systems.



Job Location


Rural Kenya



Duration


Minimum 2 years commitment, full-time job.



Job Description 


One Acre Fund relies on a home-grown Client Management Information System to help us manage our field program information. As we grow our organization, we need to continually improve this system and facilitate its integration with third party tools. Currently our Client Management Information System handles the enrollment of 180,000-300,000 smallholder farmers spread over multiple countries, records farm supply orders, manages the delivery of seed, fertilizer, and solar lights to clients, tracks millions of payment transactions, and creates a wide variety of business intelligence reports.



Given poor internet connectivity, our database uses a distributed client/server model where field offices can perform data entry and run reports offline while syncing with a central server as needed.  On the backend the technologies used are SQL server 2014 with merge replication to field offices, while on the front end we use MVC.Net, Breeze.js and Angular.js. As we are growing, we are looking to: 



  • Improve our existing tools to capture a wide variety of program configurations per country and provide functionality for a multitude of field product and process innovations  

  • Provide central management and reporting tools while maintaining a focus on field usability 

  • Build out efficient bulk data entry functionality with a heavy focus on data quality control, as well as field-facing mobile and tablet data entry, and reporting where appropriate 


The Developer will be based in Western Kenya. S/he will be responsible for the following: 



  • Field-facing mission-critical Program Management System: 

  • Participate in the continued development of our mission-critical custom database which impacts every aspect of operations 

  • Develop features which allow for flexibility in the way individual countries run their operations, while still focusing on reusability across countries 

  • Maintain a long-term perspective when faced with urgent operational demands 

  • Focus on simplicity and usability for our local staff 

  • Work together with our small team of developers 

  • Maintain coding standards and participate in peer code reviews 

  • Technology experimentation: Experiment with a variety of technologies to improve operations. Investigate appropriate solutions for deploying upgrades, database scaling and interacting with 3rd party software providers 

  • Operational insight: Become familiar with every aspect of our field operations and identify areas for improvement in the tools we develop to support the field. 

  • Other tasks: We are a young organization that is growing rapidly, which means all staffers pitch in to ensure we are providing the very best support and services to both our team and clients. 



Career Growth and Development 


One Acre Fund invests in building management and leadership skills. Your manager will invest significant time in your career development. We provide constant, actionable feedback delivered through mentorship and through regular management consulting-style career reviews. We also have regular one-on-one meetings, where we listen to and discuss career goals, and work collaboratively to craft roles that each person can be passionate about.  Because of our rapid growth, we constantly have new high-level roles opening up and opportunities in many functions. This results in fast career growth for our staff. 



Qualifications 


We are seeking exceptional professionals with 2+ years of work experience.  Candidates who fit the following criteria are strongly encouraged to apply: 



  • Solid programming skills. C#/MVC.Net/Breeze.js/Angular.js preferable, but not required 

  • Knowledge of database concepts and SQL/Linq 

  • Very strong self-manager. After an initial six-month period of heavy mentorship, supervision will consist of 1 weekly check-in. We need someone who is very well-organized and can manage their work independently 

  • Work or internship experience in a professional environment; ideally 2+ years of work experience 

  • Willingness to commit to the position for at least 2 years 

  • Experience living in a developing country desired, but not a requirement  

  • Humility. We are looking for passionate professionals who combine strong technical skills with good humor, patience, and a humble approach to service 

  • Language: English required, French is a plus 



Preferred Start Date 


Flexible 



Compensation 


Starts modest. However, this is a career-track role with fast raises for performance, paying a meaningful salary for long-term placement in developing nations. 



Benefits 


Health insurance, immunizations, flight, room and board. 



Sponsor International Candidates 


Yes 



East Africans Encouraged to Apply

jobs.title: Finance and Operations Project Specialist
jobs.content:
Wanted

An exceptional professional with experience in either finance or business operations and a passion for development.  East African candidates are strongly encouraged to apply for this position. 

 

Job Location

Jinja, Uganda

 

Duration

Minimum two year's commitment, full-time job.

 

Job Description

Our operations team provides invaluable support to our Field team, enabling them to deliver impact to many smallholder farmers around East Africa. This position will work with one of our Operations departments: Business Operations or Finance.

Business Operations:

The Business Operations department is responsible for all key client data management and works closely with our core operations on a daily basis. The Business Operations Associate will be responsible for facilitating the growth of our client base by leading a team of bookkeepers in an efficiently designed, well-structured, and goal-oriented manner. This task will require a high level of responsibility, and we’re looking for someone who can effectively meet goals and deliver results through systems design, staff hiring, and leadership development.

Specific duties include:

  • Staff Management & Development
  • Client Payments Management
  • Client Order Management & Fulfillment
  • Client Data Management
  • Customer Service

Finance

Our finance department has various responsibilities ranging from book-keeping and weekly payments to budgeting, cash forecast, financial analysis and internal audit. The finance department plays a key role in driving our program towards financial sustainability meaning that we do not depend on donor money to run our program. This position will analyze and coach our departments in their spending as well as identify and drive key savings projects. In addition, a key responsibility would be to manage our internal auditors to ensure we operate with stewardship

Specific duties include:

  • Leading annual budget process and reviewing monthly variances
  • Lead quarterly updates of department/country budget forecast
  • Identifying key savings projects in cooperation with department heads
  • Co-ordinate in country external annual audit
  • Regular training of new/existing staff in OAF financial system and processes
  • Improve in-country financial processes
  • Single point of contact against OAF international finance team

 

Career Growth and Development

One Acre Fund invests heavily in building management and leadership skills. Your manager will invest significant time in your career development. We provide constant, actionable feedback delivered through mentorship and through regular management consulting-style career reviews. We also have regular one-on-one meetings, where we listen to and discuss career goals, and work collaboratively to craft roles that each person can be passionate about. Finance & Operations Specialists will have access to regular and ongoing professional development opportunities aimed at building the soft and hard skills required for quick rapid professional growth. Because of our rapid growth, we constantly have new roles opening up and opportunities in many functions. This results in fast career growth for our staff.

 

Qualifications

We are seeking an exceptional professional(s) with 1-3 year(s) of work experience and ideally a demonstrated passion for international development. Candidates who fit the following criteria are strongly encouraged to apply:

  • 1-3 Years Relevant Work Experience – Candidates should have 1-3 years of strong work experience, including project management, team management, or entrepreneurial experiences. Candidates with a background in community development, field work, or agriculture preferred.
  • Strong Leadership Skills – We are looking for candidates with demonstrated leadership experience at work, or outside of work. Examples of demonstrated leadership experience include managing a team or starting a business.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Related Field – Strong undergraduate background at top East African university or international university. Degrees in Finance or Accounting required for the Finance position. Degree in Business, or Finance preferred for Business Operations position.
  • Humility & Positive Attitude – We are looking for passionate professionals who combine strong leadership skills with good humor, patience, and a humble approach to service to join our growing family of leaders.
  • Strong Computer Skills – Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Access databases
  • Rural Fit – A willingness to commit to living in rural areas of Uganda for at least two years.
  • Language – English required. Knowledge of Luganda, Lusoga or other Ugandan languages strongly preferred.
  • Ugandan national – This job is for Ugandan nationals exclusively.

 

Preferred Start Date

1st June 2016

 

Compensation

Commensurate with experience.

 

Benefits

Housing, transportation, and airtime allowance.

 

Note: We will not be able to sponsor a visa for this position.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Engineer for an Outdoors Media Startup
jobs.content:
RootsRated is on a mission to power outdoor discovery.


We are looking for a dynamic and driven individual to join the software engineering team at a rapidly growing organization. As the fastest growing media property in the outdoors space, RootsRated is positioned to create the most comprehensive and trusted resource for outdoor recreation in the United States.


This role reports to the CTO. A successful Software Engineer at RootsRated is excited about the challenge of creating both consumer- and business-facing products. Recognizing the stage and trajectory of RootsRated, a successful candidate will thrive in ambiguous and resource-constrained environments (doing more with less).


We're a small team with huge ideas, and we're steadfast on holding to some core practices that help us deliver high impact products, including:



  • Taking on individual ownership over features and projects

  • Saying "no" to shiny objects

  • Using data to drive feature priority

  • Being cognizant of technical debt and diligent about test coverage

  • Shipping regularly to test hypotheses


What you'll be asked to do:



  • Contribute valuable expertise to a highly-motivated and agile team

  • Play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, testing, launch, and support

  • Demonstrate productivity in a variety of work environments: independently, under direction, and in paired-programming

  • Have a passion for growing your skills, but also lifting the skills and expertise of those around you

  • Exercise flexibility in achieving tasks and priorities across multiple codebases

  • Excel at both providing and receiving code reviews

  • Develop novel features for creating, organizing, distributing and analyzing content across multiple platforms

  • Build and refine RootsRated’s platforms to house and discover content beautifully and creatively


Benefits:



  • Unlimited Vacation

  • Health/Dental (50/50)

  • The equipment you need to be successful

  • Outdoor apparel and equipment Pro Deals

  • Amazing open workspace with outdoor firepit

jobs.title: Mobile Senior Developer - Android - DC or Reston, VA

jobs.title: API Specialist
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse.


API Specialist:


Our API Specialists leverage their technical prowess and in-depth product knowledge to assist our merchants with seamless API integrations into our SDK. While you don’t need to be a seasoned developer, you should be comfortable writing code, building API integrations, and running point on complex data migrations. You’ll be the first point of escalation for the more complicated technical issues that reach our support team, so you’ll often find yourself in the thick of conversations with developers from many of our different product teams - be prepared to learn a lot!  Skills you might pick up include basic networking diagnostics, writing efficient search queries, and sleuthing through our extensive gateway code.


Beyond the technical skill-set, we are looking for someone who can delight our merchants with promptness, thoroughness, accuracy and even the occasional pun.


Examples of work you’ll be doing:



  • Assist merchants integrating with the Braintree API; you’ll be an expert in our best practices. We offer client libraries in Ruby, Python, Java, .NET, PHP, and Node.js. You won’t be familiar with all these on Day 1, but over time you will add more languages to your tool-belt

  • Field support inquiries from developers and business users about account integration and the payments features we offer to best serve a merchant platform and their customers

  • Diving in and debugging web services by building custom example integrations and experiment with merchant problems

  • Run point on merchant data migrations into our systems in a way that is least disruptive to their business and workflow

  • Spot problems and trends in support tickets, and work with our developers to improve existing workflows


What we look for in you:



  • Solid understanding of at least one programming language and capability to take that knowledge and build a simple web app that uses our API

  • Must be a self-starter. Those that require a playbook need not apply

  • 1+ year experience in a technical or support role that puts you in direct contact with merchants or customers

  • Willingness to spin up a Digital Ocean or EC2 instance to test network connectivity or integration issues

  • Resourcefulness that puts Angus MacGuyver to shame

  • Someone who possess infinite patience and devotion to their contacts … and someone who is secure in their ping-pong abilities. Watch out. You might get schooled


Braintree Perks:


Daily catered lunches: salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement: we take education and skills development seriously


Commuter reimbursement: take the L or Metra to work? We cover the monthly expenses


Give Time: program to encourage volunteering in local communities - 5 PTO days annually after first year of employment

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:


Braintree builds products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. The Braintree full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We're known for our technology but we're also known for our support, with internal risk and underwriting, account management and technical support teams who ensure a frictionless payments experience.

Our technology fuels companies like GitHub, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable, Heroku and more.


Headquartered in Chicago, Braintree has offices in San Francisco, New York, Sydney, and London with employees stationed around the world. 

Check us out - Braintree on The Muse: http://muse.cm/1wWa28H


Senior Software Engineer:

We’re looking for Software Engineers to join the squad and help us continue building solutions to complex problems and innovate in the space. Here is a little info on our team:


We are polyglots... 

Although most of our software is written in Ruby, we don’t confine ourselves to a single programming language. We believe in using the best tool for the job while maintaining a slight bias toward the tools the team knows the best. We’ve written infrastructure components in Python, and we build client libraries for integrating with Braintree in Ruby, Python, Node.js, PHP, Java, and .NET.


We pair program…


We work on Macbook Pros with two keyboards and dual 27" cinema displays. We work in an open team room; no cubicles or private offices. Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. 

We test... 

Testing is at the forefront of our development philosophy. We never need to check our code coverage to know that it's at 100%: with disciplined TDD, no line of code will be written without a test. We're confident that our automated testing is thorough and will catch any regression bugs - and that’s critical given the software we write! We use continuous integration to test every version of every client library against our gateway.


We are agile...


Agile development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us, the most important part of Agile is doing what works best for the team. We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We’re pragmatic, not dogmatic. Although we have strong opinions, we're never afraid to try to new things to see if they work and reconsider our positions if the situation warrants it. 

We value our people... 

-Two paid conferences annually to everyone on the Products Team


-Open Dev Day twice a month 


-Catered lunches daily


-Commuter reimbursement program


Take a look at some of our blog posts and scope our code on GitHub


Braintrust

Braintree GitHub

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Commerce
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook | Twitter


Engineering Team Culture:


We are hiring Software Engineers to join our Commerce Team. The focus is to build the future of commerce. We simply look to hire smart people. No emphasis on a CS degree, or deep understanding of our tech stack, but instead Engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to join a collaborative environment building the future of commerce. We are a largely remote team and have built a strong set of principles around our communication and workflow to support this.


Types of projects we work on:


Contextual commerce — With one seamless Braintree integration, you’ll pave a simple path for retailers to sell, and users to buy what they see - when they see it - on your platform.


PayPal Commerce iOS SDK — building a better way to sell on mobile and giving customers a shopping experience with less typing, smarter purchasing, and more flexibility.


Think — dropping a buy button into an email or online article to reduce friction and cart abandonment. Embed a store with our simple SDK to bring the complete shopping experience right into your existing app.


What we look for in you:


Proficiency within your current tech stack and desire to continue learning. We build with Python and JavaScript, but are open to candidates with other experiences.


Work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is spread out across the country with people working in our Chicago and San Francisco offices, as well as remotely. You should be open to various channels of communication and enjoy the workflow of that team dynamic.


You’re excited about the work we’re doing. Contextual commerce is a new concept in the space, and we’re hoping you are passionate about helping build new consumer experiences.


Braintree Perks:


Open Dev Day — two days a month our engineers work on projects that interest them to improve their craft


Product conferences — attend two conferences … all on the Braintree dime


Daily catered lunches — salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement — we take education and skills development seriously


Tracking Free Vacation — employees self track their vacation to ensure you get the time off you need


Take a look at our GitHub and blog: Braintree GitHub | Braintrust

jobs.title: Front End Developer - Commerce
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse | LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter


Engineering Team Culture:


We are hiring Front End Developers to join our Commerce Team. The focus is to build the future of commerce. We simply look to hire smart people. No emphasis on a CS degree, or deep understanding of our tech stack, but instead folks who are passionate about their craft and excited to join a collaborative environment building the future of commerce. We are a largely remote team and have built a strong set of principles around our communication and workflow to support this.


Types of projects we work on:


Contextual commerce. With one seamless Braintree integration, you’ll pave a simple path for retailers to sell, and users to buy what they see - when they see it - on your platform. Think: dropping a buy button into an email or online article to reduce friction and cart abandonment. Embed a store with our simple SDK to bring the complete shopping experience right into your existing app.


We complement these features with control panels and web clients to provide our merchants easy access to their consumer offerings and ability to manage workflows in a user friendly fashion.


What we look for in you:


Proficiency within your current tech stack and desire to continue learning. We build with JavaScript and utilize ReactJS + Vue.js. We’re most interested in your ability to write vanilla JavaScript vs specific JS frameworks.


Work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is spread out across the country with people working in our Chicago and San Francisco offices, as well as remotely. You should be open to various channels of communication and enjoy the workflow of that team dynamic.


You’re excited about the work we’re doing. Contextual commerce is a new concept in the space, and we’re hoping you are passionate about helping build new consumer experiences.


Braintree Perks:


Open Dev Day: two days a month our engineers work on projects that interest them to improve their craft


Product conferences: attend two conferences … all on the Braintree dime


Daily catered lunches: salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement: we take education and skills development seriously


Give Time: program to encourage volunteering in local communities - 5 PTO days annually

jobs.title: Full Stack Python Developer With SQL Join Virtual Team
jobs.content:
We are a small, established, and profitable technology company providing online exam software to customers in over 25 countries. We are looking for a senior developer to join our team. You can work remote as long as you overlap with the U.S. Eastern Time zone.


This is a great job for someone who loves technology and wants to work on a cool project without big company bureaucracy. You won’t be pigeon­holed into doing the same thing every day. In fact, the ability to wear multiple hats is essential. Here are some of the roles you’ll play on the team:


Hands­ on Programmer. We are looking for a senior developer who can write code. Most of it will be Python, JavaScript or SQL. You may have to set up an Ubuntu server, modify nginx settings, write a Python module for a new feature or script a Web­-based API to integrate with another application.


R&D engineer. As our product evolves and our company grows you will assist us in evaluating new technologies, designing product architecture, and thinking through Internet security issues.


Design Opinionator. While we won’t ask you to fire up Photoshop, you can certainly help us find JavaScript widgets or CSS tricks that make the site drive better and more fun to use. We don’t stuff programmers into code hell; feedback on all aspects of product development is expected and encouraged.
