jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.content:
Account Manager Position
We’re Strand, a high tech B2B marketing agency, who are growing and looking for a marketing communications professional to join our dynamic team. As an Account Manager at Strand you’ll work as part of a fast-paced client services team and will be responsible for managing project work, while attaining the campaign goals for each client. The skills we’re looking for include marcom coordination, project management, some technical knowledge, PR and social media creation/execution, and inbound campaign coordination. Familiarity with HubSpot, marketing automation, Google Analytics, Adwords are a plus, and experience with B2B technology will get you on the short list.

We’re looking for someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit and has a passion for learning our client’s technology. If you are looking to be part of a collaborative team, work for a company where your input is valued, and play a part in the company’s growth strategy we may be your next move.

Responsibilities:
• Client relations
• Project management
• Writing and/or coordinating press releases and blogs
• Developing media and social connections
• Maintaining content roadmaps
• Managing clients social channels
• Documenting and tracking editorial success
• Pitching client editorial ideas to journalists
• Compiling monthly client status reports and evaluate against targeted goals

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations, or Business Administration
• 2 or more years of experience in related field, preferably in an agency environment
• High social media and PR competency
• HubSpot experience or other marketing automation software
• Knowledge and understanding of Google Analytics and AdWords
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), well organized, detail oriented and able to understand direction and follow through on deliverables.

Sound like a job for you? Please send your resume to kbstrand@strandmarketing.com

We look forward to hearing from you.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a senior UI engineer looking to make a big impact on a high profile project?


Ai is a leading interactive strategy, design, and development agency. We are looking for driven, self-motivated coders that are able to understand business problems and translate these into technical solutions. Ideal candidates should have concept-to-launch experience building scalable and secure transactional web applications. 


As a senior UI engineer you will be leading the design and construction of the interface interactivity of our clients’ sites through the masterful use of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other related front-end technologies. You will own the technical front-end direction and collaborate with backend developers, information architects, business analysts and visual designers. 


Our typical engagement size and the size of our teams makes it possible for all team members to craft and shape the experiences we produce, with the full support of the leads and directors. The flexibility of our process makes for happy clients and the unusual ability to produce exactly the work you envision. If you want to make a real difference on a project, this is your dream role.


Off projects, you will be expected to teach your colleagues something they didn’t know in an area you are excited about. Is mobile app development your fantasy? How about responsive markup or rich, cross-browser compliant animations? Show us what you’ve got.

jobs.name: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016

jobs.title: Director of Infrastructure
jobs.company: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016
jobs.content:
At Motus, we are passionate about leveraging technology to make work-life better for mobile workers and their managers. Our cloud-based mobile technology streamlines administrative tasks, provides fair and accurate reimbursements, mitigates risk, and offers actionable data insights—all designed to allow the mobile workforce the freedom to allocate their time in ways that make them happiest.


The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced, creative Director of Infrastructure to manage our application systems and tools. In this role, you will report directly to our VP of Technology, manage our DevOps engineers, and work closely with the Development and QA teams. You will be responsible for continuing to improve the reliability, security, and productivity of our production and staging, and development systems.


We run our systems on a cutting edge platform using AWS, Apache Mesos, Mesosphere Marathon and Chronos, and Docker.  We use Puppet, Terraform, and Ansible to manage our platform.  Experience with some or all of these technologies is extremely valuable in this position.


What You'll Do:



  • Build, develop, and manage a high-performing infrastructure and DevOps team to meet the needs of a rapidly growing and changing business in an even more rapidly changing technology landscape.

  • Architect and implement a security environment to manage sensitive information across the organization.

  • Enhance automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure and scale their applications internally and at AWS, including SLA's, 24x7 monitoring, alerting and incident response.

  • Continuously improve our visibility into our systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics and log analytics.

  • Actively participate in high-level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations.

  • Design, implement, and facilitate an annual infrastructure plan.

  • Manage infrastructure projects on and to budget.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.company: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016
jobs.content:
At Motus, we are passionate about leveraging technology to make work-life better for mobile workers and their managers. Our cloud-based mobile technology streamlines administrative tasks, provides fair and accurate reimbursements, mitigates risk, and offers actionable data insights—all designed to allow the mobile workforce the freedom to allocate their time in ways that make them happiest.


The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced software engineer to join the team in the midst of some exciting expansion. The team is currently working on mobile web application projects, building new systems and supporting new lines of business all while improving the stability, security and efficiency of our production systems. Our web-based applications use Linux, PHP, Java, and PostgreSQL targeting desktop browsers, smartphones like the iPhone and Android, and other businesses through web services.


The ideal candidate for this role will be motivated and excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications as well as be a strong mentor for the rest of the software development team. Someone who has been successful at building scalable, maintainable and extensible software on a Java stack is preferred.


What You'll Do:



  • Analyze – help gather requirements and work closely with our Product Analysts to define them.

  • Design – create a workable model from the requirements.

  • Build – You’ll be writing the most complex and crucial parts of the system.

  • Teach – Mentor and guide our junior team members.

  • Improve – We’re always looking for ways to do things better, so you’ll be encouraged to take on projects that do that.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer who can support a small team of engineers and develop automated tests that we can rely on to ensure our new code is safe to release.


Do you take joy in spotting what others miss? We are looking for someone who understands how frustrating it is when things don’t work right; who feels it is their duty to protect the world from bad code.


We want an engineer who understands how to build automated tests that are reliable and easy to maintain.


Responsibilities:



  • Support a team of engineers, acting as gatekeeper for their changes

  • Build and maintain automated test suites for multiple web based products

  • Identify areas of risk and develop appropriate test plans

  • Perform investigation of escalated issues

  • “Fight for the user”


Minimal Requirements:



  • 3 Years of QA or Support Engineering

  • 1 Year QA Automation Engineering

  • Incredible attention to detail

  • Clear communication skills

  • Experience with Scrum a plus


Preferred Skills:



  • Watir

  • Selenium

  • Ruby

  • Web Console

  • CSS

  • Javascript

  • Git


About our Engineering Department


All of our developers are full-stack and work closely with Product, Design and QA teams to deliver features to about 45-55k users per day. Here is some of what you can expect working here:



  • Autonomy. Developers are organized into autonomous teams of 2-4 developers and have a lot of control over how they collaborate, communicate, and generally work.

  • Agility. Teams practice scrum, work in sprints, calculate velocity, do code reviews and rely on Continuous Integration.

  • Diversity. Women make up roughly a third of our team, and we have people from all over the world on our team. It’s part of what makes our culture great.

  • Craftsmanship. We have excellent engineers spanning all skill levels, and we all are committed to becoming better at our craft. We practice Lunch & Learns and mentorship.

  • Stewardship. We are big proponents of open source, use it a lot, and give back to the community wherever we can.


Perks


We truly care about our people, and as such are strong believers in having fun at work, continuing education and work/life/family balance. We demonstrate that in the followings ways:




  • Competitive Pay. We hire excellent people and reward them accordingly.




  • Flexible Work Hours. If you work better evenings than mornings, that’s fine by us!




  • One Paid Conference per year (includes hotel and airfare).




  • DashCon. An internal yearly conference showcasing our engineering culture.




  • 10% time per week to invest in open source or self-education.




  • Great benefits. Health, dental, vision, 401k, and more.




  • Parties! We can fly you out for our company-wide get-togethers.




  • Good times guarantee. Board game nights and Bad-joke Wednesdays, our favorite perk ;-)

jobs.title: Rails Platform Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Surkus is a rapidly growing, well-funded, mobile-first platform where anyone can cast amazing people for events, parties, product launches, and a wide variety of exciting experiences. Surkus transcends traditional entertainment and on-demand staffing applications to allow clients nearly instant to talented, amazing people for real-world events.

We are experiencing tremendous growth and driving significant technology innovation in our space.

Ensuring continuous improvement in platform performance, reliability and scalability is critical to our continued success. You will be working with a team of top-notch developers with advanced skills in a variety of technologies to make major platform enhancements to achieve these objectives.

Experience with our core stack is helpful: Heroku, AWS, Postgres, Elasticsearch, React

We currently have offices in Hollywood and Santa Monica.


Benefits


  • Health insurance
  • Stock options

jobs.title: Senior Java Developers
jobs.content:
We are looking for developers who are proud of their code and who are willing to stand behind it every time. People who want to make Test Driven Development and metrics a part of their everyday development process with a focus on quality, elegant code, and superior standards. We want people who take an active interest in the technical community as a whole and who have a passion for what they do.


As a Senior Java Developer you will be developing a cutting edge API based web application, you will be provided with a working environment that is stimulating, challenging and rewarding.  Our focus is very much on constantly improving our development processes using agile development methodologies where developers are encouraged to design and develop systems in regularly delivered iterations and unnecessary documentation is minimized.


 If you want to influence, have the talent and ability to innovate with the best and the courage to stand up for quality then we want to talk to you.


Key responsibilities:



  • Develop, test and deliver highly performant and secure API based services

  • Working in a cross-functional agile team you will be developing features end-to-end across the software stack and responsible for all non-functional capabilities.

  • You will be expected to write elegant, simple code that lends itself to low cost maintenance, extensibility, testability and performance.

  • You will validate proposed approaches and explore new concepts using proof-of-concepts, wire frames and early experience prototypes.

  • Work within a Scrum with team members based in Ireland & India.

jobs.title: Woodworking & Cabinetmaking, Part-time Adjunct Pool
jobs.content:
Woodworking & Cabinetmaking, Part-time Adjunct Pool
Kern Community College District
Position Number: 01433
Open Until Filled: Yes
Rate: $60.00 per hour/ Instructional
College/Site: Bakersfield College
Location: BC-Main Campus

Benefits:
• Sick leave only.
• Not eligible for health benefits.

BASIC FUNCTION:
• This is an adjunct position assigned to the Bakersfield Community College Main Campus.
• The successful applicant will be expected to provide instruction in a full range of woodworking and cabinetmaking courses.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS :
• Any bachelor’s degree and two years of professional experience OR
• Any associate degree and six years of professional experience OR
• Possession of a valid credential which authorizes full-time teaching of woodworking at the California Community College level OR
• The equivalent. Certain combinations of education, experience, and other accomplishments in the field may be judged as equal to the stated minimum qualifications for these positions.
• A demonstrated sensitivity to students with diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural and ethnic backgrounds and students with disabilities.

**Candidates who feel they possess such equivalent qualifications must request and submit an http://www.kccd.edu/Human%20Resources/Employment%20Opportunities/Applications/HR%20Application%20for%20Equivalence%20WEB.pdf form.
Supporting documents must be included with the completed form.


KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES :
The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate that they are broadly prepared and have a depth of knowledge in the discipline. In addition, the successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the following knowledge and abilities:

• Ability to work effectively and harmoniously with colleagues in an environment that promotes innovation, teaching, learning and service to a diverse student population;
• Ability to effectively work with students with a wide range of skills, motivations, academic, and vocational goals;
• Ability to develop curriculum, including curriculum delivered via different modalities;
• Ability to participate in recruitment and articulation activities with local schools, colleges and universities;
• Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing;
• Demonstrated ability to maintain subject matter currency;
• Ability to assess student learning outcomes;
• Knowledge of computers and willingness to explore new technologies that would benefit the program;
• Knowledge of and commitment to the California community college mission;

Desirable Qualifications:
• Industrial and/or high school agriculture experience.
• Ability to provide leadership within the discipline and college initiatives to improve student learning.
• Ability and willingness to work effectively with college committees and other organizations and to be involved in co-curricular and extra-curricular activities


Completed application packet must include:
• Completed Online Application for Employment form
• Current resume
• Copies of legible transcripts
• List of six (6) professional references – Listed on application form

ADDITIONAL NOTES:
• Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to participate in the selection process should contact Human Resources to make the necessary arrangements.
The District does not provide sponsorship for authorization to work in the United States. Work authorization should be established at the time of application submission.
All applicants must apply online at http://apptrkr.com/858545. Emails will not be accepted.
• Degrees and credits must be from accredited institutions (Title V Section 53406).
Any degree from a country other than the United States, including Canada and Great Britain, must be evaluated by an evaluation service.
• The screening of candidates will be conducted by a screening committee. The screening committee reserves the right to limit the number of interviews granted. Meeting the minimum qualifications for a position does not assure the applicant of an interview.

As an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, the Kern Community College District encourages candidates with diverse backgrounds to apply.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
You have already solid experience as a DevOps Engineer and would like to tackle a new challenge in an different environment? This is your chance!


Support our development and operations team in making our infrastructure even more robust and flexible. Help us to manage our mobile device cloud by enhancing the existing monitoring solution and automating as many administration tasks as possible.


Your responsibilities as Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f):



  • Design, setup and maintain our mobile device infrastructure

  • Drive the adoption of latest cloud hosting technologies

  • Consult us in making the TestObject cloud more scalable

  • Contribute to open source tools and frameworks we use on a daily base


Your Benefits:



  • An exciting and challenging job: You contribute to serious production grade software together with an experienced, friendly, agile team of developers and operations.

  • Benefits: You will be fully responsible for your projects and will receive a competitive salary alongside having the opportunity to directly impact our company’s success.

  • Team spirit: We are open-minded people and are happy to integrate new colleagues into our team. Team lunches, team events, after work … included.

  • Getting started: New in Germany or Berlin? We want you to feel at home here. We assist you with finding accommodation, obtaining a visa, learning German, and to establish your network in the Berlin Tech community.

jobs.title: Front End Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
The iCentris team is dedicated to developing beautiful, usable, and practical web applications for our clients. We’re highly collaborative fast paced environment utilizing a combination of agile and waterfall project management methodologies. We believe in customer validation early in the process, verifying solutions with real data, and running with our industry expertise. The team includes UI/UX design, Ruby on Rails developers, DBA’s and project/product management where everyone on the team is responsible for the success of our products and ensures we’re leading the MLM industry in technology.


We're seeking a Ruby on Rails developer with strong analytical and problem solving skills who can identify solutions a task level as well as at a product level. Candidates must be highly skilled with developing in HTML/CSS/JavaScript technologies.  The ideal profile combines deep experience in web design and strong understanding of implementing markup. You must be able to demonstrate prior experience on web sites you’re proud to show off for their functionality and polished UI, appropriate use of JavaScript and standard CSS best practices.

jobs.title: Senior C# Software Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Mapleton, Utah
URL: http://sourcecodepartners.com/

Source Code Partners specializes in building business information systems for a variety of industries.  Our custom built systems range from stock market trading platforms to back office production management solutions. Our mission is to help companies gain a competitive advantage through cutting edge technology and information systems.

REQUIREMENTS

We are hiring a US based senior developer for our team.  The position will require maintaining and enhancing existing systems for our existing clients, as well as building new systems for new clients. 

As a senior developer, we expect:

Flexible hours

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Seeking an experienced Android Developer who can create and design mobile applications for Android platforms.


In addition to having excellent technical skills, you have a keen interest in the latest technologies and have a feel for user experience. You'll be responsible for building exciting applications and implementing flows and mock ups as provided by UX and Design teams. Apart from having the ability to write fast and clean code with great attention to detail and proper documentation,  you also come up with solutions and suggestions for improvement as you will be working closely with Product Development and Marketing teams. 


Being one of our talented developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn and grow, and be a key part of creating our products. Check out http://www.omvana.com and http://www.dormioapp.com/ for our latest releases. Omvana is One of the Top 20 Health and Fitness Apps in the USA Apple Store.

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about coding?

If Activities, Content Providers, Intents and Services sweeten your Marshmallow and you like to have a Lollipop with your coffee, send us an email with links to any of your published projects in the Play Store or Github repositories. Ideally, you have also gained experienced over time in some of the following fields: JSON, REST Webservices, NodeJS, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration, Git and Jenkins.

In this role your creativity and ambition is required, whether you apply it to smartphones, tablets or Google Wearables. Develop new concepts for our technologically sophisticated business applications! Contribute to the apps for DriveNow or Sixt, our internationally successful rent-a-car app!

You will get to interact with like-minded mobile experts in our own mobile development blog and on regular hacking days, giving you the chance to expand your knowledge of other platforms and technologies. We will provide you with a great working environment that of course includes lots of great coffee, Club Mate and foosball.


For our IT, software and web development departments in Pullach and Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated Android Engineer (m/f).


Your job – performs as smoothly as our cars:



  • You develop the Sixt rent-a-car, DriveNow and myDriver apps.

  • You have high standards in regard to quality, which is reflected in your Clean Code and efficient architecture.

  • You collaborate closely with product management and design teams in a proactive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies.

  • You evaluate new technologies and create new features based on your findings.

  • You communicate fluently in English and appreciate cultural diversity.



Your profile – your willingness to accelerate:



  • You are already a passionate Android developer?

  • You have extensive experience with Java and want to become an Android developer?

  • You completed a university degree, a relevant vocational education or have related work experience?

  • You have experience with Webservices, Persistence and Material Design?

  • You even know Retrofit, Picasso, Eventbus and ButterKnife?


Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:



  • We have a very diversified job for you!

  • We offer you great degrees of freedom!

  • We offer you international career development opportunities!

  • We work in a very dynamic working environment!

Contribute to the apps for

For our IT, software and web development departments in Pullach and Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated iOS Engineer (m/f).

  • Your high quality standards are reflected in Clean Code and efficient architecture.

Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:

  • We work in a very dynamic environment!


Send us a mail with a link to a successfully completed project in the app store or your GitHub repository.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about coding? Are you enthusiastic about every new JavaScript framework?

We need your creativity and ambition to take our web development to the next level! Join us and develop new concepts for our technically sophisticated business applications. Contribute to the new Sixt website with millions of users!


For our IT, software and web development department in Pullach near Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated Frontend Developer.


Your job – performs as smoothly as our cars:



  • You play a key role in the development of our Sixt Online Booking Engine.

  • You constantly improve our React / Redux stack.

  • You have high standards in regard to quality, which are reflected in your Clean Code and efficient architecture.

  • You constantly discover new technologies and potential applications for our products.

  • You collaborate closely with product management and design teams in a responsive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies.


Your profile – your willingness to accelerate:



  • React and Redux are at the top of your favorites list?

  • On your personal TIOBE index JavaScript is #1?

  • You have extensive experience in frontend development?

  • Uncle Bob is more than a nice old man for you?

  • You can prove that you have already developed your own web applications?

  • For you, design patterns do not involve using crayons?

  • Your proactivity gives you the ability to mobilize others?

  • You can communicate very well in English?


Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:



  • We have a very diversified job for you!

  • We offer you great degrees of freedom!

  • We offer you international career development opportunities!

  • We work in a very dynamic environment!


Send us an email with links to any projects that you successfully completed. Ideally, you are experienced in some of the following topics: React, Redux, Sass, Webpack, ES6, npm, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration and Git.

jobs.title: UI/UX Product Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Completely Remote
URL: http://meetedgar.com

Full time remote position, 40 hrs/week

We want to grow our product team by adding an accomplished visual designer with skills in both interface and user-experience design. (We wanted to grow our product team by sprinkling it with plant food, but that only upset people, so now we’re trying this.)

About You

First and foremost, you’re a problem solver - whether you’re identifying user goals, designing and redesigning an interface to perfection, or building a really complicated IKEA armoire, you love a good challenge. When you’re confronted with ideas as devilishly complex and messy as a big ball of Christmas lights, you know how to untangle them to create something straightforward, simple, and only a moderate fire hazard.

When it comes to our app, that means crafting an interface that makes the user experience as simple, enjoyable, and rewarding as possible, one iteration at a time. (Because nothing is ever perfect - except, maybe, Helvetica.) Like Tony Robbins speaking into a mirror, you’re self-motivated - you proudly take ownership of your work, but still love close collaboration with a team-tastic team. And while you can articulate your design rationale, you also aren’t afraid to be wrong sometimes - in fact, you thrive on feedback like a beautiful flower thrives on the delicious UV rays of Earth’s golden sun. (Ahhh, so inspirational!)

The sort of projects you’ll work on include:
  • Plotting the user onboarding experience
  • Designing a drag-and-drop queue interface
  • Polishing the subscription cancel flow
  • A/B testing features
  • Designing inline editing in the content library

Like the tenacious fire ant, our product team is small but mighty, and frequently ruins picnics. You’ll be joining them as our first full-time designer dedicated exclusively to MeetEdgar’s interface, working directly with our full-stack developers to breathe sweet life into your ingenious concepts.

In other words? You’ll have a major hand in defining the look and feel of a product used by thousands of small-business customers, with a significant sense of independence and ownership to go with it. As we keep on growing, you’ll find plenty of new opportunities to help us take our app to the next level both visually and functionally - heck, if we didn’t already work here, we know that’s what WE would want to be doing!

Job Deets Cheat Sheet

Your experience:
  • 4+ years designing web applications, shipped to production and enjoyed by zillions of happy users (or at least HALF a zillion)
  • Thorough understanding of the technical trade-offs and limitations of designing for the web
  • Masterful vector and raster design skills using the standard cadre of professional tools
  • Familiarity creating work at multiple fidelities, from high level wireframes down to pixel-perfect mockups and prototypes
  • A mind-blowing portfolio of well-reasoned design solutions
  • Ability to roll up your sleeves and translate your designs into production-worthy markup and styles using modern front-end dev tools and techniques (you can leave your sleeves unrolled if that’s more comfortable)

Minimum technical skills and important-sounding acronyms:
  • Modern HTML/CSS
  • Vanilla JS and jQuery
  • Some CSS preprocessor (Sass, Less, etc.)
  • Some version control
  • And some templating language (Haml, ERB, JSX, etc.)
  • Ability to deliver fully coded static mockups

Extra special bonus points for any of the following:
  • Deeper technical skills within our stack: React, Rails, Haml, ES6, Sass, and Github flow
  • Qualitative user research experience
  • Illustration skillz
  • Etch-a-Sketch expertise (demonstrate a perfect circle)

About Us

We’re a small team of 16-ish people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual meetup week where we work together on cool projects all day and rock the karaoke mic all night.

We’re proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. We’re pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We'll probably get along if you’re someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

You can find out more at http://meetedgar.com/careers/ and by watching this video (please watch it, it was mad expensive): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XvU3P43b0rQ

Benefits

(REMOTE POSITION. Applicants must be able to show documentation of eligibility to work in the USA.)

  • 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
  • Monthly cleaning service for your home - not that we don't have total faith in you
  • Paid home Internet service or coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
  • 75% of costs covered for health, dental, and vision for you and your fam
  • 401k with employer matching
  • An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
  • New Mac laptop (#blessed)

To apply: Apply at https://docs.google.com/a/meetedgar.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScI9MNHqCEWP_fA0NLYMxDxVjMzruBjGgY2aNMUORH3wHjbIg/viewform?fbzx=9082129526503285000

jobs.title: ASP.Net Developer Wanted To Join Fun, Growing Company
jobs.content:
Looking for a mid-level developer familiar with ASP.Net 4+ with MVC and Webforms to begin work on projects using a proprietary e-commerce platform developed in-house. Developer would be trained and mentored until comfortable with tasks. Platform interfaces with MS SQL databases, so working with SQL is essential, as well as Entity Framework and Linq to SQL.


Programmers meet once a week to share ideas, gotchas, expectactions, etc.


Programmer can expect to work on one to three projects at any given time. HTML and JS will be provided to them along with a functional and technical spec, a dedicated Project Manager and a senior developer for guidance. The programmer will generally lead the project from beginning to end

jobs.title: (Senior) Data Engineer f/m
jobs.content:
Smaato is expanding its product portfolio due to growth and demand within our industry. This is an opportunity to work for a world-class company providing an innovative platform product that could change the way the next generation understands advertising!

For our new SaaS platform, we are looking for an experienced Senior Data Engineer, who is passionate about processing large amounts of data. Currently, our cutting edge platform is processing an average of 3 billion inbound advertising queries per day. Each incoming request generates multiple outbound requests to our partners.

The Data Engineer is a technologist and innovator who brings passionate inquisitiveness, primary research, and forward thinking to every assignment. Daily activities will include developing solutions to User Story based requirements, mentoring more junior developers, engaging positively with the Scrum Team, building software to pass automated acceptance tests, and delivery of Sprint commitments. The Data Engineer will share responsibility for all team deliverables, and will favor informal communications with Product Owners and with other stakeholders within our company.

jobs.title: Sr Android Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian is looking for a few passionate Android Engineers (mid and Sr level) to join our Mobile Team! This is a new team that will be housed in a brand new office in the heart of downtown Mountain View. The key responsibilities of the team are:



  • Research and prototyping with newest mobile technology

  • Development of both reusable software components and libraries as well as consumer facing mobile applications

  • Setting the standards and best practices

jobs.title: Engineering Manager- Product Fabric
jobs.content:
Job Description

As a Snr Team Lead/Engineering Manager at Atlassian, you will join an engineering-led company & award-winning leader in software development and collaboration tools with over 60,000 customers. We're looking for experienced and talented technical leaders to help build the platform that powers Atlassian's Cloud products.

Responsible For:
In short, you will be an instrumental in helping our customers get more even more done! The Product Fabric team at Atlassian is responsible for all shared collaboration services across the Atlassian product suite.

We empower customers to get work done regardless of product boundaries providing Atlassian's collaboration fabric services (such as Mentions, Shares, Tasks...) to internal product teams and to enable our third-party developer ecosystem to extend this capability to solve specific business problems.

This is both a people management & technical management position where you will lead multiple teams of experienced, smart engineers based in Sydney. As part of the Cloud Platform leadership team, you will help define & shape our world class SaaS & cloud platform strategy.

This is a newly created team with broad technical responsibilities across all our products with greenfield projects and technologies, not a product maintenance type of role. Sound like something you’d like to get stuck into?

To be successful in this role; you’ll bring:

· Experience leading cross-functional teams of software developers (10+) that have built enterprise grade cloud platform services to high-scale, always-on, production environments.

· Real-world Agile and Continuous Delivery experience, and the scars to prove it.

· Strong organizational and communication skills with experience of developing and instilling a culture of broad product ownership and operational maturity.

· Expertise developing full stack features from backend APIs to front-end UI components.

· A proven ability to take ownership of code, perform code reviews, providing expert technical inputs on design & development decisions.

· Working knowledge with datastores (RDBMS, NoSql, search, analytics, time-series-database).

· Experience with software dev languages like Java, Node.JS and / or Go.

· Architectural experience scaling out web applications and services coupled with experience in cloud architecture

· Deep understanding of how to write performant, decoupled, testable, maintainable code.

· A passion to continuously ship real value to the customer.

It's great, but not required, if you have some or all:

 Background in full-stack development, SOA & micro-services architecture. Mobile or mobile development. Understanding of high-availability, fault tolerant, scalable, distributed systems

More about you:

You will have relish the challenge of building on our legacy of delivering great software that is trusted by over 60,000 customers across the globe. Most importantly, you will have a proven track record in building & leading highly effective software development teams (10+ team members) naturally accepting all opportunities to lead, grow & mentor at all levels. You have real world Agile experience, and the scars to prove it, helping to deliver software every day to high scale, always-on, production environments. As the owner of the team’s technical strategy & roadmap, you’ll bring extensive experience of influencing & working in close collaboration with other engineering & product/service owners in a matrix environment.


Atlassian; Powered by you.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer, Bitbucket
jobs.content:
Are you a creative and talented front-end developer? Are you passionate about working on a dynamic team that ships code to millions of users several times a week? Want to build the future of code collaboration at a company built by developers for developers?


Come join us at Atlassian and work on Bitbucket, our source code collaboration and hosting site. You will be working in a fast-paced SaaS environment where every line of code you write will be appreciated by a developer community of millions. You'll be responsible for implementing, monitoring, and optimizing the code that powers Bitbucket's UI. The company and our products are scaling rapidly and this is the team with the most to gain.


On our team, you'll have the opportunity to:



  • Dream up and develop new features for Bitbucket that will make millions of developers around the world more productive

  • Work across cutting edge frameworks and technologies, like React, Redux, and JavaScript ES6

  • Keep Bitbucket's front-end lean and fast

  • Ensure all features are a pleasure to use

  • Keep us honest and teach us a thing or two about writing clean, maintainable front-end code


More about you



  • You have the ability to write any component in vanilla JavaScript, but the intelligence to leverage existing libraries when it makes sense



  • We're exploring use of React and Redux, and we write all new code with ES6 features, so familiarity with some or all of these is helpful



  • Efficient, well-structured use of HTML tags and CSS selectors/properties



  • We also use LESS, so experience with a CSS pre-processor is helpful



  • Highly motivated person who can deliver high-quality code in a timely manner, whether working alone or in a small team



  • Comfort with and understanding of DVCS; we use Git and Mercurial for daily development and run a website built around those technologies



  • Our backend is written largely in Python, and willingness to occasionally dive in on the backend to help fix small bugs or push features forward is always appreciated


More about our team


Imagine working in a place where you get to do what you love every single day. We are a ten-year young software development company revolutionizing the way software is sold and used by businesses worldwide. With a range of innovative software products, we have customers globally including NASA, Sony, the Apache Foundation and the United Nations. We are building a different kind of software company -- one that listens to client needs, values innovation and solves customer problems with brilliant simplicity.


More about the perks


Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including beer and bubbly), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage for you and your family, 401k matching and more.


More about Atlassian


Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With more than 50,000 global customers (including 85 of the Fortune 100) and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like JIRA, Confluence and HipChat–and we’re just getting started. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.


Atlassian. Powered by you.


We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
What you'll do:





Billtrust is seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer to work with our Agile team to ensure quality deliverables for our software-as-a-service (SaaS) Cash App platform. You will create detailed and well-structured test plans and test cases then coordinate testing activities. You will ensure quality issues and defects are appropriately identified, documented, tracked and resolved. You will collaborate with dev, product and other cross-functional groups to deliver high-quality products.



  • Work with an experienced team leveraging SCRUM techniques to deliver high-quality releases

  • Create test plans, test data, test cases and automated scripts to ensure quality for web client & server applications and mobile application.

  • Perform web, API, UI, functional, regression, smoke, black box, load, performance and end-to-end testing

  • Develop automated tests using Selenium Webdriver (C#), nUnit, SQL, and other scripts

  • Write and/or modify SQL queries to perform database validations

  • Document test cases, write and reproduce accurate software problem reports, and implement process improvements

  • Identify, document, and track all software defects to closure

  • Work with functional teams in reducing error rates and perform root cause analysis of errors/trends

jobs.title: Senior Applications Developer
jobs.content:
General Summary:


Wayside Technology Group, Inc. is seeking qualified candidates to fill a Senior Applications Developer position. In this position you would work within the IT Development Team designing, developing and maintaining all applications systems within the Company. As a Senior Application Developer you will be involved in the more challenging or domain-specific projects having both the experience and instincts to move rapidly. Candidates for this position will need to be ready for the most cutting edge technology as well as transaction processing and complex database interaction.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Developing new architecture and maintains existing architecture of Application Systems

  • Integrates pre-build products into the Company's network, working closely with third-party vendor technical support

  • Communicating with outside vendors with questions regarding API's of third-party products

  • Having significant responsibility for architecture design decisions — a confident decision maker who can make decisions on their own while establishing and meeting timelines

  • Contributing creative technical ideas at weekly scheduled meetings regarding the development of software modules

  • Contributing constructive ideas as well as constructive criticism at bi-weekly peer code reviews

  • Developing Requirement documents, Code Specification documents for planned software modules

  • Responsibility for performance tuning and optimization

jobs.title: Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Wirecard is a globally operating and leading provider of technology for electronic payments in all distribution channels: Online, mobile and at the point-of-sale

As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.

The companies belonging to the Wirecard Group develop intelligent solutions to assist mail-order merchants, tourism and haulage companies as well as providers of digital goods and services with electronic payment transactions. 


We are looking for a System Administrator Linux (m/f)  to join our team at Wirecard Technologies GmbH, a subsidiary in Aschheim/Munich.


Your Duties



  • Operating and planning of an enterprise server environment

  • Support of development, QA and production systems

  • Install, upgrade and support of infrastructure services

  • Development and maintainance of different administrative applications and scripts

  • Enterprise-level Troubleshooting and Analyzing

  • Conceptional work and project based work

  • Optimizing performance and reviewing concepts of the current IT Infrastructure

  • Coordination of subcontractors


Your Profile



  • Planning, design, specification and development of test plans and development of test cases for our web and backend applications

  • Automation of test cases covering front end and backend applications

  • Working together with the Scrum team to add value to user stories

  • Develop and work together with the entire Scrum team on User Stories during Sprint Planning and User Story Workshops

  • Documentation and presentation of test results including release recommendations at the Sprint Demo

  • Active participation in defect tracking and root cause analysis


What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events


Become part of our success story. Become part of a highly qualified team, united by a vision: to make payment happen. For any questions please contact: Mr. Benedikt Bossert Human Resources Manager benedikt.bossert@wirecard.com +49 89 4424 1323

jobs.title: Wanted: Data Scientists for our Data Driven Analytics Products, Nuremberg
jobs.content:
GfK is one of the biggest global insights providers, with an incredible data landscape: Sales data, purchase insights, global trends, consumer profiles, cross-media exposure, Social Media buzz – all these sources contributing to a holistic, integrated understanding of markets, preferences, and behaviors.


We are convinced that by bringing this data landscape together with the best Data Scientists and consultants, we can create data products and services of tremendous value. For this reason, we have founded our new global DDA (Data-Driven Analytics) unit that leverages our data landscape, our technical solutions, and our expertise in order to develop and launch a new premium analytics offering for our clients.


Are you interested in taking this journey with us? Join our team!


For our DDA unit, which will combine agile start-up atmosphere with the advantages of a Global Player, we are looking for exceptional (Senior) Data Scientists who want to become part of an interdisciplinary and international team and contribute to an important global initiative: Leave your footprint and make an impact on GfK’s position in the analytics market!


Concrete tasks will include



  • contributing to the refinement and ramp-up of the DDA technology and (Big) Data analytics stack (which includes e.g., testing new tools, defining processes and blueprints, developing recommendations on how to handle specific data challenges),

  • developing scalable, cloud-based analytics “as a service” software products that leverage GfK’s data landscape for answering important business questions of our clients,

  • driving successful, data-agnostic analytics projects, by

    • supporting our DDA “Analytics Services” teams in consulting our clients with regard to data-related business challenges,

    • translating the client challenges into analytic designs and data requirements,

    • carrying out the analyses using suitable Data Science tools and our Big Data integration platform

    • presenting the results convincingly, or developing interactive data products.





Requirements


We are looking for team players with a hands-on approach, who appreciate the opportunity to work in an international environment on product developments and projects of strategic importance. A close collaboration with both our consulting/business experts and our technology experts should be appreciated – we are all part of one new, integrated team and work towards the same objective!



Developing scalable data products will be at the core of our DDA unit. Therefore, experience in turning Data Science algorithms and approaches into products will be very beneficial. A thorough understanding of how to address marketing challenges (such as pricing, product launch forecasting, etc.) analytically will be helpful, too.



Individuals who want to have direct client contact will get the possibility through challenging ad hoc projects. While our aim for solutions and data products of extraordinary quality requires research-driven individuals, a strong commercial focus and a very good understanding of how to address real-world business challenges with analytics solutions are equally important.



We are convinced that Data Science works best in teams – nobody knows everything. Hence, we look for a variety of profiles with complementary skills, such as:




  • Expert statistical modeling skills (e.g, predictive models)

  • Expert knowledge of analytic programming languages (R is required, but knowledge of further languages, such as Python or Julia is a plus)

  • Experience with using cloud-based analytics platforms, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services

  • (Expert) skills with regard to developing data products and transforming algorithms into scalable software

  • (Expert) skills with regard to performance optimized programming (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, C++ integration in R)

  • (Expert) data visualization/visual analytics skills, also using standard tools, such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau

  • (Expert) knowledge of optimization, data integration, data mining, and machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with handling and integrating data from different sources – structured and unstructured, small or big.

  • (Expert) skills with regard to working in Big Data environments (e.g., Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Pig, Hive)

  • (Expert) skills with regard to sourcing of open data (e.g., from Web APIs)

  • Solid to good understanding of Big Data Architectures

  • (Expert) skills with regard to database handling, in particular SQL

  • Ability to think creatively in addressing real-world business problems analytically, while maintaining the balance between “art & science”

  • Ability to translate sophisticated analytical information into understandable recommendations

  • Strong business understanding – ideally with in-depth experience in a certain industry (e.g., Technology, Media, FMCG,…)

  • Proven project management skills

  • Proven communication, presentation and client facing skills

  • Ability to confidently and clearly communicate in an English business environment (required!)

jobs.title: DevOps
jobs.content:
• Modellieren und implementieren von Schnittstellen, Workflows und Services auf Basis von Apache Camel, Apache ActiveMQ und Apache Karaf (ESB)

  • Sicherstellen der Verfügbarkeit unserer Apache ServiceMix-Infrastruktur (ESB)

  • Sicherstellen der Verfügbarkeit unseres Sonic/Progress-ESB und Migration nach Apache ServiceMix (ESB)

  • Aufbau und Betrieb (Provisioning, Customization, Rollout, Monitoring, Troubleshooting) von Glassfish/Payara Application Servern (Application Server)

  • JVM-Analysen und –Tuning, sowie Application Performance Monitoring (Application Server)

  • Weiterentwickeln von Skripten und Tools, z.B. für das Monitoring der Systeme oder die Automatisierung von wiederkehrenden Tasks (ESB & Application Server)

jobs.title: Application Engineer
jobs.content:
This is going to be the most exciting and most challenging career you will ever have. You will not have time to be bored and you may incur some wrinkles. But in the end, it will be worth it.


And this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity may only come to you once. 


Does joining an awesome company with a can-do, teamwork-makes-the-dream-work, and family-oriented culture give you the chills? Are you dying to solve the world’s problems and make it a better place? Do you dream of joining a team with extraordinary passion to resolve diverse/complex technology challenges every day? If so, you are at the right place and Mechdyne is the team that you have been looking for!


We are one of the world’s best and most innovative providers of visualization hardware/software, audio, visual, and information technologies. But of course you already knew that. What you may not know is that we serve many Fortune 500 companies, leading university and research centers as well as elite government agencies and the US Military who keep coming back to us to help them solve their everyday problems by providing customized solutions created by people like you!


As an Application Engineer, you will:



  • Play with, test, and evaluate the latest cutting-edge Virtual Reality, visualization, advanced audiovisual and IT technology to make sure they work as advertised. We enjoy being the test dummies for new technology! 

  • Design and develop intuitive user interfaces (UIs) and system control applications that people are not intimidated by or afraid to use

  • Write control system code that is robust, bug-free, and readable by other humans (programmers included)

  • Combine UIs and control system code to deliver a top-notch user experience for our clients. Let’s be honest, our goal is to make our clients smile when they use their brand-new, high-tech toys every day.

  • Verify and validate overall system functionality by performing QC processes and code reviews. We know it sounds boring, but it’s not. Plus it has the added benefit of being totally necessary. No one writes perfect code the first time and we enjoy helping each other out. 

  • Travel with your teammates to various locations around the globe to personally hand-deliver the systems to our clients

jobs.title: Developers for healthcare software platform
jobs.content:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

jobs.title: Senior Application Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Developer, you will be responsible for maintaining and expanding the tools our company uses every day.  Additionally, you will assist in the improvement of the department as a whole, extending influence beyond individual programming tasks.  This includes assisting more junior developers with their projects, guiding them toward better programming solutions; assisting department leadership in setting and achieving department goals; reviewing complicated or mission-critical designs, code, and tests; and seeking and documenting ways to improve our current codebase and system processes.


We value developers who write simple, efficient, maintainable code; possess good communication skills; seek to thoroughly understand the needs of the business; and are able to get things done.  Our team growing: if you possess these qualities, we would love for you to apply!

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for Software Engineers to lead our Agile Scrum development teams in building products to support Merkle’s Identity Recognition vision.  Your team will develop code all day, every day, on a full stack cloud platform using Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure, leveraging test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery.  Your team will work in a highly structured, paired programming environment to enable learning and maximize productivity.  You will partner with Product Managers at Merkle to translate our product strategy into highly functional, modular, and high-performance code.  This is a tremendous opportunity to lead the creation of next-generation technologies, capabilities, and products to set us apart from the competition.


About You



  • You love to code and you’re willing to fail fast and iterate to success.

  • You’re an experienced team lead or senior software engineer ready to step into a lead role

  • You’re someone who enjoys educating less experienced developers

  • You’re ready to judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of your customers.

  • You play well with others and have well developed communications skills.

  • You have experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies. If you are not interested in truly living in this world, it’s not going to work out.

  • You are proficient in several programming languages. You will be pairing with developers and need to be able to understand code well enough to ask/answer good questions.

  • You have a clear understanding of cloud services, deployment models and distributed systems.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
DialogTech (formerly Ifbyphone) powers human connections in a digital world.  As the market leader in call analytics and optimization, we provide data-driven marketers with an end-to-end call attribution and conversion platform. This delivers transparency and control over every conversation, so companies can optimize lead generation, map the full path to conversion, and increase sales conversions.


Thanks to smartphones, consumers are calling businesses to engage in conversations at record rates throughout every stage of the customer journey, and at DialogTech we are changing the world of voice communications for our customers.  We enable our customers to better attribute, route, personalize, and handle their voice interactions at each stage of the marketing and sales processes.


We are seeking an innovative and passionate Software Engineering Manager who is responsible for successfully designing and developing world class products in the voice based marketing space.  The role will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in the design and development of products and features. This role will work closely with Product Managers, Developers, QA and Operations teams. This role will have ownership of the technical solution from end to end, helping us build a highly scalable application using multiple services within AWS.

With 18,000 people working from nine centers in five countries, GDS is online everywhere, helping deliver exceptional client service all the time; providing what you need, where you need it.

Advisory, Knowledge and Transaction Advisory Services are among the services offered by our Client Service team. Find your team and gain valuable experiences that will last a lifetime.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.content:
Senior Product Manager

About InMobi & Working with us:

InMobi is not just another mobile advertising company. We are a technology powerhouse. We are leading the industry by building a superior mobile ecosystem. We build mobile-first customer engagement platforms that transform the economics of influencing global consumers. Our focus on understanding consumer behaviour and leveraging big-data to predict their actions enables us to offer unique mobile advertising solutions.

Today, the world's largest brands, agencies, developers and publishers are creating immediate business value by using our platforms to deliver compelling value propositions to their target consumers. We have award-winning creative teams, innovative solutions and products, combined with big data analytic capabilities that process 100s of terabytes of data daily to enable our customers make real-time decisions and gain the most value from their investment.

Our people philosophy is based on development and growth. We believe in hiring exceptionally smart people, setting them up to crazy challenges, giving them freedom to experiment,  learn and grow, and celebrate their success. We do things a bit differently at InMobi. We don’t have performance appraisals, we have development conversations. We don’t assign ratings and performance bonuses, we give opportunities and ask about aspirations. And when it comes to taking care of our people, we go all out. Our chef managed cafeteria is open from Breakfast to Dinner. We have an onsite spa that’s free for all employees. Kids and pets are welcome to our office. Our insurance plans cover both parents and in-laws... Our people are special and we make them feel it!

What’s the InMobi family like?

We are an infectious bunch. Be it the way we rise up to challenges, the cutting edge products we create, the dreams we chase or the fun we have at work. We are sure that if you meet us, you will be infected too. Today, we are proud to be the leaders in Mobile advertising and we are sure to go even higher from here. We invite you to free yourself, dream big and chase your passion. We are here today because a few of us did just that.
 

What can we promise?

We offer an opportunity to have immediate impact with the company and our products. Modern work environment, flexible schedule and smart, creative, down-to-earth people. Internal opportunities to move roles and try out bridge assignments with different teams.  Food for your soul – free meals all days of the week, gym or Yoga class to flex those biceps, cocktails at drink cart Thursdays and fun at work on Funky Fridays. We even promise to let you bring your kids and pets to work.

What is the Team Like?

Product Management at InMobi :

Product Managers in the User Acquisition team at InMobi spend their time in: 

  • Data crunching and working with business teams to ensure that their products are delivering their promised value (40%)
  • Working with engineers and peers to build the next generation of products (40%)
  • Being the domain and the ecosystem experts to ensure InMobi is a step ahead in the mobile advertising game (~20%)

What will you be doing?

  • You will be building the distribution platform for the next generation of mobile applications. Some problems you might focus on:
  • Targeting: Who is the right user for a given mobile app
  • Optimization: What is the sequence of actions to be taken before an user downloads an app
  • Pricing: What is the price to pay for showing this ad

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Own a set of business metrics and the corresponding product strategy and roadmap
  • Contribute to the overall User Acquisition product strategy
  • Convert business needs to systemic problem statements. Work with engineering to solve the stated problems
  • Own the GTM and evangelization for your products

 What do we expect from you?

  • A strong bias for action. Willingness to dot the i's and cross the t's to make the product successful
  • 6+ years in Product Management, Growth Hacking or customer facing analytics. Has delivered tangible business outcomes from data driven insights
  • Ability to formulate a clear point-of-view on hard and ambiguous problems, and execute on the same
  • Ability to multi-task and work with a diverse set of stakeholders

Education:

Bachelors or Masters in an analytical or technical field; MBA desired.

 

#LI-NV1

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking to recruit a QA Engineer to join the Literature Services Team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI).

The Literature Services Team develops and maintains Europe PubMed Central (Europe PMC: http://europepmc.org), a large repository of over 30 million full text biomedical research articles and abstracts. These records are supplemented with links to biological databases, citation networks, and semantic annotation. Europe PMC is funded by 26 funders of biological and biomedical research across Europe, led by the Wellcome Trust.

This is a new role which has been created to take our test strategy to the next level and support a rapidly growing, successful digital service. We are looking for an experienced QA Engineer who is keen to advance their career. You will take a lead role in defining quality criteria and developing test suites. The position reports to the Technical Coordinator of Literature Services.

You’ll be working as part of our development team which includes Java and Database developers. You will be specifically responsible for developing and maintaining test suites for the web UI (for desktop and mobile browsers), the SOAP/RESTful Web Services and the backend loading and indexing pipelines. You will also be required to write test cases for manual testing.

Our team codes in HTML, JavaScript, CSS and Java. We use the Wicket, Spring and Hibernate frameworks and the Tomcat Servlet container on the front-end and the Web Services. Europe PMC has an Oracle database and we use the Lucene/Solr search technologies. The back-end pipelines are written in Perl and Shell Scripts. We are currently using Selenium and JUnit Tests for developing test suites, JMeter for load testing, Jenkins for Continuous Integration and Git for version control.

This is a new role in the team and you will be required to take the lead on defining our QA criteria and strategy, as well as mentoring other members of the team in good testing practices. You’ll have excellent knowledge of test automation and testing methodologies and you will be familiar with automated test frameworks such as Selenium and JUnit Tests and bug tracking tools such as JIRA. Experience with Databases (Oracle, SQLPlus) would be important. Exposure to shell scripting, regular expressions and Perl would also be desirable. You’ll have demonstrable experience of working on data-driven websites with high usage traffic (Europe PMC has 1 million unique visitors per month).

jobs.title: Java Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
glispa's Ad Tech powers monetization solutions for thousands of publishers. It connects advertisers to their target audiences and shows the most relevant offers to end­users. We build high available, scalable systems from client and campaign management, reporting and automated billing to ad servers, event processing, analytics, data mining and prediction.

Our systems process 100,000s requests per seconds producing terabytes of data every day. Our servers run in an hybrid environment in the cloud and data centers around the world. We are integrated with thousands of partners for real­time bidding, ad serving and reporting. By joining glispa, you will work in small collaborative cross functional teams with an agile workflow. Right from the start you will contribute to one or more components and take on ownership. With frequent deployments you will see your code in production and its impact quickly.


As a Java Big Data Engineer you will be working on our data management platform. You will be part of an high skilled cross functional agile team that is responsible for designing and developing new features in our big data environment. You will work on the core big data infrastructure. Together with our data scientists you will implement cutting edge machine learning algorithms and statistical models.


Key responsibilities



  • Design and develop with latest big data technologies

  • Process and analyze large datasets

  • Endorse a role and responsibilities of an agile team member
