jobs.title: Sales Consultant
jobs.content:
The role.
Sales Consultant

An overview.
We are looking to hire an energetic, enthusiastic and ambitious consultative sales professional to join our fast paced startup. We have built a strong and exciting company culture centered on our vision to connect employers and job seekers (home-based) on a global level through the use of technology and a strong community.

Ideally you are an experienced sales person, who is passionate about technology and startups and have a strong business acumen so that you can connect and relate to our target market (startups, small to medium size business owners or executives).

Your KPI(s).
  • Research and identify prospects within new markets.
  • Execute sustained email and outbound call campaigns targeting key decision makers.
  • Maintain and expand our database of contacts in Active Campaign
  • Achieve a specific number of qualified meetings per week, month, quarter
  • Confirm a specific number of sales per week, month, quarter
  • Develop an acute understanding of our product and service
  • Become a trusted resource among prospects, leads and clients for your knowledge and experience with how to build a global team of remote staff.

A day in the life.
  • Participate in a daily 10 minute huddle with the whole team who may be located in Asia, Africa, North and South America.
  • Review sales pipeline in ActiveCampaign for any new leads received.
  • Reach out to new leads via phone/Skype/Zoom immediately (we live by our âsame day responseâ rule), and pre-screen, then schedule, or immediately conduct Discovery Sessions.
  • Conduct previously booked Discovery Sessions (following our sales process which you will be trained on).
  • Review the status of your current active leads to see where they are in the process.
  • Connect with the recruitment team to see if there are new candidates available to show your active leads. For e.g. are they waiting to see candidates? Do you need to chase up the recruitment team to see how long it will be before you have shortlisted candidates? Are you ready to present the new candidates to your lead?
  • Research prospects in new markets.
  • Work with marketing on new ideas and initiatives to drive qualified leads. This might involve working on a new strategy to drive interest through advertising on social media.
  • The day will always end with you updating your data in a Google sheet to track each dayâs data.

The details.
You will have the following skills, experience, knowledge and abilities:

  • Degree / formal education in business / recruitment / HR / sales / marketing.
  • Minimum of 1+ years of strong cold-calling experience in the tech / internet / startup industry.
  • Target driven.
  • Detail-oriented, focussed on monitoring lead follow-up and sales development.
  • Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, and strong written skills.
  • Proficient with ActiveCampaign and or a similar CRM, sales and marketing platform.
  • Fast learner and excited about change and disruption.
  • Friendly and engaging personality with sound business acumen.
  • Demonstrated excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ambitious and driven to succeed in sales.

To apply: Please apply by completing the online application form here: https://growmyteam.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06ol2

jobs.title: Recruitment Manager
jobs.content:
The role.
Recruitment Manager

An overview.
Your role is to manage and grow our global recruitment team. This includes building an entirely new end to end recruitment process and team.

We are looking for a talented and experienced Recruitment Manager to help our team thrive as we go through a period of dramatic growth. We have built a strong and exciting company culture centered on our vision to connect employers and job seekers (home-based) on a global level through the use of technology and a strong community.

We are looking for someone who is a systems-builder who will own the challenge of setting up processes and building a strong team of recruiters and admin support. You will also be target driven and excellent at keeping your team accountable and on track.

Your KPI(s).
  • Build a global recruitment team.
  • Create an end to end recruitment process.
  • Create a performance management process for the recruitment team.
  • Identify training and development needs of the recruitment team.
  • Number of candidates placed per week, month, quarter (targets set quarterly).
  • Continual improvement of the timeliness of how quickly we can place candidates.

A day in the life.
  • Run a daily 10 minute huddle with the recruitment team who may be located in Asia, Africa, North and South America.
  • Review data in Recruiterbox to see at what stage each opening is at (in terms of number of candidates screened and endorsed, and how long candidates are sitting in each stage).
  • Communicate with the recruitment team via Slack.
  • Some days will also include spending time training the recruitment team on best practice techniques, for e.g how to interview candidates.
  • Managing inbound candidate applicants.

The details.
You will have the following skills, experience, knowledge and abilities:

  • Degree / formal education in HR and Recruitment.
  • Experience using Recruiterbox or other similar type of CRM / Candidate Management system.
  • Understanding and experience using the Topgrading hiring and training methodology.
  • Proven capabilities as a manager and a great developer of talent.
  • Deep knowledge of best practices and recent trends in the recruitment industry.
  • A clear communicator with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands.
  • Track record of implementing Recruitment practices that worked well.
  • A âstartup personâ who is hands-on and can make things happen without a large support staff or constant supervision.
  • A systems builder: thinks about how details and problems will scale and puts repeatable process in place to address them.
  • Exceptional collaboration skills and the ability to successfully partner with members of other cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent follow through, judgment, and common sense; a "make it happen" attitude.
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and maturity.

To apply: Please complete our application form here: https://growmyteam.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06o24

jobs.title: Software/Productivity Engineer
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for talented Software Engineers who are passionate about improving the state of Software Engineering. This role impacts all of our engineering team and will help improve speed of development and quality of product. Responsibilities will include: Identify and develop technologies/tools which can drive improvements in efficiency of our system; recognize potential risk factors on our website; Performance, integration and chaos engineering; provide best practices to the engineering teams. Our software is quickly evolving and used by millions, this role will be dynamic, challenging, and critical to our success.



  • Identify and develop technologies/tools to improve the efficiency of our system.

  • Risk assessment: help determine functionality that have the biggest productivity impact on the site.

  • Performance/Integration/Chaos Engineering.

  • Provide best practices to the engineering teams.


The Person



  • Must have good programming skills with OO (preferred experience with functional programming)

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Working knowledge chaos/performance engineering;

  • Working knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment process

  • BS or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred

  • Experience with building code static analysis tools


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

  • Join our collaborative philosophy by being an active member in the Objective-C/Swift/iOS community

  • Architect and build new features for the Jet iOS app and help with development of our iPad specific app


The Person

  • Experience building or adding to a published native iOS application

  • 2+ years experience building iOS applications

  • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field preferred

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Title: Software Developer

Reports To: Chief Technology Officer

Basic Purpose: Identify, create and implement approved programming and IT related tasks. Provide first level support in resolving mission critical issues and break fixes.

Organizational Scope: This position is responsible for understanding challenges and issues that could be solved with technology and creating solutions for both ProctorU staff and institutional partners. The main area of responsibility is to establish clear lines of communication between ProctorU staff and partners, understand their needs and work to provide a programmatic solution to solve for an issue or create a tool to support an unmet need. Software Engineers also serve front line support to integration partners and have intimate knowledge and experience with the ProctorU API.

Essential Functions:

  • Communicate, comprehend and create an implementation plan to solve for an issue
  • Closely communicate with the CTO, staff and partners to understand and anticipate needs and project requirements
  • Create project milestones, deliverables and timelines for implementation
  • Provides assistance to programmers
  • Completes implementation of development projects/tasks
  • Confirms program operation by conducting test / Quality Control
  • Maintains historical records by documenting progress and revisions
  • Prepares reference and documentation
  • Provides quality assurance for other projects
  • Tests base-cases, and outliers
  • Provides documentation on functions checked
  • Documents methodologies for testing and reproducing errors
  • Provide support and basic functionality training
  • Provide first line level of support for bugs, errors or feature requests from staff

Non-essential Functions:

  • Perform other duties, special projects and other responsibilities as assigned by ProctorU leadership.
  • Maintain good working relationships and open lines of communication with all other departments.

Knowledge & Skills:

Education: BS (computer science or related), or in the process of obtaining. Experience: Minimum two (2) years of experience with programming / software development (professional or otherwise), user interface design, TDD and Ruby on Rails

  • Requires strong eye for detail
  • Requires excellent multi-tasking abilities as all tasks are time-sensitive
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English with customers and employees through all available mediums
  • Ability to be responsive, resourceful and adept at problem-resolution
  • General Programming Skills
  • Analyzing information
  • Problem Solving
  • Software Algorithm Design

Number of Employees Supervised: 0 - 4 people

Travel required: None.

Hours required: Average fifty (50) hours per week. Must be available day, evening, overnight and weekends per business demand.

About ProctorU: ProctorU helps protect the academic integrity of online programs around the world. With an evolving online education environment, institutions are faced with the challenge of maintaining quality, rigorous standards and a consistent experience in online courses and assessments. ProctorU’s digital solutions, including student identity management and exam management, are designed to address the most common challenges to the academic integrity of online programs. Trusted by over 800 institutions and serving students in countries all around the world, ProctorU works to meet institutional and student needs while enhancing the online education experience. The company has four offices in the United States, as well as an international support center in the Philippines, and employs more than 600 people.For more information about ProctorU visit www.proctoru.com or follow them on Twitter or Facebook.

jobs.title: Full-stack developer w/ strong Javascript & LAMP exp.
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: www.tripverse.co

The ideal candidate is an experienced Angular engineer who’s also savvy in Node.js, HTML/CSS, PHP, and the LAMP stack.

Qualities of the Ideal Candidate
  • Lives in the United States or Canada
  • Solid understanding of OOP and MVC Principles.
  • Capabilities in Javascript (Angular, jQuery and Node.js), PHP, LAMP stack, and HTML/CSS.
  • Experience in native iOS and/or Android development a strong plus. 
  • 3~5 years of software engineering experience.
  • 2~5 years of experience with advanced Angular development.
  • Computer Science degree or comparable solid knowledge is a plus. 
  • Ability to work in a team and grow from constructive feedback.
  • Has contributed to at least one Open Source project.

Challenges of the Job
  • You will eventually take over the product's back-end and part of front-end. Essentially a chief architect of the product. 
  • You will be asked to learn constantly. Support will be provided by our team, but you are expected to research solutions on your own.
  • You must be a fast, efficient and high quality worker.
  • You should understand the value of the 80/20 principle as it applies to software development. We should strive to deliver the 80% solution (in 20% of the time) so that we can decide as a team if it’s worth proceeding through viability testing with actual users. 

Benefits of the Job
  • You’ll be able to work from home (although office time is important too - especially to start).
  • Gain experience in a wide range of technologies and programming processes to acquire the competencies needed to be a rock solid software developer.
  • Grow professionally and personally in this role.
  • Be part of the founding team that will change the travel industry for good.

Compensation
  • Competitive rate commensurate with experience. We have secured a future round of funding that's not visible on Angel.co.
  • Equity

To apply: Don't contact us if you are a dev shop. Please include link to your Linkedin profile. Apply here: https://tripverse.hiringthing.com/job/30615/full-stack-developer. Learn more about us here: https://angel.co/tripverse

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
If you can code PHP in your sleep, are giddy about Drupal 8, and refer to real life objects as nodes, we want you to be our next Drupal Developer. With our growing clientele, we are looking to expand the team and find an individual that is passionate about doing awesome work, making clients happy, and launching clean, extensible websites and apps.



As our Drupal Developer, your responsibilities would include:




  • Custom programming and web application development for Drupal

  • Testing, maintenance, and troubleshooting of existing sites

  • Working as part of a team to find solutions to clients' problems



If that sounds like you, then you should have:




  • Proficiency in Drupal, including custom module development, key contributed modules, and core API

  • Proficiency in the maintenance and administration of Drupal modules and sites

  • Knowledge of Drupal development best practices

  • Experience integrating open-source and third-party applications into existing systems

  • A solid understanding of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS

  • Familiarity with source code repository systems such as Git

  • A Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a related field (or combined with related experience)

  • A minimum 2+ years of Drupal hands-on development experience (samples of applications that you have worked on are required)

  • US Citizenship

  • The ability to commute to Washington, DC twice a week



As a Mobomo-er, you should:




  • Be results-oriented, reliable, able to work under pressure

  • Thrive in a fast-paced work environment and enjoy new challenges

  • Have the ability to communicate technical ideas to non-technical audiences

  • Have the ability to both collaborate with team members and to work independently

  • Be excited about existing and cutting edge technologies



If you join us, you'll get to:




  • Work on some of the coolest products in the industry

  • Use our agile and lean principles to ship software early and often

  • Work in our flexible, result-oriented work environment

  • Enjoy our unlimited paid time off policy



About Mobomo

Mobomo is a group of exceptional designers and developers; we love what we do and we are great at doing it. Our focus is on web and mobile development, and we specialize in JavaScript, Angular, Ruby on Rails, and PHP. Our reputation for delivering outstanding applications has won us a long list of clients including Fortune 100 companies, startups, and government agencies, and  non-profits. We're looking for brilliant people to join the ranks of our talented team.

Our reputation for delivering outstanding applications has won us a long list of clients including Fortune 100 companies, startups, and government agencies, and  non-profits. We're looking for brilliant people to join the ranks of our talented team.

jobs.title: Principal Full Stack Rails Engineer/Manager
jobs.content:
About the Role


Product is our primary concern. We hire engineers with great Product instincts because we are also the Product team. Building great software is a collaborative effort, so we work directly with stakeholders in the business. We deliver products & solutions—not features—because we understand how Stitch Fix works and are trusted to focus our time and effort where they are needed most.


We are looking for an experienced principal full-stack engineer who has built or worked heavily on a couple of Rails applications and has some other MVC framework experience. You want to help lead a team to success.


You love talking to your clients & users about what you can build for them. You are interested in how Stitch Fix works as a business, not just in the technology, and you would like a chance to make it work even better.

jobs.title: Back-End C# Developer
jobs.content:
Dynamic Signal is searching for talented back-end engineers to help us build a globally distributed, consumer-facing platform coupled with real-time reporting and analytics tools.  You will solve architectural and algorithmic problems that come with having a fast-growing list of Fortune 500 customers.  This includes exposing data and business logic to front-end developers and building behind-the-scenes services and databases.


What you do:



  • Put things together.  You know how to build business logic in C#.  Your code is manageable, modular, and constantly being tested.  You can integrate systems such as PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, and RabbitMQ.


  • Take things apart.  You rely on solid computer science fundamentals to break down a problem into high performance, scalable, and distributed solutions.


  • Learn how things work.  You’re not afraid of new technologies.  You handle .NET technologies such as LINQ, Entity Framework, and Windows Services.  You quickly pick up third party APIs, particularly OAuth social media APIs from Facebook, Twitter, and others.


  • Play nice.  You collaborate with the product management, front-end, and mobile teams to design and build new features.  You expose APIs for internal use and modern RESTful web services for the public.

jobs.title: UI/UX Engineer I
jobs.content:
GENERAL SUMMARY:


The software development department at Ambry Genetics is looking for a UI/UX developer that is passionate about the field of software development and has some experience with the design and development of engaging user experiences. You should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess strong UI skills, and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. Knowledge of the genetics and/or genetic testing industry a huge plus and a sense of humor is a must.


PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be working with product management and engineering teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. Your stakeholders are mostly internal and need to be able to support them when necessary. You are required to use the ticketing system in place as we follow HIPAA software development guidelines.

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.content:
GENERAL SUMMARY:  


The software development department at Ambry Genetics is looking for a business analyst that is passionate about the field of software development and has some experience with web development. You will be responsible for working closely with our development group to identify, assess and document business requirements and be a general liaison for one or more applications. The technologies we use include Symfony2, jQuery, AngluarJS, ReactJS, MySQL, MongoDB, and Elastic Search.  Knowledge of the genetics and/or genetic testing industry a huge plus and a sense of humor is a must.


PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be working in a team that is handling one or two applications. You will be collaborating with the technical leads and reporting to the project manager or director of the department. You will need to analyze new and existing business processes utilizing metrics and analytics tools, evaluate and interpret end user information requirements, and develop and implement appropriate technical solutions. Your stakeholders are mostly internal and need to be able to support them when necessary. You are required to use the ticketing system in place as we follow HIPPA software development guidelines.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


As part of the Artemis engineering team you’ll help craft simple and — dare we say it? — fun tools that help benefits professionals get value out of their healthcare data. You’ll have a lot of variety in what you work on (from custom data visualization to fluid user interfaces), and you’ll have a lot of autonomy in how you get the job done. Consequently, we expect you to take initiative in planning out how you’ll implement features and proactively consult other team members when you need input.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • Javascript

  • AngularJS

  • d3.js

  • HTML5

  • TypeScript

  • CSS, LESS

  • Bower

  • Gulp


Bonus Points for Experience With...



  • Building web-based enterprise software

  • Healthcare data in general

jobs.title: Back End Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


As part of the Artemis engineering team you’ll help craft simple and — dare we say it? — fun tools that help benefits professionals get value out of their healthcare data. You’ll have a lot of variety in what you work on (from custom data visualization to fluid user interfaces), and you’ll have a lot of autonomy in how you get the job done. Consequently, we expect you to take initiative in planning out how you’ll implement features and proactively consult other team members when you need input.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • Python

  • MySQL or Postgres

  • SQL

  • Test driven development


Bonus Points for Experience With...



  • Data pipeline frameworks, e.g. Airflow & Luigi

  • Building web-based enterprise software

  • Healthcare data in general

jobs.title: Sr. SQL Data Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


Help us build the most robust health data pipeline ever! If you don’t want to be a cog in a machine, you’ll love it here. We need your help in a lot of places:



  • Translating incoming data layouts into clean database tables

  • Working with implementation managers to ensure that the metrics our customers want to analyze are fast

  • Translating classification and summarization logic from our clinical teams into efficient SQL or Python

  • Tuning slow queries to get them up to speed

  • Writing data quality tests and summaries to run as part of our data pipeline


We like to work with people who enjoy owning projects and both the responsibility and the autonomy that comes with that.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • SQL

  • MySQL

  • Data warehousing

  • AWS


Bonus Points for Experience With...



  • Healthcare data (especially claims and eligibility)

  • Python

  • Postgres

  • Building web-based enterprise software

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Infrastructure Manager, the Senior System Administrator (SA) is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware, software and related data center infrastructure. The IT team is responsible for the Development & Production environments which house Linux and Windows servers. The environment consists of physical and virtual servers across two local data centers.


LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY - NO EXCEPTIONS


  • Installs new, or rebuilds existing servers, configuring hardware, operating systems, applications and storage in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements.
  • Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs and backups.
  • Apply OS patches per policy, perform OS upgrades on a regular basis, and upgrade administrative tools and utilities as necessary.
  • Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required.
  • Improve and maintain system standards for installation, configuration, and maintenance procedures.
  • Research, identify and recommend technologies that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale, utilizing automated approaches for system administration tasks where possible.
  • Investigate and troubleshoot service issues.
  • Monitoring and maintenance of data center environments, including rotational on-call.

jobs.title: Sr PHP Developer
jobs.content:
POSITION SUMMARY

We are looking for a senior level PHP developer that excels at problem solving, support related communications as well as implementation using efficient, innovative approaches and solutions. This position is responsible for the support development of existing Xpressdocs applications. Developers work both independently and as part of the development team. The position requires the ability to monitor and keep up to date support tickets as well as following Xpressdocs development process.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide technical and development support on PHP based applications in the Xpressdocs system
  • Troubleshoot PHP application problems and collaborate with QA Testing Manager to coordinate resolution of reported issues with efficiency and accuracy
  • Communicate regularly with Dev Support peers and issue reporters about status and possible solutions on reported application issues with efficiency and accuracy
  • Communicate regularly with Dev Support peers and Director about systemic problems, issue patterns & trends, current challenges, potential solutions, etc
  • Collaborate with Dev team as well as other Xpressdocs teams to understand the vision and requirements of assigned requests and to confirm determined resolution approach
  • Actively participate in unit testing, integration testing and quality assurance testing to produce quality, efficient code that meets the predefined business requirements
  • Assist with documenting functional specifications on Xpressdocs system components

Benefits


  • 401-K program
  • Medical Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Disability Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off program


OTHER

  • Only direct candidates, no third parties or recruiters please
  • To view all Xpressdocs available positions, visit: http://www.xdplatform.com/jobs/


ABOUT Xpressdocs®

Xpressdocs (www.xpressdocs.com) was established in 1998 to help real estate professionals produce high-quality marketing materials in an efficient, economical and timely manner. For our service to the real estate sector, we were named a finalist for the coveted Inman Innovator Award (2007). Over the past decade we have expanded our services to a variety of other industries to become the leading provider of direct marketing solutions for organizations with large agent, dealer and franchise networks.

Xpressdocs powers a web-based platform where users can create and order direct marketing materials, including postcards, flyers, brochures, stationery, promotional products and related services. For our enterprise customers, we create and manage brand-approved marketing templates that enable their networks to access, customize and produce marketing materials at the local level, while maintaining control over their brand. Retail customers enjoy a complete library of materials featuring agency-quality design and professional copywriting for a wide range of industries, which they can easily modify and brand to reflect their unique business offerings. In addition to professional sales, marketing and creative design teams, our facilities boast a robust digital printing operation and full service mail house.

Since our founding Xpressdocs has quickly expanded, providing enterprising team-members a chance to experience a dynamic, high-growth business environment. As pioneers of the web-based on-demand marketing industry, we continue to increase our market prominence. Our approach is simple: superior technological innovation, best-in-class quality, a consultative solutions-oriented sales strategy, amazing customer service and a strong can do attitude. If you share these commitments and want to experience life on the cutting edge of a growing industry, we'd love to talk.

Xpressdocs is an equal opportunity employer; we provide equal opportunity without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, or disability.

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Architect
jobs.content:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical engineer? Are you interested in earning $60,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

Company Description

OnTheGoSystems are the makers of WPML and Toolset. The company began in 2007, today it has 78 dedicated full time staff members from 6 continents, 35 countries, and 69 cities. OnTheGoSystems come from different cultures and operate out of different time zones. This differences inspire them to expand into new markets, and its diversity gives them the courage to take on new challenges. OnTheGoSystems WordPress plugins have been mentioned in media all around the world. Their goal is to make the lives of the WordPress community easier.


OnTheGoSystems is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description

At OnTheGoSystems you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

jobs.title: Chief Software Architect
jobs.content:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. At Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...


What to Expect as a Chief Software Architect at Crossover

At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


The Type of Chief Software Architects Were Looking For

Crossover values a culture of excellence. We need a technical genius who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment and in solving complex problems for customers with high expectations. The position is only a great fit for someone who takes a truly hands-on approach to product development, design and engineering. It's a great opportunity to secure a high impact technical lead role in an expanding global software company that is growing both organically and through acquisition. The opportunity for exposure to new challenges is immense, as the acquisition of several new products and customer bases every year creates extremely interesting learning opportunities for motivated professionals who strive to create value in their work and to personally grow.


Your key responsibilities will be:

  • Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

  • Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

  • Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

  • Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

  • Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customers enterprise/global requirements

  • Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

  • Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

  • Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the advantages and quality of our product and solution, and the technical services you lead to deliver them.

jobs.title: Lisp Software Engineer
jobs.content:
This position offers an excellent opportunity to be involved in development of industry-leading real time expert system and related products. The work involves design and development of new functionality and requires a hands-on product development approach. There is a lot of freedom and choice to develop solutions to interesting problems and build new features.


Role and Responsibilities

Work on product enhancements and bug fixes using JIRA with Agile methodology

Take up prioritized customer issues and resolve them

Break complex problems down into actionable solutions

Identify root cause and come up with an approach to fix the issues

Interact with team members on a regular basis and share any learnings with the team

jobs.title: Java Architect
jobs.content:
Are you one of the top Software Architects in the world? Do you enjoy solving complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? DevFactory provides enterprise software solutions that deliver business results, performance and scalability while dramatically reducing IT spending. DevFactory's patented solutions decrease IT expenditures by reducing hardware and associated maintenance, leveraging open source technology, and accelerating value delivery to business customers.

Job Description

This position will be a member of our fast paced, highly motivated, and diverse team. The position will be software design and development in the area of large scale distributed systems and search capabilities on top of large data sets that will utilize expert knowledge of NoSql, especially SOLR.

jobs.title: C Software Architect
jobs.content:
Ready to make $60,000 USD while working for a global company from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Choose GFI and you’ll be given a leading role in the whole process of one or more of our enterprise class business software products. You will achieve an expert level of technical understanding of our products, and facilitate the supply of source, build, and test services. We expect for you to utilize your extensive experience to continually improve and redefine software development. GFI provides security and networking software for small and medium businesses. At GFI, we are centered on customer success. GFI team members are set apart by our shared passion for using software technologies to ensure our customers’ maximum success and satisfaction.

At GFI, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content: Factual is hiring a Product Designer in Los Angeles, San Francisco

jobs.title: Senior Web Application Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Prospecting team at AdRoll is seeking a Senior Web Application Engineer to develop a new, innovative data product as a part of AdRoll's marketing platform. You will work closely with a small team of engineers, product managers, and data scientists to implement user-facing features for Prospecting and our library of shared UI components. If building scalable, usable, modern UIs is close to your heart, this is your dream job.


In this role, you will collaborate with our Product and UX teams on designing new features and improving existing products based on usage data. Through this cycle of iteration you will learn what makes great products tick and ultimately make life better for our users.


At AdRoll Engineering, we value the freedom and autonomy we give to our employees and encourage everyone to use a multitude of different technologies based on their interests. As a UI engineer, you have an opportunity to share your knowledge and help other engineers build modern web UIs and shared components.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with other engineers and product managers on building web applications, APIs and data visualizations

  • Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt

  • Perform A/B tests, participate in user interviews and analyze usage data to make informed decisions

  • Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger


Qualifications:



  • 3+ years experience building web user interfaces for B2B or B2C products

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript as a language beyond popular frameworks

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals

  • Experience with (or willingness to master) our stack, in order of importance: React, Redux, ES6, SASS, Python, SQL, Docker, and AWS


Bonus Points:



  • Contributions to the open source community

  • Experience building shared components or libraries

  • Experience with internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n)

  • Experience in visual arts, graphic design, usability research or human-computer interaction


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Real Time Bidding
jobs.content:
About the Role:


As a Real Time Systems Engineer you will need to straddle several of AdRoll’s core technologies: our stack includes Python, Erlang, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, HBase, and our own open-sourced solutions.  


Responsibilities:



  • Improving the intelligence of the bidding systems, converting insights from AdRoll’s data science team into robust, scalable code

  • Make key improvements to our core distributed systems infrastructure, powering over 500 thousand individual bid requests per second

  • Be a part of a team working on a high volume, highly available system, critical to the success of the business. Balance performance and modularity in systems where every millisecond counts

  • Roll up your sleeves and dig into every nook and cranny of AdRoll’s codebase


Qualifications:



  • BS or MS in computer science or related field

  • 5+ years in a functional or object-oriented language

  • You do your best work when you have lots of freedom and can take ownership of your projects from concept to finish


Bonus Points:



  • Erlang, Java and Python experience - programming Polygots welcome!

  • Has a genuine interest in Open Source and has personal projects


About Our Tech Stack:



  • Web applications powered by Flask, Pylons, PostgreSQL, Backbone.js, React, SASS and more

  • Soft realtime systems running in Erlang

  • Big-data backend running Hadoop, HBase, Storm and Thrift

  • We rely heavily on AWS -- AdRoll is one of Amazon’s biggest customers!


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Role:


AdRoll Growth is a cross functional team focussed on driving core business metrics by deploying technical assets across the AdRoll sales and marketing funnel. We have latitude in terms of what problems we solve, what tools we use and how we solve those problems. We are data driven and work in six-week experiments. We have Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Intelligence people that collaborate and sit together. A day in the life of AdRoll Growth can include working on our A/B testing infrastructure, implementing a new onboarding tool, helping other teams become more growth orientated, adding a new feature to our product dashboard or writing an MVP to test out a new idea.


You are:



  • Comfortable working across the stack: including Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, JavaScript (React/JQuery/Backbone) and AWS

  • Biased towards action. You ship quality code quickly and don’t let the perfect be the enemy of the good

  • A voracious learner. You’re excited to learn about new tools and methods and you’re not afraid to ask for help

  • Data driven. You look to the data to drive your decisions and build products with measurability in mind

  • Up-to-date on the most cutting edge developer growth tools. You know when to buy versus when to build

  • Empathetic to the customer. You’re passionate about improving the AdRoll experience

  • Love to work collaboratively with a tight-knit team


Requirements:




  • You have experience building web applications in one or more server-side web frameworks and languages (preferably Python)




Bonus Points:



  • Previous experience in a growth team or early stage startup

  • Any experience in marketing, AdTech or UX


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About the opportunity:


At AdRoll, we prefer the sense of perspective that comes from a diverse group of people and a healthy work-life balance. When we aren't busy making AdRoll a fantastic place and product, you'll likely find us tinkering with hardware projects, going on bike rides around the bay, playing some Street Fighter, and spending time with other Rollers.


We are currently seeking Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our teams in retargeting, native ads, big data and data science to implement and develop products and features that will make a big impact for our external customers and internal stakeholders.


If you think AdRoll is the place for you, then apply today to join our engineering community. If there is a team/role that looks to be a match, a member of our technical recruiting team will follow up.


Responsibilities:



  • Write high quality maintainable code

  • Work with product management and fellow engineers to plan features, create specifications, and estimate effort.

  • Help establish technical standards as the product(s) scales up

  • Create high profile customer facing/internal product(s)

  • Develop novel solutions to the test, interface and stability challenges that arise in SOA environments


Requirements:



  • 5+ years experience building production web applications in a corporate or start-up environment.

  • Strong fundamentals: B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

  • Productive in one or more imperative programming languages.

  • Productive in one or more server-side web frameworks and object-oriented languages.

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and system design

  • Experience in modern web application development and frameworks, e.g. ES6, React, Redux, Sass.


Bonus Points:



  • Interest in deployment automation and scalable infrastructure. (AdRoll is a big user of AWS!)

  • Meaningful contributions to the open source community

  • A good sense of design, direction, and humor


Our Stack:


Python, React, AWS, Redux

jobs.title: Billing and Accounting Engineer
jobs.content:
About Our Team:


The AdRoll Billing, Payment, Accounting and Finance Engineering team is a (very) small but resourceful group responsible for a critical part of AdRoll’s platform. Building, expanding, and supporting AdRoll's automated billing system and it's many complementary integrations is a complex task that requires strong reasoning skills, a bit of financial acumen, and editorial disciple that is often lost in software development. In addition to core application responsibilities, we also support our finance department and AdRoll's customers directly through automation, reporting, and the creation of user-facing and employee-facing tools.


Together we will take on exciting and challenging areas like automated billing and payments, currencies and conversion, account keeping, billing specific UIs, aggregated reporting from many data sources, complex integrations with payment providers and financial systems, and billing as a service in a multi-product environment.


Who We're Looking For:


You are delighted by the idea that your code will be part of a critical platform component, used by every single customer, with little to no margin for error. You have some experience in the billing and/or finance domain. Quick test: one or more of the phrases 'gateway', 'deferred revenue', and/or 'general ledger' mean something to you. You may have even designed or implemented payment/invoicing integrations or systems in the past.


In a more general sense, you can design and build scalable, fast, fault tolerant systems that minimize customer impact in case of failures and errors. You can architect and build systems that can process a high volume of transactions while maintaining state. Your experience working with systems gives you insight into building APIs and services which can be easily extended. And you understand the fundamentals and importance of building secure systems which protect sensitive data.


Responsibilities:



  • Help make decisions that influence the future of AdRoll's Billing System

  • Design, implement and maintain software responsible for:

    • Keeping accurate and detailed customer accounts

    • Writing invoices

    • Processing payments and refunds

    • Integrating with international payment providers (Braintree, Adyen) as well as complementary systems like Salesforce and Netsuite

    • Provide reporting and analytics to complementary teams like Finance and BI



  • Work with the finance team to formalize and automate processes and improve AdRoll for customers and employees alike

  • Investigate issues and improvement opportunities in the Billing & Finance domain and pursue them with innovative solutions


Qualifications:



  • Self-directed and resourceful

  • You employ careful design methodologies with an emphasis on simplicity, reliability and legibility

  • You have experience with Python, Ruby or similar dynamic programming language and UNIX-like systems

  • Humble -- happy to work on critical-but-sometimes-invisible systems


Bonus Points:



  • Background in finance or accounting

  • Familiar with GAAP


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Here at Rally we believe in teamwork, communication, trust and not taking ourselves too seriously. We believe in the power of small teams. We believe in supporting personal growth and the importance of nurturing a great culture.


About us:




    Flexible minds: We need to do a lot with a small team, so it's important to use the right tools for the right job and be willing to change down the line if we find a more efficient solution. We also believe in "strong opinions, weakly held," being humble, accepting and giving feedback.




    Self-driven: Developers are given a large amount of autonomy in how they work, who they work with, when they work, and are responsible for a large part of driving project functionality and seeing them through to completion.




    Quality-focused: Quality code helps a small team do more. Increasing communication through code readability decreases the cost of maintenance to ensure we don't work weekends.




    Entrepreneurial: Developers are given complete ownership over their projects from design to implementation, testing, deployment and production maintenance.




    Communicative: We believe in teamwork and sharing the experience through design reviews, code reviews and weekly technology presentations.

jobs.title: DevOps Director
jobs.content:
Rally Health improves health and saves money with our friendly, easy-to-use products that help people improve their diet and fitness, shop for health benefits, and find the best doctor at the right price for their needs.


We do it at scale, with millions of reachable accounts and thousands of concurrent users, figures which are roughly doubling every year. The Operations team drives the systems that power this growth in a stable, secure, and performant way, and we are looking for YOU to join and lead our team, working from our San Francisco office. The team is geographically and organizationally distributed, with nationwide presence and complex reporting relationships. The ideal candidate will have management experience in such an environment.


As a director, you will be responsible for setting a direction for operations, reacting to and anticipating business, technical, and cultural problems and opportunities. We are a high-touch, collaborative organization, and you will be expected be an aggressive steward of the culture, providing room for individuals and teams to take risks and sometimes fail while not compromising the integrity or availability of our systems. "Firm but fair" is sort of corny but that's what you will be. You'll be courageous and strong-willed too, changing the team and technology as it needs to be changed in order to achieve our goals.


Security experience is a must, including defensive design, incident management, and vulnerability management and assessment. Since we manage health-care data, we must comply with HIPAA and related laws, and good decision-making and data-defensive thinking are critical for our team members: you will be expected to articulate and enforce security policies and present them at a senior level inside and outside of Rally Health.


Our technology stack is modern and always changing, but we are thoughtful and deliberate about bringing new technologies; it is important that you are or were hands-on relatively recently, as this is a fast-moving space. You will develop and communicate a technical vision for where our site operations needs to go to meet business needs over a multi-month timeframe. Where we can, we make decisions based on data, and the ideal candidate would know how to use tools such as Librato and Splunk to gather their own data to make design and architectural choices. Experience in creating and managing a technology roadmap in a SaaS environment would be a major advantage for any candidate.


Culture is important to us and we cultivate it carefully. We do not strive for heroism and while we recognize and reward individual accomplishments, we know that ultimately, teams win. Most of our projects are paired work and several of our team members are embedded in development teams. I almost wrote this whole job posting without saying DevOps. Oh well! Yeah, we do that too, whatever it is. 


We offer a competitive compensation package that includes stock options, free health care for individuals (families prorated and highly discounted), daily catered lunches, snacks, and unlimited PTO.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
As part of our growing team, you will be the person that helps us develop and run our automated software testing system. You will also be responsible developing QA procedures, integrating applicable tests into our continuous integration and build pipelines as well as testing of software, low-level hardware components, and high-level robot functionality, and reporting on the quality of the current builds. This role will expose you to all aspects of the software stack and will serve as a launch pad for moving into developing other aspects of the system.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop, document and regularly maintain test plans and their results

  • Maintain test automation that provides reliable and repeatable test results

  • Develop internal QA tools to effectively test the components/application

  • Design, develop, and deploy automated tests in a continuous build environment

  • Go beyond testing web applications and dig down into process handles and network connections

  • Dig into code to help identify the root cause of an issue and help the engineering team develop a solution

  • Perform extensive functionality, integration, regression, interoperability and end-to-end system testing independently or with the team

  • Design and develop scripts to automate regression tests where possible

  • Troubleshoot, analyze, and isolate defects and report them to a bug tracking database (JIRA)

  • Communicate technical concepts/issues clearly to colleagues and review documents for technical content and accuracy

  • Participate in product spec/design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, product designs, schedules, or potential problems regarding testability.

  • Provide feedback and recommendations to developers on software usability and functionality

  • Be involved in automation framework including core libraries development using programming languages such as Python

  • Develop or specify standards, methods, or procedures to determine product quality or release readiness for an enterprise scale software application

jobs.title: Senior Designer-Surgeon
jobs.content: Drumroll is hiring a Senior Designer-Surgeon in Austin, TX 78701

jobs.title: Sofware Architect
jobs.content:
Zype is the video distribution service for OTT

We are dedicated to making it easy for content owners to connect directly with their audiences on every screen.

With Zype, enterprise content owners and brands can own and accelerate all aspects of their video distribution pipeline.

The Zype cloud service provides publishing, monetization, streaming, audience management, and analytics software that is integrated into hundreds of web, mobile, and OTT apps and engaged by million of viewers every month.

Learn more about Zype >> http://www.zype.com/company

Software Architect in New York City

Zype is hiring a Software Architect, an individual contributor role, in our New York City office on West 28th and 7th Avenue. This position will be in our Engineering group, which is responsible for building, improving, and maintaining our multi-tenant cloud based video services.

Requirements:

  • Software design expertise, specifically multi-tenant cloud based services, APIs, and dashboards
  • Over 5 years experience in software development
  • A demonstrable history of shipping production code
  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails expertise (senior level)
  • MongoDB and SQL expertise
  • AWS-based infrastrcture expertise - must have
  • Willingness to work on and deliver a take home project
  • 4 Year Degree in CS or equivalent
  • Advanced Degree preferred
  • Experience with microservice design a plus
  • Experience with Docker and ECS a plus

Responsibilities:

  • Report to Product Manager on day to day sprint and long term roadmap planning
  • Design cloud infrastructure, microservices, databases, applications, and front-ends for cloud video services
  • Lead development efforts for new development projects
  • Provide mentorship and support to junior developers
  • Write specifications and detailed technical designs and documentation before, during, and after projects are build and shipped
  • Work with local and remote development and DevOps teams
  • Communicate with 3rd party vendors and partners and collaborate with their engineering teams on integrations

Learn more about How We Hire >> http://www.zype.com/how-we-hire

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content: We’re looking for a senior web developer with expertise in Ruby to help us turn around a wide variety of client projects. You should be actively engaged and passionate about the technologies you’re using, quick to learn, and excited to collaborate. And you should be inspired by a work environment in which requirements and technologies vary from project to project, driven by a balance of the client’s needs and our expertise and experience.

jobs.title: User Experience Researcher
jobs.content:
Stack Overflow exists to serve developers. Whether we’re helping developers get answers to their questions or find a new job, we build products that make millions of developers’ lives better every day. As a UX researcher, you’ll have a major impact on how we build products by equipping our product teams with insightful, actionable user research.


This is a unique opportunity to be the first-ever dedicated UX researcher at Stack Overflow, and help shape how user research is done at the company. As a member of the design team, you’ll work with all our product managers, designers and developers to iteratively design products that delight our users. You’ll help us execute research, and teach us how to do it better.


We’re looking for someone with experience doing UX research who is excited to help define a new role and evangelize user research within the company. You’ll have an immediate impact by joining existing projects to do research on feature usefulness and usability, and expand into longer-term strategic research as the role of UX research grows in our company. As our first hire you’ll do a bit of everything, but we are specifically focusing on qualitative user research for this role.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Digital Ads
jobs.content:
At Stack Overflow, we are obsessed with serving developers. Whether we’re helping developers get answers to their questions or find a new job, we build products that make millions of developers' lives better every day.  As an Ads Product Manager, you’ll work with our passionate Developer, Design, Marketing, and Ad Sales teams, bridging the gap between the technical and business worlds.  Ads are an important part of our business at Stack Overflow.  Ads initiatives, like any other feature we build, need to be additive to the developers overall experience.  In the past we’ve run contests and developer surveys through our ad platform, but as one off projects.  We want you to productize these kinds of initiatives and come up with new ones to help grow our business and offer new compelling experiences for our community.


You’ll have the opportunity to do a lot at Stack Overflow, and you can expect during the first year:



  • First Month: Get onboarded and brought up to speed on our current roadmap and past experiments.  You’ll spend most of your time learning about our products and customers, and building a rapport with the product, ad sales, design, and marketing teams, as well as starting to sketch out your initial plans.



  • Next 3 Months: Start piecing together the roadmap.  Our Director of Ad Sales will want to introduce you to key customers, you’ll spend time talking to developers in the Stack Overflow community, and you’ll begin implementation of your high priority projects.



  • Next 6 months: You can expect to be be the primary owner of new ad initiatives.  You’ll be involved not just in product development, but in the ongoing relationship with paying customers and the community, and in improving our internal development processes.  


We like to work in public.  Not only does that mean being open with the company about what your team is building, but also bringing in the community as soon as we’re able.  Some examples of big projects/discussions we’ve had with the community recently:



  • We’re standardizing the sidebar width at 300px on all sites

  • Why Stack Overflow Doesn’t Care About Ad Blockers

  • Documentation

  • Developer Story


Skills and Requirements


What you’ll do:



  • Conduct market research to determine needs of clients while balancing the company’s requirements of a positive user experience

  • Create a product roadmap to support Ad Sales goals and strategies

  • Help make build/buy decisions concerning the development of new products, features, and enhancements

  • Define and monitor metrics to determine the effectiveness of new features, and administer split tests to learn whether a change is an improvement

  • Partner with the Director of Ad Sales when building your roadmap, product positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategies

jobs.title: Freelance JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
Smart Design is looking for a Freelance JavaScript Engineer to help supplement our Interaction and Technology team on an exciting client project.  We are seeking an engineer who is passionate about working with design teams and being a part of a fast moving team where you can make a difference, solve a challenging engineering problem and deliver quality code for an MVP. The client project is an interesting challenge in the healthcare space, but some of the deliverables will include heavy data-driven dashboards, so previous fintech experience a plus.


As the primary engineer on this project, you will be responsible for ensuring that we are up to date with the latest technology trends, libraries and best practices. The role will be full-time for approximately 2 months. Some remote flexibility, but must be onsite 3 days a week at our studio, and be available for daily stand-ups even when working remotely.


We are interested in talking with Software Engineers who have experience with the following technologies:  



  • Proficient in either Angular or React is a MUST

  • Ruby on Rails or PHP (preference for Ruby)

  • D3.js

  • LESS or Sass

jobs.title: Front-End Developers
jobs.content:
Exceptionally gifted front-end developers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work closely with our world-class team of chemists, biologists, and computer scientists on developing web and mobile information-management interfaces that are critical to our research efforts.

Successful candidates will design and implement dynamic websites that deliver rich and intuitive user experiences using Javascript, HTML, and CSS.  In addition to UI/UX design, relevant areas of expertise might include WebGL, D3, Python, SQL, Django, Flask, Numpy, and Matplotlib, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement. 

D. E. Shaw Research is pursuing long-term projects aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology using high-performance computation for molecular dynamics simulation. We are developing multiple generations of the Anton special-purpose supercomputer, as well as a variety of simulation tools that run on commodity clusters and GPUs, with the aim of fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.

We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/UID

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

jobs.title: Remote Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Ideally you are better at *something* that the rest of the team. A team is like a jazz band. You always want to be playing with people that are better than you. That applies to us. We want you to be the best at something so you can learn from us and we can learn from you. The only thing we're sure of is that we don't know everything.


As a Rails Devleoper you'll primarily be responsible and be the go-to person for all of our front end application dev. You probably have a good eye for design.


We use Node.js, Rails and Ember.  So we would expect that you'll want to learn that. Willingness to learn, and aptitude to learn are important. I've seen rookies that can learn faster than veterans with a decade of experience. So, we don't have any hard and fast rules about "number of years experience".


We'd like to see some URLs or some kind of portfolio with your application. You'll generally get an e-mail back right away if you take the time to send us an application and include some kind of URL or portfolio.


Bonus points for using remote technologies to get an interview scheduled.

jobs.title: Senior UX/UI Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description

ActivTrak is looking for a senior level UI/UX developer to lead the user interface development in our rapidly growing Dallas-based startup. This is a big move for us, and we require a person with a proven track record of building great web interfaces. You'll be an expert resource on front-end technology, and you'll ensure our UI development can scale with the rest of our company.


Benefits


Why work with us?

  1. Profitable cloud-based SAAS company. Yes, we exist.
  2. Free choice of hardware and gadgets
  3. Flexible work schedules and vacation
  4. The opportunity to work on cool big data project with tens of thousands of users
  5. Tremendous possibilities for growth
  6. Work with cutting edge tools and tech
  7. Competitive Pay and Stock Options
  8. Lots of chances to learn something new

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Network Systems
jobs.content:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER - NETWORK SYSTEMS


Fastly is looking for engineers to create the software responsible for configuring, controlling and coordinating our global network. While we operate within the same constraints imposed by network hardware as our competitors, Fastly distinguishes itself by being a software company first and foremost, and we pride ourselves in having always taken a systems perspective to computer networking.


Whether you work on pushing packet performance at the data plane, defining APIs for interacting with network processes at the control plane, or applying decomposition methods to global traffic management is largely immaterial: if you have built a solid understanding of a problem space and are now ready to drive clean slate solutions, you should talk to us.

jobs.title: TLS Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
TLS SYSTEMS ENGINEER


We’re looking for talented software engineers with experience in communications security to join our team. We’re building exciting products to bring the power of our CDN to the delivery and automation of secure content.

jobs.title: Director of Application Security
jobs.content:
DIRECTOR OF APPLICATION SECURITY


As Director of Application Security at Fastly you will manage and build Fastly’s application security team of security architects and security engineers.


We are looking for a Director of Application Security who has a track record of building a team that isresponsible for all development aspects of securing a large sophisticated system. The Director will drive application security to help protect the biggest online platforms in the world, handling massive amounts of traffic at very low latency, for customers with diverse security requirements.


This is a role with a high impact, friendly security team. In addition to contributing to industry leading security products and services, you’ll make sure our customers benefit from a service built to the highest security standards in the industry. We’re in beautiful downtown San Francisco, but for the right candidate, we’re open to considering a remote position, and we have the team and tools in place to make it work.

jobs.title: Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
SENIOR NETWORK ENGINEER


Fastly is seeking best-in-class Senior Network Engineers who can help us scale and operate one of the fastest growing networks in the world. Ideal candidates have experience with high-density, multi-vendor data center deployments, and are excited by the opportunity to build and operate a complex software-defined network. Members of Fastly's Network Engineering team must possess the ability to autonomously define and complete complex projects, automate routine tasks, manage around failure, and work across many teams for larger initiatives.

jobs.title: INFORMATION RISK AND SECURITY ANALYST
jobs.content:
INFORMATION RISK AND SECURITY ANALYST


Vacancy #: 908353


Salary Range: $60,000-$80,000


Closing Date: 09-05-2016



The Information Security Specialist advises business process owners, functional area representatives, and department directors on the management of information security risks within their respective areas of responsibility. The person in this position assesses and reports on information risk and security issues following established frameworks such as ISO 27002, 31000 and 27005.



The Information Security Specialist develops and maintains information security policies, standards, best practices, and employee awareness content in accordance with university business needs, stakeholder expectations, regulatory and legal requirements, contractual obligations, and applicable industry standards. The person in this position develops and manages projects to achieve specific information security strategies and goals. And finally, the person advises on security incident management and reporting activities.



Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or an Information Security degree or closely related field from an appropriately accredited institution; or Bachelor's degree from an appropriately accredited institution and one year of experience in IT Security or closely related area; or an Associate's degree in Information Systems Security from an appropriately accredited institution and two years of experience in IT Security or closely related area; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred Education and Experience


Experience performing written information security assessments and information risk assessments, and formally reporting assessment results to impacted management areas.



Experience working with established frameworks for information security and information risk management, such as ISO 27002, 31000, and 27005.



Experience developing and delivering employee awareness programs, managing information security projects involving multiple work teams, and leading incident response and reporting processes.



Experience providing information security management and information risk management services in higher education environments.



Special Instructions to Applicants:


This position is subject to the Career Banding Salary Administration Plan. If candidates are not identified at the Journey level, management may consider candidates at a lower competency level. Pay will be commensurate with applicant's competencies as well as budget, equity, and market considerations.

Salary Grade Equivalent: 77 (for reduction-in-force priority purposes only)



Additional Instructions to Applicants:


Applicants must complete a candidate profile or staff application (see "Application Types Accepted" below) online via the PeopleAdmin system. In addition, applicants must submit the documents requested in order to be considered for the position.



Application Types Accepted:


Application (SHRA and CSS only)


Applications must be received in the Department of Human Resources by the closing date of 09-05-2016 to be considered. Please submit an online ECU application for vacancy # 908353 to ECU Human Resources at www.jobs.ecu.edu.



East Carolina University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.



Visit this job posting at https://ecu.peopleadmin.com/applicants/Central?quickFind=82330



PI95017387

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Mobile
jobs.content:
In an Agile environment, you will design and develop new functionality to iRobot's mobile application that controls connected consumer robots.  Although your role will focus on iOS implementation, the ideal candidate will be able to work on both iOS and Android platforms, including cross-platform development in C++.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Due to our growth and continued support of our customers, Autosoft currently has an opening for a Software Developer to join our development team in Western Pennsylvania. This position is able to work remote but is required to be in the office at least one or two days out of the week.


The Software Developer will be responsible for re-modernization, re-engineering, and replacing a legacy application using .NET.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, analyze and develop system requirements, program specifications, and system tests to meet business requirements

  • Develop, test and implement small, medium to large applications

  • Frequently lead large projects, resolve problems of medium to high complexity

  • Provide guidance to those in less senior positions
