jobs.title: QA Automation Engineer
jobs.content: As a QA Engineer, you are responsible for the creation, maintenance and execution of automated test scripts. You will author tests via Selenium and Java, assigned to you by your manager. You will develop tests from scratch as well as convert manual tests prepared by other teams. You will make sure that automated test suites are ready and available for execution on a regular schedule and on demand. You are expected to keep test suites current with new features or functional updates. You can also be assigned to support a functional or performance testing project.

jobs.title: Network Socket/Protocol Programmer
jobs.content: KE2 Therm Solutions, Inc. is experiencing rapid growth due to our innovations in commercial & industrial refrigeration technology.  We are looking for a Network Socket/Protocol Programmer for expansion into industry verticals with our emerging technology which integrates Industrial and Ethernet communications securely.

jobs.title: System Administrator and IT Professional
jobs.content:
We are looking for an IT professional with a diverse set of skills and the ability to respond and adapt to unique requirements. We offer a flexible and supportive work environment with the opportunity to continuously learn and develop as you provide creative technical solutions in support of our engineers and projects.


Kyrus is a small company that works with the big picture in mind, taking on projects with real significance that grow our capacity to tackle even more fascinating development problems.  We've earned a reputation for efficiency, effectiveness, and impact since our founding in 2009.


Communication is paramount in this position, and we are interested in hiring an effective team member who will actively engage with our administrative and engineering teams and work closely with our Director of IT to design and implement systems and solutions.


Responsibilities


System and network administrator in support of engineers, software developers, and administrative staff.


Participate in the design, setup, and maintenance of project-specific IT systems and solutions.


Work as a site lead and team member. Ideal candidates will be comfortable working with a  diverse set of hardware, software, and networking environments. Essential skills include administration and maintenance of VMware ESXi servers, Linux servers, Windows Servers, Active Directory, networking, and Windows, Linux, and OSX client and development systems.


Advantages of Working at Kyrus


The opportunity to work with a small team of highly-skilled individuals dedicated to solving real-world problems.


A small company with a focus on personal productivity and potential, Kyrus respects employees and trusts them to do their jobs. Kyrus provides: flexible hours, work from home when appropriate, flexible vacation and leave, personal training and business travel budgets.


Benefits


Fully paid medical and dental benefits;


Health Savings Account;


Flex savings account (FSA) for health and dependent care;


401k;


Annual training and conference budget;


Life , short-term and long-term disability insurance;


Cell phone and home internet expense reimbursement;


Unlimited paid vacation;


Flexible work schedule;


Ability to work from home when applicable;


Fitness budget.


Additional Requirements


Due to the nature of our work, applicants are required to be a US citizen with an active security clearance, or have no significant impediments to acquiring a security clearance.


Due to the nature of this position, applicants must be able to perform heavy lifting: up to 50 pounds. Must be willing and able to perform physical activities including bending, stooping, pushing, standing and kneeling for long periods of time.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence
jobs.content:
When the world throws technology challenges at us, we eat them up. And then we ask for more. Welcome to life on the TMP technology team. Here, you’ll work on our scalable, evolving platform, face tremendous software challenges, and work on projects for Fortune 100 clients. You'll be part of a fiercely collaborative technology team charged with creating digital solutions that are transforming the way employers and job seekers connect. That means contributing to high-traffic websites for a broad range of high-profile companies. Developing next-generation applications and products for some of the most recognized brands in the world. And actively supporting our diverse suite of best-in-class technologies. All this in an environment that constantly challenges you to push beyond boundaries and enhance your expertise—with the support of a global team of industry experts. Sound like a fit for your talent and passion? Read on.


The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer’s role is to design and implement BI software and systems. This includes requirements gathering, analysis, planning, selection, blueprinting, designing, developing, rolling out, and end-user training of BI solutions to the user community. The Business Intelligence Developer is also responsible for timely data availability and system up-time through support functions and in-depth testing.


Responsibilities:



  • Gathers requirements, analyzes, creates design documents, and performs impact analysis.

  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.

  • Continuously evaluate industry trends for opportunities to utilize new technologies and data sources for BI improvement and prepare strategies to implement these enhancements in the BI environment.

  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.

  •  Develops Extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) processes to acquire and load data from internal and external sources.

  • Develop, enhance and maintain the metadata layers, reports, report definitions and dashboards.

  • Produce guidelines and standards for ETL usage, manageability and maintainability within the organization.

  • Build database models, dashboards, reports, interfaces for BI packages.

  • Assist users with problems and resolves issues independently.

  • Creates test plans, test cases, test scripts and performs testing of the BI and related environments.

  • Promote BI benefits to the organization and usage of our tools to relevant business groups.

  • Plan and organize tasks, reports progress to manager.


To learn more about TMP Software Development and what we are working on- check out these links:


https://www.tmp.com/tmp-technology-jobs


Stack Overflow page: https://careers.stackoverflow.com/company/tmp-worldwide

jobs.title: Senior Strategy Consultant, Professional Services
jobs.content:
Build software. Reach 500 million users. Change lives. That’s what we’re doing at Lithium. And you can do it, too. If you want to put your stamp on the digital customer space and enjoy yourself along the way, come join the team. We’re looking for seriously passionate, fun, collaborative & innovative thinkers to help us change the world.

We are interested in connecting with future talent for this role, it is not an open position immediately. 

 

Senior Strategy Consultant, Professional Services

We are looking for an experienced entrepreneurial lead to work with our customers to define and execute large scale, integrated social marketing and social support programs utilizing the Lithium Social Customer Suite.

 

You will work collaboratively with Lithium management and account teams leading social strategy engagements for our top prospects and customers. The ideal candidate is high-energy and intellectually curious, with a keen interest in social media’s impact on society, culture and business. You will have a background developing holistic strategic plans, but also have experience at the tactical level defining, building and overseeing ongoing customer programs. Excellent computing and communications skills, and the ability to thrive in a team environment are a must.

 

Responsibilities

 

As Lithium’s social strategy expert, you will:

 

  • Build strong executive relationships with your customers and work closely with the Lithium management and sales teams to ensure strategy and delivery stay on target
  • Work with customers and prospects to define and execute social strategy initiatives that leverage Lithium products and services
  • Deliver consulting services that bridge the gap between social strategy and program execution - readiness assessments, data insights, social strategy definition, initiative planning, solution mapping, and program governance
  • Work with Lithium’s product and services teams to develop holistic and integrated thought leadership programs around the Social Marketing and Social Support disciplines
  • Develop new strategic business solutions and models utilizing customer and Lithium proprietary data

 

Requirements

  • University degree
  • 5+ years of work experience in a management consulting or digital agency capacity
  • Extensive experience developing and managing strategic marketing and interactive business programs for large enterprise clients
  • 2+ years of work experience as a manager with direct reports
  • Deep, demonstrated track record and expertise in one of the following domains:
    • Social Media / online Communities
    • Digital media
    • ecommerce
    • eSupport
    • CRM / Social CRM
  • Thorough understanding and firsthand experience managing initiatives involving the broader social media technology landscape (Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, G+) as well as concepts relevant to actors in the social space (share of voice, tone of voice, etc.). Personal, hands-on experience managing or facilitating online communities or social response a plus.
  • High degree of industry expertise. Follows new and emerging trends. Ability to conduct and/or lead research in new areas adjacent to own area of knowledge
  • Demonstrated C-level stakeholder management skills and ability to clearly, concisely convey messages, solutions, conceptual visions and recommendations in a compelling way while respecting the complexity of the receiving organization
  • Excellent communication skills and experience in public speaking
  • Unstructured problem solving skills. Ability to create a solution to a business problem based on unstructured data, research (stakeholder interviews, industry expertise and best practices, technology)
  • Strong command of the English language and other European languages desirable.
  • Awareness of personal limits, not afraid of asking for other people's expertise, while retaining ownership of the problem at hand
  • Willingness to travel (30%)

 

About Lithium

Lithium's software helps companies reinvent how they connect with their customers. We work with more than 300 of the world's best brands— including AT&T, Best Buy, Indosat, Sephora, Skype and Telstra — to respond on social networks and to build trusted content on a community they own. Now with Klout, Lithium reaches more than 500 million consumers across 10,000 specific interest areas to establish trust and reputation. Together, we represent one of the biggest collections of data on consumer attitudes, preferences and digital activities. Our 100% SaaS-based Lithium Social Customer Experience™ platform enables brands to build and engage vibrant customer communities to drive sales, reduce service costs, accelerate innovation and grow brand advocacy. We are experiencing rapid growth and are recognized as a leader by top analyst firms, including Gartner and Forrester. And because our culture is as exciting as our products, we’ve been ranked as one of Glassdoor’s Best Place to Work. Come check us out!

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer 2 (Automation)
jobs.content:
About Lithium

 

Lithium Technologies is an award winning privately held venture-backed company garnering Social CRM Market leadership from both Gartner and Forrester. Lithium builds trusted relationships between the world’s best brands and their customers, helping people get answers and share their experiences. Customers rely on our software platform to help them connect, engage and understand their Total Community.  In a world of extreme expectations Lithium Technologies has allowed our customers like Airbnb, AT&T, Best Buy, Fitbit, Sephora, Skype, Google, GoPro and Virgin Atlantic meet the ever-growing expectations of their customer base by allowing them and drive the conversation through unique vibrant Lithium powered communities.

 

Position Overview

We’re looking for talented individuals who are smart, passionate, and like to improve the quality of software and software development process. If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative workplace, and like to be challenged and inspired and if you like to bring creative and thoughtful solutions to the table, we can accomplish a lot together. 

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Design and develop automated tests on a world class platform for managing online communities
  • Develop performance and regression tests that run in parallel on AWS
  • Work with an awesome team in a fast-paced and collaborative environment

 

 Qualifications

 

  • 4+ years of experience in Quality Assurance 
  • Proficiency with Selenium or other automated testing tools, experience writing Java code
  • Experience working with web and/or mobile technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, XML, HTTP Protocol
  • Strong analytical and investigative problem-solving skills
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills
  • Passion for testing and developing clean, object-oriented code
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field

 

Why you should join our team Lithium offers a great working environment and competitive compensation and benefits package. We're looking for fast-thinking, innovative, passionate team players who enjoy brainstorming new ideas, work with the best and brightest in the social media software industry. Build software. Reach 500 million users. Change lives. That’s what we’re doing at Lithium. And you can do it, too. If you want to put your stamp on the digital customer space and enjoy yourself along the way, come join the team.

 

Lithium we encourage our employees to be real. In keeping with this philosophy, we appreciate diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic information or criminal history.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering Team.  We are a highly motivated, innovative, broad-minded and flexible team that enjoys taking on hard problems of all types.  We seek fast, flexible learners that want to apply their knowledge and experience to complex problems.  You should be adaptable and creative in the face of a highly competitive and changing social networking analysis landscape, and enthusiastic about seeking truth in the face of huge amounts of data.


We are particularly seeking engineers of diverse backgrounds, experience in fields outside of pure software development being valuable to help bring differing perspectives to the table when it comes to solving problems.


We want passionate engineers, those who feel a great deal of pride and ownership in the work that they produce.  We feel that care in testing, documentation and logging and analysis go part and parcel with the development of a complete project.


We want excellent communicators, as our engineers work closely with our product development and design teams to determine the best ways to share our data and analysis with our customers.

jobs.title: High-scale Software Engineering in Go
jobs.content: This job is a fun, high-scale use of Go on Google Cloud Platform for a fast-growing (and well-funded) startup. If you secretly thought that you loved computer science more than everybody else in your classes and wrote code for fun outside of class, then we'd love to talk to you. And you'd probably enjoy working with our engineering team. We combine serious computer science with a scrappy, self-directed engineering culture that will give you plenty of opportunities to demonstrate valor and achieve glory.

jobs.title: PHP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
DomainTools is seeking a junior level PHP Software Engineer to join our team. This position is perfect for someone who loves the challenge of designing and building products for big data. At DomainTools we process and display information about relationships between hundreds of millions of domains, IP addresses, and domain ownership records. As a PHP Software Engineer, you will help develop and improve products that encourage user discovery and experimentation with our large data sets. This is a full-time permanent position in our offices in Seattle (Belltown).


At DomainTools, you will work as part of a small but highly productive team of smart and engaged engineers. Expect to spend much of your time solving complex technical problems around delivering large-scale data and analysis to security researchers. You will work in an environment where productivity is fostered. You will spend very little time in meetings, and you won't be distracted by processes that get in the way of high-quality results.


Perks



  • Work with big data and machine learning that matters. We're not just trying to sell more ads or widgets, we're helping organizations improve their security and protect against cyber attacks and domain hijacking.

  • Whatever hardware and software you need to do your job. Multiple 30 inch monitors - no problem, fully loaded MacBook Pros - no problem. Access to more processing machines than you can shake a stick at - no problem.

  • Free lunches brought in twice a week plus a kitchen stocked with plenty of snacks and beverages.

  • An incredible Italian espresso machine.

  • A cool, open layout workplace that is blocks from Westlake and Whole Foods.

  • A ping pong table (matches held every day during lunch time) and a media/game room.

  • And for the last few years we've taken a paid company ski vacation to Whistler, BC!

jobs.content: Synechron is hiring an UX Designer in Chicago, IL

jobs.title: Embedded Firmware Engineer
jobs.content:
THORLABS is a broad based photonics technologies company offering an extensive array of products ranging from optical and mechanical components to integrated test and measurement systems. Thorlabs’ catalog products are produced in manufacturing centers in the USA, Germany, Sweden, United Kingdom and Japan. Our company has a long-standing customer base with significant growth potential and an excellent reputation for quality, customer service and dependability. It is our mission to supply the photonics market with the tools to ensure the ultimate success of our customers.

THORLABS designs and manufactures over 15,000 scientific products and instruments for the optics and laser research industry. As we continue to grow, we are seeking talented individuals to join our team that have a strong desire to succeed. Ideal candidates will be highly motivated with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. THORLABS Headquarters are located in Sussex County, New Jersey, USA, THORLABS also has facilities in Maryland, Virginia, Texas and Michigan, and is established in 8 other countries. THORLABS is a privately held company established in 1989 which now employs over 1400 people.

Purpose of the Position Thorlabs is seeking an embedded firmware engineer to participate in the development of next generation scientific instruments. We are seeking an insightful, talented, dedicated engineer to contribute to our fast paced and dynamic R&D environment within Thorlabs’ Quantum Electronics Division. The successful candidate will plan, design, develop, and implement real-time firmware for microcontrollers to be used in complex instruments. The candidate is also expected to develop basic software and user interfaces as well as SDKs. Activities include design documentation, prototype verification and debug, test development and transfer to manufacturing. This position requires troubleshooting of complex electronics and system problems, and being committed to customer satisfaction. Preference will be given to candidates with a broad range of interests and skills. Essential Job Functions include the following, but are not limited to:

  • Responsible for generating all necessary embedded firmware and software for product development, product launch, and support. Design and support documentation including, but not limited to: firmware theory of operation, SDK definition, source control and revision tracking, test procedures, and end user’s manuals.
  • Developing and testing next generation embedded software / firmware and electronics for driving and controlling advanced laser imaging products.
  • Interfacing with R&D engineers, test engineers, other design engineers, and production staff to develop robust, producible systems that adhere to regulatory and compliance requirements
  • Support migration of systems from design phase to manufacturing phase
  • Complies with safety regulations and maintains clean and orderly work areas

In addition to the essential functions and duties listed above, all positions are also responsible for:

  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures.
  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behavior in completing job duties and assignments. The Company retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.

Physical Activities: This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.

Qualifications

Experience:

  • Preferred 5+ years’ experience with embedded software / firmware and electronics design for high performance scientific instrumentation. Interest and/or experience in digital feedback controller design, real-time embedded operating systems, simulation and implementation a plus.
  • Significant experience and detailed working knowledge of embedded hardware, such as microprocessor and microcontroller based control and monitoring circuits.
  • Direct experience with writing FW on small CPU's e.g. processors based on the ARM Cortex-M4F such as the STM32 F4
  • Proficient in C/C++ for embedded systems development
  • Proficient in using electronic measuring test tools, designing methods for testing "real time" performance of HW/firmware timing.
  • Experience with developing firmware for real-time I2C, SPI, USB protocols.

Education:

  • MS or BS in electrical engineering, computer engineering or related field with minimum of 5 years of experience.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills:

  • Strong ability to work well in a group atmosphere, and comply with high quality standards
  • Proven expertise in troubleshooting and resolving electronic issues in instruments using oscilloscopes, DVM’s, logic analyzers, and other standard lab test equipment.
  • Exposure to Revision control software preferably Git or Subversion
  • Proficient in KEIL Development Environment
  • Direct experience and ability to read PCB schematics.
  • Exposure to and interfacing with FPGA fabric (experience with system on a chip technology a plus)
  • PID control implementation in Firmware.

Other: NA

Organizational Relationships Direct Reports: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Thorlabs values its diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identify or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer. Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Magento Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Denver, CO
URL: http://branchlabs.com

Magento Developer

We are looking for a remote Magento developer to join our team!

Your Day-to-day
This is a hands-on, remote, contract, Magento programming position (Note: individuals only please. No consulting companies). Most often, you'll be working in Magento, but occasionally Shopify or Wordpress. In addition to experience with Magento, you'll need to be intimately familiar with the underlying technologies—PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, and JS.

Our projects are generally focused around making large, material changes to our clients' sites or designing and developing new sites from the ground up.

We have quite a bit of work booked for the next few months, so an ideal applicant will be ready to hit the ground running. Despite the amount of work we have, I strive to minimize context switching—if you're on a project, you shouldn't expect to be bombarded with unrelated tweaks on other projects here and there.

About BranchLabs
BranchLabs is a rapidly growing eCommerce consultancy based in Denver, CO.

Our reputation is built on delivering results. We take pride in the work we produce. The products we deliver are high quality inside and out, and they help our clients capitalize on real opportunities. We work closely with founders and stakeholders, combining their understanding of their business with our understanding of all things eCommerce. Together, we craft solutions that work for our clients and their customers.

Technical Responsibilities
When you start, this is what you can expect to work on.

  • Full Magento site development
  • Design architecture, then implement features for existing Magento stores
  • Implement designs in CSS/HTML/JS
  • Configure Magento-related middleware services, Redis, Memcached, Varnish, Solr, etc.
  • Integrate with 3rd party APIs

Qualifications
These are the must haves. Basically: be a Magento developer!

  • 3–5+ years of industry experience
  • Hands-on programming experience with Magento
  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, and JS
  • Git experience
  • Understand the web—REST, HTTP verbs, basic HTTP status codes, etc.
  • Command line familiarity

Ideal Qualifications
If you fulfill the above and have experience with a few of the below, definitely get in touch.

  • Hands-on programming experience with Shopify
  • Strong UX/UI chops
  • Opinionated about design—visual and code
  • A portfolio of personal projects (not necessarily code related)

Some Notes on Culture
Here are some of our values. They're always being refined based on what works and what doesn't.

  • We value clear, concise communication.
  • Quality can only be discerned in the context of an objective.
  • Provide context and motivation for each task to empower developers to find better solutions.
  • Automate repeatable processes to free up time for interesting problems.
  • No process for process' sake. No meetings for meetings' sake.
  • Build or use tools to provide predictability and eliminate boring work.
  • Programmer productivity is hugely dependent on a minimally distracting, supportive environment.

To apply: Send a resume and cover letter to graham@branchlabs.com

jobs.title: Senior Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Development Manager, Full Stack Web Development



Autodesk is seeking a highly motivated, experience development manager to join our Autodesk Accounts (Portal Services) platform team.



As an ideal candidate, you’ve managed UI and Server Side development teams developing modern web applications and have demonstrated hands on experience with interactive web applications.  You should have strong knowledge in the current web technologies and are in tune with the industry trends.  You are comfortable in an agile environment and know how to build and guide a highly effective and high performing team. Most of all, you can inspire a team to do great things.  As the ideal candidate:




  • You understand what it takes to develop and deliver highly scalable and highly performant web applications

  • You know how to motivate and inspire your teams to be as effective as possible

  • You can spot and attract amazing talent

  • You have a passion for being a mentor and a teacher

  • You are a leader with vision

  • You have a sense of humor and don’t take yourself too seriously

  • You take risks and can make quick decisions

  • You can maneuver sometimes vague requirements

  • You have a passion for devops, continuous integration and continuous delivery

  • You know how to execute and have demonstrated the ability to incrementally delivery on your team’s vision.



Responsibilities




  • Manage a cross functional team of developers and business systems analysts responsible for delivering features and functionality in Autodesk Accounts

  • Work with your team to help understand requirements, evaluate new features, new architecture and help drive decisions

  • Build collaborative partnerships with software architects, technical leads and key individuals within other functional organizations.

  • Build and foster a high performance culture, mentor team members and provide your team with the tools and motivation to make things happen



Requirements




  • Proven ability to manage and resolve complex and ambiguous issues

  • Experience with key technologies and tools such as Java, Javascript (angular, node), Bootstrap, Ruby, AWS, Jasmine, jQuery

  • Experience with Scrum and agile development processes and methodologies

  • Excellent communication and written skills

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field

  • 5+ years experience

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HealthMEDX is looking for talented, passionate Senior Software Engineers who can come help us build and maintain a leading-edge healthcare software suite. Our Engineers build software that creates a better quality of life for thousands of post-acute care patients. Occasionally, they help Senior Support Representatives when they get stuck on a client issue. Most importantly, they help us continue to set the bar in our industry. 


Under minimal supervision a HealthMEDX Senior Engineer develops, debugs, and tests code for a variety of complex processes in a web-based applications environment.  The Sr. Engineer uses ingenuity and creativity to meet complex challenges. The Sr. Engineer develops technical specifications and serves as technical expert in assigned product areas (Clinical, Census, Financial). They ensure adherence to standards and requirements. They improve knowledge of internal programming languages and tools, extended healthcare industry, and relationship with other software products.  The Sr. Engineer also recommends improvements to cross-functional processes and mentors/trains less experienced engineers.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for experienced developers to join our team. Need to learn Ruby? No problem. Training’s on us. Once you’re on board, you’ll jump into our three-week Ruby on Rails training program.


As a Developer at CoverMyMeds, you create solutions that make our healthcare system work more efficiently and effectively in order to help millions of patients receive their prescription medications every year.  You build products that our partners in healthcare use everyday, and innovate products that don't even exist yet.  You work on small teams with other really smart developers with endless opportunities to take on responsibility, continue learning and mentor others.


Our Tech Stack:


Ruby on Rails, Python, PHP, Backbone.js, SQL-Server, PostgreSQL, Git, Elasticsearch, Capistrano, Redis, Sidekiq, Vagrant, Puppet, Apache, RSpec, Capybara, Cucumber, Watir


 What You'll Do:

  • Design and develop internal support software  for our own awesome coworkers

  • Help our world-class support team solve tough customer issues

  • Contribute to and improve revision control and deployment in our fast-paced, agile environment

jobs.title: Customer Success Crusader
jobs.content:
ConveYour is built by Throwing Boulders, a self-funded software startup based just outside Austin, TX. We have team members also in Bend, OR. Founded in 2009, Throwing Boulders has a solid track record of building B2B SaaS products. 

ConveYour is micro-learning for a society with fruit-fly attention spans! Speakers, thought leaders, and trainers build very engaging challenges and courses. ConveYour has been in development for over three years and is now experiencing strong monthly growth. 

We are looking for someone that understands we are successful only when the customer is successful at accomplishing their related goals through our service. Getting them success with the product will be your ultimate responsibility. 

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Promptly answer customer support requests via email, live chat, and phone.
  • Whenever possible, help customers get in the habit of using the product knowledge base.
  • Help customers with file imports and product setup.
  • Teach customers how to to fish. When necessary, perform screen-share training for customers.
  • Later, identify holes in our self service documentation and fill the holes with well written articles and screencast videos where applicable.

About You

  • You are a focused, sincere listener. That means listening to the customer well enough to read between the lines so you can ask them better questions which leads to better answers and better results.
  • You take fastidious care in recording customer notes, next steps, follow up. No balls are dropped!
  • You are self directed and motivated. You have a great track record with getting important, hard work done without being supervised.
  • You are a voracious learner. It's ok to say âI don't knowâ to a customer but afterwards you go seek out the answers you need to equip yourself for the next customer conversation.

Requirements

  • 1+ years customer support experience in an unsupervised, remote workplace (preferably working for a SaaS business)
  • Fast, reliable internet/computer that can run video editing software, skype, join.me, etc
  • You can work remotely.
  • Very strong English communication skills are needed.
  • Strong empathy and a care for others. Your role will be to make sure we make our customers happy.
  • You are VERY tech-savvy. Weâll train you on our systems and tools, but you should be happy and eager to learn new software, programs, and interfaces.

Bonus

  • HTML and Markdown editing experience
  • Video editing experience
  • Instructional Design Experience

Perks

  • Small team with no drama
  • Results > hours focused
  • Influence all the things
  • 100% remote

To apply: Please apply here : https://conveyour.typeform.com/to/efbNyH

jobs.title: Gravity Forms Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Gravity Forms is the industry leader in online forms and one of the most successful commercial WordPress Plugins ever launched. 

We are a distributed team with headquarters in Virginia Beach, Virginia. Bootstrapped from day one, we're proud to provide WordPress users with the best online form solution available.

As we continue to grow we are looking to add both Full Time and Part Time Support Engineers to our highly skilled team.

Geographic location is non-issue. Relocation is not necessary. Hours are flexible based on geographic location.

Is This You?

  • Great people skills and love helping people solve problems.
  • WordPress savvy and know how to get your hands dirty when it comes to using HTML CSS, JS, PHP, and WordPress hooks/filters.
  • Ability to work independently in a remote environment and interact with the rest of the team via Slack.
  • Fast learner.
  • Fluent in written English.  

What You'll Do

  • Interact with Gravity Forms customers via Help Scout, Twitter and Facebook.
  • Help customers with issues related to Gravity Forms features and functionality.
  • Assist customers with issues that may arise due to plugin conflicts, theme conflicts or server compatibility issues.
  • Provide customers with assistance with minor customization requests that may involve pointing them to the right hook/filters to use, or assisting them with minor CSS enhancements.  Minor customizations only.
  • Collaborate with our development team to fix bugs and our documentation specialist to make sure things are well documented.

Bonus Points

  • Fluent in multiple languages.
  • WordPress Plugin development experience.
  • Gravity Forms implementation and customization experience.

To apply: Email us at jobs@rocketgenius.com and tell us all about you and your experience with WordPress and Gravity Forms.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Who You Are


You are a web development guru. You take pride in your work, writing clean, maintainable code. You also prioritize and build what’s necessary to accomplish the business objectives at hand. You roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to push the company forward. You have strong back-end skills, but are also comfortable with front-end work and can drive a feature from PSD to functional product.


You Have



  • A GitHub account (or portfolio) that rocks

  • Projects that you can point to that you personally (not your team) built

  • 2+ years of Ruby-on-Rails experience

  • 5-10 years of web development experience, ideally some of which is in a startup environment

  • An understanding of web analytics, A/B testing, and agile development methods

  • An outstanding academic background; CS degree preferred


What You'll Do Here


We're looking for a full stack engineer to help us build amazing products.  We've got a full slate of interesting projects and need an exceptional engineer to help us create innovative technology that will change real estate.  You'll be working on mission critical projects, both on our internal tools and on our customer facing products, and will be able to help shape our engineering culture as we grow.


You Want



  • Your work to matter - to be critically important to your team’s success

  • To work on a small team that gets sh*t done but also likes to have fun

  • To receive a competitive equity/comp package

  • To build cool technology that will transform an industry and forever change the way people buy and sell real estate

jobs.title: Full Stack - NodeJS + React
jobs.content:
So we're not Twitter. We get that. We're also not GreenPeace.  We get that as well.  What we are, though, is trying to do our part to better the industry that we know best: Online Video.  And if we do our jobs right then we will become greater then Twitter and (maybe) GreenPeace!


We're creating a break through platform using NodeJS + React that will transform how online video is traded and exchanged globally.  Everything from your favourite music videos to breaking news will be discovered, exchanged and reported on our platform.  


We're just at the beginning of our journey so we need the ground floor crew - people who lean into problems and have great initiative and talent.   People who take calculated risks and push boundaries.  And yes, you've heard this song and dance before, but this is the real deal.  If we can get this right then the sky is the limited.


The ideal you will be:



  • A rockstar in NodeJS and React;

  • Have envious experience in transaction based architecture;

  • Be able to work remotely and as part of a virtual team;

  • Bonus marks if you've worked with online video before (we have!)

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
We have several openings for software engineers available at our downtown Chicago office. You will contribute in a variety of areas including: Multi-tenancy, Cloud Architecture, Distributed Architecture, Real Time Market Data Feeds plus much more. Bring your enthusiasm and problem solving skills, and we will take care of the training you will need in the world of finance.


As a team member, you will be working with an exceptional group of open-minded developers on our flagship product. Our cloud based platform allows us to constantly evaluate and incorporate new technologies and methodologies with plenty of opportunities to add to your skill set. As a part of this team, you will work closely with clients and other financial institutions, giving you a close insight into the financial industry.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are a small team of software engineers passionate about creating fast, lean, and robust Python code. We use Python 3, and broadly employ modern language features/libraries such as generators, decorators, functools, itertools, and collections. We leverage high-performance libraries like Pandas, numpy, and PyTables, and use Flask for microservices and (with Javascript) web UIs. While we do not write much C, we understand Python at the C level. We have spent some time in academia, so we prefer thoughtful, reasoned approaches. We tame large datasets filled with noise and irregularity, and develop reusable approaches to data pipelining, caching, and numerical processing. We habitually test everything we write, and practice continuous integration and continuous deployment. We develop on Linux and deploy, via Ansible and Supervisor, on a fleet of internally managed VMs. We take the time to find optimal designs, and invest in building powerful, general-purpose tools when needed. All of our tools are used in-house, so we benefit from having a small and collegial set of users.

We are the core development team in Investment Management at Research Affiliates, a global leader in innovative indexing and asset allocation strategies. We build the tools that construct hundreds of different portfolios; we create and maintain an expanding network of applications for processing portfolios and financial data, from back-end reporting to front-end comparison and analysis.

We are looking for software engineers who share our interests.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
We are looking for a self-motivated data-driven inbound marketer to drive our organic growth. 

We are a small group of information security professionals who have built a successful online privacy/security service. We are passionate about the right to free speech, privacy, anti-censorship and freedom. You should have some interest and knowledge in these areas to understand our market and target audience. You will report directly to the CEO and be responsible for all marketing initiatives; with a heavy focus on inbound marketing.

Youâll be doing a lot of the following:

+ Brainstorming and researching (remarkable) new content ideas for our site.
+ Managing the editorial process and recruiting suitable subject matter experts as required to create the content.
+Establish relationships with influencers for outreach of content.
+Manage and improve organic SEO through competitor research, keyword research, site architecture etc.
+ Design & implement marketing automation through email, content, and social channels.
+ Investigate new marketing channels (both paid and organic).

You will need to enjoy working independently and have good project management skills. We communicate daily using a chat tool similar to Slack and have weekly video meetings. If youâre looking to grow your digital marketing skills with a fast growing company, please apply asap.

Extra tags: marketing

jobs.title: Senior WPF/Web  Developer Remote
jobs.content:
Looking to work remotely for a company that has been delivering line of business software to exciting industries such as craft beer breweries, food flavorings, and nutraceuticals? Ready to face the challenge of integrating with multiple 3rd party applications such as Microsoft Dynamics, QuickBooks Online, and several warehouse management products?


We are looking for developer who is well versed in C# and WPF. Experience in current web development technologies, such as AngularJS, is a huge plus.


You will be tasked with reviewing the current application, re-engineering key components, and implementing an application framework that allows for data driven menus; plug-in functionality; and user configurable dashboards with data sourcing from both SQL Reporting Services and web services. In addition, you will be actively involved in improving the current application both from a usability perspective and performance. You will have direct input into product direction.


Moving forward, you will play a key role as we move parts if not all the application away from the desktop and into a full web based application.


Specifically:



  • Work remotely with senior development, product management, product sales, and support

  • Present designs and markups for future releases

  • Support current releases and respond to issues reported from sales, implementation, and customers

  • Suggest and implement architectural and usability improvements; see the results first hand based on direct customer feedback

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.content:
About the Position


We are looking for a creative and endlessly inquisitive Data Analyst to join our team. You will be working hand-in-hand with our head of analytics to develop highly optimized predictive models from a large volume of regularly updated data. In addition, you will be a key resource for building out custom analytics to help our work in the political and advocacy spheres.  You will be working in a small but dedicated, detail-oriented team, who put our mission above all things. The Murmuration work environment is friendly, driven, non-corporate but professional.


The Data Analyst will: 



  • Analyze local and state political races to help drive strategic electoral decisions for our partners

  • Create predictive analytics using the latest machine learning algorithms on relatively “big” data (hundreds of features on > 100 million records)

  • Work with other education initiative national staff and partner groups to craft analytic solutions to key problems facing our industry

  • Work closely with our business analysts to draft clear and informative data visualizations

  • Help optimize our analytic work to perform well on large datasets stored in AWS Redshift

  • Never stop asking questions of our data and will always be hunting for the next insight to be gleaned from our data

jobs.title: Database Administrator
jobs.content:
About the Position


We are looking for an experienced, innovative Database Administrator/AWS professional to support a network of Amazon Web Services resources as the backend to our new product. The role calls for expertise in designing scalable database technology and developing robust data strategy. Working with Murmuration’s team of developers and top political strategists, this individual will be responsible for developing the backend data storage for mInsights from design to implementation.


The Database Administrator will: 



  • Design, budget for and provision a large, robust AWS (Redshift, EC2, S3) data ecosystem to centrally hold and process data from partners and other data sources (multiple TBs)



  • Maintain our AWS data warehouse, doing regular quality control checks



  • Establish and implement database security and access control policies



  • Manage a small data team (1-2 people) to handle the intake, matching, and cleaning of frequent updates to the data warehouse from vendors and partners



  • Make recommendations and provide strategic support regarding ways to make data and database operations more efficient and effective across Murmuration



  • Collaborate with the analysis and data teams to understand application requirements and recommend best practices for manipulating data at scale.



  • Coordinate with data vendors to ensure fidelity of data and data ingestion processes

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking an experienced full-stack developer to join our dynamic, highly collaborative team who is passionate about building web applications using the latest technologies. At Columbia University, we develop solutions that bring together and support alumni, and enhance education and research through increased donations and other forms of engagement. The full-stack developer will provide best practices and tools to coordinate between all roles within the team and contributing as an integral part of our development processes. This is a great opportunity if you love discovering solutions to complex problems and being a part of an evolving and exciting environment.


Responsibilities



  • Communicate effectively with diverse clients to understand their business and project goals.

  • Prototype, design and develop applications that are responsive and flexible.

  • Develop front-end and back-end code using JavaScript, HTML5 & CSS3 techniques with a focus on MVC design.

  • Produce interactive solutions that function in cross-browser environments.

  • Produce technical outcomes based on user stories defined for sprint cycles.

  • Participate in the discovery phase of medium to large projects to come up with high level design

  • Troubleshoots business and production issues

  • Translate software requirements into workable and maintainable code


Essential qualifications listed below:



  • Solid understanding of application design and programming.

  • 3-5 years of full stack experience (Node.js, Express.js, Angular.js, jQuery).

  • Experience with relational and document oriented databases (MongoDB & Oracle)

  • Working knowledge of build and automation tools such as grunt, gulp, Jenkins.

  • Proficient with version control systems: Git, GitHub, SVN.

  • Understanding of testing frameworks such as Selenium, Jasmine.

  • Working knowledge of HTML5 & CSS, including SASS & LESS.

  • Experience with UI responsive frameworks such as Bootstrap or Foundation.

  • Proficiency in object-oriented programming and experience applying modern design patterns.

jobs.title: Full-Time Research Software Engineer in Los Angeles, CA
jobs.content:
MISSION STATEMENT


You are at the forefront of pioneering technology at space150. You are passionate about software and hardware development and wish to apply your experience and wisdom to new challenges. Your peers will seek you out for answers to difficult problems, or to check the feasibility of a solution. You will be a core software engineer on projects that push the agency forward through new ways of applying technology.


ACCOUNTABILITIES



  • Stays educated on latest trends and practices across all software engineering disciplines (Web, Mobile, Interaction, Animation, Computer Vision).

  • Functions as a core developer on one or several projects at a time.  Research Software Engineers often own entire code bases for a project, or responsible for large portions of functionality in extremely large projects.

  • Collaborates and reviews code with peers to ensure projects will be maintainable and performant

  • Assists supervisor with development story writing and estimation tasks

  • Configures development and production environments (including on-site installations) for both internal and external use

  • Collaboratively audits and provides feedback for interface designs.  Ensures that designs are appropriate with current development standards and within technical scope of projects

  • Ensures that projects developed achieve a precise alignment with creative design and user experience design specifications

  • Assists in planning or responding to projects and new business opportunities that have a higher degree of technical uncertainty or pioneering aspects


BACKGROUND



  • Degree in computer science, technical education or equivalent work experience

  • 3-5 years of experience in a Senior Software Engineer (or similar) role

  • Demonstrable record of successfully launched products

  • Competency in several core languages for space150


SOFT SKILLS



  • Ability to react positively to fast changes and requests

  • Communicates effectively on project progress and across disciplines of interaction

  • Constant awareness on projects, identifies issues and proposes solutions

  • Capable of leaving their comfort zone to learn a new language, framework or hardware

  • Creates a positive attitude when working with legacy code and/or projects

  • Proactively shares relevant technical and industry information across space150


CONSIDERATIONS



  • Research Software Engineers can work out of our Venice, CA office

  • Some travel is required for on-site installation and support


BE BOLD. APPLY.


You know the drill. Send us an email at careers@space150.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
This developer position is different by design.

We're looking for lifelong learners who are inspired by technology and are looking to really push the boundaries of what is possible.

Our senior developer will be at the helm of a small team on a variety of projects that range in tech including Gaming, Internet of Things, Virtual Reality / Augmented Reality, Facial recognition, Audio stamping, Robotics, and of course the standard web and mobile applications. You will have a lot of liberty to explore new technologies here. At Brave New World (BNW) everyone has a voice. You will be part of the team we want to hear your input and have you help shape the development and growth of the company.

In terms of skillset, we are looking for someone with the typical full-stack experience in modern backend and frontend web and mobile frameworks, who enjoys innovating with new technologies, and who is passionate about sharing their knowledge.

The successful candidate will be working on a number of different projects both brand new and existing code bases. They will be working in small teams, and from time to time will be required to lead development on their own projects.

Above all, we have to be the right fit for each other; we want you to become an integral part of our family.


About Us

Brave New World is about innovation. We help companies develop new products from strategy to ideation to execution. This is very different from a standard agency. We are not just focused on the how, but also the why and more importantly the why not. Technology is a big part of that conversation. It's not just about what exists today; its also about what can exist and hasnt been created yet. This poses some unique and inspiring challenges. Our team is constantly looking forward, exploring the ever changing landscape of technology to incorporate into what we create.

Were an agile, small to mid-sized company with offices in Halifax and New York that has been around for almost a decade. We have a great team, a great environment and our company cares greatly for its people. You will grow and share in the success of our company.


Benefits


  • Passionate work environment and peers
  • Flexible work hours
  • Very competitive salaries
  • Additional medical coverage (Prescription, Vision, Dental and more)
  • MacBook Pro Work Environment
  • Brave New World is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly support diversity in the workforce

jobs.title: Machine Vision Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're a small machine vision company in Denver, CO generally focused on industrial markets - Artemis Vision www.artemisvision.com. It's currently a very busy team of 10. We have sales offices in Charlotte, NC, Dallas, TX and Lincoln, NE. We've been in business for 6 years and counting. The business is growing and so we need another engineer to join us. Given the size of the place we all end up doing a lot of different things and you'll be handed a lot of responsibility from day one. You'll discuss solutions with clients directly, and then go about implementing them. All the solutions we build accomplish very real world goals and solve real world problems of parts on production lines.  It's a very tangible job, solving "how it's made" for our customers.  We want somebody who looks to grow a business and deliver great solutions. We want people who are able to fully focus on building the best systems and solutions, yet also pragmatic and flexible enough to work for a small company.

*What we do:

We put in machine vision solutions throughout North America. Solutions are programmed here in Denver and then installed at the client site. We also program and license machine vision software and systems other companies install. We've been working on building a portfolio of standard products.

We're looking for fellow programmers who like machine vision and building systems from the ground up to exacting levels of quality. Because machine vision often moves into industrial automation, we end up communicating with a lot of embedded devices and dealing with some robotics and motion control. Skills with PLCs are a plus as are database skills (Oracle, MS SQL, MariaDB, etc.). We're programmers ourselves so we certainly understand skills in C++ transfer to C# or Java and vice versa. Every project is very different, and we need people who enjoy challenges and seeing if a given industrial puzzle can be solved and then pursuing that solution to a solid and reliable system.

In general most projects are programmed by 1-2 people so there's generally little bureaucracy around interfaces. Typically the system will have 1-4 users at a factory and you'll know them by name so there's no guessing about what the hypothetical "user" wants. Part of the job is discussing it with them and they'll tell you what the system needs to do.

jobs.title: Full Stack Javascript Developers, Your Attention Please!
jobs.content:
Be our web developer extraordinaire, and use your full-stack skills to help us change the world, one jobbatical at a time!


We'd like to tell you this is the best jobbatical in history, but we're a bit biased. Having said that, this is totally the best jobbatical in history. Let us count the ways:



  • The team: A close-knit group of people eager to help you fit in. We love what we're doing, and we also love a good laugh.

  • The role: A fantastic opportunity to build and perfect a platform poised to change the world of work as we know it.

  • The location: Beautiful Tallinn, an innovative and spirited city with an intriguing history and a bright future. You'll never cease to be amazed by the cultural and meteorological quirks of this pint-sized capital.

jobs.content:
As Vice President of Engineering, you will lead our software engineering organization in architecting and building our mobile first consumer facing products ranging from highly responsive and engaging e-commerce web sites to custom mobile applications. You will be responsible for translating the Critical Mix product strategy into best in class application services. Preferred Locations, but will consider remote for the perfect candidate.


Perrysburg, OH - Dallas, TX - San Franciso or LA, CA

jobs.title: Senior Enterprise Document Management Analyst
jobs.content:
Senior Enterprise Document Management Analyst (Job ID 5560)
Analyst/Programmer
IT Business Consulting Services
Full-Time/ $6249 - $8750/month

** NOTE: IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR ANY OF OUR POSTED VACANCIES, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION DIRECTLY THROUGH OUR WEBSITE: WWW.CSUN.EDU/CAREERS. **

CSUN's Commitment to You
CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity. Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining a respectful and inclusive work environment.

About the University
Serving more than 42,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States, and it has an impact to match its size. Money Magazine recently named CSUN one of the top ten values in all of higher education, and the Social Mobility Index ranked CSUN fifth in the nation for elevating its students' economic and social well-being. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI) and an Asian American, Native American, Pacific Islander Serving Institution (AANAPISI) and we value the diversity of all of our students and the campus community. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.

Major Duties
Under the general direction of the Director, Business Consulting Services in Information Technology, the Senior Enterprise Document Management Analyst provides overall leadership, project management, strategic direction, analysis, high level technical support and consultation to stakeholders across the university that utilize the Hyland OnBase Document Management System. The position works with stakeholders to help them transition from paper-based processes to electronic ones; develops workflow enabled forms; provides day to day application administration, maintenance and training; works with the applications development team in Information Technology (IT) to provide development and support for a wide variety of projects that will utilize the OnBase software. Develops and maintains strong working relationships with internal users of the application; understands business processes and opportunities to continue to drive value through the use of the application; actively engages with Hyland to understand new features as they deploy and participate in OnBase User Groups to stay current with best practices. Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field. Five years of full-time, progressively responsible field-related experience, including one year of project management, team leadership, and systems implementation. PeopleSoft development experience desirable. Experience in an enterprise-wide Records Management systems Hyland OnBase System Administration (OCSA), Hyland OnBase Workflow Administration (OCWA); shell scripting language(s), Windows, Perl, Java Script or other scripting languages strongly preferred.

CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity. Serving more than 42,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States, and it has an impact to match its size. Money Magazine recently named CSUN one of the top ten values in all of higher education, and the Social Mobility Index ranked CSUN fifth in the nation for elevating its students' economic and social well-being. Under the general direction of the Director, Data and Analytics (D&A), the Data and Analytics Development Lead provides hands-on design and development of Business Intelligence (BI) / Data Warehouse solutions, including functional end user management satisfaction with the level of technical services provided. The incumbent serves as the technical lead for application development on D&A team; works closely with clients to translate business requirements into technical solutions; manages technical delivery throughout the full cycle of the analytics projects; works with campus business end users to determine functional report requirements; writes technical specifications based on user requirements, and designs; develops, tests and maintains reports and dashboards using the Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) and DataStage / EPM tools; works closely with D&A Senior Data Analyst to design and implement data mappings and integration protocols for PeopleSoft data and DataStage/EPM data warehouse; works closely with the relevant IT units; plans and coordinates technical aspects of release and maintenance of Data and Analytics products; identifies, recommends and promotes utilization of the appropriate reporting tools (e.g.,OBIEE, Tableau); contributes to the development of the analytics strategic plan, setting of goals and priorities based on IT vision and campus initiatives; supervises D&A developer; provides guidance, mentoring, and training to other members of the technical staff as needed; identifies gaps in staff expertise; creates and implements training plans; coordinates workload according to the priorities and subject area expertise; leads the implementation of system enhancements that will directly benefit students, faculty, and staff; prepares or approves detailed specifications for approved modifications; reviews and evaluates testing results for completeness and accuracy; reviews user documentation produced in support of the D&A applications; and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a job-related field. Five years of full-time, progressively responsible Business Intelligence (BI) experience working directly with the business users, preferably with OBIEE analytical tools; which includes one year of project management, team leadership, systems implementation and PeopleSoft development; familiarity with ODI/SIA a plus.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Extensive knowledge of: data warehousing, programming, systems analysis techniques, and systems development principles; and relational database principles; troubleshooting OBIEE issues at the Report, RPD, BI Server and Oracle Database level. Basic OBIEE administration (manages web catalog objects, archive/unarchive, set permissions and ownership, start/stop server, deploy RPD, etc.). Working knowledge of: OBIEE RPD development, including the design and creation of dimensions, hierarchies, and logical data sources, etc.; developing and conducting performance tuning on OBIEE RPD layer (Physical, Business Model mapping and Presentation Layers ); report metadata analysis and modeling, such as OBIEE RPD, for a data warehouse; and performing data validation on enterprise reports. Knowledge of DataStage ETL tool and EPM data warehouse; must possess energy and enthusiasm to lead analytics projects; excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong questioning and listening skills and ability to look beyond obvious answers and understand the impact on other areas is required; out-of-the-box thinking; strong analytical and organizational skills; extensive knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) in operational and data warehouse environments including tuning skills; dimensional data modeling experience; experience in DS/EPM, , SQR, Oracle and Microsoft SQL server environments. Knowledge of higher education practices; exposure to application services lifecycle, including systems design, specification, development, data transformation and migration, unit and integrated testing, implementation and post live applications support. Ability and specialized skills to: code, test, and debug software applications; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; and communicate effectively both orally and in writing; develop and make presentations; conduct meetings; develop and provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
The university offers an excellent benefits package.

jobs.title: Backend/Full-stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Interested in cracking rare genetic diseases through computation? Help us grow our engineering team of two. We're an 18-person startup funded by private investments and public grants, such as a $1.5M NIH Grant for Rare Disease Drug Discovery, and an upcoming multi-million series A.


As engineers, we extract and present biological data efficiently and reliably. Our other team members include biologists, who run cell experiments in a wet lab, and data scientists, who build descriptive models from experimental data.


We're looking for strong back-end engineers, and full-stack engineers. We use Go, JavaScript, and some Python, on a myriad of cloud services from AWS and GCE.


Here are some past and upcoming projects:



  • Distribute computations that extract geometric features from cell images on EC2, every day. Computations are docker-ized, and run on up to 10,000 cores at a time.

  • Web-app to view super-imposed cell segmentation boundaries on raw cell images, with zoom, contrast, and composite functions.

  • Sync terabytes of high-resolution cellular images daily from our high-content microscope to S3.

  • Web-app to view thumbnails across related experiments using the HTML5 Canvas and AngularJS.

  • Color-composite and generate thumbnails of cellular images on AWS Lambda in real-time. We run millions of GB*sec of λ computations monthly.

  • Automatically detect contamination in experiments through image recognition.

  • Develop an in-house laboratory information management system (LIMS) that pulls IoT data from complex biological machines.

  • Build a responsive front-end for the LIMS that biologists can actually use in a lab -- a great UX challenge.

  • Write the cluster infrastructure for our deep-learning experiments.


If you're interested in coding for a meaningful purpose and building distributed systems, web apps and tools for biologists, or just have a knack for back-end coding, let us know -- you don't need a biology background.


We offer competitive compensation and our hiring process is fast.

Professional Growth Opportunities

Vortala was founded in 2004 with a vision to provide healthcare professionals with a world-class website service to grow their practice. Watch this short video (featuring our flagship brand Perfect Patients) to see exactly how our website service works!

Working full-time from your home office, youâll enjoy flexible hours and assume the following responsibilities:
