Intimate knowledge of the Windows APIs and experience using them to develop both web and Windows applications is required.

jobs.title: Front-End Software Developer
jobs.content:
About Viewpost 


We’re a well-funded, unconventional startup poised to revolutionize the way businesses connect, invoice and pay one another. To make it possible, we've created a one-of-a-kind network that makes everyday business simple and fast. Why? Because we believe time is money. So if you value your time, consider devoting it to the excitement, camaraderie and experience of building something the business world has never seen—while also building your career.


Role Description 


Viewpost is seeking an exceptionally talented and motivated Front End Developer with mobile experience. This role will work daily with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React and Angular in order to create responsive applications for both the web and mobile devices.  Our team is flatly structured, so you won’t find any Junior or Senior titles here. We are all developers at various stages in our career, working together to solve a very difficult problem.  All opinions hold equal weight and can contribute towards the way we build our software.


What the Front-End Developer will do:



  • Use JavaScript, HTML and CSS to build out a large-scale, SPA-like web applications

  • Develop responsive applications for mobile devices daily

  • Work with various frameworks and libraries such as React and Angular, along with others, in order to build rich user experiences

  • Contribute to our front-end architecture as it continues to grow and evolve

  • This employee shall maintain or assist in the maintenance of the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all data in physical and/or electronic format

jobs.title: UI/UX Designer
jobs.content: TrackMaven is hiring an UI/UX Designer in San Francisco

jobs.title: Junior Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Cambridge, UK
URL: https://okfn.org/

The Organisation

Open Knowledge International is a worldwide non-profit network of people passionate about openness, using advocacy, technology and training to unlock information and enable people to work with it to create and share knowledge.

The wide range of projects we work on all aim to give people access to data, the knowledge to understand it, and the power to use it in our everyday lives.

The Position

We are looking for a visual designer to work closely with our senior designer to support the wider organisation and project teams. You will work on the production of a range of materials including websites, web applications and printed promotional items.

OKI are a 100% virtual team based all over the world so expereince or strong understanding of what is required working in highly transparent remote teams is a distinct advantage.

We offer flexible working conditions but as role will involve close collaboration with specific teams, it is a requirement that you are based within UTC -1 and +4

Typical activities

  • Producing wireframes / sketches of ideas
  • Producing designs in appropriate formats, including vector, raster and HTML/CSS
  • Communicating with senior team members to receive feedback
  • Supporting the team throughout the execution of projects (for example, with the production of graphical elements).
  • Offering input to team meetings

Required Skills

  • Excellent written and communication skills in English
  • Comfortable with a range of design software packages (ideally including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign)
  • Experience in writing HTML and CSS
  • An attention to detail
  • Enjoy problem solving
  • Motivated to maintain and improve standard of work
  • Willingness to listen to, and act upon feedback
  • Open to new ideas, methods and techniques

Desirable Skills

  • Familiarity with version control, preferably Git
  • Experience with Javascript
  • A background of working as part of a production team
  • Experience working with user stories
  • Experience with CSS preprocessors, such as SASS
  • Understanding of web standards and best practices
  • Experience with open data and/or open source software

Compensation

Competitive based on required skills and experience. Please indicate your expectations when applying.

To apply: If you’d like to apply, please email jobs@okfn.org stating 'Junior designer' in the subject line. Include your CV, a link to your portfolio and a cover letter explaining your reasons for applying.

jobs.title: Mentor | Modern Web Development
jobs.content:
Help mentor the next generation of developers with Thinkful! As a Career Path mentor, you will be working with our most motivated and advanced students as they navigate the ever-changing landscape of web development and prepare to enter the industry. You will take students under your wing and guide them through code reviews, pair-programming, career advice, and industry best practices. Not a front ender? We are always looking for talented and enthusiastic mentors for our Node.js and React courses as well.


Thinkful mentors work remotely and set their own hours. The role is a great fit for experts who genuinely love their work and want to share their expertise, experience, and themselves, with awesome students and fellow mentors from around the globe.

jobs.title: C# Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We (Adashi) are a US company that builds interconnected multi-platform software apps that allow fire, police and ems personnel  to respond to emergencies. We are  looking for highly motivated C# developer to join our core team and perhaps make the world a little safer.


Client applications are developed in C# using WPF. Server applications are written in C#, are database agnostic and support a large number of concurrent clients (both mobile and pc) that keep the entire fleet instantly in sync.


Preferred Experience for all positions:


Ability to understand an end user’s requirements and story, and then work with a team to build a solution that meets the user’s needs.


Nice to have:


Domain knowledge in Public Safety.  Specifically 911 centers, command and control, and mobile data terminals, Computer aided dispatch systems.


Experience in ESRI and other Geospatial technologies.


Database knowledge and experience. 


Experience with WPF and XAML.


Experience implementing UIs using the MVVM pattern.


Appreciation for visual design and its impact on user experience.


Compensation: Competitive full-time salary dependent upon skills/experience plus a great benefits, vacation package and opportunities for advancement.  Offices located in Farmington Hills, MI, and Baltimore, MD

jobs.title: FreeFlyer Software Engineer - Spaceflight Applications
jobs.content:
Join the team building one of the premier tools used to support human and robotic spaceflight! Team members contribute to future and ongoing NASA missions that utilize FreeFlyer.  These missions include the International Space Station (ISS), James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), Orion, and the Asteroid Redirect Mission, as well as Air Force and commercial space missions. a.i. solutions is seeking focused and ambitious individuals who have a passion for spaceflight, technology, writing quality software, and wish to work on skilled software engineering teams. In addition to primary job roles, a.i. solutions provides the opportunity to perform internal research and development, as well as explore new technologies and potential products for application to future missions. We foster a collaborative, casual, and friendly environment. If you have a passion for space, software, and solving challenging real-world problems, we want you on our team.


(For more information on FreeFlyer click here or here, or see our company profile)


Essential Roles & Responsibilities:



  • Design, implement, and test new features and enhancements for FreeFlyer releases

  • Solve complex technical problems and perform trade-off analyses of feasible options

  • Identify and propose innovative solutions to customer challenges

  • Interact directly with customers in technical demonstrations, training, and meetings

  • Research emerging software technologies in support of analysis, operations, and automation

  • Create and update software systems documentation

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Copilot team is seeking a full­stack engineer to help grow and develop a cutting edge content management system.We are looking for someone that has a proven track record of shipping digital products with fast, reliable code. Since we are building an application that can be extended and built out, we are also looking for someone that can pioneer long­ lived patterns and abstractions.


What is Copilot?


Copilot powers the online experiences for brands such as GQ, Epicurious, Vanity Fair, and more to come. It is an Ember.js web application that serves as the editorial tool for creating and publishing content. We plan to continue optimizing and adding features to Copilot to support Conde Nast making editorial breakthroughs in the digital space.

jobs.title: C++ Software Engineers in Silicon Valley and Raleigh
jobs.content:
219 Design helps great companies invent products that change the world. 219ers have improved patient outcomes, changed the way we enjoy sports, and revolutionized data transfer - just to name a few. We achieve better outcomes because we create new solutions by crossing engineering disciplines and challenging assumptions.


At 219, you will develop tangible prototypes and products that get into the hands of real people while maintaining an average 40-hour work week. You will share in the profit and help shape our company. You will continue to develop and learn to be a stronger strategic thinker and inspirational leader through weekly discussion groups, leadership development, informal knowledge sharing via Pizza Fridays, transparent corporate management via Sandwich Monday’s, and formal training. At 219, we see our job as more than just a way to make money – it's how we fulfill an inner drive to solve problems and to express our creativity.


As a C++ software engineer at 219 Design, you will work on a diverse set of projects with a variety of clients. You will be a public face of 219 as you tackle big challenges for products that improve people's lives. We need engineers who are adaptable, display leadership and management qualities, and are passionate about their work. If 219 sounds like a good fit and you are fluent in C++, please apply!


To apply, please fill out our application which should take about 10 minutes. For serious consideration, have your resume and a code sample (C++ preferred) handy for upload.

jobs.title: (Senior) Java Engineer
jobs.content:
What you will be responsible for



  • developing and continuously delivering applications for one of the most successful e-commerce platforms in Europe to enable our growing and successful business 

  • working in a Scrum environment and taking part in alle parts of the software life cycle from concept thru coding to testing and maintaining

  • get fascinated by discovering and solving the digital challenges of delivering a full e-commerce stack: Customer Experience, Payment, Supply Chain & Finance

  • strive for mastery in a challenging agile environment using state-of-the-art technologies

  • be part of a multinational team located in the Munich city center

  • work autonomously surrounded in a pleasant working environment


We strongly believe that this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced developer looking for a new challenge. The opportunity to work within the heart of Munich, within the international e-Commerce scene with opportunities arising all the time. Lastly, a great group of colleagues with a genuine passion and interest into what they do, inside and outside of work.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
The AppLift Engineering team works on a full-stack self-serve demand platform, which includes real-time bidding, social capabilities, as well as advanced campaign management functionalities. We help app developers to intelligently bid on advertising spaces in milliseconds. We run a multi-continent infrastructure that handles billions of requests a day, crunching huge amounts of data.


We are looking for passionate Front End Engineers, who can work in a challenging and dynamic environment. Have a look at our technology section and tech blog.


Your Responsibilities:



  • You analyze, design and implement web (desktop and mobile) based solutions for the AppLift platform.

  • You take ownership over specific components in systems and continuously work to improve them.

  • You produce clean, semantic and mobile-optimized web experiences using JavaScript, HTML5 & CSS3.

  • You are working closely with fellow teammates as well as product management and design team to deliver quality products and solutions on time.

  • You rapidly diagnose and resolve production issues.

  • You are conscientious about performance implications and the overall scalability of your code

  • You are proactive and pay attention to the scalability, performance, availability and usability of our systems

  • You research for new technologies and happy to learn new ones that will improve our products and development flow

  • You work with our designers to create solutions that offer a good user experience


What do we offer:



  • The opportunity to get out of the day-to-day work routine to join AppLift Labs in San Francisco to shape new product initiatives with colleagues from all AppLift offices

  • Stay on top of current industry trends and join tech conferences and meet-ups all around the globe

  • Build products that will change mobile advertising and handle 50 billion requests per day

  • We provide a framework that will help you to constantly improve your coding skills through e-learning, on-the-job training, mentoring, and coaching sessions

  • You can obviously choose your own equipment and the best tools to get the job done

  • Enjoy a competitive salary package and benefit from a tailored career development path

jobs.title: SENIOR FRONT END DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Manama, Bahrain
URL: http://www.artobrand.com

JOB SUMMARY
We are working on the next generation of online experience for a major internationally recognised brand. We are looking for a strong Front End Developer to help steer development of the site across platform for mobile, tablet and desktop. 

You will be working with a stellar team of UX experts, developers, designers and data scientists to create new and exciting applications and experiences. We’re looking for people interested in creating rich web experiences on a massive scale, and doing so in a fast-moving, collaborative environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES
As part part of the team you will be expected to work with a cross functional team to help develop a new online experience and steer the direction of the site’s front-end code.
Write and organise lots of HTML, CSS.
Developing framework for a large site.
Implement features with designers and other developers.
Develop custom features.  
Working in a highly iterative environment and help create an experience that will soar.
Build highly visual and dynamic web pages for a variety of form factors.
Help with development needs by our mobile team.
Writing code with multiple breakpoints that performs well across responsive site and on low bandwidth.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years experience writing HTML, CSS
Ability to write fast, well performing client-side code.
Write clean and well documented code.
3+ years experience with SCSS as well as CSS frameworks such as SASS and LESS.
3+ years experience with HTML frameworks such as Foundation and Bootstrap.
3+ years experience writing JavaScript
Extensive developing features to enhance performance such as lazy-loading images
Strong design focus and history of working with product designers and managers.
Strong experience working with accessibility needs, security.
Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment.
Worked on consumer products in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Dealt with restructuring an existing large, application code base as well as greenfield development. .
Experience working with and developing asynchronous content.
Extensive experience with accessibility needs, security.
Familiarity with JSON and options to update content in regular intervals.
Basic knowledge of and experience working with data stores like SQL, MySQL, etc
Experience working with CMS such as Wordpress and creating templates from scratch.
Extensive experience with accessibility needs, security.
 
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working with PHP.
Experience working with and deploying content to CDNs.
Experience with OO languages
3+ years experience working with Node.js
 
BENEFITS
Rate commensurate to experience.
Opportunity to help shape online experience of an internationally recognised brand and market leader in their field. 

To apply: Jamal@artobrand.com

jobs.title: Crazy Full-Stack Folk for one-time life opportunity in Asia
jobs.content:
SeeChic is looking for full-stack Django developer to build a totally new version of our backend. We are using Magento’s for the moment, but we’ve already reached its limits. Yes, because we are aiming to become the leader in south east asia! (job is based in Singapore, we can work-out a remote work for a time given but not as a long-term solution)


Responsibilities



  • You will report to the CEO and working very closely with me (product manager/django developer/crazy tech visionaire, never take “it’s not possible” for an answer). And yes, this position is a possibility to become a team leader. In SeeChic, we do not give a title to give a title, you have to earn it.

  • Building from scratch the whole infrastructure in collaboration with me : from the product information management system, to the front-end.

  • Nobody will tell you how to do smth, we are looking for an expert willing to learn and find solutions.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Virgin Galactic (VG) www.VirginGalactic.com is seeking a Lead Application Software Engineer to lead the development of flight software. This role is for a hands-on person with great attention to detail and excellent people skills. This is a full-time position at Virgin Galactic’s aerospace facility in Long Beach, California.


Responsibilities:






  • Provide strong technical leadership to a team of Software Engineers in the development of flight software.


  • Own and direct work according to the overall schedule, plans, deliverables, and design reviews.


  • Conduct trade studies on multiple software trade-offs.


  • Responsible for overall system reliability and efficiency.



Basic Qualifications





  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) with 5+ years’ experience.


  • 5+ years of proven leadership in a software development environment.


  • Strong experience in developing critical multi-threaded applications.


  • Solid understanding of data structures and performance optimization techniques.


  • Understanding of boost and standard libraries relating to all multi-threaded processes.


  • Broad systems programming expertise, especially with regards to network programming.


  • Experience with time critical applications and mission critical applications.



Personal Requirements


Virgin Galactic has a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter, and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under commercial pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Rails, React
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Washington, DC
URL: https://govpredict.com

About Us

We are GovPredict, an exponentially growing, Y Combinator-backed startup in Washington, DC. Our software+data product helps companies predict what the US government will do. We work with Fortune 500 publicly-traded companies, Ivy-League universities, and United States House and Senate offices.

Our culture is "build fast and ask questions later." But we value rigor and best-practices too. Our team of powerful engineers is building the software that no government has ever seen before.

Our team of top-tier software developers is in Moldova and Romania and our sales + business development is in the USA. Our primary language is English, but most of our team also speaks Russian and Romanian.

About the Job

As a senior developer at GovPredict, you will be responsible for architecting software, providing technical leadership, writing smart+scalable code, and helping grow our team. You will be a team leader working with data nobody has ever worked with before.

You will work on frontend and backend features. Our product pulls in data from structured APIs or from unstructured sources with our python scrapers. We then manipulate, organize, and display it in never before seen ways to our customers.

Our Stack

  • Ruby on Rails backend
  • ReactJS front end
  • Python scrapers
  • AWS
  • If you’re a strong engineer but haven’t used these technologies, we may still interview you!

Other facts

  • Remote work
  • Full time
  • Competitive pay
  • NOT an agency or outsourcing company -- you will work only on one product

Requirements

  • Strong engineering background
  • 4+ years software development experience or equivalently skilled
  • Comfortable with automated software testing (such as RSpec)
  • Desire to work with Ruby, Javascript, and Python
  • Can take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
  • Ability to mentor and guide fellow team members constructively
  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally in English (other team members speak Russian, Romanian, Spanish, and Portuguese in addition)
  • Eager to learn new things and apply them quickly
  • Willing to work full-time with some overlap on US business hours (8am to 6pm EST)

To apply: Fill out the form here: https://govpredict.typeform.com/to/ae0cXa If you need anything else, email us at: careers@govpredict.com (Do not apply through email!)

jobs.title: Programmer Analyst III
jobs.content:
Information Technology is a life-saving technology at UCLA Health. UCLA is one of the worlds most respected hospitals, and the complex systems and networks we build support patient care, research, medical education, billing, staffing and communication. Our IT needs can be unique, so we frequently develop our own applications. And because everything we do at UCLA Health is to serve the needs of the patient, our IT professionals are engaged in work that ultimately advances human health. We are currently offering telecommuting options for several of our positions.

At the David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA you will part of an internationally recognized leader in education, research and patient care. The medical breakthroughs that occur at this elite institution continue to change the course of medicine, while the students we train will be tomorrow's world leaders in health and science. So consider the unmatched rewards and opportunities of a career with the David Geffen School of Medicine as we work toward greater knowledge and better outcomes in the delivery of patient care.



As the Programmer Analyst III for Pediatrics, you will work with the Director of External Relations, assisting with the creation, maintenance, and administration of the Department(s) Clinical and Research data repositories, SharePoint development, and the project management of software projects. In this role, the Programmer Analyst III will provide lead programmer coordination and supervision for programming activities, ensuring all data repositories remain secure and are meeting HIPAA, Compliance, and Department guidelines.

jobs.name: I Will Teach You To Be Rich

jobs.title: Growth Designer
jobs.company: I Will Teach You To Be Rich
jobs.content:
Headquarters: United States
URL: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/growth-designer/

The Giant Hairy Problem You’ll Be Solving

We've got a pretty big vision for what we want to accomplish. We're building multiple premium brands, have an audience of millions of people, and what to push the quality of our design for every touch point with our users. Our work should set the benchmark for everyone else.

We're building a mission-based team with designers, engineers, and marketers all working together to a make this vision a reality. It's a small, tight-knit team that moves fast and has a lot of autonomy to make an impact. We've got an opening for a designer on this team. That’s where you come in.

You’re not just another body that makes things “pretty”. We need a much larger commitment from you. You’ll be responsible for the UX of the Growth team. For every campaign, app, and test, you’ll push to give our users a world-class experience that delights them at every step. The hard part? We need to delight users while driving measurable growth across the business. You'll find the sweet-spot between giving people an amazing experience while driving measurable growth.

And this is your giant hairy problem. How do we meet the goals of the business while over-delivering on value to our users? You’ll tackle this head-on and find the perfect blend between the two. You’ll push the limits of your design craft to meet the needs of our users and the business.

You’ll Learn More In 3 Months Than You Did All Of Last Year

We’re not here to follow mediocre best practices. We want to deeply understand what drives a business forward. Which variables matter? How do we persuade people to take action? Which levers and projects drive the most value for the business?

We have a simple goal on the Growth team: learn faster than anyone else in the industry. The faster we learn, the faster we grow the company. You'll be in the middle of everything. You'll see how the entire business works and it'll be your ideas that help us make it even more effective. You'll learn exactly how to build a world-class growth machine.

We reach this depth of understanding by operating at an incredibly high tempo. Our iteration and feedback loops happen at a blistering pace. Testing combined with an intense tempo means you’ll learn faster than any of your peers.

You’ll work on projects like:
  • Variants for A/B testing across every step of our funnels.
  • Launching new landing pages for campaigns.
  • Working with our engineers to build light-weight freemium tools for our audience.
  • Improving our student apps to show them the value of living a Rich Life.
  • Building new funnels and signup flows.
  • Other marketing odds and ends (social profiles, PPC ads, email designs, etc).

What We're Looking For:
  • Design skills that drive conversions and actions. This is not a branding team, this is an acquisition team.
  • Can start with just an idea, turn it into a polished design, and handle most of the front-end. We have engineers that can handle the heavy lifting and back-end but the closer you can get your work ready for production, the more projects we'll ship, and the larger your impact will be.
  • This is not an entry-level design position, you'll need to know how to drive projects and hold our team to a high design standard.
  • Growth projects are HIGHLY iterative. Many ideas won’t work. This means you’ll put your heart and soul into projects which will flop on a regular basis. That’s the nature of the work. But you need to be able to tackle the next iteration with as much gusto and passion as you did the first time. The magic doesn’t happen on launch day, it happens in the countless iterations that follow.
  • You should love design but you should love results more.
  • Our team moves at an exceptionally high tempo, you'll be shipping weekly if not daily. You'll need to find that perfect balance between high quality design and getting a project shipped.
  • Comfortable de-scoping to meet deadlines. Short deadlines and a high tempo mean we can't do everything. You'll need to instantly see the most valuable piece of any project, make it as lean as possible, and find a way to get it shipped so we can see if it had any impact.
  • Must be based in the US.
  • This is a 100% remote position, work from anywhere you like.

To apply: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/growth-designer/

jobs.title: Product Developer
jobs.company: I Will Teach You To Be Rich
jobs.content:
The Opportunity
At IWT, we take pride in creating some of the best online programs in the world, from Zero to Launch, to Find Your Dream Job, to Earn1K, and many more. And weâre just getting started. As a Product Developer, you will take ideas and transform them into finished products that make a huge impact on thousands of students around the world. Youâll be working with a world-class product development team and will learn more about human psychology in 3 months than you have in your entire career. Weâll teach you proprietary product development techniques that you wonât learn anywhere else. Most importantly, youâll see first hand how your work helps thousands of people live better, richer lives.

You will own the entire product development lifecycle, from initial research, to content creation, to user experience and seeing it through to product launch. Some of your day to day work will include the following:
Product Ideas
You will collaborate with your product development peers and brainstorm big product ideas to pursue. Youâll be an integral part in deciding which ideas have the potential to impact thousands of students.

Research
Youâll not only be performing market and competitive research, youâll also talk to our students and learn how we dig deep to discover their deepest hopes, fears and dreams.

Scoping & Positioning
Working closely with the team, youâll develop a product vision, define what our product is/is not, and work with designers and marketers to create the product name & logo.

Content Creation
Each product will bear the mark of your creativity and dedication. Youâll own the creation of the program including developing course outline, video scripts, presentations, case studies and customer emails that are read by hundreds of thousands of students.

Product Improvement
We are constantly updating our material to make sure we only deliver the best to our students. You will analyze customer feedback and make corresponding product improvement recommendations.

What We're Looking For
Product Development Experience

  • You are an exceptional copywriter. When it comes to copywriting, youâre second to none. You have a proven track record of taking on the appropriate voice and style to write compelling content, scripts and pitch copy. You understand that this is a very writing-intensive role and you are thrilled about it.
  • You have prior and relevant product development experience and know what it takes to bring a product from concept to market. Youâre no noob to the product development lifecycle. You LOVE digging deep and are passionate about researching your customers. You have an impressive portfolio demonstrating your expertise, understanding of your customers, and products youâve brought to life.
  • You have deep experience, interest and knowledge of IWT material. Preference will be given to those who have signed up for several IWT courses and know them inside and out.
Empathetic, Detail-Oriented and Passionate

  • You are highly empathetic. You understand people inside out and know how to get inside a customerâs head.
  • You are obsessed with getting it right. Youâre known as the perfectionist and are willing to try something 100 different ways just to get it right.
  • You are a great teacher and communicator. Not only are you a master at breaking down complex topics into simple concepts, and communicate them in a way that beginners can understand, but you also do it in a way thatâs 100X more valuable than whatâs already out there.
  • You are passionate about online business. You may even have direct experience in online sales and conversion optimization (huge plus!).
This is a full-time, 100% remote position.
If youâre excited about this, weâd love to talk to you. Use the âApply Nowâ button below to get in touch with us.

To apply: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/product-developer/

jobs.title: Sr Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Komodo Health is focused on building a leading platform for expertly curated big data and analytics in healthcare and life sciences. Our cloud-based data integration platform brings together disparate data from all over the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry, the public domain, and proprietary sources. Through our real-time analytical applications, Komodo Health helps enterprise customers make better decisions that improve patient outcomes. We value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions that wow our customers.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help build out our data infrastructure using the best tools available so that data can truly flow through scalability, reliability and automatically.

This is an opportunity to join a growing team of folks accomplished in diverse Machine Intelligence and Data Engineering disciplines; focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology and data science to address answer complex, real-world problems in the Healthcare and Life Science space. Some of the tools we use are: AWS, Spark, Scala, Python, Postgres, Git, Airflow and Docker.

Responsibilities

  • Build out a large scale distributed data infrastructure using the latest technologies
  • Create pipelines that collect, connect, centralize, and curate data from various internal and external data sources
  • Implement tools that help extract, analyze, and visualize data faster
  • Develop tools to monitor, debug and analyze data pipelines
  • Evaluate new technologies for continuous improvements in Data Engineering
  • Produce high quality production ready code in an agile environment
  • Collaborate closely with the product team to build new features and infrastructure
  • Work with the data scientists to implement forecasting and prediction algorithms and models in the data infrastructure

Benefits


  • Competitive salary and equity compensation
  • Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
  • 401k plan with employer match
  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA) - Health and commuter benefits
  • Your choice of equipment set-up (computer, monitor, and accessories)
  • Flexible hours and unlimited vacation days policy
  • Opportunities to attend industry conferences and events
  • Awesome team and culture
  • Great office location(s) in SF/SOMA and NY/West SoHo
  • and more...

jobs.title: FrontEnd Engineer @ Heal
jobs.content:
As a Senior FrontEnd Software Engineer, you will play a central role in the design and development of the Heal product.


As a fast-growing startup, we look for self-starters who like to take the bull by horns and get stuff done – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.
In this role you work with a small, collaborative team of engineers, product manager, and designers – so excellent interpersonal and communication skills are also a must.
And most importantly – we look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.


You must have a valid work authorization in the United States of America. We will sponsor visa transfers.

jobs.title: DevOps Team Lead
jobs.content:
This is not your typical DevOps Team Lead role; and Altus Analytics, makers of ARGUS Software are not your typical company. Altus Analytics has set the bar high and we are the leaders in technical solutions for the CRE industry on a global scale and we want to stay at the top! At Altus Analytics we support, promote and challenge our team. We are passionate about researching and upgrading our technology and rolling out the best solutions for our clients. Joining Altus Analytics now and working out of their City Centre location in Houston is a smart career move.

We need a DevOps Team Lead who wants to own and drive the next stage. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to take that next step  in their career and who like to manage a small team while staying hands on and technical. Reporting to the Director of Development Operations, our new DevOps Team Lead will be managing not one, but two SaaS applications: Voyanta and Argus on Demand. Our new products are live and running.

Our tech, our stack.

Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand are Amazon Web Services hosted applications. We build our cloud-based applications using multi-tier architectures, for a SaaS environment. We use both .NET framework and Microsoft technologies as well as Linux based technologies combined with Open Source products and Citrix XenApp.

At Altus Analytics, we have some exciting challenges ahead of us. Here’s just a peek at what you’ll be doing as our new DevOps Team Lead, you will:



  • Own the AWS cloud infrastructure for multiple SaaS applications. (There are currently two, with more in development!)

  • Manage, mentor, lead and coach a team of systems engineers.

  • Drive automation of infrastructure activities as we believe in achieving “Infrastructure as Code”

  • Put in processes to ensure high availability, high security and be compliant to ISO 27001 and SOC 2 Type 1

  • Recommend technologies - from cost estimates to timeline projections - to strengthen our infrastructure, increase security and increase availability.


To that end, we need a DevOps Team Lead who is an AWS expert. Someone who always has their finger on the pulse of infrastructure and networking best practices and technologies. Someone with end-to-end applications experience from cloud builds to implementation; from automation to deployment. We need a DevOps Team Lead with hands-on SaaS expertise, cost optimization focus and the communication style to share that knowledge. Someone obsessed with networking, security and process.



Here’s what our new DevOps Team Lead will do:



  • Own it. You will own and manage all the hardware and software needed to run the Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand SaaS solutions in the cloud.

  • Drive it. You will make technology recommendations to strengthen our infrastructure and drive the adoption of those changes, coordinating estimates and timelines.

  • Do it. You will apply your hands-on expertise to making proactive changes, and maintaining highly reliable infrastructure.

  • Mentor. You will actively mentor, guide and manage a team of (currently) two systems engineers, including a remote UK-based employee.

  • Oversee. You will oversee third-party relationships with consultants we may engage for monitoring, certification and auditing.

  • Collaborate. You will work across teams with architects and developers for both SaaS applications.

  • Manage it. You will focus all activities around making the environment highly available and secure.

  • Deploy. You will plan and oversee the deployments of our software to the infrastructure.

  • Apply certifications. You will manage ongoing certifications for the environments such as ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type 1 & 2.

  • Engineer policies and processes. You will determine, define and enforce all policies and processes required to smoothly run Operations with minimal downtime.

  • Automate. You will drive automation to help run “Infrastructure as code”. You will essentially automate anything that can be automated.

  • Be diligent. You will ensure other Operational parts such as backup, disaster recovery, antivirus, IDS etc. are in place.

  • Report it. You will maintain KPIs for availability and other reporting aspects as required.

  • Solve it. You will ensure timely resolutions to production issues, minimizing downtime. You will be the main point of contact for escalation of issues pertaining to SaaS Operations.

  • Meet it. You will ensure your team meets defined and negotiated SLAs.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
Gooee is looking for a FrontEnd Engineer specializing in AngularJS who will contribute to the client side of our platform. Your primary focus will be to implement the front end architecture in the form of a mobile and desktop web app utilizing AngularJS, with a focus on performance. Your main duties will include driving development to create modules and components and coupling them together into a functional web application. A thorough understanding of all of the components of our platform and infrastructure is required.


Responsibilities



  • Delivering a complete AngularJS front end application

  • Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop

  • Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented JavaScript, HTML and CSS

  • Cooperating with the back-end team in the process of building the RESTful API

  • Communicating with and consuming external web services

jobs.title: Scrum Product Owner
jobs.content:
As a member of the Development team, the Scrum Product Owner will use their business savvy and eye for UI/UX design to lead software development projects from concept through completion. The Scrum Product Owner will work with Product Managers and other key stakeholders to gather, refine, and convey requirements to the Development team in order to build the best products possible.


In order to be successful, a candidate must demonstrate an understanding of the market, the customer base, and the business in order to make sound decisions. They must also have exceptional communication skills, be able to work closely with internal and external parties, and be able to communicate appropriate messages about the product at any given time.


Essential Functions



  • Gather ideas and requirements from key stakeholders and refine them into a vision and a set of features for products

  • Create wireframes, define messages, develop and maintain style guides, and specify scenarios to clearly outline what the development team is expected to deliver

  • Develop and maintain the product backlog, ensuring the highest-value features and functions are listed by priority (or are appropriately prioritized)

  • Participate in software release planning

  • Drive multiple products concurrently

  • Develop effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders

  • Maintain a solutions-oriented approach, working quickly to remove obstacles

  • Help the teams to deliver exceptional, timely results

  • Other duties as assigned by management

jobs.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
Position Description


As a member of the Development team, the Software Quality Assurance Analyst is an active member of one or more Agile Scrum development teams. The Software Quality Assurance Analyst will participate in the planning of payment software development cycles to ensure that each planned item is sufficiently defined and testable. During each cycle, the analyst will test items as they are completed to meet Shift4’s quality standards.


A successful candidate for this position will be able to understand software requirements, create test plans and test cases, execute test cases, articulate test results, and objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective. Additionally, the candidate must be able to effectively juggle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.


Essential Functions



  • Identify and test software defects

  • Create effective test plans and test cases

  • Document and execute test cases and articulate test results

  • Validate whether software requirements have been met

  • Objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective

  • Track quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and defect counts

  • Review user feedback to determine how to test items

  • Suggest process improvements

  • Other duties as assigned by management

jobs.name: Rambler On - A YETI Partner Company

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Front end
jobs.company: Rambler On - A YETI Partner Company
jobs.content:
About Rambler On


Rambler On, YETI’s Exclusive Customization Partner for the Rambler line of stainless steel drinkware. We leverage a unique laser marking process to create an attractive and highly durable custom mark on the cup. Rambler On is growing extremely fast and and we have big plans for across the board technology development and integration from e-commerce to our manufacturing floor.


Summary


The Front-end Engineer will be part of an engineering team that will be responsible for all of the development and implementation of Rambler On’s e-commerce and order-management systems. This position requires a high comfort level with front-end development using modern JavaScript frameworks. The Senior Software Engineer will be asked to work on both customer-facing e-commerce applications as well as internally-facing order management tools. This position offers an extremely rare and unique opportunity to join a highly profitable, fast growing business with a fun and agile startup culture.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.company: Rambler On - A YETI Partner Company
jobs.content:
Rambler On, YETI’s Exclusive Customization Partner for the Rambler line of stainless steel drink-ware. We leverage a unique laser marking process to create an attractive and highly durable custom mark on the cup. Rambler On is growing extremely fast and and we have big plans for across the board technology development and integration from e-commerce to our manufacturing floor.


The Senior Software Developer will be part of an engineering team that will be responsible for all of the development and implementation of Rambler On’s manufacturing and production control systems This position requires a strong background in Service Oriented Architecture. The Senior Software Developer will be asked to work on multiple mission critical control applications that will be used everyday on the production line to run our custom built lasers. This position offers an extremely rare and unique opportunity to join a highly profitable, fast growing business with a fun and agile startup culture.


Responsibilities



  • Development of back-end services that support the automation and scheduling of Rambler On’s purpose-built assembly line

  • Design and implement database schema, state-machines, scheduling algorithms and network protocols needs for control and communication with factory machines

  • Unit testing and Functional test of applications before deployment

  • Support deployments and production debugging

  • Work closely with cross-functional team leads in the design and development of new applications


Technology


While this position specifically seeks a Senior Software Developer who will focus on implementing services in C# on Windows, we strongly prefer candidates with a diversity of experience capable of working across a variety of technologies. We are in the early stages of a major technology build-out and the candidate will be able to influence certain key architectural decisions that we must make.


Compensation will be commensurate with experience at going market rates along with a performance bonus plan.


Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes.

jobs.title: Sr. Backend Developer for Big Data VR/MR/AR Project
jobs.content:
WE'RE LOOKING FOR A SEASONED BACKEND APPLICATION DEVELOPER!


Magnopus is an experience company founded by a diverse team of Oscar-winning artists and technicians.  We’re combining storytelling, art, and advanced technologies to create Hollywood-caliber augmented reality, virtual reality, and mixed reality experiences in education, entertainment, and more.  


Job Description


We are working on a cutting-edge VR/MR/AR application which allows people to connect deeper to the world around us in order to feel touched, inspired, educated and entertained. To help get the app into people’s hands we are seeking YOU a skilled backend developer to help us bring the experiences to life. The position is full time and is using the latest technology stack in our downtown Los Angeles office


Responsibilities



  • Spike testing and rapid proofing of concepts around emerging technologies

  • Implement service/business/data layer, cross-cutting components, external service integration, client-side offline capabilities and much more

  • End-to-end development of new features from concept through testing to deployment in a CI environment

  • Contribute to driving the application architecture

  • Writing clean, well documented, design pattern oriented and testable code following SOLID principles

  • Meticulous attention to detail and high quality of work


Core Skills and Requirements



  • Excellent knowledge in designing and developing complex multi-tier software applications

  • Minimum of 3+ years experience with C# and .NET Framework

  • Minimum of 2+ years experience with JavaScript

  • Creation and consuming RESTful web services

  • Well versed in the design and usage of SQL and NOSQL databases including ETL

  • Experience using 3rd party APIs to obtain data from internet sources

  • Good understanding of design patterns



Additional Skills Considered a Plus



  • Experience with NodeJS

  • Experience with big data and machine learning algorithms

  • Working in an agile scrum environment

jobs.title: Senior DBA
jobs.content:
Rockstar San Diego is seeking a Sr. DBA to join our award-winning development team. Your primary role will be architecting and operating the databases that play a vital role in the support of critical platforms and services. You should have prior experience in database operations, design and architecture, administration (monitoring and proactive maintenance, tuning and backup and recovery).

The ideal candidate will have a passion for database engines and developing a deep expertise in database internals and systems integration. The DBA must possess strong ownership qualities and be service oriented. Experience in the game industry is not required, but a passion for gaming is a huge plus.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Installation, architecture, and configuration of MS SQL 2014 & 2016.

  • Proactive and reactive performance tuning.

  • Participation in ongoing SQL development projects.

  • Physical data modelling.

  • Developing SSIS and other ETL solutions to analytical platforms.

  • Issue detection and resolution.

  • Development of automation and scripts to perform proactive maintenance.

  • Participate in 24/7 operations via on call rotation schedule.

  • Backup and recovery.

  • Provide guidance to engineers, architects and additional team members.

  • Strong knowledge of deployments and source control.

  • Documentation skills for processes and procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Six or more years of current administration experience in MS SQL Server.

  • Must possess advanced SQL skills.

  • Proficiency in TSQL.

  • Expertise in storage, servers, operating systems and application interaction.

  • A sense of ownership, initiative and drive.

  • Experience in MongoDB, Hadoop, Vertica or Redis is a big plus.

  • Solid understanding and proficiency in Linux is a big plus.

  • Passion for Rockstar Games is a plus.

jobs.title: Senior Brand Designer
jobs.content: Lumosity is hiring a Senior Brand Designer in San Francisco

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Site Experience
jobs.content:
Software Engineer - Site Experience


The market leader in travel research, is seeking a dynamic, passionate developer for the Site Experience team.  This team is focused on building a rich user interface (UI) and experience (UX)  In addition, the team is responsible for how user content (reviews, photos, videos) is managed and how users efficiently find the information they are looking for (navigation, auto-complete, and site search).  Projects are fast iterated and results are carefully measured, which speaks to the quality of both the engineers and the culture. We are a successful company that moves quickly and takes risks on ideas we believe will yield big wins.



You Have:



  • A sense of ownership and take pride in your role.

  • Experience developing complete Java-based, database-driven applications.

  • Experience developing multi-threaded, object oriented, and high-scale code powering full stack web applications.

  • Extensive experience with JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, UI and UX.

  • Proven success at an Internet startup or early stage company.

  • It would be great if you had in-depth and hands on knowledge of Linux, and related open source technologies such as Apache, Tomcat, Postgres, Memcached and Hadoop. If not, be prepared to learn them all quickly... Very quickly.

  • Strong interpersonal skills, analytical skills, combined with intellectual curiosity, and a desire and ability to "get things done" are essential requirements

  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.


You Will:



  • Design and build tools, services and infrastructure to support the Site Experience Team.

  • Design complex systems and participate in the technical solution of projects

  • Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the website

  • Work closely with our product and teams to define feature specifications.


Do you have a proven track record of delivering high quality results, while thriving in a fast paced environment? If so, please come join us.

jobs.title: Senior Development Manager, Vacation Rentals
jobs.content:
Our client, The Worlds Largest Travel Site is looking for motivated and talented Technical Managers to join their team as they build their next big product.


If you're looking to build something new, are eager to join a team working with trusted payments, social, and mobile, and love being part of a great team that thrives in a fast paced environment - then we'd love to hear from you!


The Technical Manager will be responsible for building and leading a team within Vacation Rentals. You will be leading a wide range of project work, from integrating with vacation rental management platforms, building APIs for third party suppliers to integrate their inventory into our website, working on a PCI compliant payment platform, to delivering rich content and user experience to our travelers researching vacation rentals for their next vacation. In short, your work will encompass the key areas of execution for the Vacation Rentals business.


Can you enable highly iterative agile development by breaking down complex projects into discrete tasks? Are you a leader that can mold bright young developers into seasoned veterans? Are you capable of hands-on development and digging into reports and logs when problems arise along with delegating and prioritizing the work needed across the team? Are you, above all else, passionate about success?


Qualifications:



  • You have a BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • You have at least 6 years of software development experience, with at least 1 year managing a team

  • You show a sense of ownership and pride in your role as a leader, and you can make us believe you'll excel

  • You have consistently exceeded expectations throughout your career, and you can describe specific activities and projects that demonstrate this behavior

  • You can manage a team towards long-term goals while delivering new capability daily

  • You have the ability to work with everyone from engineers to product owners to C-level executives to help communicate, prioritize, influence and inform key product decisions

  • You have successfully hired and built teams including interviewing, on-boarding, and mentoring

  • You find the live operations of your team's code fulfilling and worth getting right

  • It would be great if you had in-depth and hands-on knowledge of Linux, Java, JavaScript and related open source technologies such as Apache, Tomcat, PostgreSQL, and Hadoop

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Web Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: www.apartmenttherapy.com

At Apartment Therapy Media, our mission is to help people make their homes more beautiful, organized and healthy. As a Senior Front-End Web Engineer, you'll join our Product team in shipping software that delivers an excellent experience to our 29+ million monthly readers on Apartment Therapy and Kitchn. We have a wonderful, supportive team and you can read more about our process, culture, and tech stack on our team README.

This position fills a seat in our recently-formed Learning Squad, whose mission is to perform small experiments that directly impact our company goals. As we build our data-driven product strategy, this squad will work with A/B testing, feature toggles, and other tools and processes that will be incorporated into the company's workflow.

Our ideal candidate is excited to step into a new codebase and hit the ground running. With plenty of support, you're comfortable proposing high-level code decisions with solid reasoning to back them up. The fundamentals of the client-side web (JavaScript, CSS, HTML) are second nature and you're hard-wired to consider the long-term maintainability and scalability of your work. You've shipped a variety of projects into a production environment and have a deep understanding of how modern web applications live in the wild.

Leadership is practiced at all levels of the company, and we look to our Senior members to help drive decisions while keeping a holistic view of our projects and processes in mind. We value learning on our mixed-experience team and you'll share knowledge and mentor others through thoughtful code reviews, pair programming, and the example you set.

Our team (and much of the company) works remotely. We all wear many hats and maintain a collaborative and encouraging environment. You may work remotely or in our New York City office, however you must be able to work effectively with a remote team and coworkers. Excellent communication skills and self-direction are critical for success.

Additional "nice to haves":

  • Experience working with a distributed team
  • Experience in data-driven development
  • Familiarity with React and Ruby/Rails
  • Experience in small team (startup/lean/agile) environments
  • Experience mentoring less-experienced engineers
  • Interest in home design, cooking and other lifestyle areas our publications cover
Here's what current Product team members say about the job:

  • "Smart, action-oriented people; everyone always willing to jump in to help; flat team culture"
  • "Working from home is obviously great"
  • "I feel like our priorities stay pretty solid once they're defined and on the roadmap; I've definitely worked places where they shift so much nobody ever knows what's going on — definitely a bad thing about other places"
  • "Diverse team is really cool too — everyone comes from a very interesting background"
  • "Coming into this team I was used to using what was easy. Seems like the whole team here jumps on board with what makes the most and best sense."
  • "We've also hired people who have a 'bias for action.' Like get your hands dirty from day 1 and shine."
To apply, email hr@apartmenttherapy.com. In addition to a cover letter, résumé and links to relevant additional work (portfolios, blog, GitHub profile, Twitter account, etc), please include:

  • something you dislike about your favorite web framework
  • a link to a post from one of our sites you find compelling, stating briefly why
  • any questions you have for us
Extra credit: UBJpyrire!GRYYhfUBJlbhQRPBQRQguvf
US based applicants only. No recruiters or agencies.

To apply: hr@apartmenttherapy.com

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Overview:    


Enthought is a leading provider of python-based data analytics and scientific computing solutions.  Our software products, training solutions and consulting services are used by customers worldwide to accelerate innovation in a broad array of industries.  Our clients include the most recognized names and respected brands in technology, finance, energy, consumer products and more.  Enthought is a highly collaborative, low hierarchy place.  People that thrive at Enthought are passionate about life and work, intellectually curious, dedicated to doing quality of work, friendly and fun.  We value “really smart", "highly productive", and "dedicated” more heavily than any specific skill set or degree.  Based in Austin, Enthought also has offices in Cambridge (England) and Mumbai (India).


Position Overview:


Enthought is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to support our global product development and consulting service teams.  The DevOps role covers a wide range of responsibilities including:



  • Deployment of all web-services:  automation and monitoring

  • Management of the cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure)

  • Process re-engineering on various projects

  • Management of the development and continuous integration of workflows for projects and products on six platforms

  • Oversees IT infrastructure and internal IT support staff

  • Team player attitude and strong communication skills to interact with teams located worldwide


This position is based in our Austin, TX headquarters.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Title: Software Engineer


Location: Portland, OR


Reports to: Sr. Manager, Software Engineering



JOB FUNCTION



The Software Engineer delivers solutions to internal and external customers. This includes the design, modification, development and implementation of software programming applications. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected, as well as an understanding of business needs and requirements.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 



  • Modifies, writes and documents software programming applications. 

  • Consults with clients to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features and input and output requirements.

  • Works with stakeholders to understand problem statements and suggest possible implementations.

  • Demonstrates personal ownership and takes accountability for larger assigned tasks.

  • Designs and codes screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs and interfaces with other systems. 

  • Converts designs and specifications into computer code. 

  • Compiles code into programs and corrects errors detected in compile process. 

  • Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises programs.

  • Consults with client to prototype, refine, test and debug programs to meet needs.

  • Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems or questions about programs.

  • May train end users or technical support staff to use programs.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer II
jobs.content:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer II


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance




JOB FUNCTION



The Quality Assurance Analyst will conduct thorough product testing and maintain agreed upon quality standards in order to provide the highest quality software products to both external and internal customers. The QA Analyst will work to understand the business requirements and objectives relative to the desired functionality of products and applications. Additionally this role will evaluate and test new or modified software to determine that software meets user requirements and established quality standards.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Writes and executes detailed test cases; performs complex manual, integration, and regression tests

  • Documents software issues and enhancement requests and assists development with concise and detailed steps for duplication of the problems found while performing manual functional, integration, and regression tests

  • Verifies resolved Jira issues and maintains accurate status for Jira issues entered and assigned

  • Assists fellow team members and customers with problem reporting and resolution and maintaining appropriate follow-up communications throughout the resolution process

  • Creates master test plans with clearly defined test objectives

  • Contributes towards QA estimation and scheduling process

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Platforms
jobs.content:
With over 50 million users, Runkeeper processes 10s of thousands of requests a second to its backend APIs. These APIs power everything from GPS stats to personalized goal recommendations. We are looking for an experienced software engineer to both optimize our existing backend APIs, and develop new APIs that will power future features in personalized training, social interaction, commerce, and communications.

A great candidate for this role enjoys technical problem solving with a great deal of autonomy and leeway to determine the right course of action, as well as teaching others and engaging with product and business partners to find innovative solutions to user needs. You will get to touch a wide variety of topics from overseeing the design of algorithms for scalable features to assisting with database architecture.

Here's what the role entails:

  • Maintaining critical systems, including purchase path and GPS trip save
  • Identifying areas of technical debt and weigh user impact and level of effort to address
  • Propose and oversee architectural improvements
  • Support the Platforms team in reaching application health goals
  • Document internal APIs and consult with product teams on their usage
  • Mentor other engineers through code reviews and pair programming

Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience building and maintaining APIs
  • Experience with Apache Tomcat, as well as AWS services such as S3 and Cloudfront
  • Experience or strong familiarity with functional programming concepts and Lambda architecture
  • Comfort with multiple languages/programming paradigms (our primary codebase is Java)
  • Ability to clearly communicate technical issues to business leaders
  • Expertise in one or more of the following: automated integration testing, performance testing, system monitoring and incident response, security and privacy

jobs.title: Sr. Java Developer Team Lead
jobs.content:
Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change.

About this Role:

The Senior Java Web Developer, Team Lead role at Forrester provides both technical and people leadership on a variety of projects touching web display, mobile, content management, CRM, and search engine applications. This exceptional candidate must be able to contribute to the analysis of requirements and convert them into high-performing, scalable solutions. You will collaborate with a diverse team of product and business owners to make these designs a reality.

jobs.title: Senior C# Developer / Team Lead
jobs.content:
We are looking for a developer who is passionate about technology and has achieved a high level of technical competence. We respect the fact that it takes time and efforts to achieve technical knowledge, and we reward handsomely for it. If you are a dedicated and energetic individual interested in a long-term career growth, then come and work with us!

We are looking for an experienced Senior C# developer to work for a growing North Dallas-based company with modern offices and fantastic SaaS Software products. Working in a team of 6-8, you will be instrumental in design and development of the Company's exciting brand-new mobile platform using RESTful API and Xamarin. You will help formulate mobile architecture using latest advancement of mobile technology.

jobs.title: Head of Product Design

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
The College of Arts and Sciences at The Ohio State University is looking for two Drupal Web Developers to join our team.



Responsibilities include:




  • Create user-focused websites within the College of Arts and Sciences.

  • Work with graphic designers and project manager and other members of the project team to develop websites in the Drupal Content Management System.

  • Address content management system/module issues and requests.

  • Install content management system modules.

  • Develop themes and views for modules following established coding and security guidelines and procedures.

  • Assist with design for new web page layouts and components; create wireframes, process flow descriptions, and user interface layouts.

  • Work in Acquia Cloud for the hosting and security updates.

  • Write system design specifications, process flow descriptions, user interface layouts, and technical specifications.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: Help take applications to the next level of usability and design.  Create a clean, intuitive user experience with maintainable, extensible code.  Consolidate user experience across different software platforms and devices.

jobs.title: Manager of Mobile App Development, Android- Digital Ventures
jobs.content:
About Starbucks Digital Ventures At Starbucks, digital products are transforming our customers’ experience in incredible ways. With tens of millions of active users, over 25% of transactions (US) done using our mobile apps, and billions of dollars in revenue generated through our digital platform today, the opportunities to innovate at a global scale are huge. Our Digital Ventures organization leads the planning, design, development, and support of our industry-leading mobile, web, and emerging tech products.

Job Summary and Mission The Starbucks Android application is used every day by hundreds of thousands of Starbucks customers, and the Android development team within Starbucks Digital Ventures is growing and innovating fast to deliver the best possible experience to each one of them. We are seeking a full-time Android Application Development Manager to join the team. In this role, you will manage and oversee our Android application development projects to ensure that programs are well-planned and delivered on-time and within budget. You will develop and champion great software engineering practices and processes, be a leader and mentor to your team of talented engineers, and be a model for Starbucks' core guiding principles.

Summary of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

Leadership - Setting development and product goals for the Android engineering team, developing effective workflows, and modeling how the team will work together: Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results Supports the implementation of company programs to ensure the success of the Company.

Technical Guidance - Choosing the processes, platforms, and technologies that enable innovation and quality in our Android products: Develop and champion the development processes, coding style guidelines, and architectural designs necessary to innovate and maintain great product quality Understand and evangelize best practices for development and user experience on the Android platform Plan and manage processes and practices to ensure that development is aligned with company business goals and objectives.

Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities: Understand the business processes, priorities and roadmap. Work closely with our product and design teams to further the Starbucks experience on the Android platform Ensure that the Android mobile projects align with business goals and overall IT infrastructure Assist in guiding the overall technology strategy of the Company Negotiate and manage small-to-medium vendor contracts, ensuring successful resolution of issues.

Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams: Challenges and inspires team members to achieve business results and constant innovation. Conducts and ensure the completion of performance reviews. Ensure partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Oversee training and development of partners and make effective staffing decisions.

Summary of Experience Systems development, mobile application development and integration Experience managing systems or application development projects of all sizes and complexities, including large systems
Systems analysis Leading or managing small technical team(s)

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Ability to handle multiple tasks Ability to provide technical oversight and guidance to partners for projects on the Android platform Strong coding abilities and experience with Java and Android SDK Ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment Strong analytical skills Strong project management skills Ability to act as a business partner in support of business units Ability to build relationships Effective management and supervisory skills, including planning, organizing, developing, and monitoring partner performance

Starbucks is an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

jobs.title: Senior Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Senior Performance Engineers proactively look for ways to improve the overall performance of our software products.


As a member of an Agile/scrum project team, performance engineers participate in the application design, requirements and estimation process.   They create master test plans for performance/load and scalability, record/ execute scripts according to plan and record results.


While doing this they are verifying applications are coded according to the non-functional requirements.


Although duties are performed as part of a scrum team structure, you will work independently in accordance with QA procedures and methodologies to insure quality deliverables.


In this truly collaborative environment we welcome your participation in the selection of tools for the QA Team.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Greenhouse is looking for Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our growing tech team. We’re at a unique point in our growth where we’re big enough to offer stability, development best practices, and a variety of projects but still small enough so that every engineer makes a big impact on the product and code base. 


In the past year, we’ve started to move from a monolithic application to distributed web services, begun switching our hosting from Heroku to AWS, and built a test suite with over 8k tests covering our system; but we’re just getting started with scaling challenges. Here is a glimpse at some of the projects and architecture decisions you’d be involved with:



  • Scaling from 100M requests per month to 500M requests per month

  • Building and deploying globally distributed systems with sharding, read/write splitting, and HA

  • Improving page load time by 30%

  • Designing and implementing a unified API

  • Building Greenhouse's mobile experiences


Our engineers can expect to start contributing to feature development within their first weeks using Ruby on Rails and Javascript. You’ll also influence how the team is structured, mentor and teach your fellow engineers, and learn alongside other senior engineers in an agile environment. At Greenhouse, we believe in concrete deliverables, feedback and iteration, collaboration and transparency, and recognition for your impact and contributions.

Software Engineer – Web Applications


Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) seeks an innovative team member to join our Wired Networks group in either Lynnwood or Pullman, Washington as a Software Engineer or Lead Software Engineer. This team is developing innovative software for the configuration and management of software defined networks.


In this position you will participate in development of new capabilities being added to the single-page web application that drives our network configuration and management software. You will also participate in the design and maintenance of the API bindings between the web application and the north-bound REST interface of the C# backend.


If you are looking for an opportunity to develop cutting edge software components, services and applications as part of our Wired Networks group, then this position is for you!
