  • Other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Software Engineer-Data Engineering Gemfire
jobs.content:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Software craftsmanship requires two traits—passion and discipline. Passion is the drive to study, practice, sharpen our skills, and improve ourselves. Passion is our desire to deliver an amazing software experience. Discipline is what makes us follow principles, write unit tests, and add value to our code by steadily tending the garden. Discipline is doing what is required to get the job done at its highest level, even when it is inconvenient. A software craftsman is a professional. We are looking for craftsmen and women to help us continue to provide a better reality for our clients, and to experience a better reality for themselves.


We will provide you with the best tools so you can focus on solving problems, including: Visual Studio, SQL Server, ReSharper, NCrunch, ASP.NET MVC, Twitter Bootstrap, and more. And how would you feel about working with award-winning in-house designers to make your applications both engaging and beautiful? 


We really only have two over-arching requirements for our developers: they must be smart, and they must get things done. We do have some technology constraints, namely, Envoc is a .NET shop with our main focus on C# and MVC based applications. We make extensive use of JavaScript and JavaScript based frameworks in our presentation layer. For mobile applications, our primary cross-platform development is done using Xamarin.


This position must be located in either our Baton Rouge, LA or Hammond, LA offices. 


How to Apply: It is critical that you follow the instructions in our application process. Following the process is the only way to be considered for any position at Envoc. The first step in applying is to send a one-sentence statement of interest along with your resume to apply@envoccareers.com.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Infrastructure
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Infrastructure

FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator. If our mission and product resonate with you, you’re interested in joining a collaborative, motivated and close-knit team who want to help small businesses thrive, then join us!

We are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to help ensure that FiveStars has a reliable and scalable backend system. Help us transition some of our legacy systems to a clean, elegant Service Oriented Architecture. During our time of growth, you will be helping us to deliver highly scalable and reliable systems which drive the experience of thousands of businesses and millions of consumers.

Responsibilities:

Work on the platform upon which all of our web products and mobile APIs are built Proactively identify site scaling issues and help redesign systems to address them Maintain a high level of quality in our infrastructure systems through sound development practices including code reviews, monitoring and alerting systems, and architecture reviews Ability to design, develop, and stand up new services based on new product needs Continually improve our internal infrastructure and tools Invest in FiveStars and our culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

Requirements:

B.S. or greater in Computer Science or a related field (math, physics, engineering) and strong CS fundamentals Expertise building large-scale, distributed, high-volume systems Enjoy playing with tech like nginx, haproxy, postgres, AWS, ansible, docker, nagios, or graphite Be a strong team player Work with small, tightly knit product teams that function cohesively to move as quickly as possible Determination to provide reliable and fault tolerant systems to the application developers that consume them

Preferred:

Deep working knowledge of Linux servers and networked environments Thorough understanding of distributed systems and the protocols they use, including TCP/IP, RESTful APIs, SQL, NoSQL Experience in managing and sharding a relational database

jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Mobile (Android or iOS)

FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator.

FiveStars is searching for Android and iOS engineers who are thoughtful, responsible, and passionate builders who want to be part of a highly collaborative team that is creating the best user experience in mobile. We are looking for someone who is skilled in Android or iOS development, values good design, and is not afraid to get their hands dirty in backend code. We are in a position to shape how some of the newest trends in tech (BLE, NFC, among others) improve how local commerce is done, and we would love to have you help us create that future!

Responsibilities:

Work in a multi-disciplined scrum team to plan, design, and implement new features for our consumer Android application or native FiveStars iOS application Evaluate application designs in regards to technical feasibility and approximate development time Write high-quality code (in Java using Android Studio or Objective-C and Swift using Xcode) and design and implement RESTful APIs in our Django stack Maintain a high level of quality in our code bases through well-written automated tests and good architecture and code review practices Invest in FiveStars and its culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

Requirements:

B.S. or greater in Computer Science or a related field (math, physics, engineering) and strong CS fundamentals 3+ years of software development experience, with at least 3 years in Android or iOS Strong team player - we work in small product teams that work very closely together and are constantly collaborating in order to move as fast as possible Have shipped either an Android application and is proficient in Java or an iOS application and proficient in Objective-C or Swift Experience using Android Studio, or Eclipse with ADT Has an understanding of mobile test strategies and frameworks

Preferred:

Experience with continuous integration Familiarity with Python, Django and Git

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Development
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Web Development

FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
When it comes to modern day software development, you will have your finger on the pulse of the entire pipeline. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


DevOps is as much about communication and business relationships as it is about any of the software or tools you will use.


Duties & Responsibilities


As a New Context DevOps Engineer you will be expected to provide technical leadership with a hands-on approach. On a daily basis you will be interfacing with our clients and other New Context staff members while working from the New Context office, at client sites or from your home. Expect to heavily leverage open source software to tackle challenges like delivery of highly secured containers to IoT devices or building Big Data ecosystems at petabyte scale and beyond.


The team works well together, but also understands that sometimes they go rogue to motivate the group into being effective. Your most important daily responsibilities: have fun, lead by example and solve exciting challenges.


Qualifications



  • Seasoned Technical Veteran


    • We are looking for a team member with 5+ years of experience in a similar role that can demonstrate they have already learned how to excel in this role.

    • Experience with highly available and high-performance open source web technologies

    • Existing familiarity (or the eagerness to learn) Ruby and/or Python is helpful, given they are the common languages of systems automation.


  • Strong communication skills


    • You must be ready to communicate current status in an effective and professional manner.


  • Independent worker


    • Work may often require direct interaction with clients or team members without direct supervision. You must be able to think on your feet, communicate constantly and professionally, and above all else meet the expectations of our clients.


  • Calm and professional demeanor


    • This is critical! You will be faced with frustrated clients, team members and situations. You must be able to handle yourself in a professional manner and find the best course of action to take in order to please the client as much as is possible.

jobs.title: Senior Manual QA Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you the QA engineer to help us implement a robust manual QA process for our open source platforms developed for non profit organisations?


We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… and sometimes it breaks! So we’re looking for a confident and ambitious Senior Manual QA Test Engineer to join our distributed team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, CRM, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies.


We are also developing several open source products that are used by non profit organsiations worldwide and the role will be uniquely rewarding as you will have the opportunity to influence and support these valuable projects.


The ideal candidate will be an experienced QA engineer who has worked on many complex web applications in the past.


The role will involve a mixture of writing and executing manual test scripts, feeding back to developers on bugs or issues noted. There may also be some future work on automation testing although the primary focus for this role will be manual testing. The ideal candidate would have some existing CRM and CMS experience (ideally Drupal), be an expert in developing comprehensive test plans, have expert SQL knowledge and be comfortable setting up a basic development environment and working with Git.


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and loves picking holes in (other people’s!) logic. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone who thinks and acts like us to join our growing team.


If you are interested in the role, please send your CV through to us with a short covering letter explaining what caught your interest and why you think you would fit in.


(Please note that this is a remote position)

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.


As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.


We Can Go Fast Forever.


We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.


We Court Perfection.


Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.


Get Breakfast Every Day. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.

Interested in becoming a Pivot? We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our Dearborn (Detroit) team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.


Pivotal Labs is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer

jobs.title: Software Engineer I
jobs.content:
iOS Engineer


What makes us so awesome: Cutting edge technology is created at NCR Midtown Atlanta, just a quick walk to tech square at Georgia Tech. We have a marketplace of thousands of restaurants building consumer facing and mobile applications for many of the top brands. Our engineers are some of the best and the brightest in the industry with a passion for creating technology to revamp experiences. With an open environment to promote collaboration, our office is intimate like a start-up but has the backing of a large corporation. The Midtown office contributes to an exciting workplace providing office recreation, catered lunches, and team building events. The culture here is dynamic, yet laid back (you might even become a ping pong pro during your tenure). We work in a fast paced environment that allows continuous innovation with the ability to grow new and existing mobile & online technology for the hospitality industry.

Check out our environment for yourself - http://vimeo.com/104714234

You are: Someone who believes that software engineering changes lives. You’re passionate about technology and see the world a little differently than your peers—everywhere you look, there’s possibility. Opportunity. Boundaries to push and challenges to solve. That’s what we’re seeking at NCR. We’re a global tech company that makes life easier for you—and people all over the world—by enabling than 450 million transactions every day. Restaurants, shops, banks and airports come to us for hardware, software and services. They know we have the best and brightest software engineers who know the world of mobile better than any other—and relish in revealing previously unknown insights. Software engineers who write code than can survive under the pressure of hundreds of thousands of requests per minute. Software engineers like you.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Farmers Labs:


We hire with purpose. We provide you with a place to grow, a place to build a career, and a place where everyone is part of the team. At Farmers, you will have the opportunity to work on today’s most innovative projects in web solutions. We recognize that our success results from the success of our employees, and we strive to create an environment that challenges and nurtures talent.



We’re Changing How Insurance Does Software:


Our day consists of pair programming to ensure we deliver the highest quality software possible. Utilizing Test Driven Development (TDD) ensures that our code is ready to deploy after every development cycle. We work on Farmer’s public facing sites so our work is used by a large audience and our successes are highly visible. Typically our day consists of 8 hours of intense coding and nothing more. We believe that the best work is done with a sustainable pace.



We’re Shaping The Future:


As critical members of the Marketing IT organization we work on all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle. Using agile methodologies we are able to bring new functionality into production shortly after inception. Our best practices are being taught to all areas of the greater Farmers IT organization. In a word we are building the next generation of the Farmers digital presence.



Are You Ready?


Want to work at a company who aspires to make state of the art technology central to business? Ready to play your part in a team that is skilled, knowledgeable and agile? Looking for that rare combination: the spirit and excitement of a startup with solid financial results? Appreciate an environment where your opinions and contributions are highly valued?

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Farmers Insurance is one of the nation top insurers and providers of financial services. Today, the Farmers Digital Transformation is a new strategic initiative that was formed to drive agility throughout our business and to respond faster to market demands. A critical part of the initiative is to build a new engineering team for mobile and the innovation labs to foster innovation and to promote more lean, agile processes while delivering products in two key areas: mobile and API platform/Big Data. A career at Farmers Insurance offers compelling ways of delivering something that is not only impactful for the organization but also for our customers.


Farmers insurance mobile and innovation team is looking for  backend engineers (junior, seasoned and senior) to help us take InsurTech to the next level.


The role:


    - Work on Farmers Mobile REST API


    - Develop new services and optimize existing ones


    - Research new technologies that will extend your skills and the value that Farmers Insurance can offer to our customers.

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: London, United Kingdom
URL: https://pixelcab.in

Junior Full Stack Developer (Remote, UK preferred)

About Pixelcabin
Pixelcabin is an agile web development agency, focusing on ecommerce solutions for a wide range of companies. We work closely with Shopify building polished front-end experiences for our clients, and expanding the native Shopify functionality with bespoke Rails apps that leverage Shopify’s extensive API. We are a core Partner of Shopify, with advance access to upcoming APIs and features, allowing our projects to deliver cutting-edge solutions.

Our team is small and fully distributed, and working remotely has been part of our DNA since Day 1, meaning you’ll find a great remote working environment focused around making your day-to-day enjoyable and efficient, using tools like Slack for communication, Github for code, Rubymine IDE, Pivotal Tracker for project management, amongst many others. As part of a remote team, we encourage finding a setup that provides both the work productivity and lifestyle that suits everyone, even if that is something completely different for each person. Without geographic constraints, time and location can be flexible to fit around each team member’s needs.

As our clients are also remote, we occasionally travel to spend time embedded with them, and this can also provide us as a team time to come together. Outside of these trips, we also organise an annual meetup to bring everyone together for a few days to get away from our desks, bridge the remote-working gap, and plan for the future direction of the company - our last meetup involved converging on a beach in Miami for a weekend!

The company has evolved around a few core principles: quality over quantity, under promise and over deliver, and taking pride in your work. We take on projects that will present new problems for us to solve, and get excited about elegant solutions to complex problems. Most importantly, we want to invest in our team - we encourage continuous learning and development and aim for a high degree of code-review as part of the day-to-day experience.

About you
We are seeking a Junior Full Stack developer to help us grow our team. You will be exposed to a variety of different apps, and given ownership of some upcoming projects currently in the planning stage.

An ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated, able to take initiative in solving problems, and someone that can take ownership of projects, without needing to be micromanaged. Working as part of a remote team has many great advantages, however you will be expected to be able to communicate clearly with the team over a variety of different mediums, take a task through to completion, while being comfortable in raising issues or questions along the way.

As a remote team across time zones, we have a flexible approach to work schedule, however we would usually expect you to cross at least 5 hours of 9am - 5pm Monday to Friday UK time during your first year of working with us.

We favour a strong CS background over any specific language or technology skills, but as part of this we would expect a foundational understanding in Rails, JS, CSS, the modern web and Git.

Required knowledge and experience
  • Some familiarity with Ruby
  • Some experience working with JavaScript & CSS
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English
  • A passion for exceeding client expectations
  • Naturally organized and self-directed

Desirable knowledge and experience
  • Computer Science degree
  • Contributions to open-source projects
  • Some experience with Rails

Salaries and Perks
  • You can work from anywhere in Europe
  • Starting salary £25k - £32k
  • Flexible workspace allowance
  • Professional Development allowance
  • Tickets/Travel to Shopify's annual Unite conference

Application Deadline
The application deadline for this is end of Monday 29th August 2016. We will start to reply to applications after this date.

To apply: Please send all applications to jobs@pixelcab.in, including your Github, LinkedIn, and any other relevant links. No agencies please.

jobs.title: Lead Instructor
jobs.content:
Web Development Intensive


We're seeking an instructor for our fastest-growing and most in-demand program, WDI. A 12-week long program meeting Monday-Friday, 10:00AM - 6:00PM with a 1- hour break each day for lunch. This program aims to transform beginner programmers, screened for logical reasoning and their ability to construct basic programs, into entry-level developers. The school offers plenty of support to instructors including an entire curriculum and training for instructors, as well as assistance to students prior, during, and after the program as they undertake the journey of a lifetime, learning an exciting new skillset!

jobs.title: Scala Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you?
Well then you should apply for LeadIQ’s Lead Engineer post in our new Singapore office.


LeadIQ is one of the fastest growing sales tools in Google’s Chrome store, and we’re looking for a rock star to work closely with our front-end team to cut down our growing stack of customers' feature request.


We won’t provide you with a motorcycle or leather jacket, but we will provide you with:
- Health insurance
- Remote working
- Free gym membership
- 3 weeks PTO


We’re a tight knit group, and this hire will be a foundation to our Singapore office’s culture, as well as an extension of our values here in US.


The best applicants are eager to learn, excited to build something super cool, and are reliable facing any challenge.


If you want to continue to build your impressive technical knowledge and professional skills,contribute to multiple projects at the same time, and even help us hire more developers, send us over your resume, and any code repos. Apply now!

jobs.title: Full-Stack Enterprise Developer
jobs.content:
The EIS (Enterprise Information Systems) team writes the software that builds rockets and powers SpaceX. We are responsible for all of the software on the factory floor, the warehouses, the financial systems, the restaurant, and even the public home page. Elon has called EIS the "nervous system" of SpaceX because we connect all of the other teams at SpaceX to ensure that the entire rocket building process runs smoothly.


SpaceX is seeking developers with demonstrable experience in: ASP.NET, C#, SQL Server, and AngularJS. We are a fast-paced, highly iterative team that has to adapt quickly as our factory grows. We need people who are comfortable tackling new problems, innovating solutions, and interacting with every facet of the company on a daily basis. Creative, motivated, able to take responsibility and support the applications you create. Help us get rockets out the door faster!

jobs.title: Sr Mobile Engineer, Android
jobs.content:
DAILY MENU


Our mobile development team knows that by helping our users we help our business, so we listen to our customers and give them features they want to use. Design and implement scalable solutions for our public- and consultant facing web sites, back-end tools, and APIs following Agile development methodologies. At Pampered Chef, you'll be working with great engineering and design team who take full ownership of their part of the platform. You’ll be a key part of the idea generation process because at Pampered Chef each engineer makes a difference.



  • Provide technical leadership and execute on new market initiatives, continuously improving the codebase, architecture, and processes of existing systems

  • Mentor other engineers, review their work, and provide constructive feedback

  • Write solid, maintainable, and testable code, paired with useful documentation

  • Build and maintain scalable ecommerce APIs (e.g. shopping cart management, order management, etc.) that will support The Pampered Chef internal, consultant and .com facing set of tools

  • Analyze and resolve technical and application problems

  • Participate in peer-reviews of solution designs and related code

  • Drive innovation within the team in areas including: development efficiencies, custom component development & integration, leading-edge industry concepts and developments.

  • Share knowledge in areas of your excellence by setting up and holding brown bag sessions

  • Establish working relationships with all the productized SCRUM teams and key team members and across the IT organization as appropriate

  • Verifies integration test specifications to ensure proper testing

  • Creates integration plans to support systems interface testing

jobs.content: Design and develop the 3D printers and scanners that are changing the way people work and create.  We are looking for software engineers who are interested in working on complex web-based solutions, and have extensive experience in javascript & node.js.  Our software engineers are constantly working on brand new problems, are picking up new skills all the time, and have a direct impact on the direction of the products we build.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer in Berlin
jobs.content:
fromAtoB is looking for an experienced full-time Frontend Engineer headquartered in Berlin or Aachen.


We unite lovers, families and businesses. We bring our customers from A to B. Thanks to our deep understanding of Europe’s traffic networks, we develop unique and intelligent routing algorithms that magically calculate the best path between two places. Traveling has never been easier or more efficient and we do all this without charging any extra fees.


When customers use our products they search, scroll, click, swipe, filter and book. They touch and feel our work; your work. As a Frontend engineer at fromAtoB you'll be directly influencing the happiness of our customers. It will be your mission to implement interfaces that users actually enjoy and love to use.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer in Berlin(m/f)
jobs.content:
fromAtoB is looking for an experienced full-time Backend Engineer headquartered in Berlin or Aachen.


We unite lovers, families and businesses. We bring our customers from A to B. Thanks to our deep understanding of Europe’s traffic networks, we develop unique and intelligent routing algorithms that magically calculate the best path between two places. Traveling has never been easier or more efficient and we do all this without charging any extra fees.


Every search, intelligent routing, booking, payment, email and every other bit of logic we do, allows someone to travel. As a Backend engineer at fromAtoB your ambition and passion is required to convert people into happy travelers. In return, as one of our greatest assets, you will thrive from our exceptional team spirit, great benefits, and a culture where your achievements will always be acknowledged and highly valued.


This is you



  • you have very good experience with Ruby, Rails and Rspec

  • you love proper testing, no questions asked

  • you are a team player and culture is your passion

  • you always keep an eye on the customer

  • for you “it works” is not enough


Icing on the cake



  • you have realized projects in other languages and frameworks

  • you know that Sandi Metz is not a canadian politician

  • you still miss _Why as much as we do

This could be future-you



  • you have a big impact on our product, specification and decision making

  • you finally accepted that this is a never ending journey of learning, experimenting and understanding

  • you went beyond salary, demanding and finding purpose on a daily basis


Sounds like a good fit?  We’d love to talk! Please submit



  • Your complete application with salary expectations

to join-our-team@fromatob.com or apply directly via https://fromatob.workable.com/ .


This job probably isn't for you, but maybe you have a friend who is a perfect fit? Send them this link and cc join-our-team@fromatob.com. Once they applied we'll get you a free ride. You happy. We happy. Win-Win!

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
About Showpad


We believe in the power of content to move people and inspire them – to start conversations and win them over. Content can only live up to its potential if it can be easily found, shared, and used in the right place, at the right time, with the right audience.


Showpad activates content for sales and marketing teams of over 850 companies around the world, including Johnson & Johnson, Fujifilm, Intel, and Kimberly-Clark. We won’t stop until every company has the opportunity to accelerate their business and elevate their brand through effective content.


About the position


As a Data Engineer, you will shape the future of the Showpad product by developing its data intelligence platform. Showpad is a data centric company and you will help to develop an ecosystem of services that retrieve, process, enrich and serve that data. Your decisions will help make Showpad the ultimate intelligent sales platform.


Key responsibilities as a Data Engineer at Showpad


A Data Engineer contributes to the data intelligence platform. You will need to:



  • Architect, develop and maintain a data management and exploration platform to be used by data scientists and other engineers

  • Build out a robust infrastructure for dealing with large amounts of data

  • Work closely with data scientists and other engineers to design and maintain scalable data models and pipelines

  • Define ways to measure the quality and consistency of data

  • Define measures to keep up a high level of code quality

  • Be passionate about data and keeping it organised and accessible

  • Team up on projects and coach and learn good practices

  • Having regular scrums and focus meetings

  • Having lots of fun with your passionate engineers


What you can expect from Showpad


On the outside, we’re redefining how sales and marketing use content; on the inside, we’re redefining the workplace. Showpad is a global company where personalities and cultures across  oceans collide to create something extraordinary.


In the morning we’re drinking San Francisco Blue Bottle coffee with Portland doughnuts; in the evening – Belgian tripel Westmalle and English scones.

jobs.title: AgentFire.com is looking for a killer Senior Designer with extensive WordPress experience and great communication ability!
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Anytown, USA
URL: https://agentfire.com/now-hiring/

Our growing organization is looking for someone extremely proficient with WordPress Theme Customization / HTML / CSS, IDEALLY with experience in X-Theme & Cornerstone Visual Editor - or anything similar, like DIVI - will be considered big bonus points! If you don't have experience with these frameworks but are a killer designer, we encourage you to still apply for the position!!!

Here's a basic snapshot of the process
Client signs up for a new site and will complete a number of 'client questionnaires' that will include all of the information that needs to make it's way into the site (so all of their contact information, their logo, personal photo, photos to use in image slider, social networks etc

We will clone an existing 'template' site which will many of the defaults already set, and then it's up to you to basically work with the responses in the questionnaire to build out the 'first draft' of their site. We use the 'x-theme' framework for WordPress, and most of the design will be done in Cornerstone (an advanced front-end visual editor, again very similar to Divi or Visual Composer)

We are looking for some with above average skill as our sites are amazing! (check agentfire.com/our-portfolio/ for recent examples) - we're also looking for a great communicator - as you'll be managing jr. designers and speaking directly with clients and giving 1 on 1 demo's (more on that below)

Required Skills
- Must have expert level knowledge of CSS, HTML
- Must have expert level knowledge of Responsive Design
- Must have expert level knowledge of WordPress
- Must have expert level knowledge of working with and configuring WordPress plugins
-Must have a portfolio of existing websites demonstrating these abilities (please include a link to your previous work if applying for this position)
- Must be able to learn new skills quickly
- Proficient with Photoshop / Illustrator
- Must be fluent in English
- Work hours are somewhat flexible, but expect start time to be roughly 10am EST, end time to be 6pm EST daily
- Must be able to work well within a team dynamic
- Be able to communicate back and forth with clients

Bonus Skills
These are huge bonus skills, so if you have these, as well as the above, you'll be a front-runner for this position.

- Have experience with real estate websites
- Experience with X-Theme Framework
- Have experience with Cornerstone/Visual Composer/Divi or some other front end visual editor for WordPress
- Knowledge of Javascript

Compensation
$15-25 hourly depending on skill level and experience PLUS commissions on successful demo conversions - demo's are 1 on 1 conversations with interested parties and our current close rate is ABOVE 50% (these are not sales calls, you'll be speaking to very interested parties and your objective during the demo is to evaluate the prospective clients needs and how we can accommodate into an AgentFire website) - each successful demo conversion is +$75 plus your hourly rate, and we'll give you 6-10 demo's per week (or more if you're doing a great job with them) - you will also be lead designer on any successful demo conversions. 

Also to note - we will be raising our prices soon and will be raising our commissions - again we are GROWING and we'd love you to grow with us :) 

There will be anywhere from 40-50 hrs per week of work (so lots of opportunity for additional income) - also lots of opportunity for career advancement - we have gone from from 4 to 24+ fulltime employees over the last year alone and you can read our employee reviews here: https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/AgentFire-Reviews-E1258957.htm - also we have a great work environment (group chat via Slack) and have lots of fun here. Seriously, every one of our employees loves working with us. 

We are looking to hire ASAP!

Important Note
In your application, please also let us know your favorite color so we know you've actually read this :) 

To apply: Please visit https://agentfire.com/now-hiring/ to apply for the position!

Sr. Web Developer

jobs.title: Frontend Developer with a passion for design
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about great user experience and cool user interfaces?

The Data Insights team in Telenor Digital is developing a number of tools to deliver customers and business analysts insights into and control over their data. We are now looking for someone to cover the frontend development for our solutions. The success of our solutions depends on their beauty and usability, so in this position, you will play a central role in shaping our solutions to be loved by our customers.

We offer you an exciting, open and agile international work environment within a great community of designers, researchers and software engineers. You can expect possibilities to grow, participation in hackathons, travel opportunities and a competitive salary. The workplace is located in Oslo, Norway, but as we have stakeholders and colleagues in many different countries, the working language is English.


What you would do:

jobs.title: Technology Lead
jobs.content:
Here at the Office for National Statistics (ONS) we provide the data that shapes our nation. And the ever-advancing world of digital opens up exciting opportunities for us. It enables us to better engage with and inform our customers, to develop more relevant and targeted products and increase our audience reach and their understanding of what we do. All this ensures we provide the most up-to-date information about the nation. Information that will help our nation make better decisions.

As Technology Lead, you’ll work collaboratively within a multi-disciplinary team to design, build, support and improve new and existing digital products and platforms. A technology specialist, you’ll work with our IT Architects to coordinate solutions between multiple development team and products, ensuring knowledge is shared between them. You’re an inspirational leader and will instil a culture of collaboration, communication and creativity as you coach and mentor your team members, particularly when it comes to best practice and setting standards both for software and infrastructure. You’ll also work alongside Delivery and Product Managers in understanding and communicating technical concepts, viability of plans and the associated risks to wider stakeholders. Taking a leadership role in the wider community, you’ll share your experiences as Technology Lead through tech talks at conferences as well as blog posts. Surrounded by like-minded individuals, this is an excellent opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technology.

First and foremost, you’re a tech expert. You live and breathe technology and love finding a solution to technology challenges. It goes without saying that you’ve a strong technology-focused background and experience working with a wide range of products, languages and technologies in multiple areas, including software design and development, architecture, infrastructure and different hosting options, including Cloud. You’re a pioneer of new approaches and enjoy sharing your findings with others. Motivated, forward-thinking and enthusiastic, you’re a great leader, someone people listen to and believe in, someone who gets the best out of others.

The Office for National Statistics shapes the nation, informing debate and improving decision making across the country – from businesses to government agencies. As the largest producer of official statistics, we compile and analyse a vast amount of data that has an impact on nearly every aspect of our lives.

Please note the closing date for this role is the 16th of Aug 2016.

jobs.title: BMW Group - Senior Architect for Functional Safety
jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Architect for Functional Safety (m/f)
Job reference: 105398


The BMW Group is taking the lead in highly automated and fully automated driving. We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Architect (m/f)) for Functional Safety (FuSi) in the area of autonomous driving. Your activities will range from the design of interdepartmental safety concepts to FuSi-compliant partitioning of the electric/electronic (E/E) architecture and validation concepts across process chains. In close collaboration with specialist departments, you will develop future-oriented E/E architecture concepts for fulfilling Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL) requirements for functions that constitute the cutting edge of autonomous driving at the BMW Group. Your tasks will include the analysis of the optimum ASIL utilisation of available hardware platforms and strategically orientating future integration platforms for quick integration of automated driving functions. A further responsibility will be to assess technical safety concepts of suppliers together with the internal FuSi specialist departments. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the coordination and implementation of FuSi-relevant aspects in terms of deadlines and maturity levels, the monitoring of project progress and reporting on project status.

jobs.content:

SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR NETWORKED THINKING.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Software Developer Guiding Applications Navigation Systems (m/f)
Job reference: 101002


BMW Car IT GmbH, a wholly owned subsidiary of BMW AG, is a software company focused on the design and development of innovative software for future BMW Group automobiles. We create, evaluate and integrate software solutions working exclusively for the BMW Group, while also participating in open source communities, standardization efforts, funded research projects, and collaborations with universities. We are offering you a challenging position in the field of automobile navigation software development. You will develop a guiding middleware component which computes and provides maneuver information along a route. The guiding instructions are presented in various ways to drivers by clients like Head-Up Display, Instrument Display or a Voice Module. As part of an international and highly motivated Scrum team you are writing code and automated tests, analyzing and solving technical problems as well as designing components and APIs. Additionally you are working with a modern development environment, develop a modern C++ code base using today’s best practices like Git, code review, automated testing and CI.

jobs.content:
ELECTRONICS GETS THINGS MOVING. AND NOT JUST THE WHEELS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR INNOVATIVE SYSTEM FUNCTIONS.


Success is a team sport. That's why BMW doesn’t simply employ specialists with proven expertise, but real people who understand one other. And we support them with cutting-edge technology and sophisticated processes that still leave room for unconventional thinking. We want to make our team even more innovative in the future, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Expert Machine Learning (m/f)
Job reference: 100999


Autonomous driving is a key component to meet the upcoming challenges of future mobility. We are looking for people that join us on this path by designing and developing software solutions for autonomous driving and driver assistance systems. We offer you a chance to join our international team at BMW Car IT in Ulm, a wholly owned subsidiary of BMW AG. As a member (m/f) of our team on onboard & offboard environment model you are responsible for application and deployment of novel machine learning solutions at BMW. Based on your profound knowledge in machine learning algorithms as well as practical expertise in software development you will analyse prototypical approaches and provide market ready engineering solutions. Communicating and discussing complex technical aspects as well as practical boundary conditions with our internal partners is an essential part of your job. Working on core components, your contributions will have a significant impact on the customer experience throughout the BMW product portfolio. We expect that you share our enthusiasm for embedded software in automotive industry, that you bring fresh ideas and the ability to think outside the box. Join us in developing quality software solutions and shape with us the future of individual mobility.

jobs.content:
TAKE A TRIP ON THE REAL SUPERHIGHWAY.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.

Senior Function Architect (m/f)


We are offering an exciting opportunity to work as a Senior Function Architect (m/f) in the field of autonomous driving and safety systems. Your challenging tasks will range from analysing the requirements of innovative and future-oriented functions of autonomous driving, to developing a function architecture and designing a technical architecture. In an excellent disciplinary team, you will develop optimal solutions with the aim of forming the cutting edge of future systems for autonomous driving. In doing so, you will act as a link between those responsible for functions, and the vehicle wiring system and software architects. Furthermore you will define concrete functional building blocks, including interfaces of external and internal developments in the function network and you will define architecture premises and scaling levels for the function development team. Your thrilling range of activities will be topped off by the joint design of interfaces for autonomous driving in the vehicle wiring system in addition to the definition of a sustainable architecture for new and future-oriented systems for autonomous driving.

jobs.content:
IF AN IDEA DOESN'T HAVE WINGS, IT WILL NEVER HAVE WHEELS.

We are offering an interesting opportunity to work as a Lead Engineer (m/f) for the Environment Model in Autonomous Driving. You will be responsible for the medium- and long-term development of the environmental model as a central component of autonomous driving. As a specialist, you will lead the environmental model feature teams to develop new, innovative algorithms, architectures and validation methodologies to meet new requirements for autonomous driving. You will design and implement comprehensive functional concepts from situation interpretation to multi-sensor data fusion, to sensor systems. Additionally, you will ensure scalability across various vehicle derivatives and various equipment variants. An example of your responsibilities is prototype development across all environmental model development teams for assessing and testing new technologies and algorithms. In the tackling of issues, you will ensure close collaboration with BMW Research and initiate and support cooperation ventures with external partners, such as universities and research institutes.  A broad array of modern mathematical methods and stochastic procedures in the area of multi-sensor data fusion and classification will form your basis for design. Finally, you will systematically develop your detailed understanding of software development methods and technologies, such as continuous integration, agile development and test-driven development.

Furthermore, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software in close cooperation with function specialists. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. Moreover, you will write and optimise complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification or fusing of objects and open spaces fit for driving and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing of the functionality throughout the overall vehicle.

jobs.title: Senior Front End React.js Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: life.io

Life.io is looking for a passionate and articulate front-end React.js developer to join our team. This role will support Life.io's growing user experience footprint as we build out new mobile applications and enhance our web platform. We're looking for someone with attention to detail, a dedication to patterns and style, and an appreciation for the frameworks we're embracing.

Required Skills/Qualifications
  • Solid experience building Javascript applications in React, React Native, Flux/Redux, and ES6/ES7.
  • Great at writing responsive and user-friendly markup using HTML5 and SCSS (Bourbon Neat experience a huge plus).
  • Experience with build tools like Gulp, Webpack, Babel, npm, etc.
  • Comfortable consuming and transmitting data to and from a restful JSON API.
  • Good understanding of Git flow and basic version control with a team.
  • Comfortable planning, reviewing and implementing complex UI and interactions.

Nice to Haves
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails / Rails APIs
  • Background in animation or illustration
  • UX Design experience

Things About You
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team.
  • Enjoy helping people: curious, empathetic, collaborative, and happy to help problem solve with the team.
  • Enjoy learning about new products and how things work.
  • Ability to switch gears while keeping in mind the bigger vision.
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events.

About Life.io
Life.io is a well-funded, venture-backed startup that's changing lives. Our wellness platform, which is offered globally through insurers and employers, provides motivation and education, and rewards people for making meaningful improvements to their health and lives.
With expertise in epidemiology and behavioral sciences and an Advisory Board that includes leading faculty in the area of diagnostics and behavioral economics, our team utilizes an evidence-based approach that is flexible, accessible, rewarding, and entirely HIPAA compliant.

Culture
We are a small company with 5 full-time developers. Though we work remotely, we also work collaboratively, taking advantage of Slack, Jira/Confluence, Screenhero, and Google Hangouts to connect with each other throughout the day. As a small team, each person's contribution is meaningful, impactful, and valued, both in terms of the actual work, but also in terms of planning, making suggestions, having opinions, and offering new insights / knowledge to the team. We embrace and want to know more about any of your unique skills and passions. Above all, we treat each other with respect, acknowledge and make accommodations for each other's needs both at work and at home, and do all we can to make Life.io the best possible place to work.

Perks
  • Full-time remote work
  • Possible stock options
  • Comprehensive health insurance including dental and vision
  • Life insurance
  • Excellent work/life balance
  • Generous vacation time (mandatory minimum of 2 weeks)

To apply: Send us an email to jobs+react@life.io with your resume, a bit about yourself, and some previous projects you're proud of.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  PHP  Leipzig

jobs.title: Quant Developer
jobs.content:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematical software developer.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  Although we are part of a larger organisation, we're a young group with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At RPC Consulting we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark Sinclair-McGarvie at RPC Consulting.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are a software development agency based in Melbourne, Australia that builds web applications and cross-platform mobile apps for a wide range of clients big and small.


We are seeking a full stack web developer with several years experience in delivering successful customer projects. We are after someone who is a great communicator, self-motivated and can contribute in a team environment.


The technology stack we are seeking experience in consists of:

Front End:
* AngularJS
* Bootstrap
* jQuery
* LESS/SASS


Back End:
* ASP.NET Web API (C#)
* NHibernate/Entity Framework
* MS SQL Server/MYSQL Database
* Redis


You will be working directly with our clients and would have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of different projects for different industries. You will also have the opportunity to help guide the technologies we use and our best practices.


Requirements:
* Similar timezone to Melbourne, Australia or willing to work some overlapping hours with us.
* 5+ Years experience as a full stack web developer
* Significant experience with C# and AngularJS
* Strong experience with SQL and databases
* Familiar with Visual Studio
*  Git / SourceTree
* Attention to detail, reliable, curious and passionate

Extra tags: angularjs, fullstack, web development, .net, c#, web api, asp.net, bootstrap

jobs.title: Solution Architect
jobs.content:
Do you want to have a meaningful global impact and be an integral part of a fast growing business?
Then Appway is looking for you!


Solution Architects at Appway provide high level consulting services to our clients. In this role you will be responsible for accompanying both the client and our Appway developers, from beginning to end of a project. You are expected to bridge both sides of the table, and to ensure that the Appway solution meets and exceeds the requirements set by the client. Your input is critical from the very start of a project; from initial contact and requirement setting to idea building, process construction, and final implementation. As a Solution Architect, you will mentor clients in key Appway functionality and provide technical support to business groups. Appway Solution Architects are also in constant contact with client senior management, the Appway developing team and project Engagement Leaders. This is a leadership role that requires strong organization and communication skills. Solution Architects are the glue that holds our clients and developers together; yours is the job of elucidating, educating, and developing healthy and long-lasting relationships with Appway clients.

We’re looking for someone with .NET development skills and proficiency in C# and C++ who’s interested in a truly collaborative experience, where you’ll work closely with designers and be both a coder and a code reviewer for your fellow developers. Propelled by Esri’s desire to incorporate the latest advances, if Microsoft introduces something new, you’ll have it in your hands, not just be reading about it online. Our apps are used by municipalities, major industries, utilities, retail businesses, defense, and the military, so what you create will make a real difference in the world. If you’re smart, driven, and know how to get things done, we’ll give you the latest and best tools to do it.


Responsibilities



  • Develop and design modern Windows apps

  • Build software that follows industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment models

  • Collaborate with designers and developers throughout the development process

  • Stay up to date with the latest technologies, trends, and best practices

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
Web architecture is rapidly evolving, creating new challenges to build responsive, interactive, data-driven applications used by people around the world to make decisions and collaborate with one another. We are actively looking for more colleagues to join us in creating the world’s best geospatial mapping and data analysis platform.

You will be actively involved with people across engineering to devise new system architectures that leverage application frameworks and emerging technologies. As a platform that serves millions of users and domains, our software needs to be modular, reusable, and well crafted. We iterate rapidly, constantly learning from feedback, metrics, and the mission of our community.


Responsibilities: 



  • Work closely with product management to understand requirements and create application architectures and API to meet product goals

  • Design and develop stable software that includes automated test validation

  • Develop reusable components and libraries for use internally and open-source

  • Work within agile processes for short cycle, fast-paced delivery

  • User-focused development and work closely with UI designers to craft compelling user experiences

  • Willing to take on complex goals that push the boundary of the possible

  • Ability to manage small teams of developers

jobs.title: SDK Software Developer
jobs.content:
Do you have a flair for designing SDKs that make common use cases easy, while keeping the SDK highly flexible for unknown scenarios? Do you like to stay ahead of the market and design with tomorrow's technologies in mind? In this role, you will be tasked with building software that works on today’s existing systems and cutting-edge technology. You’ll be partnered with equally passionate programmers on a dynamic, integrated team creating best-in-class .NET SDKs for all Windows platforms as well as Xamarin to support other developers building great apps on top of Esri’s geolocation systems.

We’re looking for someone with .NET development skills and proficiency in C# and C++ who’s interested in a truly collaborative experience, where they'll work closely with other developers across all the platforms we support. Propelled by Esri’s desire to incorporate the latest advances, if Microsoft introduces something new, you’ll have it in your hands, not just be reading about it online. Our SDKs are used by municipalities, major industries, utilities, retail businesses, emergency services, defense, and the military, so what you create will make a real difference in the world. If you’re smart, driven, and know how to get things done, we’ll give you the latest and best tools to do it.

Responsibilities: 



  • Develop and design modern .NET APIs

  • Build software that follows industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment models

  • Collaborate with API designers and developers throughout the development process

  • Stay up to date with the latest technologies, trends, and best practices

jobs.title: Software Engineer - .Net/C#
jobs.content:
Are you a talented .NET/C# developer? Do you have a passion for solving development problems with distributed systems? If so, apply your skills to develop web services for Esri’s ArcGIS Online hosted services, which allow our users to expose a map or dataset on the web without having their own GIS server. As a member of our ArcGIS Online team, you’ll help build the next generation of these innovative services.


Responsibilities: 



  • Create web services components that follow industry-standard design patterns, development methodologies, and deployment models

  • Assist in bringing excellent software to the ArcGIS platform

  • Work closely with other developers to design and develop quality APIs that scale to millions of users

  • Write comprehensive technical design specifications and support documentation

jobs.title: Creatives (multiple roles/disciplines)
jobs.content: Foxley is hiring a Creatives (multiple roles/disciplines) anywhere

jobs.title: Fullstack Javascript Dev
jobs.content:
We're looking for a person with the right blend of experience in both front-end and back-end development, a love for coding and learning, and the ability to work in a fully-remote environment.  A high-energy person and strong communicator who can join an expert team and work with limited direction.  


This is a contract to help us rapidly expand our new product.  USA citizens only please.


The Work:



  • Work on our social media management and analytics suite of products

  • Interact with the major Social Media APIs and technology partners

  • Build Angular and React features on top of JS API and microservices


The Environment:



  • 100% remote team

  • Agile approach, mostly SCRUM-based and Kanban

  • Platform based on MEAN stack + RabbitMQ (microservices architecture)

  • Starting to build with React and React-Native

  • Cloud-based hosted infrastructure (AWS, Heroku, MongoDB Cloud, etc)

  • Slack, Hangouts and other online collaboration tools


The Perks:



  • 100% remote work

  • Competitive pay

  • Trust, autonomy, empowerment


This is just scratching the surface -- we're a fun team of people who love what we do!  If this sounds good so far then reach out and we'll share the details.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Help us reach 1M connected devices.


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers. Pershing Square hosts a farmer's market and food trucks on a weekly basic.


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong Front-End Engineer eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces. Think air-traffic control for city bus fleets.

  • Delivering intuitive user interfaces used by millions of bus riders annually.

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data.

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption.


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Agile process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan w/ match, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

jobs.title: CTO's Right Hand - Software Developer
jobs.content: Software developer to assist the CTO in expanding the software capabilities and functionality of our system, and becoming a key team player as backup to the CTO.  Will work with the company's founders and CTO to respond to growing market demands for increased functions and interfaces with partner software.  Ideal candidate will be located in southern California, but remote locations acceptable for the proper candidate.

jobs.title: PHP Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking mid to senior level PHP developers to work full-time contributing to the success of our SaaS platform. With more than 5,000 customers in both the enterprise and SMB space, our developers get to make a big impact on the applications and markets they serve.


We are looking for developers who have experience in some sort of object-oriented PHP  framework (we use Symfony), and have made contributions to production applications. As a PHP developer at PrintSites, you will be responsible for crafting features from idea to production, including collaborating with stakeholders, prototyping solutions, building the actual thing, debugging and testing, and working with QA.


Looking to expand your skills beyond PHP? We also use Python (Django) and JavaScript (Ember, Backbone, Node.js). You’ll get a wide berth to select the right tool for the right job and have plenty of opportunity to grow.


Tools we use


Git, Jenkins, Aegir, Ansible, Xdebug


JIRA, Confluence


PhpStorm


Linux, Vagrant, Memcached, Varnish


and lots more...

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Concur R&D
jobs.content:
As a core member of Concur’ s Minnesota R&D Center, you will be designing and building the next generation of our end-to-end solutions spanning Concur’ s  product line.  We run small teams with a purpose, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the project, including architecture, design, development, and operations.  You believe in being a team player, collaborating and communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.    You bring a result-driven focus, high enthusiasm, energy, confidence, curiosity, and a sense of fun.
Concur has a customer base of over 30 million end users and year-over-year growth exceeding 50%.  As a Software Engineer with Concur you will be working on solutions that are key to Concur’ s product delivery and aggressive growth.


In the first 12 months you will be:




    • Developing features at all levels of Concur’s technical stack:  You will be building solutions from end-to-end— for example; standing up new services, coding business logic, improving the UI, as well as taking ownership for product quality and delivery

    • Delivering features in the cloud: You will be creating and scaling features and services that utilize Concur’s cloud as well as other commercial platforms such as AWS.

    • Agile Development:  You’ll use Agile Development (Scrum, XP, etc.), Continuous Integration and DevOps concepts (automated deployments, monitoring/alerting, etc.)  You will be collaborating and working with you team members to constantly improve our development process so we can quickly respond to opportunities across our business.
      Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: As part of Concur R&D you will be contributing to architecture, design, development, and operations

jobs.title: Senior SDE - Clojure
jobs.content:
Concur (https://www.concur.com/) is a provider of integrated travel & expense solutions. With over ~100M registered users and ~35,000 enterprise customers, our SaaS stack services a large % of Fortune-500 travel & expense traffic.

We are re-platforming our stack to keep up with customer growth. We are heading towards a service architecture. We are a small team that owns the foundational services on which the new stack is being built.

Description

The Core Services team tackles Identity, Profile-Stores, Authentication, Authorization & the new API stack - all of which is being built in Clojure. Compliance with RFCs/open standards are extremely important to us. We are obsessed with performance, metrics, resiliency, failure proofing, scalability, and complete end to end ownership.

The team is split between Bangalore-India and Bellevue-WA. We are hiring full time programmers for the Bellevue office. Production experience with Clojure, or experience with any Lisp dialect is an obvious plus.

If you are a Clojure/Lisp newbie, you are welcome as long as you have a passion for programming and a willingness to learn.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thorn invites software engineers in the San Francisco Bay Area to join the Thorn Innovation Lab to contribute their talent to create new technology interventions to fight child sexual exploitation. The lab's areas of focus will include human trafficking, darkweb child abuse/exploitation content and social platform cyber safety. Technically, projects in these areas will span a wide variety of engineering and analysis topics relevant to cybersecurity and intelligence including adaptive crawling/scraping, statistical analysis, search, machine learning (NLP, computer vision, sentiment analysis), entity resolution, data pipeline development, UI/API design, and more.


Engineers will participate in both product development as well as broad exploration in the space – working to identify new possible interventions. Engineers must be big thinkers, but also executors,  interested in solving hard problems that require more than just technical skills – including partnership development and learning new subject matter areas.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Engineer
jobs.content:
CyberU is a part of the Cornerstone Startup Accelerator, and we are looking for someone who can create the vision for and execute on the infrastructure for a scalable online video and e-commerce learning platform. If you are smart, passionate, resourceful, and want to be a visionary, founding team member who will help craft the technical architecture and direction of our product, then this is opportunity for you. The ability and passion to design and implement something from nothing is a must, along with long term vision for architecting quality code. Come join our team, and get in on the ground floor of a startup that will revolutionize the consumer learning space.


In this role you will...



  • Work with team to define, document, and communicate the core system platform

  • Ensure the platform meets the needs of front-end application teams as well as internal and end users

  • Ensure platform scalability and performance

  • Ensure the platform is easy to deploy and sustain

  • Ensure platform resiliency and plan for evolutionary paths and pivots

  • Ensure that internal users understand the platform

  • Work as needed on tool and environment selection

  • Produce scalable, robust, high-quality code

  • Manage risk identification and risk mitigation strategies

  • Actively contribute to architectural whiteboard/design session

  • Promote the platform

  • ... and being the rockstar you are, be willing to take on additional responsibilities as needed

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


Reporting to the VP of Technology, the Software Engineer will help develop our proprietary platform -- combining vehicle telematics, a carsharing reservation system, predictive analytics, a customer portal and mobile app.  This is your chance to create something awesome from scratch, with a clean slate and no legacy systems!


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Build client-side user authentication and authorization between multiple applications
