  • Create configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate developer to be the next member of our small developer-owned company (everyone here writes code every day). The ideal candidate would have extensive experience with C#, .NET, and SQL Server. We are looking for someone who has experience building production web applications and is as passionate about helping customers as they are about working with new technologies. We need a candidate that is confident and values freedom (we work almost exclusively from home), but is humble enough to ask questions when they are stuck. We need a candidate who wants to build new things, but doesn’t mind rolling up their sleeves and doing some maintenance work. We know this is a hard mix to find, but if you feel like you’re up for the challenge, please get in touch!

jobs.title: Software Engineer III
jobs.content:
Software Engineer III | Current Openings













Essential Duties:



  • Gathers and writes technical requirements for complex stories and features. Designs smaller stories within a feature. May author technical designs and takes responsibility for features.

  • Codes web applications following specifications and using the appropriate tools. Follows best practices.

  • Maintains and modifies existing applications.

  • Identifies internal/external issues of limited scope and drives to resolution. Proactively seeks and fixes defects.

  • Contributes to project document reviews, and design/code reviews.

  • Adheres to IT Control Policies throughout design, development, and testing.

  • Works with cross-functional teams and interacts with internal business partners to verify/clarify business requirements and design decisions.

  • Engages team to review ideas, solutions, issues, and/or concerns.

  • Applies AGILE concepts and works collaboratively and closely with QA in an Agile/Kanban environment.

  • Generates supporting unit test as well as system test specifications and implementations; can build automated tests.

  • May train and mentor new team members as needed.













Software Engineer III | Current Openings













Competencies:



  • Proficient with multiple technologies and may have some understanding of design principles.

  • Ability to handle multiple projects and possesses a proven track record of high quality deliverables.

  • Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to technical staff and is able to work effectively with cross-functional departments with varying degrees of technical experience.

  • Understands and is able to explain up and downstream impacts across products and teams.

  • Constructively challenges the status quo; develops, proposes, and supports the implementation of innovative and creative solutions. Iterates and improves upon domain technology.

  • Displays flexibility in adapting to changing conditions.

  • Strong team player, makes a valuable contribution to team objectives, displays trust and mutual understanding, accepts constructive feedback, and handles confrontation constructively.

  • Proficient understanding of and ability to apply the AGILE methodology; competent AGILE team member.

jobs.title: Java Development Lead
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations
• Provide clear directions and guidance on technical issues to all team members
• Write high-quality code for web-based applications, to create and improve robust high-volume production applications
• Develop and evaluate prototypes and ideas quickly
• Take the lead in code and architecture reviews
• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products
• Develop JavaScript solutions using standard frameworks including JQuery
• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse
• Assist in acceptance testing for business and technical requirements
• Improve program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance
• Work closely with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables
• Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.
• Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.


Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.

The Role:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java and application specific database tuning on Oracle.

As a senior software developer at Loblaw Digital, you will be presented with opportunities to:

• Develop complex consumer facing software using Java, Spring Framework and Hybris.
• Mentor, coach less experienced developers, through design sessions, code reviews and pair programming.
• Work through hard problems with your team and deliver consistent results.
• Think long term. Create technical roadmap for products or services your team owns.
• With your experience and judgment, influence the business on how software can enhance end user experience.
• Follow agile development principles when the situation calls for it. Use tools such as continuous integration, automated tests and automated deployments to improve product time-to-market.
• Work together with front-end developers and external development agencies.
• Organize and participate in our twice a year hackathons, where technology and business work together to create cool things.

jobs.title: Sr. Python/Django Engineer
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack Web Engineer

jobs.title: .Net C# MVC Developer
jobs.content:
Anexinet is the leading systems Integration and Technology Management firm in the Philadelphia area. The growth of our business has been fueled by our strong relationships with our clients and leading edge technology partners, as well as our employee focused culture where our people feel they are part of a team and are treated with honesty, respect and integrity.  Selected as the Best Place to Work for companies our size in the Philadelphia area for the past six years, we are looking for a few awesome .Net MVC C# developers to join our great Application Development team,


In addition to applying hands-on experience with the technical skills listed below, you will be expected to interact effectively with both business and technology clients, share your knowledge and experience with others in a supportive and learning oriented team environment and have a visible and measurable impact on the success of the project.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
TES is looking for senior software engineers to build and scale our quickly-growing education technology platform.


What you'll do

There's lots to do: You'll work on our San Francisco team designing and building new microservices to help teachers in their classrooms. You'll collaborate with our London teams building REST APIs and writing front-end javascript. You'll write code that powers simple and beautiful UI and makes teachers excited to use the platform. You'll work with our AWS data pipeline to make sure that the work you're doing is having a meaningful impact.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
Overview


As a member of the Computronix development team, you will work in a highly dynamic, fast changing and fluid work environment. You will contribute technical expertise to design, develop, implement or support Computronix software solutions.  


 The Senior Software Developer is part of a team of developers working toward a successful implementation of our web-based workflow management solutions.  This role requires advanced knowledge and skill in a variety of technologies, with a strong emphasis in Oracle relational databases.  Because our solutions are built on an Oracle database platform, Computronix strongly prefers developers who also have database management experience.  Ideal candidates will have the ability to work independently, as well as with a team of developers in a dynamic environment.

jobs.title: Experienced Software Developer for Multi-Domain Consultancy
jobs.content:
We're growing a diverse team of curious, creative people who love helping client solve problems with software. We're looking for thoughtful makers who are passionate about development and have excellent people skills.


Atoms work on self-managed teams of 2-10 designers, developers, and testers—collaborating to make custom products for our clients, from the idea phase through launch and beyond.


As a developer at Atomic, most of your time will be spent writing tests and code. But you'll also participate in the entire lifecycle: Research, Design, & Planning, project management, technical documentation, meeting with the customer, user testing, etc.


Atomic teams are project-based, so you'll get to work with new people and tackle new challenges every 6-12 months.


On each team, one maker (a designer or developer) also acts as Team Lead, managing the budget and backlog and taking the lead on client communication. We expect all makers to eventually grow into this role.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content: Software Engineers are responsible for leading Passport’s application planning and development across all divisions and product lines. This includes managing the product throughout the product lifecycle, gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with our team to deliver a superior product.

jobs.title: Cleantech Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Amber Kinetics is looking for a talented software engineer to build real-time communications and controls systems for a game-changing energy storage technology that has already won major utility contracts. We are looking for a candidate that is self-motivated and loves to learn and work on challenging problems, such as real-time communications, cryptography, and developing performant, fault-tolerant architectures. This position is responsible for architecting, developing, and testing software that will run on real, large-scale energy storage systems around the world.



At Amber Kinetics, we value a healthy work-life balance, engineering-driven decision-making, and developer autonomy and agency. We offer and encourage opportunities for personal and technical growth, and the chance to pioneer new technologies and architectures to solve consequential problems. The company aims to develop the world-leading energy storage technology that will catalyze the renewable energy revolution, and is looking for candidates that share that vision and dedication.

jobs.title: Applications and Web Developer
jobs.content:

jobs.name: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.company: Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
jobs.content:
Summary: The Combat System Development and Assessment Group of APL is seeking an individual to perform software development as part of a team utilizing Modeling and Simulation (M&S) to address complex Air and Missile Defense (AMD) real-world challenges.


The job:

jobs.title: VP, Information Technology
jobs.content:
The Vice President, Information Technology will provide leadership to the technology organization This individual will partner with the CTO to delivery product that help the organization accomplish its strategic objectives. The VP of IT must understand the development process and how to deliver a SaaS based platform. They will hire, assign and manage computer specialists and other technical workers to implement projects. The essence of the role is hands on technology leadership.


Duties/responsibilities:


The VP of IT will be responsible for the Company’s development. The candidate will be responsible for delivering a high quality roadmap.



  • Maintain software development roadmap

  • Servant leader working with other members of the delivery team

  • Partner with the IT organization in identification of data and business systems in support of continued growth initiatives and for improved efficiencies and business decisions.

  • Coach and develop staff and provide timely performance management feedback.

  • Direct and manage IT plans, schedules, policies, and programs.

  • Evaluate risks and create appropriate response plans.

  • Evaluate existing and new and emerging technologies and collaborate with leadership and their staff to research, implement and maintain technology products.

jobs.title: Sr. Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
You will be working in an Agile Scrum environment with the support of an assigned SCRUM Master, dedicated product management and a team of quality engineers to develop new applications, enhancements, and provide maintenance on the existing product.  We are building/enhancing commercial grade SaaS web applications that will service an industry leader in the Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) space.



  • Contribute to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software by participating in design and architecture discussions, and proposing and discussing solutions to systems and product changes that are directly related to the area of focus.

  • Write clean, simple, efficient, modular, maintainable, and well documented code that meets the requirements and the design of the solution.

  • Write Unit and Automation Tests

  • Mentor peers

  • Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection

  • Proactively find and fix software bugs. Offer your feedback on ways to improve product(s) features, workflow, design, security and coding patterns

jobs.title: Director Security Operations Center
jobs.content:
Director Security Operation Center


Position Overview


The Director Security Operations Center [SOC] has strong expertise in Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP), network security monitoring and incident response. The Director SOC will lead key MSSP program elements including the following areas Predictive monitoring, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Threat Hunting and Cyber Security Risk Assessments. This role will be responsible for security awareness and enforcement, accomplished by pulling together information from a variety of systems; and normalizing and correlating the information. The SOC provides real-time detection and reaction services for information security incidents within the company.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Perform in-depth network security analysis and work with the SOC analyst team conducting incident response, event analysis and threat intelligence for the corporate enterprise

  • Provide both strategic analysis and near real-time auditing, analyzing, investigating, reporting, remediation, coordinating and tracking of security-related activities for the corporate enterprise

  • Analyze data and prepare reports that document vulnerabilities from network based attacks and recommends actions to prevent, repair or mitigate these vulnerabilities

  • Provide technical mentoring to other team members

  • Establish and create standard operating procedures for a variety of computer network defense (CND) related tasks/positions within the team

  • Provide technical expertise on post event network security logs and trend analysis

  • Review security events that are detrimental to the overall security posture; analyze and detect sophisticated and nuanced attacks and discern false positives and provide results to management

  • Perform correlation of events from a variety of network, enterprise and host collection sensors

  • Coordinate and liaise with other departments within the company and external auditors with information regarding intrusion events, security incidents, and other threat indications and warnings information

jobs.title: Principal Security Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Principal Product Engineer


Position Overview


The Principal Product Engineer is responsible for continuously protecting our critical information assets, assuring compliance with corporate and regulatory policies & industry best practices, while simplifying, enhancing and enabling business initiatives. This role is responsible for providing technical guidance focused on information security architecture, including all security R&D, analysis and design for all corporate computing systems to prevent unauthorized access from both internal and external perspectives. This role is considered to be a SME in one or more of the information security disciplines supporting the design, implementation and management of the organizations information security architecture.


Key Responsibilities



  • Responsible for the selection, implementation and maintenance of all security tools across the enterprise

  • Partner with Technology teams to implement security solutions and work closely with these teams as alerts and issues are identified and escalated by the MSSP

  • Collaborate with Enterprise Security Architect to design and complete comprehensive security architecture by evaluating existing tools, looking for opportunities to consolidate and/or replace for better coverage and cost efficiencies

  • Serve as the subject matter expert in the tools: (ex. Trend Micro, Beyondtrust, Arcsight, Red Seal, Qualys, Carbon Black, Splunk, Tripwire) and work with the MSSP to ensure optimal efficiencies for their security monitoring

  • Serve as an escalation path for potential alerts from the MSSP

  • Execute and/or coordinate security/vulnerability testing of web-baed applications and associated infrastructure on a regular basis

  • Plan, coordinate and execute incident response activities related to detection, investigation, containment, eradication, recovery, and remediation/mitigation

  • Advise the engineering team about information security threats, technologies and related regulatory requirements

  • Track information security issues to closure by partnering with CISO, communicating solutions, and verifying remediation

jobs.title: Senior Security Engineer  Incident/Threat Intelligence
jobs.content:
The Sr Security Engineer is responsible for assuring compliance with corporate and regulatory policies/standards & industry best practices, while simplifying, enhancing and enabling business initiatives. The Sr Security Engineer is responsible for developing and utilizing information security threat research sources to collect, store, assemble and evaluate leading edge technology related threats.


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop, utilize and share a wide variety of research sources to create a team wide intelligence base of information, from which to draw inferences and summaries.

  • Assist in the identification and communication of trends, providing recommendations to business counterparts and leadership, regarding OUTR related threats.

  • Responsible for providing technical leadership and expert level consultative services focused on Threat Intelligence. Ensure that all layers of the network and application infrastructure integrate in a secure fashion.

  • Develop and utilize standard processes, techniques, and procedures to collect, review, process, and evaluate intelligence information from a variety of internal and external sources, including Law Enforcement and private/public industry security associations.

  • Use creative methodologies and technologies to develop and communicate trends, patterns, profiles, estimates, and tactical interdiction information as well as to solve unusual problems related to threats with a direct or indirect impact to the brand, business operations, technology infrastructure and client trust.

  • Work with the Enterprise Risk group to conduct company-wide risk analysis assessments to determine/forecast potential risk exposures.

  • Proactively use intelligence information to develop, design, communicate and implement countermeasures and assess the criticality of countermeasures.

  • Prepare reports, assessments, materials for publications, statistical or financial summaries and other material concerning Threat and Intelligence program operations.

  • Lead and execute Information Security projects related to Threat and Intelligence. Develop, execute on and communicate project tasks, timelines, and status information.

  • Stay current with information security trends and provide intelligence in the areas of intrusion techniques, social engineering, technology, and security specific solutions.

  • Participate as a member of the Security Incident Response Team, acting as a security first responder.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
You will be working on the team that creates and expands the Peloton ecosystem on the web. You and your team will be working on the front lines to implement a complicated user experience that can be seamless for both Mobile and Web users. In our planned expansion, our website is an essential part of providing metadata to current and potential Peloton Riders. We are looking for engineers who are excited about developing complex, interactive websites that have very thoughtful UX/UI. Currently, the team is working on building out an A/B testing platform, re-working out e-commerce check out flow, and actually migrating some of our Codebase to React. In addition, you will:



  • Gain experience working with Open Source tools like Typescript, Sass, Jade and more.

  • Implement Peloton Cycle’s web experience leveraging our real time REST API

  • Work within an agile development environment with peer engineers on a daily basis to scope, develop and deliver a software experience that realizes the product strategy

  • Make unique software with a great team dedicated to disrupting a category.

jobs.title: Technical Program Manager
jobs.content:
The Technical Program Manager will drive planning, project execution, and development for our engineering team. It will be your responsibility to be relentless in getting things done. As the scrum master, you will help our engineering teams maintain organization while continuing to improve on process and communication. It will be your job to wear multiple hats, and go beyond the normal expectations.

You will be joining a company that creates positivity, community, and fitness with technology. You will work with smart engineers, designers, and product managers to build and improve our commerce platform (web, mobile, logistics), iOS app, CMS, home bike tablet, live streaming services, and other back-end services. In addition you will:



  • Be the Scrum Master, evangelist, and coach for agile development

  • Help create self-organized, empowered teams that drive continuous improvement

  • Coordinate and help come up with solutions, and remove impediments

  • Wear multiple hats with willingness to go beyond your own role

  • Specify project constraints, and provide mitigation plan

  • Help build consensus between teams

jobs.title: Sr. Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
IDG is looking for a Sr. Dev Ops Engineer to join the engineering team in San Francisco!


IDG is a global media, data, and services company with one of its many offices located in the SOMA neighborhood of San Francisco. Excellent benefits including health (medical, dental, and vision), 401k, fitness reimbursement, pre-tax commuter program and fantastic time off allocations are available to all employees starting day one of employment.


Responsibilities:



  • Automate, configure , optimize and scale Linux server environments (over 120 systems) responsible for support the day-to-day operations of a terabyte size high-performance IDG’s Digital Media Groups website farm serving our web properties to include sites such as Macworld, PCWorld, TechHive, CIO, Javaworld, Greenbot, Computerworld, and IDG.tv to name a few.

  • Working with engineering to lead troubleshooting efforts and to find  ways to make our current applications more cost-efficient.

  • Ensuring that systems and network changes occur without adversely affecting the stability of the production environment.

  • Enabling rapid deployment of new product features with the necessary safeguards to maintain stability, high availability and performance.

  • Working with senior Technology Leaders (Operations, QA, Development) on the Ops project roadmap and completing all critical projects on time as planned.

  • Working collaboratively with Engineering and business stakeholders so that critical business needs are met.

  • Build and deploy the internal toolsets when necessary to optimize network, infrastructure, monitoring and deployment

jobs.title: Take part in our residential sustainable energy revolution
jobs.content:
Experienced full stack .NET software developer


We are looking for a senior developers, with extensive .NET experience, passionate to apply his/her skills towards solving exciting, challenging real-world problems. This is an opportunity to get deeply involved in hands-on, cutting edge development work on automated remote quoting for sustainable energy solutions using 3D models and database learning. Our candidate will have senior level programming skills and has state of the art understanding of modern web-development.


A few examples of our systems currently in use are:



  • Automated Sustainable Energy Advice Shop: Enabling home owners to get personalized sustainable energy advice just by entering their zip code. The shop generates a 3D model by using LIDAR data and other open data sources. Based on this 3D model and our housing database the advice on solar panels, wall insulation, heat- pumps and other sustainable measures is generated automatically.

  • Solar Remote Quote: an application used by solar panel installers to remotely measure tilted roofs in images, design a solar system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

  • Wall insulation Remote Quote: An application used to generate automated wall insulation quotes, by auto recognition of windows and remote surface measurement.


We offer:



  • A lot of responsibility within our development team to make the difference by deploying your knowledge to make sustainable energy solutions available to the general public;

  • High pace, short development cycles, result driven;

  • Interesting imaging and computer vision challenges;

  • Flexibility and freedom of choice in the use of tooling and techniques;

  • Flexible working hours, or partially working from home;

  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues.

jobs.title: Work in Barcelona - Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a DevOps star to join our friendly international team. What would be your daily duties:



  • Maintain fleet of Linux servers (Debian and CoreOS)

  • Take care of our cutting edge technologies. We are using Ansible, Docker, Couchbase, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, Airflow and many more

  • Work closely with the development team to implement projects

  • Design and implement Continuous Deployment pipeline. You will have full freedom on how to do that

  • Maintain Infrastructure as a code approach. We are using Ansible but open for any other solution, that fits our needs

  • Automate your daily work with any scripting language you already know or eager to learn

  • Integrate in-house and cloud solutions

  • Support our cloud infrastructure (GCE)

  • Able to choose right technical solution for the situation and motivate why you did that

  • Create documentation and ensure it is always up to date

jobs.name: Part Time Full Stack Invoice To

jobs.title: Part-time, Full-stack Web Developer
jobs.company: Part Time Full Stack Invoice To
jobs.content:
Background

I built Invoice.to as a side project and solution to my search for a simple and elegant invoicing app that works on every screen.

Here is the site : https://invoice.to

Here is a sample : https://invoice.to/ZMgJyk47Uq.

Here on Product Hunt : https://www.producthunt.com/tech/invoice-to-2

It's built with HTML, CSS & Jquery, PHP, MongoDB. It runs on Heroku, uses Mailgun and Stripe APIs.

You are

  • A full-stack web developer
  • Someone who resonates with the solution
  • Interested in working on a regular basis (5-20 hours/week)
  • Have full command on both front (HTML, CSS, JS) and backend (PHP, MongoDB)
  • Experienced in open source projects (more than 2 contributors)
  • Familiar with Heroku, Oauth, Mailgun and Payment systems (Stripe, Paypal, ACH etc.)

You'd be working on

  • Opensourcing and maintaining the project on Github
  • New features (i.e payment integrations, user backend)
  • Bugs and fixes
  • Documentation
  • Refactoring

jobs.title: C# GUI Software Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for an individual to create custom user interfaces for the unique specialty machines and systems that we build. We also have a core library that this individual would use and continue to develop for rudimentary, reoccurring needs.  The applications can be quite graphical and often involve communication with other devices such as bar code scanners, laser markers, PLC’s, engine controller, robots and more.  In some cases the application may also collect high speed DAQ data or control a machine. There is a good balance between sitting on the tube all day and seeing things work. There are opportunities to become multi-dimensional in the form of being exposed to other forms of engineering and having the opportunity to program different devices. We are always doing something different, so the boring factor is low!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer - Sporting Big Data
jobs.content:
As Senior DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for the provisioning, administration, and security of all our privately hosted hardware. You will also be in control of packaging and deploying applications from our development team, holding them to the highest standards.


Our technology needs to be available globally meaning real-time data replication between Europe and Asia. If you think you have what it takes then we want to hear from you.


What you will be doing



  • Making sure that our products are available real-time in low latency around the world

  • Designing, building and allocating server resources as required by applications

  • Making sure our internal tooling is always working and redundant across data centres (LDAP, Mail, etc)

  • Making sure our systems are hacker proof

  • Ensuring that our applications have fast and redundant networking connections for uninterrupted operation

  • Ensuring that our Disaster Recovery plan will not fail

  • Managing tooling for application systems including Hadoop

  • Creating, supporting and maintaining our continuous delivery platform helping our teams increase the quality and speed

  • Creating and administering application packaging and deployment for development teams

  • Working closely with other engineers to advocate sensible, scalable, systems design and share responsibility with them in diagnosing, resolving, and preventing production issues

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content: .NET Developer is responsible for development, support and maintenance of complex components of a project module

jobs.title: Back End Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Back End Software Engineer to join our small, dynamic, fast-moving team. You will be focused on our image processing platform, which is responsible for generating maps and 3D-models of data all around the world. As an early stage contributor, you'll have the opportunity to take ownership of key parts of the software and drive them forward.

Where You Can Make an Impact

  • Develop and release new features on Map Engine.
  • Effectively and timely debug new issues within the production system.
  • Develop high quality, reliable, tested software.
  • Inspire innovation and cultivate an environment of continuous improvement.
  • Advocate for modernizing team practices and tools. Continuously educate yourself and others on the newest technical advancements.
  • Ensure your technical decisions support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security.
  • Write clear, maintainable and high-performance code.
  • Diagnose problems and improve performance in a container infrastructure.
  • Influence the back-end and other teams with best practices and experience.
  • Work cross functionally with infrastructure and front-end teams.

Your Experience

  • Bachelor’s, Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • You have excellent Python development skills.
  • Familiarity with Linux environment specifically Ubuntu.
  • Demonstrated experience building and delivering high-quality software.
  • Comfortable troubleshooting new systems and environments.
  • Comfortable with AWS technologies like S3, SQS and EC2.
  • Available to work within our San Francisco office.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with image processing, OpenCV, GIS programming, Docker.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, like MongoDB.
  • Familiarity with computer vision, photogrammetry or structure-from-motion a plus.
  • A consistent track record of taking initiative and ownership of problems.

Why You Should Choose Team DroneDeploy?

DroneDeploy is the leading cloud software platform for commercial drones, making the power of aerial data accessible and productive for everyone. Trusted by businesses and individuals in over 80 countries worldwide, we are transforming the way drone users collect, manage and digest impactful data in a variety of industries, including agriculture, real estate, mining and construction. Simple by design and easy to use, DroneDeploy builds revolutionary software compatible with any drone. If you’re excited about drones and want to help us create a simple and seamless experience for drone users across the world, we’d love to hear from you!

Life at DroneDeploy

We’re a team of star wars loving, hot sauce eating, tech enthusiasts with inspirational talents. Everyone is empowered to explore and implement new ideas and improvements. We enjoy our collaborative office environment and encourage each other to push boundaries. We host weekly Friday night BBQs on our rooftop deck, offer great salaries, generous equity,100% employee health coverage, unlimited vacation and delicious catered meals among other perks.

DroneDeploy is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: GUI Developer
jobs.content:
You will begin as an individual contributor, optionally growing to lead the team that will design and implement the browser-based user interface for a range of cyber security applications used to both manage and analyse results from security sensors. Candidates wishing to remain an individual contributor are definitely encouraged to apply.


WE DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES ENGAGE WITH OUTSIDE RECRUITERS

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
We’re a growing company that creates local marketing automation software and we’re looking for a senior level developer to help work with our biggest customer.



We build enterprise level solutions for Fortune 500 customers and need an engineer who is a developer at heart but gets the big picture. Our web-based systems produce all forms of advertising from ads, flyers, emails, flash banners, restaurant menus and any other advertising collateral you can think of.



What is local marketing automation?
We build web applications for large companies that have many local locations. Those local locations want to build brand marketing materials that include their contact information and allows them to customize the material to their needs, without violating brand standards. Our tool allows the brand to lock down the aspects they don’t want to be editable and the local user to customize the parts that make the material unique to them.


Who we Seek


We have developed and maintain many integral parts of our biggest customer’s internal systems ranging from digital asset management to offer management. We need a developer that can help see a project from beginning to end. An ideal candidate would be able to understand our customer’s needs for a feature, help the project manager come up with a specification, implement, and deploy it.

jobs.title: PHP Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking to hire a PHP developer with a good grip on OOP and MVC. That's about all you probably need to know if you want to apply, so we'll spend the rest of the text limit here telling you about the job.


Who we are: Sourcetoad is a dev studio in Tampa, FL. We work with some pretty huge clients, on really interesting projects. You will not be bored here, guaranteed.


We don't have any non-technical staff. Our project managers are programmers, our business developers are made to learn to code, so this is a nerdy place to work. 


What we do:


We build mobile apps, middleware, and web applications, and we do it well. On the backends, we like working with frameworks (mainly Laravel and Yii2), and would want you to have experience with one of those or something similar. We understand that as long as you have a fair grip on MVC, you'll be ok.


What you get: Competitive pay, health, dental, and vision insurance. We give our people top of the line equipment, cool toys, and a casual, supportive work environment... oh, and free beer. You will get time to work on a passion project, and have support of the company behind you, and a developer-centric management philosophy. We try and make it a fun place to work, and to give developers a place where they can learn, grown, and build awesome stuff.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
DeMark Analytics is growing rapidly and searching for JavaScript developers to join our team in building a cutting-edge real-time web application.


We love JavaScript and are driven to innovate and impress. Our focus is writing “non-frameworky” code with small modules in an agile environment, and we openly embrace and encourage new ideas and solutions.


We believe that a collaborative environment with nice people makes a huge difference personally and professionally, so being self-motivated and able to work with a team is more important than being a rock star or a ninja.

What You Will Be Doing:



Working with senior team members to build out a real-time web application that consumes and displays large amounts of data.

jobs.title: Senior UI Engineer
jobs.content:
We need a Senior UI Engineer for a team focused on building new products. Ideal candidate has extensive experience with JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, Angular, and great JavaScript fundamentals in a commercial software development environment. Looking for a fast-paced startup environment with stability of a fast-growing and profitable company? This is the place for you. 


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Management and Development team members on technical design to come up with compelling solutions to problems

  • Own all aspects of implementation for features from design to development, deployment to production, and support and maintenance

jobs.title: Technical Architect for Software Development
jobs.content: The Technical Architect provides overall direction and framework for software development teams while working side-by-side to develop software and write code.  This position requires strong technical vision and ability to communicate that vision into fruition.

jobs.title: Lead Developer in Finance Industry
jobs.content:
This is an exceptional opportunity for an exceptional candidate.  We are seeking a passionate technologist to join us at an inflection point for both our firm and industry as technology is reshaping the investment world.  No experience in finance or investing is required, just a sense of intrigue by all the ways in which technology is disrupting finance, investing, and trading.  You will have a front row seat and take an active part in this transformation.


Technology has always been a central component of our business philosophy.  Technology initiatives are managed by the firm’s Risk and Quantitative Research group, the 3 members of which have deep technical expertise.  The collaborative dynamic of this group is designed to stimulate creativity and provide an environment for each member to maximize personal potential.  There will also be interaction with team members across all groups within the organization – investments, operations, investor relations, and marketing.  We are seeking candidates who have a strong desire and aptitude for learning about all aspects of our business in order to best understand how and where to apply technology most effectively.


Ideal candidates will have demonstrated proficiency in a variety of languages/platforms (preferably C# and/or Python) and have interest in learning new ones.  We believe in utilizing the right tool for the job, so a key part of this role will be ongoing evaluation of new technologies to incorporate into our stack and owning the implementation thereof.  Most of all, the right candidate will have an entrepreneurial attitude, long-term focus, and be excited to grow with the firm.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
SayKara is building an intelligent personal assistant for physicians in a radical re-imagining of healthcare technology interaction.


As a full-stack developer, you will build on our existing framework, help brainstorm, prototype, and conceptualize new features, and work closely with the lead developer and product designer to deliver a seamless experience.


If working on difficult yet meaningful challenges at an an early-stage startup with an experienced team of engineers and entrepreneurs sounds exciting - we want to hear from you.

jobs.title: Windows DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Cardinal IP/ Cardinal Holdings is looking for a DevOps engineer with a background in operations, an affinity for software development and comfortable in being an all-around generalist. DevOps engineers report to the Application Development Manager, and work to design, maintain, and improve infrastructure related to our primary focus of web application development.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Manage and troubleshoot all aspects of the CI systems (TeamCity/Octopus), help diagnose incidents in all development environments (test, stage, production), work with AD groups.
Assist developers with roadblocks and issues, and help accelerate implementation of project goals.
Methodically research complex problems many of which may be outside your existing knowledge and at least come up with ?need to answer questions.
The individual in this position should also be comfortable scripting, especially in Powershell.
Be extremely comfortable with windows stack and unafraid to venture into the Linux world.

jobs.title: Senior Systems Engineer, DevOps
jobs.content:
As a Senior Systems Engineer at Seven Bridges you will...



  • Collaborate with colleagues across the world to design, develop and implement solutions that meet the specific needs of leading genomics research organizations.

  • Work on automating our deploy system, infrastructure and application monitoring.

  • Work to constantly improve the quality and stability of our system and help us to scale highly dynamic infrastructure running hundreds of servers in parallel.

  • Work with individuals from multiple departments to identify and implement technical approaches to improve company collaboration.

  • Meet with clients to understand their needs and the technical capabilities of their system.

  • React quickly to issues and resolve them with grace and professionalism.

jobs.title: Hiring Automated Test Engineers
jobs.content: SURGE is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior automated test engineers who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors (no W2) on a variety of software development projects.

jobs.title: Hiring Senior Software Engineers
jobs.content: SURGE is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior-level software engineers who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors (no W2) on a variety of software development projects.

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content:
You have the unique opportunity to build a technology team from the ground-up for one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in the food delivery space.


SnackNation is a different kind of B2B SaaS – Snacking as a Service that is.  The Company currently delivers a curated, healthy snacking experience to more than 2,000 of the most innovative businesses across America, all on a membership/recurring basis. As the “Snacking Marketplace for Millennials,” SnackNation is connecting the top, emerging CPG brands with previously inaccessible consumers, and is democratizing the CPG landscape.


We are looking for a hands-on VP of Engineering / CTO with experience leading teams and interfacing with stakeholders to solve the complex operational challenges that SnackNation faces today.


Reporting to the COO, you will have the opportunity to build your own team to expand upon our platform to solve the technology challenges of tomorrow: providing insights to brands, product recommendations to customers, and building a direct-to-consumer relationship through eCommerce & mobile.


Skills:



  • You love to code. And you really love to code in Ruby.

  • On every system you work on, you understand the architecture as a whole, and you’re always striving to improve it.

  • You have a firm grasp of the SDLC and Agile methodologies. You can capture functional requirements in meetings with stakeholders and convert them into clear technical specifications, specifically with UML.

  • You know how to plan resources and set a delivery schedule for your team to meet stakeholder requirements and deliver software on time.


Experience:



  • Significant experience with Ruby on Rails in a professional environment.

  • At least 6 years of overall experience writing software in a professional environment, with significant exposure to Ruby on Rails and Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) tools.

  • Experience overseeing other engineers in a formal management role.

  • Hands-on experience in operations in a Linux environment at some point in your career, demonstrating your ability to deploy and debug a running system (outside deploying via Capistrano or Heroku).

  • Experience with AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or other cloud platform.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a talented web developer with a passion for what you do and a desire to own projects start-to-finish?  Do you thrive in small environments and truly enjoy collaboration?   Can you handle the elasticity of goals inherent in start-ups while still being mindful of the big picture?


If you answered an emphatic yes to all of the above, then we need to talk!

jobs.title: Employee #1 at Laravel
jobs.content:
Hi, I'm Taylor Otwell, the creator of the Laravel framework, Forge, Envoyer, and Spark. Laravel has grown faster than I could ever imagine in the last five years. With the continued growth of Forge and Envoyer, the time has come to find someone to join me on this adventure!

I am looking for someone with a deep knowledge of the Laravel framework, JavaScript, HTML, and Bash scripting to help maintain Forge, Envoyer, Spark, Laravel. Who knows, we may even tackle a few new projects! ;)

This position is fully remote and is open to anyone in the world!

Job Responsibilities

  • Lead developer role on Forge and Envoyer
  • Adding new features to Forge and Envoyer
  • Maintaining existing features on Forge and Envoyer
  • Assisting with Laravel Spark development
  • Assisting with customer support for all Laravel products
  • Assisting with Laravel open source development, issue management, and pull requests
  • Researching new technologies that may be of benefit to Laravel
  • Assisting with development of future Laravel projects which are probably entirely top-secret and highly classified

Required Skills

jobs.title: Director of Customer Support and Hand-holding
jobs.content:
About CoachAccountable
CoachAccountable is a platform for coaches to structure and support coaching work done with their clients (think business coaching, fitness programs, life coaching and so on).

It's going well, and after 4 years my days of doing this as a one-man shop are numbered as business continues to grow.  I'm looking for an independent, sharp and personable individual to join me as CA's first hire and gradually take over the customer support side of things.  Think startup-like freedom but with the stability of an established company.

There are 3 pillars to the position:

I. Fielding Customer Support Issues
Currently relatively low volume, I can usuallyknock it out in a morning an evening session of 30-45 minutes each. Answering questions, directing attention to how to do this or that, andoften pointing out a given article or tutorial video which wouldanswer the specific question but also teach other related goodies. Loads of opportunity to be more awesome by pointing out related things theymight be looking for, and thereby educating users further on how to best use thesystem.

II. Developing the Inline Support Knowledge Base
We're building an inline help system, a collection of interconnected articles based onvarious sections and features within the system. Much of thematerial already exists scattered about in the blog, manuals, etc. It is to be recompiled with updated screen shots, and 2 or 3 versionswritten for each topic: one as an internal reference for support staff, one for coaches, and one for clients (for client-facing features). There isalso much to be written from scratch to flesh out the content tocompletely represent all the system does (as a one-man shop I indeed haven't kept things fully up to date!).

III. Customer Hand holding and Concierge Service
SO often folks benefit massively from just beingshown around the system, helping them get acquainted with whicheverfeatures would serve a given coaching style or program. CA iswickedly powerful but it takes something for folks to find andrealize the benefit of that power, and so often folks left to theirown devices just wonât bother, either under utilizing the system orjust walking away from it. CoachAccountable is very much in thebusiness of teaching coaches to be better coaches, and someonereaching out proactively to offer that sort of guidance holds greatpotential to grow the business. Itâs the sort of support thatbleeds into being a sales role.

Succeeding in this looks like...
Being a clear writer and a patient, personable teacher are key to this.  Being technically sharp and able to quickly learn a software system is nice, but if you're not a whiz at this sort of thing already it's fine because you'll learn and get fluent with how the system works through experience soon enough.

I'm looking for someone who is keen to grow and evolve with this role over the long haul, someone who really learns the system and excels at teaching coaches how to be better and get great value out of the platform will become more and more valuable over time.  Because it's an early stage company there is a LOT of room to innovate and make yourself massively valuable, while enjoying a wide variety of (hopefully!) intellectually stimulating and satisfying work.  I know what I need today, and together we can co-create your role as we continue to build the team and infrastructure to make a fabulous machine of customer support and on boarding.  Doing webinars and making screen casts for example are two directions in which you might branch out within this role.

Structure of the job
Structurally, the role will begin with an emphasis on you learning the system and easing in to fielding support emails as you learn (i.e. Pillar I above).  Once you get the hang of that you'll add in Pillar II and begin flexing your copy writing chops to write informative and illustrating articles on how the system works.  Finally once your fluency with the system is comprehensive enough you'll be able to move on to Pillar III outreach and hand-holding to compliment your other duties.

Hourly contract basis to start, $30/hour.  If you're awesome and twist my arm I'm willing to consider starting higher.  Again, I view this role as having greatpotential to grow the business and so the right person, one who's able excel from the start and grow over time, is worth a lot.  I imagine the role to commence part time and grow into a full 40 hours a week within a month or two as you get up to speed and are ready to take on more responsibility.  When we're both clear this is a great fit and love working with each other we can make your position a full time salaried one.

Speaking of loving working together, it is my intention that whomever takes this position LOVES their role, and I'll do whatever is in my power to make that happen.  I'll be relating to you as a competent, responsible adult and give you as much freedom as possible (within the needs of the role) to do your thing independently, where and whenever works best for you.  I want this work to be interesting and life giving to you, varied and purposeful from the interactions you have.  For this to work you have to have at least a baseline love for doing customer support, for being a guide over the phone, and for doing writing that teaches.

Application Instructions
In any application here is what I'd like to see:

  • A brief introduction of yourself and your experience with customer support and/or teaching in general
  • Your thoughts on how you would ideally like to spend your time among the 3 pillars of the position and why
  • Answers to these two common support questions, so that I can get a sense for your writing style:
      1. I couldn't find CoachAccountable in the app store, is there one?
       2. How can I have the system send out a worksheet for my clients to fill out before our sessions together?

(Everything you'll need to know to answer these questions can be found at http://blog.coachaccountable.com/2015/09/introducing-ca-mobile/ and http://blog.coachaccountable.com/2014/04/appointment-worksheets/)

To apply: Keen to hop on board as employee number 2 in a successful and growing venture? Great. To be considered for the role, send me an email to john@coachaccountable.com. In it please include the items listed in the instructions above. Finally please include your own candid assessment of how likely you are to love this role and why. Having whomever takes this role be blissing their brains out as often as possible is one of my top priorities. :)

We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even image yet. jobs.title: Brooklyn Based Team Lead to Join MIT and NYU Researchers
jobs.content:
Do you like creating and building successful Big Data platforms from scratch? Do you enjoy coaching and leading your team to victory? Are you looking for an ambitious new project to test and grow your skills?


 Come join our brand new, and well-funded, start-up to revolutionize data collection for a wide range of studies extending from health and behavior to education, employment and consumer finances.


We are seeking an experienced and outstanding leader to head our software development team for our Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution for Big Data collection, verification and operations. This PaaS solution will be used in research panels, and it includes mobile apps (Android, iOS) and back-end systems for data ingestion, processing and integration with 3rd party data sets. This solution will be first deployed in the Kavli HUMAN Project (http://kavlihumanproject.org) that is to launch in NYC in early 2017.


 The Human Project, Inc. (HPI) is a brand-new and exciting start-up in Big Data and Predictive Analytics space, called . HPI was founded by world-class researchers from NYU and MIT, and it is developing a revolutionary data collection and analysis platform that will disrupt longitudinal research.


We offer a competitive salary, benefits and equity in this brand new company.


The Software Development Lead will report to Chief Measurement & Technology Officer, and will lead all software development efforts. Key responsibilities include:



  • Create strategy, architecture and roadmap for the PaaS platform and execute on this roadmap,

  • Lead and manage software development and QA teams for mobile apps and back-end systems,

  • Provide technical leadership for the development team,

  • Ensure engineering excellence to deliver robust, secure, scalable and high performance solutions & enhancements in a timely manner,

  • Establish software development lifecycle management best practices,

  • Work closely with operations and data analytics teams to ensure ease-of-use and optimal effectiveness for the platform,

  • Develop key relationships with stakeholders to align platform with both scientific and commercial objectives, and participate in decision making,

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to improve system capabilities and maximize development efficiency.


Company will not offer sponsorship.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
ClarityAd’s software protects from bad ads. We run ads in our custom browser environment in the cloud to gather hundreds of data points. We assess security and compliance for billions of ad impressions daily. Our back-end stores this wealth of data in a way that's usable and efficient, allowing publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time.


You will work with our VP of engineering and back-end engineering team and you will be directly involved in:



  • Setting up a robust and highly scalable backend

  • Optimizing database queries and caching as required

  • Optimizing web server configurations

  • And most importantly, participating in the day-to-day improvement and extension of our product functionalities, for all things backend.


We would love to hire someone with ad tech experience, but we’re ready to train newbies and give you a deep understanding of the ad serving stack and Real Time Bidding (RTB). This environment has grown to such a level of complexity and automation that consuming online media has become an exercise of frustration: Latency, invasive ads, privacy issues, malware/malvertising that exposes users to trojans, ransomware, botnets… The rational option for the audience is to rely on ad blockers. Our unique product suite makes it possible for publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time. We have the secret sauce to disrupt this market for good, annihilate the bad actors and restore confidence in publishers.


We are passionate about solving these issues and we want to grow our team with people who share our vision and ambition.


We use: PHP, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis + Lua, Node.js, C++ (browser sandbox). Our infrastructure includes: AWS EC2 (thousands of VMs) / Route53 / ELB / S3 / Bare metal / lots of exotic hardware in exotic places with exotic vendors all playing nice with Puppet.


We value diversity and we’re not looking to hire candidates whose experience is a perfect match to our tech stack. We expect you to bring your own background and experience to the problems we are solving.


Bragging rights:



  • We routinely are the 1st to report on-going live malvertising attacks to ad platforms, including to Google

  • We increased our volumes by 20x last year and keep getting stronger

  • We have have received mentions in Google’s Security Hall of Fame

  • We’re still an “engineer only” startup, even as our monthly revenue passed into six figures less than 3 years in


The position is not open to remote candidates.


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Health care coverage

  • Health savings account

  • Dependent Care FSA

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:


    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef.  Hadoop, MapReduce. Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The internet is experiencing a transformation – ad blindness and blocking are forcing media companies and advertisers to rethink the way they connect with consumers. This evolution is changing the way we consume content and how we interact with brands. Nativo is enabling this shift by developing the media and advertising platform of the future enabling brands and media companies to engage consumer with content rather than interrupt them with ads.


For brands, Nativo provides the ultimate technology for distributing content into native placements and measuring its impact across premium publications. For media companies, Nativo is the platform of choice for automating the workflows around native ad serving. From the hands and minds of an amazing team, Nativo has engineered a platform that is recognized as the best in market. Nativo is respected, well-funded, and growing rapidly. Nativo is playing a vital role forging the path of media and advertising’s evolution.


We believe in being smart, innovative, pragmatic, polished, and efficient and are looking for remarkable people that identify and fit with those values. The DevOps Engineer will be an integral part of the effort to develop our next generation platform. We want team members who have a passion for leveraging technology and software to solve problems and maximize productivity and efficiency.


WHAT YOU WILL DO



  • Work as part of a small DevOps team to build and manage a resilient and secure infrastructure for application platform.

  • Collaborate with development team to fulfill each other's requirement, create scripts, modify source codes if needed or workarounds (requires solid knowledge of programming)

  • Scale infrastructure to meet rapidly increasing demand

  • Improve automated deployments, monitoring, management and incident response

  • Monitor site stability and performance and troubleshoot site issues

  • Conduct stress, high availability and proof of concept tests

  • Get up to speed and understand our technology stack

jobs.title: IT Project Manager
jobs.content:
This is a virtual, work-from-home position. Must be a U.S. resident


We are growing! Join a department of developers, business analysts, QA, and support specialists who support an entrepreneurial company of over 80 people with industry-leading web applications in areas of subscription-based continuing education, simulation and training, eCommerce, content management, and more. (www.audiologyonline.com | www.speechpathology.com | www.physicaltherapy.com | www.occupationaltherapy.com | www.simucase.com | www.audiologydesign.com )


ABOUT THE COMPANY


We build start-ups and nurture them into mature, successful companies. We are fast-paced, structured, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions and we’re looking for another person to join our cause.


ABOUT THE TEAM


Though we are virtual, we communicate a lot and have a tight-knit group. Our meetings are filled with sarcasm, laughter, and movie quotes. We meet face-to-face several times a year but work primarily on Skype. Everyone works hard, we contribute directly to the success of the company, and we have an excellent work/life balance.


ABOUT THE POSITION


We are seeking an experienced and engaged IT PROJECT MANAGER who is motivated, creative, and fun to extend our current project management capabilities.



  • Full-Time, 8a-5p in your time zone

  • Work from your home office

  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, Internet stipend, etc

  • Must be located in the United States and be legally eligible to work for us without visa sponsorship.

  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once or twice per year for team or project meetings.


 Responsibilities



  • Manage major and minor web application projects from kickoff through development and QA.

  • Produce, organize, and update necessary project plans, documentation, and project asset documents as required by each project.

  • Develop and execute communication plans on a project-by-project basis.

  • Organize and oversee bug and feature request tracking.

  • Work directly with the IT Business Analyst to assist stakeholders in developing project specifications and keeping functional site documentation up to date.

  • Guide projects through effective change control processes.

  • Write and archive final project reports that summarize project successes, challenges, regression analysis and lessons learned.

  • Along with the PMO, help to refine our internal project management process and best practices, meeting the needs of both the start-up and mature business.


TO APPLY


Submit a cover letter with your resume that includes 1) a project you managed that you are particularly proud of and why; 2) a link to a favorite movie clip on YouTube; and 3) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

jobs.title: iOS Developer for Communication Apps
jobs.content:
With 400+ customers in 60+countries, CounterPath’s innovative software technology is changing the way people communicate around the globe. Named one of Vancouver’s fastest growing companies in 2015, we’re growing and have an immediate need for an iOS Developer to join our team.


With 24 patents under our belt and 20 million downloads of our flagship product, we’re changing the face of telecommunications. Our team is diverse. We’re FIFA Certified Soccer Coaches, Authors, Pilots, and Musicians. But what brings us together every day is the love for our technology and the passion for our team’s success.


We’re looking for a talented and energetic iOS Developer to join our Global Engineering team. In this role you’ll work with some of the biggest telecommunications providers in the world and design, develop, and deploy cutting edge mobile communication applications. Some of our clients include AT&T, British Telecomm, and Google. We’re looking for someone who’s highly collaborative, self-motivated, and obsessed with learning.


This is a full time opportunity for employment. This person must be willing to work out of one of five North American offices: Victoria, Vancouver, Kanata, Boston, or Chicago.

The Linux DevOps Engineer will also work closely with the museum's Facilities and Content Strategy departments to support Linux-based AV and digital signage systems. Activision Central Technology (CT) is a group of engineers that collaborate with Activision studios to provide expertise in tools, graphics, systems engineering, and optimization.


The CT tools engineers at times support all parts of the asset creation, build pipelines, and automation across the studios. For example, we provide a centralized server farm, with bespoke systems for continuous integration and testing. We offer expertise in devops-style automation.


Our work also takes us into studio-specific tools, where we help with robustness, optimization, and occasional feature development.


We thrive on finding root causes of instability and slowdowns. We obsess about details and quality.


Today we are looking for engineers at all levels of seniority to help drive these efforts forward. If you are passionate about helping others, excited about unlocking team productivity, and overall love to solve problems, we want to talk with you!

jobs.title: Packaging Associate
jobs.content:
This position is for Pactiv, a company of Reynolds Group Holding Inc. At Pactiv, continuous innovation and development has secured our place as one of the world's largest manufacturers and distributors of foodservice and food packaging products. Pactiv currently produces custom and stock foam, plastic, aluminum, pressed-paperboard, PE coated board, and molded-fiber packaging. Our global force of almost 12,000 team members allows us to supply packers, processors, supermarkets, restaurants, institutions and foodservice industries around the world. Over the years, Pactiv has consistently outpaced the competition in safety, innovation and strategic acquisitions. Want to learn more? Visit www.Pactiv.com.

DESCRIPTION: Provides support for the operation team by working safely to feed material into machines, inspect product for defects and pack finished goods in correct configuration. Notifies Supervisor of quality issues as they arise. Makes minor machine adjustments to minimize interuptions and ensure quality product. Maintains good housekeeping practices, able to work safely in a fast paced environment. Completes paperwork accurately and in a timely manner. Able to complete basic mathematical calculations and follow standard work instructions.

Pactiv is an Equal Opportunity Employer EEO AA M/F/Vet/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs.content:
Description


Are you passionate about quality in software applications? Would you jump at the chance to support and promote quality achievement throughout the organization? Do you yearn to work in a startup culture that leverages the latest technologies, but also value a company that’s stable, financially capable, and expanding at scale?



In the POLITICO Technology team, you’ll get the start up life without the startup grind. We’re expanding our team and revamping our systems with plans to move towards more advanced applications involving mobile, natural language processing, and machine learning. If you want to cut your teeth on the technologies supporting a top digital media business, we’d like to hear from you.


Responsibilities



  • Support testing efforts for both manual and automation.

  • Collaborate with an offshore QA team.

  • Contribute and support the definition of detailed QA schedules, conveying clearly defined milestones for test preparation, execution, and compliance reporting activities and deliverables

  • Demonstrate Creativity with testing ideas, and show flexibility to align with team objectives at all times.

  • Design, develop, and execute detail oriented test scripts and test cases using test plans and project specifications.

  • Work closely with the QA Manager to maintain an efficient QA workflow for product releases and project timelines.

  • Work closely with the development team to maximize overall testing impact and effectiveness.

  • Evaluating and communicating test coverage, “red flags” and anomalies to the QA Manager and Scrum team to aid in making the decision to certify releases.

The ideal candidate will have experience developing and delivering enterprise software solutions. Candidates should be familiar with understanding customer requirements and developing a technical solution to meet those requirements. This is an opportunity to join a growing organization with a focus on providing customized services and products to our commercial and government customers. This is a customer focused team environment requiring excellent communication and time management skills. Travel up to 15% may be required.
