jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Who We Are: 
Consumer Product is responsible for the core features of twitter.com, which includes timelines, tweets, search, trends, tweet details/permalink, and more on web and mobile. Our code operates at massive scale and speed, serving billions of requests per day, connecting hundreds of millions of active Twitter users to real-time information about their lives and the world we live in. 

We’re a full-stack team with expertise in mobile, web, and backend. We’re building out products to enable richer and more interactive content on Twitter for our users, advertisers, and developers. Our technology stack is mainly based on Scala and Java on the backend and Javascript, CSS, HTML on the frontend. 

At Twitter, we believe that good system designs require collaboration so that the end result is simple yet sophisticated. We also promote openness by contributing to open source and sharing our data through Twitter’s API (many are hosted here - 
https://github.com/twitter). Our team sizes here are kept small to encourage individual contributions from team members and promote meaningful collaboration.

Consumer Product is hiring for the following areas: 



  • Recommendations - Combining real time relevance, richer timelines, and recommendations, to put the most interesting content in front of the user at all times.  

  • Product Safety- Keeping our users safe on Twitter. They're building world-class prediction tools and detection systems around detecting spammy actions and responding to spammer attacks on a large scale. 

  • Home- Responsible for everything from the core home timeline, to the signup process, to search and even the logged out version of Twitter.  

  • Web Client - Using web technologies for all the features of twitter.com, which includes timelines, tweets, search, trends and more.  We've recently delivered the new Home Timeline, Moments, GIF Search, Emoji Hashtags and we're working on a brand new mobile web experience!


Who You Are: 



  • A passionate developer ready to design and implement awesome new features through innovation and data-driven iterations at Twitter scale. 

  • Someone that works best in an environment with a sense of urgency and can rapidly iterate on product/platform features.

  • Someone who wants to push limits of product innovation using the latest advancements in technology and methods.

  • A partner with the business! You've worked closely across a variety of teams including product management, interaction designers, and various engineering team. 

  • Someone with a strong knowledge of core CS concepts such as data structures and algorithms

  • Experienced with software engineering best practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documentation)

  • Someone with a detailed approach to testing and quality assurance



Requirements:



  •  B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)


  • Experience with web infrastructure, data analytics, and distributed systems





Here’s all the legal good stuff:We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status

San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What We Need 


A problem-solving, product-building, forward-thinking engineer. The idea of fixing Healthcare appeals to you. You’re ready to help take our product and your career to the next level. You enjoy working with Product, UX, and Engineering teams to hatch progressive, bullet-proof, game-changing products. If you’re looking to join a talented team of visionaries then keep reading! 


What You Will Do 



  • The fact of the matter is you’ll be writing microservices in Java and single page web applications in AngularJS with a growing team of tech heads who love building things with ones and zeros. 

  • Working in a fast-paced work environment that sometimes fails quickly and early, but always learns and improves. 

  • Unshackled by conventional thinking and allowed to use cool technology to solve hard problems.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Scala and Python Full Stack
jobs.content:
View Req 7067BR : Senior Engineer - Software














EchoStar’s Digital Broadcast Centers provide advanced online video delivery and satellite video delivery for broadcasters and pay-TV operators across North America. Through our network of uplink centers, these world-class facilities are also home to EchoStar’s 24/7 traffic, technical operations, and satellite access centers. This team is comprised of experienced professionals dedicated to providing customers with an unparalleled level of service delivering content and programming to over 16 million subscribers every day.

EchoStar is seeking an innovative and passionate Software Developer to join an agile team of software engineers located in Englewood, CO and bring value to market quickly. This team uses the scaled agile methodology to create a developer-driven culture via ceremonies such as big room planning, demos, innovation days, and retrospectives. This position is an opportunity for a creative developer to design, develop, and maintain software that will propel the digital TV and movie delivery industry into the future. If you have a sense of adventure, take pride in writing great software, and strive to build the best products on the planet, we want you on our team here at EchoStar.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop full stack solutions using primarily Scala and Python on Unix and Linux around Oracle and Mongo

  • Participate in the Daily Scrum with the Scrum Master and the Agile Development Team

  • Work with the Product Owner to write User Stories that ensure robustness, redundancy, and scalability

  • Contribute to the Emergent Architecture that identifies problems and solves them

  • Design and write software in a functional style combined with object-oriented techniques

  • Write and execute unit tests and automated acceptance tests  

  • Continually integrate code to a common team trunk and continually deploy to a production system  

  • Research, design, and prototype with Spikes and Refactor Stories

  • Promote teamwork and collaboration by participating in paired programming and code reviews

  • Participate in retrospective discussions to help continuously improve our methods

  • Innovate by enthusiastically participating in Innovation Day and patent harvesting activities

  • Help identify and troubleshoot complex production issues in the customer-facing environment

  • Continually populate a team knowledge repository with design summaries, takeaways, techniques, and tutorials

jobs.title: Technology Manager
jobs.content:
Clean (http://www.cleanprogram.com) is a leading wellness, lifestyle, and detox brand based in Soho, New York City. We are looking for a talented individual to manage all of the technology our business employs to work with our team to provide great technical leadership, and implementations while showing dedication to Clean and our customers. This individual will be a high level participant in forming the product strategy for the company, advising on smart choices for technologies, and wise paths towards implementation, while maintaining a nimble approach towards shifting priorities and requirements. The individual will work directly with the CEO and management of Clean in order to design a product roadmap and deliver against it. Although the Technology Manager will primarily be involved with the management of technological implementations, they will need a strong background in hands on technical development as a full stack developer in order to manage and guide developers


Job Description





    • Ownership of all technical services Clean uses and offers from both a tech and product perspective

    • Act as a partner to executive and management teams in order to manage a roadmap of releases

    • Be a participant in discussions regarding product design as far as technical integration and implementation



    • Lead development on an active live website and be responsible for:


      • Site stability, uptime and consistent, desired functionality

      • Troubleshooting and fixing frontend, backend, and infrastructure issues.

      • Designing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting Magento, and other integrated features such as blogs and forums

      • Evaluating, installing, customizing, and deploying of 3rd party Magento or other vendor extensions and other site enhancements

      • Code reviews, testing, and code deployments

      • Develop and maintain all IT practices and technical documentation

      • Plan, manage, and coordinate implementation of multivariate (A/B) tests and site optimizations

      • Manage front end development for all websites and digital touchpoints


    • Be the “go-to” person for all of Clean’s technical infrastructure and operations


      • Work with department managers to identify technical needs, build requirements, and prioritize new features, updates, and customizations

      • Be the technical point of contact and manager for software vendors, platform providers, and hosting companies

      • Remain up-to-date on new technologies and inform team of important changes and their impact

      • Evaluate technologies to develop action plans, technical strategy, and road maps for company success

      • Research technical issues and provide recommendations to enhance company web sites and operations





Clean prides itself in offering an incredible work-life balance to employees. With full medical coverage, great vacation policy, complementary supplements and cleanse products, a healthy-stocked kitchen, Summer Fridays and smoothies every morning - we make sure you are taken care of. :)

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
WHAT WE OFFER:


1)  The opportunity to help change an enormous industry from the ground up.


2)  A team ­oriented startup culture, with the resources and stability of an established player.


3) The ability to work on the latest technology stacks (MongoDB, Node.js, etc.)


ABOUT US: 


We are an innovative in­house startup at one of the largest life insurance companies globally, that is on a mission to redefine life insurance, making it simple, convenient, and online. 


For the right person this is a unique opportunity that brings the culture of a startup to the stability and backing of a large company. 


You will be part of a small and growing team of experienced technology and customer experience ­focused professionals that values smarts, moving fast, and iterating quickly. You will have the opportunity to work on the latest technology stacks (Node.js, MongoDB) in real production environments and with the backing and resources of a large company.


Their office is based in a WeWork space in New York City and we are looking for like­minded developers, with an interest in financial services innovation, to join our team today.


THE ROLE:


This role includes being one of the primary developers responsible for front­end development on our advanced financial services web application. It also includes working closely with marketing to support customer acquisition efforts requiring technology resources such as blog, landing pages, or campaign needs.


These are essential to success in this role:


      Significant experience developing web­based applications in production environments.


      Thorough understanding of CSS/HTML and modern page layout techniques.


      Experience working with designers cutting up layouts to implement pixel perfect pages.


      Experience with responsive layout and design, preferably with Bootstrap framework.


      Familiarity with website optimization techniques.


      Experience with Javascript as it pertains enhancing web pages, managing 3rd party scripts


      Strong visual design sense and appreciation for developing with a client experience focus


      You must be a high achiever, ambitious, willing to learn and aiming to be a rock star.


      Clear communicator, both written and oral, and able to work with marketing teams effectively.


These skills are a not required but are a plus:


      Programming experience in Javascript or other languages


      Single page app experience (e.g. Angular, Ember etc).


      Some experience with an MVC  framework like Angular, Backbone, Ember etc.


      Experience with web analytics (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc.)


      Experience with social media interfaces and related analytical tools


      Familiarity with SEO and how it affects implementation

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
WHAT WE OFFER:



  • The opportunity to help change an enormous industry from the ground up.

  • A team ­oriented startup culture, with the resources and stability of an established player.

  • The ability to work on the latest technology stacks (mongoDB, node.js, etc.)


ABOUT US:


Our client is an innovative in­house startup at one of the largest life insurance companies globally, that is on a mission to redefine life insurance, making it simple, convenient, and online. 


For the right person this is a unique opportunity that brings the culture of a startup to the stability and backing of a large company. 


You will be part of a small and growing team of experienced technology and customer experience ­focused professionals that values smarts, moving fast, and iterating quickly. You will have the opportunity to work on the latest technology stacks (node.js, MongoDB) in real production environments and with the backing and resources of a large company.


Our office is based in a WeWork space in New York City and we are looking for like­minded developers, with an interest in financial services innovation, to join our team today.


THE ROLE:


You will be joining a small, experienced technology team as one of the main developers responsible for our advanced online financial services application.  Experience with web development is a plus, although more important to us is real programming experience and thoughtfulness about how and why you do what you do.


Your job will require you to work closely with your fellow technology team members, to coordinate with QA resources, and to communicate with business team members in completion of your work.  Working with other developers you might work on items such as: developing components for algorithmic or manual underwriting module, creating workflow tools for routing insurance applications, defining and applying rule sets for third party data feeds, or building customer facing components for taking new business applications. The job will be varied and challenging.


These are essential to success in this role:



  • 3-­5+ years of experience as a developer.

  • Deep knowledge of Google Analytics

  • Extensive experience with past exposure to traditional object oriented languages (e.g. Java, .net, Ruby, Python)

  • A demonstrable experience in building modern, complex customer­facing web applications.

  • Experience with Javascript as a programming language

  • Exposure to modern MVC (Model­view­controller) frameworks

  • Solid grounding in data driven applications and concepts (data/object modeling, database systems)

  • Comfortable expressing and defending points of view while respecting those of others.

  • These skills are not required but are a plus:

  • Testing strategy definition and framework creation

  • Experience with event­driven Java programming (e.g Swing, GWT)

  • Experience and familiarity with financial services or other mathematically oriented applications.

  • Working in a startup or agile development environments

  • Experience in multi­platform web­sites (desktop, mobile).

  • BA/BS in computer science.


COMPENSATION:


Our client pays competitive base salaries and rewards performance. Their salary structure is commensurate with experience. In addition, you will be eligible to participate in their comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).


Our client is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D)

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Ruby on Rails
jobs.content:
We’re growing and need a Full Stack Developer to join our team of world-class designers and developers. Every member of our team is expected to ship top-notch code and take real ownership of their work. This is an opportunity to get down into the trenches of a growing business.


About You:



  • You enjoy working with colleagues you can rely on and learn from, and you bring a lot to the table yourself.

  • You are willing to leave your ego at the door and are open to learning from those around you, but you are also comfortable vigorously debating the right approach to solving problems.

  • You value an engineering culture rooted in collaboration, humility, trust, responsibility, and learning.

  • You stay up to speed on new technologies and introduce them to your teammates.

  • You possess 5+ years of professional programming experience. While we don't use all of them, experience in Ruby, Java, Groovy, Python, Perl, PostgreSQL, or Oracle are great predictors of success.

  • You are an excellent communicator and collaborator, especially with non-technical coworkers.

jobs.name: New Wave Design and Verification, LLC

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.company: New Wave Design and Verification, LLC
jobs.content:
Develop innovative high performance networking products by applying your Linux network programming skills to our high bandwidth, low latency programmable network cards and systems to create solutions to the really hard problems our aerospace, telecommunications, finance and big data clients bring to us to solve.


Work closely with our hardware engineers to design, implement, test and support Linux-based software networking products, including network device drivers and applications. Must possess outstanding problem solving and communication skills to collaborate within and across the engineering and project teams, as well as work independently with minimal supervision.


Perform research and development to create roadmaps to improve and broaden our products and technologies. Assist in the generation of quotes and proposals.


Be committed to sound software engineering principles, and ensure that good processes are in place and being followed. Provide recommendations to improve quality and efficiency.

jobs.title: UX Designer-DeveloperCome help us transform software development
jobs.content:
Phase Change Software is looking for an experienced UX developer. We’re building technology that understands and structures the knowledge inherent in software and uses this knowledge to develop and maintain software systems. We have the tools and data; we want you to help our users make sense of it.


We need the right person—creative, pragmatic, excited and productive.



  • Can you design an interface that untangles complex data representations?

  • Can you help an entire team elevate its understanding of HCI concepts and standards?

  • Do your designs live by “Don’t Make Me Think?”

  • Do you enjoy creating and demonstrating prototypes, and do you believe in the value of an iterative process?

  • Are you excited to communicate and collaborate with a team to implement and take your ideas further?


We’re looking for someone with very strong graphics and visualization skills, who can also implement their ideas. You’ll be an integral part of our team.


If you are well versed in program comprehension tools and designs, plus novel visualization techniques and interfaces (we’re open to virtual reality), then we want to hear from you.


Please send a portfolio with your application. While not required, it will give you extra consideration.


This position requires a design/coding test.


The coding test will be creating a visualization of a data set in any way that you think is useful and interesting. Ideally, you will use Java, Python or JavaScript, but other libraries are welcome, as long as we can easily run them. Check with us before you start if you’d like to use something else. Please email us with your resume and a cover letter. We’ll reply with the full assignment and data set.


This position is full-time and on-site in Golden, Colorado.  


Phase Change Software is an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer - hardware for real world products
jobs.content:
Practichem makes real scientific instruments controlled by browsers.


We write bugs. We don't mean to, but we do. So, we need you to help find them. For each 3-4 software engineers, we employ one tester, so you'll be joining a test-oriented team.


Responsibilities:



  • Update tests to reflect the latest user stories (Jenkins, Selenium, Cucumber).

  • Devise client and server system tests.

  • Write code to automate testing.

  • Create bug reports (JIRA)

  • Verify that features work as expected.

  • Verify and test bugs.

  • Participate in design discussions.

  • Write and review wiki pages (Confluence, Google apps suite)

jobs.title: Web Application Developer for IoT
jobs.content:
Practichem seeks full-stack Web Application Developers to integrate browser controlled Arista™ into a whole browser based lab concept. Along with a great team of mechanical & electrical engineers, you'll be bringing amazing products to the world. 


You'll create full stack web applications using AngularJS, CoffeeScript, Less, Jade, Node JS, Meteor and related technologies.


What makes this position stand out?



  • Control real hardware using web applications you develop.

  • Work in the highly technical domain of scientific instruments.

  • Choose your daily OS. Many of us prefer Linux.

  • Count on professional User Interaction designers on our team.

  • Create new software using the latest frameworks and tools.

  • At Practichem, we make our own real, physical stuff.

jobs.name: Advanced Business Computers of America, Inc.

Software Engineer


At Advanced Business Computers of America, Inc. (ABCoA) our mission is to provide the premier software solutions to the global subprime industry. jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Back-End Java Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


Responsibilities

  • Design and Implementation of security and data protection

  • Design and implementation of data storage solutions and multithreaded Web Application (Java) utilizing web application frameworks

  • Develops applications using dependency injection and configuration driven behaviors

  • Conduct Unit tests, code review, refactoring current source code, assessment and improvement of performance.

  • Settings and improvement on CI (ex.Jenkins)

jobs.title: Software Engineer/Architect, Senior
jobs.content:

Support requirements analysis, capture the perspectives of multiple stakeholders, and translate into technical design. Perform evaluations of products and solutions, identify and consider design alternatives from business and technical perspectives, and communicate recommendations to clients. Support business development, market investments, and client engagements in the strategic analysis, planning, and execution of IT-enabled business solutions.

jobs.content:

jobs.title: DevOps Developer, Senior
jobs.content:

Implement DevOps platforms to provide the capability to easily perform complicated data science operations with large amounts of data and facilitate code-sharing and a sustainable process for running jobs. Create Jenkins jobs for build automation and continuous integration and security. Manage Jenkins configurations and create pluggable development environments. Use Microsoft Azure to provision and configure machines and virtual networks. Form data pipelines using Apache NiFi to transfer large amounts of data from remote servers.

jobs.title: Big Data Developer

Refine a data processing pipeline focused on unstructured and semi-structured data refinement. Support quick turn and rapid implementations and larger-scale and longer duration analytic capability implementations.

jobs.title: Front End Developer - Angular/Drupal
jobs.content:

Work in a dynamic team environment developing innovative Web applications that address the client’s most challenging business, technology, and systems integration needs. Participate in the full Agile life cycle development of solutions using Drupal, AngularJS, Java, and MySQL. Work with the product manager, scrum master, and client staff to identify requirements and develop, modify, and maintain a variety of applications to achieve the client’s goal and mission. Design, develop, and implement custom components, services, Drupal modules, page layouts, and scripts. Integrate newly designed functionality with other currently existing products. Articulate requirements with the client to design the specific site implementation.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Java - Consulting
jobs.content:
­


Our team is hiring Senior Software Engineers and Application Architects to design solutions for unpredictable and varied problems for multiple clients around the metro Atlanta area. Team Daugherty Software Engineers and Architects have superior technical expertise gained from extensive experience and industry research of best practices within Database, Pattern Implementation, Coding, Architecture, Pattern Usage and Implementation. You will contribute to a team project predominately focused on architecture and development and work with a team typically in an Agile methodology (oftentimes using Paired Programming or XP) completing various development and coding initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a broad range of languages and who can adapt to new client environments and learn new technologies quickly.


Because we work with a variety of Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 clients, as well as some smaller shops here in town, there is no one specific job description.  You have to keep an open mind, understand that you are not being hired for one specific project -- your job description will change with each client / project.  We look for Developers and Software Engineers and Architects who have a passion for what they do, who like variety, who like to learn and who enjoy their craft.

jobs.title: React, Rails, Radical Innovation
jobs.content:

Our projects demand skills and vision to take advantage of the latest capabilities in our target technology stack. We are expanding our team with senior technologists to help build awesome new applications and drive innovation in our space. You will work with other top-notch developers with advanced skills in a variety of technologies that will be sure to complement your capabilities.

If you are tired of being the 'smartest one in the room' and want to excel at your craft while working with some of the best in your field, then let's talk. We're ready to set you on your first mission, so let's get started!


Benefits

  • Flexible schedule/vacation time
  • Profit sharing

jobs.title: Senior UX/UI Developer
jobs.content:
As we build and scale Crystal over the next few years, our product & engineering group is growing along with it. Crystal is a huge project that requires close collaboration between data analysis, NLP, and social science. 


We're looking for a technical leader to take ownership over UX decisions, design our user interfaces, and contribute to front end development. We value:




  • True individual ownership and responsibility over projects.




  • Saying “no” to lots of good things to say “yes” to one great thing.




  • Listening to constant feedback from our team and customers.




  • Having a healthy approach to velocity and technical debt.




  • Taking our work very seriously, but not taking ourselves too seriously.




You'll be the first full-time UX/UI specialist working alongside the CEO and a talented engineering team to translate Crystal's powerful data into everyday business value. You'll be on the ground floor helping us build the foundation for an enduring, impactful company.


Now for some specifics:



  • Your day-to-day will vary between design and development, so this role requires strong coding and design skills, but it's OK if most of your professional experience comes from one of those two sides. Previous management experience is less important if you have right attitude and desire to learn. 


  • We work primarily with Javascript (React, jQuery), Ruby on Rails, and PostgreSQL. Our platform runs on AWS.




  • We have a lot on our roadmap for the next two years, including improvements to the breadth and accuracy of our personality detection system, Chrome extensions, enterprise tools, and data integrations.




  • We rely on a few tools very heavily for communication and workflow - Slack, Github, Trello, Google Apps.




  • We love customer support and believe everyone plays a part in user experience.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Elixir, React, Rails
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Philadelphia, PA
URL: https://curadora.workable.com/jobs/308843

Curadora is on a mission to create new, innovative tools for people to plan for an event - from music festivals to sporting events and more, and we’re in need of the smartest developers.
We're committed to attracting the best talent possible, which means we want to offer this opportunity to those that live beyond the Philadelphia area. If you’re eager to get your hands on the newest technologies to create amazing digital experiences, then read on!

Your new day-to-day

You’ll have the opportunity to contribute from design, to code, to test, to deployment. That includes working collaboratively with like-minded teammates to plan development cycles, break down feature requests into a series of tasks, and remove blocks. You’ll be integrating with multiple third parties to build a robust and scalable web application for consumers. As a senior developer, you’ll play a critical role in the direction of our product by prioritizing needs, analyzing usage data and researching new technologies. You’ll need to face complex problems and turn them into sophisticated solutions.

Technology you will work with

  • Elixir with Phoenix
  • React with Redux
  • APIs/XML
  • Redis and Elasticsearch
  • Ruby on Rails
  • SQL databases
  • CSS / SASS
  • Node.JS
Who you are

You’re someone who is talented, organized, and motivated to get things done. You like the idea of working in an entrepreneurial, startup environment because you have a ton of ideas and are interested in making a noticeable impact on a product. You thrive in an environment that moves fast, and you’re always thinking ahead – about user experience, testability, security loopholes, caching, database optimization, and even code organization. You’re constantly thinking “how can we do this better, faster, and more efficiently?” Success for you means users LOVE the products you build because they deliver the best online experience.

What you bring to the table

You’re someone who has experience designing and implementing small or medium-sized software systems. You have a proven track record of successfully designing and implementing multiple software components and systems. You can communicate that design and implementation to fellow developers, and articulate strengths/weaknesses and rationale to business stakeholders.

You’re also someone who can solve concurrent challenging technical problems in a fast-paced environment. That means you have an acute attention to orient with good task estimation and prioritization skills.

If you have experience with online travel agencies, that would be really nice too.

Where you’ll be working
We're committed to attracting the best talent possible, which means we are also accepting applications for this opportunity to those who wish to work from a remote location.

Benefits for you
  • Competitive salary
  • Healthcare insurance
  • Healthcare & dependent care flexible spending account
  • Mass transit / commuter benefit program
  • 401K match
  • Generous vacation and personal day policy
  • Start-up experience in an energetic environment
  • Bagel Tuesdays!
  • Being a part of an all-star team

To apply: Apply at Workable or browse all our career opportunities at www.careers.curadora.com. For additional details, please visit open_in_new https://curadora.workable.com/jobs/308843.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
About Enplug


Enplug is a rapidly growing tech company in Los Angeles. Our team builds a software product used by companies around the world and experienced by millions of people.


We've been featured in Forbes, Fortune, and Wall Street Journal. We were named in the prestigious Inc. Magazine's 30 Under 30 list along with companies like GitHub, Instagram, and Facebook. 


Enplug develops the leading open software that can turn any TV, projector, or digital display into a multi-tool for businesses. Our apps range from live social feeds, RSS feeds, digital menus, and many more third-party developed apps. Fortune 500 companies and small businesses around the world rely on our software including Dodger Stadium, Marriott Hotels, and Silicon Valley Bank.


Who is Enplug



  • Our startup team is passionate about our work and we have a fun time in the process.

  • We're talented. Our pedigrees include ex-Microsoft developers, a former CEO of a biotech company, a creator of two top apps in the Mac App Store.

  • We're a tech company. Top tier engineers make up over 50% of our team. We're obsessed with building the best product possible.


Web Developer Responsibilities


Drive development of this critical part of our product. Contribute to further development of our platform and app market. Build amazing apps showcased on displays during biggest sports events, shows, restaurants and in the offices of fortune 500 companies. 


Work perks



  • Flexible work hours

  • Paid benefits and PTO

  • Equity

  • Free parking

  • Pet-friendly

  • Ability to crash at the Enplug House in Bel Air anytime

  • Fun team outtings paid for by Enplug including regular movie nights at the theater

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Cloud Apps / Telecommute OK
jobs.content:
Join a high-powered group of people who create data-visualization software for significant project planners around the world. We are a small, privately-held, profitable company with an enthusiastic customer base.


If you’re tired of startup antics, but want to work for a company that gives you the freedom and flexibility of one, you’ll be pleased to know that we have no outside investors and no debt, so our guiding principle is to grow by doing what is right for our customers. In 2007 we sold the first copies of our OnePager applications, and they have since revolutionized plan communications in industries such as pharmaceuticals, defense, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and government.


Your job is to be a major contributor on our new cloud app built with ASP.NET, JavaScript, and HTML5 Canvas. We are an agile-methodology company and encourage flexible work arrangements. You can work from your home and join our daily standup meeting by WebEx every morning.


This position is initially contract, with the option to convert to a full-time employee very quickly if there is a mutual fit. This position will be primarily telecommute, with face-to-face meetings as reasonably necessary.

jobs.title: Lead AEM Developer

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Ruby
jobs.content:
Great organizations are made of great people. We are looking for someone who will embrace our mission, vision and values and complete tasks independently, as well as part of the team. This position involves working with the Lead Dev to build onto and strengthen our web-based application. This individual must be passionately committed to our mission of providing the first and best solution for our marketplace and the patients that our application will ultimately serve. We are an organization with the energy and excitement of a startup that is developing a team in a rapidly growing healthcare niche.   • Leverage software design best practices to craft well-written, flexible code

jobs.title: Senior UX Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary

Avalara is seeking an expert level UX engineer with a proven ability to solve complex problems and make it easy for customers. Join us in building delightful user experiences that make “sales tax less taxing” for Avalara customers.

You are passionate about developing ambitious web apps that are simple and clear to use. You delight in solving complex UX engineering problems using clean, performant code. You know that architecture is important, that no developer stands alone, and that effective, supportive, and collaborative team processes produce the best solutions. You have a strong grasp of software development fundamentals and are able to apply those concepts in your prolific contributions.

Job Duties

  • Writes readable, maintainable, and test-covered code, setting high standards for the team
  • Investigates and fixes bugs, taking primary responsibility for software quality problems observed in the project and especially on owned features
  • Contributes to architectural design of new features and improvement of existing features
  • Helps improve team processes and expertise by participating in designs and code reviews, and by suggesting new processes and tools. Enjoys mentoring others and taking feedback in order to improve.
  • Owns expertise in specific technology areas relevant to the project
  • Actively engages with developing industry tools and practices in order to remain current

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum of 5 years experience building customer-facing UX
  • Expert knowledge of Javascript, including ES6
  • Expert knowledge of HTML and CSS/Sass
  • Experience with recent versions of client-side UX technologies such as Ember, React, and/or Angular
  • Proficiency with supplemental tech such as Git, Bash, Team City, and JIRA

Preferred Qualification

  • Experience and comfort with continuous integration and automated build-check processes
  • Experience developing and maintaining tooling for UX
  • Experience designing and developing software services and APIs

About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with sales and excise tax, VAT, and other transactional tax requirements by delivering comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions that are fast, accurate, and easy to use. Avalara’s end-to-end suite of solutions is designed to effectively manage complicated and burdensome tax compliance obligations imposed by state, local, and other taxing authorities in the United States and internationally.

Avalara offers hundreds of pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications. The company processes millions of tax transactions for customers and free users every day, files hundreds of thousands of transactional tax returns per year, and manages millions of exemption certificates and other compliance related documents.

A privately held company, Avalara’s venture capital investors include Sageview Capital, Battery Ventures, Warburg Pincus, Technology Crossover Ventures, Arthur Ventures, and other institutional and individual investors. Avalara employs more than 1000 people at its headquarters in Seattle, WA and in offices across the U.S. and in London, England and Pune, India. More information at: www.avalara.com

jobs.title: Oracle Business Functional Analyst
jobs.content: This position is responsible for collection, analysis, review, documentation and communication of business needs and requirements to IT. Facilitates and leads the gathering of business needs, assisting with solution design on moderate to highly complex initiatives with the primary focus on the Oracle EBS applications and modules. Partners with Business Analysts and Business Application Support Liaisons to provide coaching and mentoring. Performs software training and presentations.

jobs.title: Maker of software
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Chicago, IL
URL: https://highrisehq.com/

Highrise is looking for a full-time person who makes nice software.

You might consider yourself a designer, but you don’t let that stop you from building something awesome yourself. You know your way around a Ruby on Rails application and have no problem developing new views for it. You’re handy with Javascript.

Sure, you love working with smart backend engineers and other people with great design ideas. But by yourself or with a team you find a way to get your ideas out into the world.

Highrise is a fairly typical Ruby and Rails web app, created by the people who created Ruby on Rails :) — but there are a ton of opportunities to use Rails/Ruby/Javascript/Go/React/whatever the right tool for the job is as we scale and improve.

We need people with diverse skillsets who are interested in a variety of challenges, from rethinking things we take for granted in software apps, to creating marketing sites, from developing novel onboarding experiences to nailing small details on new color pallets. You’ll have an opportunity to do it all.

And most importantly, there’s going to be a lot of people using your stuff.

Please get in touch and let’s get to know each other.

MORE ABOUT US:
Highrise is a super simple CRM tool, built by 37signals/Basecamp and launched on March 20, 2007. It’s grown to become a multi-million dollar business with a strong, loyal customer base. In August 2014, Highrise left the nest, and was spun-off as its own company — a very welcome change for Highrise users, as our users now have their own dedicated development and support team.

@highrise — Loving the new iPhone app. Nice work!!-@DarrenSproats

Very impressed with all the activity out of @Highrise lately.-@DUQE

Highrise, in many ways, feels like a startup. We have a brand new team exploring new ideas with freedom to build the things we think are best. Except, we also already have significant revenue and users eager for the things we’re working on. There is no “runway”. No risk of not getting our next round of venture funding. It’s a profitable business, and all we care about is making better products.

OUR CURRENT TEAM:

Nathan Kontny, CEO 
Software engineer and designer for 15 years. Began an entrepreneurial career with two Y Combinator backed startups: Inkling (http://inklingmarkets.com) in 2005 and Draft (http://draftin.com) in 2011. Also was an engineer on President Obama’s re-election campaign. One of the best ways to get to know me is my writing on Medium and Ninjas and Robots

Michael Dwan, CTO 
Michael is a Y Combinator alum and the engineer behind creating an awesome photo application called Snapjoy. Snapjoy was quickly acquired by Dropbox, and you’ll see his handiwork all over what Dropbox has done with Carousel and photo storage.

Chris Gallo, Head of Customer Support 
You’ll likely hear from Chris if you need help with Highrise. Chris knows how to communicate and how to help. He’s been an incredible asset to Highrise.

Lynette Kontny, COO 
You’ll see Lynette’s work all over Highrise. She makes sure we’re all on the same page and getting the right things done quickly.

Jon Phenow, Software Engineer 
Jon is a big reason Highrise continues to improve at a rapid pace. He juggles multiple projects at a time and makes Highrise more useful every day.

Alison Groves, Customer Support 
Alison is our newest addition. She comes to us via Zapier and Raven Tools, loves to chat with customers, and has a ton of insight on the world outside of support as well as in it.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
We are furiously improving an already well-used application. We believe in the power of momentum and want small, impactful projects out quickly. A lot of people are going to see and use your work. You can see how fast we develop by the number of things we’ve gotten done since we’ve taken over:

http://blog.highrisehq.com/

Not only will you have your hand in improving an app a lot of people use, we have a ton of new projects on deck: new iOS/Android apps, new business ideas, things being rewritten. Highrise is a big sandbox to play in with employees and users who would love your help.

WHERE?
Anywhere in the US. Highrise is headquartered in Chicago, but we all work remotely. Work from wherever you are comfortable

-Nathan Kontny 
CEO, Highrise

To apply: Write makers@highrisehq.com with the subject: I love making things. Please send along your GitHub & Twitter profiles, website, resume, references and anything you think would help introduce yourself: where you blog, anything open source you’ve developed, your 3 favorite books I should read, businesses you’ve started (even if they haven’t worked) etc. Looking forward to meeting you!

jobs.title: Mobile Applications Engineer
jobs.content:
Our client is changing the way law enforcement uses technology. Their mission is to protect life and truth, making the world a safer place through smart devices and software services. We need brains and passion to make it happen and make it happen in style.

The mobile application engineer will own the native app development and need to be comfortable across the stack: working with lower level Bluetooth features and low latency audio / video pipelines.


Looking for:

2 iOS Developers

2 Android Developers

1 Windows Developer


Benefits


  • Competitive salary, 401K with employer match, and equity
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Ride along with police officers in real life situations, see them use technology, get inspired
  • And more...

jobs.title: Senior UI Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a rock star UI Developer to join our talented team of a UI/UX Architects, UI Developers and QA Engineers working to change the way people buy eyewear online. You should have hands on responsive development experience in an enterprise-level eCommerce environment with a keen understanding of HTML5, CSS3, Object-oriented JavaScript, and Bootstrap. 



Key Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with our brand, merchandising, marketing, UX, and back-end teams to ensure the UI meets business requirements, delivers superior site performance and provides an optimal experience for our millions of consumers.

  • Participate in regular project planning meetings to ensure LOE and project timing are correctly scoped and projects are delivered on time.

  • Develop new site features and functionality that improve the online eyewear purchase process

  • Maintain existing site and support ongoing marketing and merchandising needs.

  • Create clean, efficient, responsive code that leverages today’s best practices and can be effectively integrated into our Oracle ATG/Endeca back-end

  • Review code to ensure it is cross browser functional and device compatible.

  • Stay up to date with current and emerging front-end technology and best practices

  • Excel in a fast-paced environment and quickly respond to new requests and proactively finding new opportunities

jobs.title: Junior PHP Application Programmer - Digital Technology
jobs.content:
JOB TITLE:            Junior PHP Application Programmer - Digital Technology


DEPARTMENT:      Digital Application Development Dept.


PAY STATUS:        Salary based on work experience


EFFECTIVE:          Immediately


HeBS Digital is a full-service digital technology and marketing firm working with leading hotel brands and hotel companies throughout the world.  We have built an excellent team of top industry professionals, and enjoy a fun and friendly work environment. Our services include digital technology applications, website design, full-service digital marketing: search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), email marketing, social media, mobile marketing, online media and retargeting, direct response online advertising, research and analysis, as well as website revenue optimization consulting services.


Company offers comfortable boutique business environment with an emphasis on results while retaining work/life balance. Provides excellent opportunities to build responsibilities and grow with company. Position based in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.


Once in a lifetime opportunity to become an industry digital technology expert!


HeBS Digital is expanding its team of talented professionals by adding a high energy Junior PHP Application Programmer to our New York office to focus on creating and maintaining of a wide range of digital technology systems and applications.


At HeBS Digital, we strive for excellence in everything we do. In order to achieve this you need to be open to learning on your own as well as with the help of your team. Self-motivation to develop in an international business environment is essential.


As a Junior PHP Application Programmer, together with other team members, you are responsible for creating and maintaining of a wide range of digital technology systems and applications. You have knowledge in a variety of areas and a strong understanding of how to combine new technology with creative innovations. You continually educate yourself on the latest technologies, and try to stay on the professional edge. The ideal candidate should have solid experience developing using PHP5, MySQL and jQuery.


As a Junior PHP Application Programmer, your responsibilities include:



  • Working with our team (e.g., team leads, executives, sales team) to plan program code enhancements and changes to the award-winning proprietary software, including all aspects of programming

  • Maintaining software repositories, keeping our client software up to date, configuring servers, installing patches.

  • Developing high-performance, test-driven, highly available hospitality industry oriented client software with flexibility and code reusability in mind.

  • Helping other team members with extensive knowledge you have.

  • Taking part in maximizing software functionality (either back-end or front-end related), optimizing and improving user experience.


Requirements:


What you need for this position:



  • College degree is required, preferably in Computer Science

  • 1+ Years solid work experience as a PHP programmer

  • Proficiency with MySQL database schema design and performance

  • Experience writing well-documented, test-driven (TDD) PHP code

  • Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) coding methodologies

  • Proficiency with JavaScript (jQuery), AJAX, and JSON

  • Proficiency in CSS3/HTML5/XML/SOAP

  • Experience in Git and code versioning

  • Previous experience with hosting and/or cloud environments

  • Yes-we-can-do-it attitude.


Good to have:



  • Experience with Front-end Web Development is a PLUS!

  • Experience with Zend Framework is a PLUS!

  • Experience with MVC frameworks is a PLUS!

  • Experience with PHP Open Source projects, e.g. WordPress

  • SCRUM or Agile methodology knowledge

  • Any NoSQL experience, e.g. MongoDB, Redis, etc.

  • Familiarity with Social Network integration

  • Professional attitude and appearance

  • Confident and creative team-player who takes initiative

  • Diligent work habits and ability to meet deadlines


If you are a PHP Application Programmer with 1+ years of solid experience, and looking for a job in Midtown Manhattan, New York City, apply today!


Please reply with resume, cover letter and salary expectations.



  • Location: Midtown Manhattan, New York City

  • Compensation: Competitive Salary + Benefits + PTO + Medical/Dental +

  • 401K/SIMPLE IRA

  • Principals only. Recruiters please don't contact this job poster.

  • Please, no phone calls about this job!

  • Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.


About HeBS Digital


HeBS Digital is the hospitality industry’s leading full-service digital technology, website design, full-service digital marketing and consulting firm (www.HeBSDigital.com).


HeBS Digital has pioneered many of the best practices in hospitality digital technology and marketing. The firm has won over 250 prestigious industry awards for its digital marketing technology and website design services, including numerous Adrian Awards, Davey Awards, W3 Awards, WebAwards, Magellan Awards, Summit International Awards, Interactive Media Awards, IAC Awards, and others.


A diverse client portfolio of hospitality clients: from restaurants to major hotel brands, luxury and boutique hotel chains, resorts and casinos, hotel management companies, franchisees and independents, and CVBs are benefiting from HeBS Digital’s direct online channel strategy and digital marketing expertise.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer/Technical Services Liaison
jobs.content:
The goal of this role is to ensure that HelpSystems maintains our significant maintenance revenues by providing superior customer service. The Lead is the first line of contact for critical support services and acts as the liaison between the development team and other departments. This role is responsible for customer driven enhancements, managing all escalated support requests, and managing smaller product extensions for HelpSystems’ AutoMate product line.  


Job Responsibilities



  • Work with Quality Assurance to validate issues reported by Services and Support

  • Address critical and major defects that are reported by Services and Support

  • Provide 4th level troubleshooting / configuration support for Services and Support

  • Develop and deliver small customer driven enhancements across the entire product line

  • Analyze technical support tickets, looking for key areas of improvement to lower support costs and improve customer satisfaction

  • Work with Product Development Manager in defining processes, principles and practices for the Technical Development Services team

  • Continually evaluate the development process for improvements

  • Work with manager to ensure that maintenance releases are properly planned and executed on-time and according to defined processes, principles and practices

  • Advocate and champion automated engineering practices, including unit testing, continuous integration and automated build process

jobs.title: Database Administrator - Amsterdam
jobs.content:
Booking.com is looking for a MySQL Database Administrator!
 
Booking.com is one of the largest e-commerce sites in the world. We book over 500,000 room nights every day and are one of the largest MySQL installations worldwide. The DBA team at Booking.com supports 2000+ MySQL servers in a rapidly evolving and dynamic environment. The team focuses on scaling our environment to support the immense growth of the business, automating day-to-day DB related activities and providing support to applications and development efforts.
 
You will have a responsible position with a lot of freedom and we encourage you to take ownership as much as possible. You will be working together with the best technical members in the industry and a very skilled development team.
 
Key responsibilities



  • Automating systems management of new and existing Databases.

  • Actively monitoring the performance and stability of all the production and internal Database infrastructure at Booking.com, using your analytical skills to anticipate future problems and resolve them effectively.

  • Troubleshooting and resolving problems with other Database administrators, systems administrators, software developers.

  • Supporting the rapid development and deployment of internal software and systems.

  • Provide excellent service in response to commercial business requirements. You will have to provide knowledge and support to technical software developers.

  • Documenting systems and communicate technical knowledge to Colleagues.

  • You will have the ability to make a big impact and the responsibility to do the right thing.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Booking.com is looking for the world’s best Front End Developers all around the globe! Join us at our beautiful headquarters in Amsterdam and work on planet Earth’s  #1 accommodation website with some of our industry’s smartest people! You’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of users.


About the Front End team


Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a developer in our Front End team you will be building the user interfaces of the Booking.com website. You'll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like team which takes full ownership of their part of our platform. You'll work side by side with designers, back end developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyze, hand code & test your ideas.


About you


You’re excited about the endless potential of the web, and being able to build things that millions of people can use every day. You’re passionate about your craft, have an excellent eye for detail and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. Your core responsibility will be in combining your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to deliver a world-class user experience to our diverse, loyal user-base. You’ll be comfortable taking a data-led approach to development, since we make all our decisions based on experiments and testing. You will be a passionate advocate for the user and excited about working in an agile, collaborative environment.


Key responsibilities



  • Translate requirements and mockups into fully functioning features using JavaScript and HTML/CSS

  • Continuously look for ways to improve Booking.com and implement A/B tests

  • Take ownership of sections of Booking.com's desktop, tablet and mobile web sites

jobs.title: Senior Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing hotel markets.


We are looking for a Senior Linux System Administrator to join our headquarters in Amsterdam, NL. As a member of our IT Production Team you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in different live operating data centers around the world. You will be part of one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world and work with some of our industry’s smartest people. You will work on a wide range of technologies which include UNIX, Linux, CentOS, puppet, chef, Perl, Python and more. By proactively thinking about scalability we can ensure the growth of Booking.com.


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As a Senior Linux System Administrator you will:



  • Combine your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to support and maintain a world-class infrastructure and to enable our continued growth

  • Analyze, monitor, configure, and maintain the existing system and identify possibilities for improvement;

  • Ensure the reliability and continuity of our global systems;

  • Cooperate with other System Administrators, Engineers, DBA’s, Developers and Product Owners during projects;

  • Research, deploy and implement new systems and solutions, for example on automation or scalability;

  • Advanced troubleshooting;

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.


There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.


B.responsible



  • Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights.  

  • Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.

  • Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.

  • Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.

  • Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

jobs.title: Perl Developer
jobs.content:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for Perl Developer who is passionate about their craft, who thrives on challenge and who believes in success through collaboration. Whether it is hardening Perl's hash function or developing efficient serialization libraries, we solve serious problems using Perl.


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch. We are actively engaged and enjoy the benefits our culture produces such as increased communication between each other and also to our business counterparts.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day. We are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


Even without Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for an iOS developer to join our team in our Amsterdam headquarters.  As a member of our IT Production Team, you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements that impact millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in multiple, live, data centers around the world, as well as working within one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world.  


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As iOS developer you will:



  • Maintain and enhance our iOS application

  • Translate requirements and mock-ups into fully functioning features

  • Develop new and existing iOS applications features

  • Provide estimates on development cycles

  • Implement conversion experiments (A/B tests)

  • Partner with designers to help define and implement User Interface improvements

  • Work with team members on server-side integration


B.ig Bonus



  • Experience with Apple Approval & Distribution Process, Ad Hoc & Enterprise Distribution

  • SQL knowledge and/or willingness to learn

  • Have built an approved store App

  • Experience working with A/B testing

  • You are passionate about open source and contribute

  • You’re not afraid to solve deep technical challenges of a whole new level at a huge scale

  • You have an intrinsic curiosity in technological innovations and you are always on top of the latest trends


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

jobs.title: Backend Developer, Open Source
jobs.content:
Booking.com is looking for Software Developers who are passionate about their craft, who thrive on challenge and who believe in success through collaboration – people who would complement our existing team of developers!


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch.


Even if you do not have Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day, are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

jobs.title: Commercial Buildings Software Developer
jobs.content:
Requisition #R1477


You will work within a tightly integrated, multidisciplinary software development team to create and deploy client/server and cloud-based software solutions for the built environment. Product stakeholders include the Department of Energy, California Energy Commission, investor and publicly owned utilities, regional energy organizations, third-party software developers, architects, engineers, and building owners. The successful candidate will be adept at executing complex software integration tasks, but also communicating effectively with teammates and stakeholders. This position requires California residency via remote assignment with periodic travel for in-person collaboration and stakeholder engagements. The successful candidate is proficient at using collaborative development tools and process to facilitate team coding or production-quality software solutions that meet or clients’ needs for cost-effective analysis and design of highly efficient buildings.

jobs.title: Groovy/Grails Developer
jobs.content:
Background


Why consider this opportunity?  For starters, this company was founded 14 years ago by a software developer.  Now the CEO, he understands and appreciates developers.  Each team member is given a private office, in an optimum working environment and treated with respect.  The company’s products are successful internationally, and the company has never needed a dime of investment capital.  Major re-architecture and new development goals have created a need for an excellent developer to help design and develop their next generation SaaS Communications Management Software. Located near LAX, you will enjoy the caliber of the team, the latest technologies and tools, excellent compensation and benefits, matching 401K and most importantly, an ability to influence the product.


Job Scope


Strong candidates will have deep experience in Java, Spring, and MySQL, ideally with some work history in Akka and Groovy/Grails (though this is not required). S/he participates throughout the design, development, coding, testing, and debugging stages in agile development environment.  S/he works within a team to understand problems with software and develops specifications to resolve them. Candidate should be competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications programming activities.   This position requires an individual who is able to produce well-written, well-documented, high-quality, fast code.  Excellent verbal and written English communication skills are a must.


Compensation and Benefits



  • Above market compensation

  • 401K with employer matching and immediate vesting

  • Health, Dental, Vision, Disability, & Life Insurance

  • Education Benefits

  • Private office and covered parking

  • Unlimited snacks and beverages with weekly catered meals

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Developer
jobs.content:
N2 Publishing is seeking a skilled web developer with an awesome personality to join our technology team. The successful candidate is welcome to work remotely from home or relocate to our headquarters city to work in the office. Please note, the remote teammate should be prepared to travel to our home office location about 3-4 times a year. But, weâre situated in the beautiful coastal town of Wilmington, NC, so neither relocating nor traveling to our home office location is a bad gig!


But enough about the logistics. As a talented web developer with an equally impressive personality, you have lots of job options. We know that. So we'd like to give you a breather and put the company in the interview seat for a change.


Why N2 Publishing:
â¢	The ability to work with cutting-edge technology and interesting publication applications
â¢	People-first company culture (we've actually won awards for this -- check them out here)
â¢	Flexible schedule with a company focus on work-life balance (Fortune recently named us one of the "Best Workplaces for Flexibility")
â¢	The opportunity to grow professionally and potentially lead a technical team
â¢	Laid back company atmosphere
â¢	Office location 15 minutes from the beach, though the position could be 100% remote if desired
â¢	Generous paid time off, plus company-wide two weeks off at the end of the year
â¢	Benefits including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability, and life insurance
â¢	401(k) retirement plan with employer match
â¢	Two Lunch & Learns each month
â¢	Monthly company socials
â¢	Daily on-site fitness classes


Interested? Here's what youâll do:
â¢	Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
â¢	Create site layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
â¢	Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
â¢	Provide input, options, and recommendations on software features and system enhancements
â¢	Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
â¢	Provide recommendations into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities


Sound like you? Here's what you'll need:
â¢	4-year degree in a computer science-related discipline or relevant degree
â¢	Expert knowledge of Ruby on Rails, as well as in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS and Javascript
â¢	In-depth understanding of how web applications work including security, session management and best development practices
â¢	Full working knowledge of MVC application architecture
â¢	In-depth knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
â¢	Experience using Agile Methodologies and Test Driven Development
â¢	Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and master diverse web technologies and techniques
â¢	Team player attitude with a desire to be part of an organization that is making a difference in peopleâs lives
â¢	Proven experience leading a technical development team is not required, but is a plus
We provide a drama-free culture built on trust, respect, and humility. People are promoted based on consistent performance and cultural fit; we intentionally develop our talent so that we can promote from within the organization. We are emotionally healthy people who genuinely enjoy working with each other. So brilliant jerks need not apply.


Think youâre the one for us? Apply now.



N2 Publishing is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, N2 Publishing complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
