jobs.title: Amazon Web Services
jobs.content:
Are you a software developer with AWS experience? Are you interested in sharing your knowledge with other developers, virtual mentoring, building your personal brand and earning extra income in the process? Want to join one of the fastest growing education companies in the world?


Pluralsight, the leader in online technology training for software developers, is currently looking for individuals to develop and teach online technical courses to subscribers around the world.  We are specifically looking for developers with relevant AWS knowledge, passion and experience.  


As a Pluralsight Author, you'll collaborate with our curriculum and editorial teams to select and develop your own technical course. We'll work together to ensure your course is presented and marketed in the best way possible. Our author positions are freelance/part-time, enabling a very flexible work environment.


Join a community of recognized expert instructors that inspire, teach and transform lives everyday by helping learners obtain skills that provide career opportunities and advancement through online learning.

jobs.title: Sr. Ruby Software Developers
jobs.content:
PhishMe is seeking professional and experienced Rails developers to join its software engineering team.  Our product line is growing and constantly improving, so we need some really talented people who have worked well on Scrum teams and want to do so again to build truly world class software.


If adding features, extending capabilities, and actually delivering working and fully tested software excites you, then we want to talk with you!  We’re looking for software developers, not just coders.


The successful candidate will have professional work experience (internships or professional jobs held as a student are valid). This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc in the Leesburg, VA office.


Successful Applicants Must Be:



  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance

  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of both collocated and remote teams in a dynamic business environment

  • Comfortable working independently or paired and is able to escalate problems when necessary

  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally.

  • Eager to learn and able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly

  • Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members kindly and constructively

  • Detail-oriented

  • Willing to work for eight solid hours per day where at least five overlap with 8am to 6pm EST

  • Available to work off-hours occasionally

  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events

jobs.title: Software Engineer needed to make small business work better.
jobs.content:
Propelware is seeking a junior to mid-level software engineer to help the company grow.  We're looking for a talented programmer who likes interacting with customers and wearing multiple hats while working with a tight-knit team in a fast paced environment.  You'll work directly with users on a daily basis to help them connect QuickBooks to other important apps.  


As a small company, we shed all the red tape found at bigger businesses and focus on problem definition, impact, and solutions.  No committees, no manager approval, no exhaustively detailed spec sheets.  Everyone is empowered to make the right decision for the customer.


This software engineer position will be focused on 3 primary goals:



  1. Building out the Autofy platform and pushing our solution forward

  2. Implementing custom solutions for customers

  3. Fixing problems customers have with our solutions (gasp!)


Time spent will be split between these activities, and almost nothing else.  When not doing the above 3 things, you'll more than likely be in the occasional internal meeting, going to lunch with the team, or attending a local industry event.

jobs.name: the cutting edge of big data

jobs.title: Fullstack JavaScript Engineer
jobs.company: the cutting edge of big data
jobs.content:
Senior Javascript Engineer


At Qubit, the frontend team is focused on building well engineered, beautiful products with JavaScript. Our products provide an intuitive way for marketers to modify their website, understand and target user segments and measure the impact of their changes.


ARE YOU…


A team player? We are an opinionated team looking for like minded people. Are you excited by the prospect of solving complex challenges on an interesting technology stack?


Independant thinker? We like to hire engineers that thrive in a world of ambiguity. We want people that can be given hard problems and can go off and find the best technical solution.


Experimental? We are constantly experimenting with new technologies, right now some technologies that we really like are:



  • React, Flux and Redux

  • ES 2015/16

  • Git(hub)

  • Node.js

  • SuitCSS

  • Docker & Mesos

  • Make

  • Webpack

  • Mocha & Karma


Passionate about open source? Sharing is caring after all. We always contribute back to the open source community. Qubit's array of open source projects include:



  • react-test-tree: Simple and concise React component testing.

  • cherrytree: A flexible client-side router.

  • marty: A Javascript library for state management in React applications.

  • bamboo: HAProxy auto configuration and auto service discovery for Mesos Marathon.


You'll be responsible for:



  • Writing Javascript that will be run in hundreds of millions of browsers every day.

  • Building end-to-end products with Javascript (Node.js, React).

  • Understanding business problems and translating them into technical solutions.

  • Instrumenting, testing and deploying your code to production (We like to deploy multiple times a day).

  • Working closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications.

  • Working closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale our applications.

jobs.title: PeopleSoft / Oracle Developer
jobs.content:
The University of Connecticut is seeking an enthusiastic individual to fill a full-time position as a PeopleSoft/Oracle Developer in the Information Technology Services division. The individual will provide support for the PeopleSoft HCM 9.1, CS 9.0 applications. You will be joining a team of experienced IT professionals managing multiple PeopleSoft/Oracle applications and providing technical services to the University community, with the ability for advancement within the division.


 The successful candidate will provide analysis, design, development, and production services for the delivered PeopleSoft application as well as supporting customizations and extensions that have been applied to the PeopleSoft application.


The University of Connecticut has been named the top public university in New England for over a decade and is ranked among the top public universities in the nation. The University of Connecticut is also a Carnegie Foundation Research University, a prestigious honor shared by only the nation's top higher education institutions.


 Duties and Responsibilities



  • Provide analysis, design, development, and production services for the delivered PeopleSoft application

  • Develop and support customization and extensions using PeopleSoft PeopleTools

  • Documentation and communications

  • Work in conjunction with end users to gather business requirements


For additional information about the University, visit www.uconn.edu. For detailed position information and the job description, visit http://uitsjobs.uconn.edu/.


Appointment Terms


This is a full-time, permanent position. The University offers a competitive salary, outstanding benefits including employee and dependent tuition reimbursement at UConn, and a highly desirable work environment. Salary will be commensurate with successful candidates’ background and experience.


For additional information regarding benefits visit http://www.hr.uconn.edu/docs/enrgde.pdf.


 To Apply


Interested candidates please submit a letter of application and resume that demonstrate how you meet the minimum qualifications and any preferred qualifications you may have for this position, and a list of contact information for three professional references. Please apply online using the University’s UConn Jobs applicant system at www.jobs.uconn.edu, Staff Positions. Reference Search #2016677. Screening will begin immediately. Employment of the successful candidate will be contingent upon the successful completion of a pre-employment criminal background check. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. (Search # 2016677)


All employees are subject to adherence to the State Code of Ethics which may be found at http://www.ct.gov/ethics/site/default.asp.

jobs.title: Senior Linux Administrator
jobs.content:
IdeaScale, offers a unique opportunity for talented, passionate, and highly-creative systems engineers to have a wide-ranging impact on our organization's products, operations, and services. As a member of our SysOps team, you will be responsible for contributing to the architecture, design, automation, deployment, monitoring, and senior-level support of our solutions and services.


Position Responsibilities:


In this multi-faceted role, the Senior Linux Administrator will be responsible for:


Working side-by-side in a truly collaborative manner with our architecture, operations, sales, marketing, compliance, and executive leadership team to provide best in class solutions, services, and customer support.


Collaborating with your peers on the SysOps team to ensure that our solutions and services meet and exceed our client's expectations and achieve our rigorous quality standards.


Typical job functions include:



  • On-going Sysadmin work on bare metal and AWS instances.

  • Proactive system/network monitoring.

  • Proactive system capacity planning.

  • Deployment and task automation utilizing salt or other methods.

  • Issue/Incidence response.

  • Code-level analysis of issues including root cause determination and/or potential code fix.

  • Peer-level customer support for low-level, highly-technical issue resolution.

  • Work with compliance team to implement controls and other security needs.

  • Continual improvement on the system as a whole.


Benefits:



  • Health Insurance

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Equity Offered

  • Yearly Retreats

  • Phone and Internet Stipends 


Join and contribute to the communities and foundations that support our chosen open-source technologies and platforms. How you provide support will be dictated by your own interests, abilities, and personal passions.


You will be required to have fun, love what you do, and thrive in a transparent and open work environment.

Our on-staff experts love what they do, are continuous learners, anxious to take on new challenges, and mindful of best practices to ensure optimal service.


You have to be able to "play nice with others." IdeaScale seeks extraordinary minds, talent, and abilities to help keep pace with one of the Top 100 Fastest Growing Companies in the Bay.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Architect
jobs.content:
Business Intelligence Architect

Carfax is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Architect who will lead the design and execution of both internal and customer facing reporting and analytical solutions that:

  • Demonstrate the value Carfax brings to customers, partners, and other external stakeholders
  • Help Carfax analyze the effectiveness of the products we offer
  • Support ongoing business functions such as finance, sales, and marketing

You might be the ideal candidate for this challenging role if you:

  • Have Strong Communication Skills—You speak to business stakeholders in their language and convey technical content in easy to understand ways—both verbally and in writing.
  • Seek Continuous Process Improvement—You are always seeking ways to do things better, faster, and cheaper. You like to set goals for improvement and measure results. You hold yourself and others accountable for achieving those goals.
  • Enjoy Variety—You are easily bored by the status quo. You enjoy variety in the projects you support, the roles you play, and the technologies you apply to deliver the solutions needed.
  • See the Big Picture—You want to understand the overall business problem you are trying to address and before you begin to tackle individual parts of the problem.
  • Think Creatively—You love to find new ways to obtain best practices results in non-traditional ways. You would prefer to help create new best practices approaches for solving difficult problems, if existing best practices cannot adequately address a challenge.
  • Are a Lifelong Learner—You love learning new things about the business, systems, and data. Learning new tools and technologies energizes you, and you pick them up quickly.

Responsibilities:

  • BI Solution Architect
    • Support the development and implementation of CARFAX’s information strategy and the BI Team’s technical vision
    • Drive architectural design decisions for reporting and analytical solutions
    • Establish development practices/standards and ensure they are followed
    • Ensure that the BI environment meets agreed upon service level requirements
    • Root cause production support issues and recommend steps to take to prevent issues from reoccurring
  • Project Execution
    • Support the BI developers in the delivery lanes
    • Work closely with the Product Manager and Data Integration Manager to understand the business requirements and to plan work
    • Work closely with the Data Integration Manager to ensure that the data architecture supports these reporting and analytical needs
    • Work closely with the BI development team to design and deliver reporting and analytical solutions that satisfy business and technical requirements.

Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience leading the execution of reporting and analytics projects. Experience working in Agile development environments a strong plus.
  • 4+ years experience architecting BI solutions using leading BI tools. Experience with Cognos a strong plus.
  • Experience working with advanced data visualization tools such as Tableau, Spotfire, and Qlikview a strong plus.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and implementing standards and best practices
  • Demonstrated experience coaching and mentoring top performing teams
  • Demonstrated ability to work with a project management office and separate data integration team to jointly deliver BI projects
  • Demonstrated ability to support the execution of multiple simultaneous BI projects
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing priorities and business needs
  • Demonstrated ability to follow through on commitments and to own tasks from start to finish
  • All candidates subject to a full background check

jobs.title: Bluetooth Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Bluetooth Software Engineer


SHFF is seeking an experienced Bluetooth engineer to support development of our consumer products with BLE connectivity and help ready them for final production.


Responsibilities



  • Handle all BLE design, certification, and production support for the product

  • Handle all aspects of the BLE software sub-section

  • Planning, designing and implementing system hardware and embedded firmware

  • Review and optimize existing firmware and make ready for production

  • Work with Quality Assurance to address defects and issues

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content:
MetaCommunications is looking for a Vice President of Engineering to lead a world-class development team competing for the top spot in a “hot” space. We’re relentlessly innovating while building an incredible company filled with smart, creative, hard-working people who want to make a difference. We are growing fast and have outgrown the single “CTO / VP of Engineering” role.



As Meta’s VP of Engineering, you’ll be at the helm of our software engineering and product team that is responsible for designing, developing and validating our award-winning enterprise and prosumer cloud-based software products. You will be a part of our executive team and will work alongside our globally renowned CTO to run the team on a day to day basis. You’ll start with a large team of direct reports, grow and hire talent as needed to help scale, establish new & improve existing processes, build upon our strong engineering culture and lead the team to deliver beautiful software that will dominate the market. You will be unlikely to have time to “get your hands dirty” with the actual code, but you will be talking product and leading the charge to solve hard technical, architectural, process and logistical problems on a daily basis.



You'll also be responsible for collaborating with all our other teams in innovating product direction and coordinating the implementation of that direction.



The ideal candidate is a great manager and a team builder, has a keen engineering mindset and excellent communication skills, and is a tenacious problem solver with a proven track record in a similar high paced, high performance startup-like environment. Your ultimate job will be to build the absolute best engineering team and fix the issues that are getting in the way of its success.



What you'll be doing



  • Inspire, lead and grow an outstanding team of software engineers

  • Continue to inspire and develop a customer-centric culture of excellence

  • Design and improve engineering and project management processes, practices and standards

  • Work with the executive team and the product owners to build, maintain and execute product roadmaps

  • Continuously work to improve product quality and foster a culture of strong engineering design

  • Manage to budget targets and work with the executive team and the product owners to optimize R&D investment in the next generation of products

  • Manage product and project milestones, progress and issues

  • Collect, analyze, and report performance metrics to stakeholders

  • Collaborate with leadership to build a world-class engineering organization

  • Work with CTO, UX team and product owners to ship beautiful and functional products


What we're looking for



  • 5+ years as an engineering lead or design engineer

  • 3+ years of software engineering management

  • 3+ years of “in the trenches” startup experience or working with a small team (<30)

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent

  • Hands-on engineering experience with modern software stacks

  • Strong command of software engineering principles, design, and process

  • Demonstrated technical project management skills

  • Demonstrated product management experience

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment



About MetaCommunications


MetaCommunications develops workflow and collaborative productivity solutions that help marketing, creative design, packaging and prepress workgroups around the world be more productive. MetaCommunications has over 1000 business customers including 3M, Anixter, Allstate Insurance, Bath & Body Works, Bon-Ton, Bridgestone, Crate & Barrel, Diageo, Eddie Bauer, Fox Sports, Mead Johnson Nutrition, Menasha, Merck, National Geographic, Pfizer, Staples, Sony, TJX, Talbots, United Nations, USA Today, Village Roadshow, Wilton, Yamaha, Younkers, and more.


MetaCommunications is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. If you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate. As a US employer, MetaCommunications is required to verify all employees, regardless of citizenship or national origin, are eligible to work in the United States.

jobs.title: Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
REN Cloud Solutions is looking for a few individuals to join a talented, senior team providing best-in-class solutions for extremely complex problems and have the ability to work on the most cutting edge technology platforms and tools available.


Although we are flexible on location, Northern Virginia (Herndon), Philadelphia, Boston and NYC are the most desirable home bases.


Ideally we are looking for a professional with experience in automating large scale deployments with modern configuration and deployment management systems. You will be working on a team of talented engineers to solve some of the most complex and exciting challenges facing the world of IT Automation and cloud deployments.


REN Cloud has a number of open positions so all levels of talented candidates please apply!


Typically this position can pay anywhere from $70k - $150k base salary depending on skill set and experience.  Position includes countless other perks like bonus, work remotely, flexibility in lifestyle, conference budget and many, many other things!

jobs.title: Web Developer - Drive Technological Advancement Impacting Patient Experience
jobs.content:
Bring your talents to New York’s #1-ranked hospital, where innovation is at the forefront of a better tomorrow. As part of our talented and high-performing team, you’ll work on cutting-edge projects that build on our success in empowering employees while transforming the patient experience. Find out how you can Make It Possible. 


Thrive in this challenging new position, as you develop, implement, test and maintain engaging mobile and multi-tiered web applications. Transform health care using innovative information technology, solving real problems, developing awesome apps and creating amazing user experience. Experience true work-life balance, along with access to countless training opportunities.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
At Mattel, our vision is "Creating the Future of Play". We strive to achieve this vision primarily through our creative and enthusiastic employees who DARE to be innovative, and THRIVE in a friendly and fast-paced environment. Mattel is committed to developing employees and supporting their career goals, helping them GROW with a host of meaningful experiences and learning opportunities. And by promoting a culture of BALANCE that emphasizes working passionately and taking time to play often, we are proud of how our employees LEAD by example in all that they do!

Sproutling, A Mattel Company, is looking for a senior backend engineer to help us develop the services and API that form the foundation of a variety products that are part of our Nursery of the Future vision. It is an opportunity to work with the latest connected devices and hardware as well as with a sophisticated platform that will process large amounts of data per second. If you are looking to work with the latest technology and create an uncompromising user experience that guides them through challenges of a connected platform then this will be a rewarding opportunity.

Responsibilities

  • Design REST interfaces to hardware components with data structures that support optimal data transfer
  • Build web services in the appropriate language that are performant and inherently secure
  • Instrument Docker to build sustainable and portable environments that are easily deployed
  • Design and use SQL and NoSQL databases to support both relational and nonrelational storage requirements
  • Write testing code according to Test Driven Development best practices
  • Document web services and jobs for clarity and ease of use including outside 3rd parties
  • Ensure that all services have appropriate logging and are instrumented for monitoring and alerting
  • Leverage Kubernetes to deploy and manage a scalable infrastructure that supports high thoughput
  • Respond to system level issues as necessary to provide the best overall customer experience

Qualifications

  • Experience with the Linux operating system and the Bash shell
  • Several years of professional experience developing REST based services that support millions of users or devices
  • Ability to develop in multiple languages including Java, Ruby, Python, GO, Objective C,Swift, C or C++
  • Understanding of how to leverage, build, deploy and tune the JVM and Java based systems
  • Understanding of Continuous Integration/Deployment and tools like Jenkins
  • Excellent written and communication skills

Nice to Have

  • Past experience converting scientific or data algorithms to higher performance languages like Scala and C/C++
  • Familiarity with either websockets or MQTT as communication protocols
  • Experience using Docker for development and deployment to production environments
  • Experience with multiple cloud based infrastructures with preference given to AWS

Location

Sproutling is located in the beautiful Embarcadero part of the Financial District in downtown San Francisco. The office is steps away from the Embarcadero Bart Station and the Ferry Building. Restaurants, shops, hotels, banks and wonderful views of the bay are within a short walk of our sunny, open floor plan office.

ABOUT US

Mattel, Inc. (Nasdaq: MAT) is the worldwide leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of toys and family products. The Mattel family is comprised of such best-selling brands as Barbie®, the most popular fashion doll ever produced, Hot Wheels®, Monster High®, American Girl®, Thomas & Friends® and Fisher-Price® brands, including Little People® and Power Wheels®, as well as a wide array of entertainment-inspired toy lines. In 2013, Mattel was named as one of the "World's Most Ethical Companies" by Ethisphere Magazine. Mattel also is ranked No. 2 on Corporate Responsibility Magazine's "100 Best Corporate Citizens" list. With worldwide headquarters in El Segundo, Calif., Mattel employs nearly 40,000 people in 40 countries and territories and sells products in more than 150 nations. At Mattel, we are Creating the Future of Play! Visit us at www.mattel.com/careers, www.facebook.com/mattel or www.twitter.com/mattel or www.youtube.com/MattelRecruiter

Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer

jobs.title: Backend Server - Software Development Team Lead
jobs.content:
At Mattel, our vision is "Creating the Future of Play". We strive to achieve this vision primarily through our creative and enthusiastic employees who DARE to be innovative, and THRIVE in a friendly and fast-paced environment. Mattel is committed to developing employees and supporting their career goals, helping them GROW with a host of meaningful experiences and learning opportunities. And by promoting a culture of BALANCE that emphasizes working passionately and taking time to play often, we are proud of how our employees LEAD by example in all that they do!


Fuhu Inc., now a division of Mattel, is the leading designer, seller and innovator of “thoughtful” consumer products and services for children and families.  Creator of the nabi™ tablet, the world’s first tablet made just for kids, Fuhu provides an ecosystem of hardware, software services, and accessories that provide rich and engaging experiences.



Our Team Lead, Back End Software Developer will:

Enforce processes, utilize technological components and tools used in the software development lifecycle


Design and development software modules

jobs.title: Software Development
jobs.content:
Purpose: To support the mantra of 'Guiding Church Leaders to a Better How' by writing code to support the mission of making churches the best run, most effective organizations in the world.



Directly Responsible For:




  • Writing code to accomplish the goals of the organization

  • Troubleshooting and maintaining the software to ensure strong optimization and functionality

  • Contributing to Agile Team success



Key Competencies:




  • Self-Awareness/Feedback: Recognizes own strengths and weaknesses. Not defensive. Does not rationalize mistakes or blame others. Uses feedback mechanisms.

  • Integrity: Ironclad. Does not ethically cut corners. Earns trust of co-workers. Puts organization above self-interest. Inspires people to follow lead. Minimizes intimidation.

  • Excellence: Sets high stretch standards of performance for self and others. Has a low tolerance for mediocrity and a high sense of responsibility. Monitors client satisfaction (internal and external). Seeks simplicity.

  • Resourcefulness/Initiative: Passionately finds ways over, around, or through barriers to success. Achieves results despite lack of resources. Goes beyond the call of duty. Shows bias for action and is a result-oriented 'doer'. Reputation for being passionate and not giving up.

  • Team Builder: Achieves cohesive, effective team spirit with others. Treats others fairly and respectfully. Shares credit. Exhibits dynamism, excitement, and a positive attitude. 

  • Leading Edge: Reaches out to peers. Approachable. Leads peers to do what is best for company. Constantly benchmarks best practices and expects others to do same. Leaves a current role better than it was when started.

  • Analysis Skills: Identifies significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems and people in depth. Sorts the wheat from the chaff, determining root causes. 

  • Pragmatism: Generates sensible, realistic, practical solutions to problems. 

  • Adaptability: Not rigid. Copes effectively with complexity and change. 

  • Creativity: Generates new approaches to problems or innovations to established best practices. Shows imagination.



Experience/Education Level:




  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or equivalent relevant work experience required

  • 3+ years' PHP object-oriented programming experience required

  • Knowledge of Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methodologies 

  • Experience with back-end technologies such as Linux servers (operating system), Apache web server to power the websites, and MySQL database servers for data engine

  • Experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS (Bourbon, Compass, Foundation, Sass), PHP, SQL, Git, React JS, and React Native

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Intoximeters is currently looking for a DevOps Engineer to build and maintain the infrastructure for our customer-facing applications. Our environment is completely cloud-based, running on AWS and GCE.


Responsibilities include:



  • Deploying, configuring, and managing AWS/GCE services (EC2, S3, Route53, etc.)

  • Deploying, configuring, and managing cloud-based Linux servers and their applications.

  • Developing plans for infrastructure improvements.

  • Working closely with the team on upcoming features.

  • Maintaining the current levels of reliability, monitoring and automation.

  • Collecting and presenting metrics on system performance.

  • Managing system security and credential administration.

  • Responding to system alerts and resolving potentially complex systems issues.


Candidates should enjoy learning about new technology and value system reliability and automation. Other qualifications include:



  • Experience with Amazon Web Services and/or Google Compute Engine

  • A strong background in Linux systems administration, cloud computing, networking, and scripting.

  • Experience with at least one configuration management system (preferably Chef).

  • The ability to write clean, reliable, maintainable code in Ruby and/or other languages.

  • Linux/Unix shell scripting

  • Familiarity with several of the following:

    • Docker

    • Kubernetes

    • Nginx

    • PostgreSQL

    • Sensu

    • Jenkins

    • Elasticsearch

    • Kibana

    • Heka

    • Graphite




Team members are provided with a MacBook Pro and a generous benefit package including 401(k) and profit sharing; medical insurance; and tuition reimbursement. If you are interested, please email the hiring manager at jobs@intoxitrack.net

jobs.title: Freelance Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Palo Alto
URL: www.konsus.com

http://konsus.interviewed.com/?source=wwremotely
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • We are looking for highly creative graphic designers interested in becoming part of the ever-expanding Konsus community.
  • As part of the graphic design team, you will receive projects ranging from logo design to corporate branding.
  • These tasks are expected back in a timely manner, while maintaining high quality results.
  • We offer a steady stream of projects with the freedom to choose when, where and how much you work. Freelancers always have the option to decline a project if they are unavailable.
ABOUT KONSUS:

Konsus provides on-demand freelancers for business. We are always looking for great freelancers to help with our growing client base and increasing work load. As a freelancer working for Konsus you can work where you want, when you want and how much you want.

Companies around the world send us office tasks and we instantly assign them to pre-vetted freelancers (that would be you) based on skill and availability. We launched in August of 2015, and already have 500+ customers with some very large international clients. We work with interesting and exciting tasks in a modern way, and our mission is to create the future shape of how to do business around a new and connected globe.

ADVANTAGES OF WORKING WITH KONSUS

  • Work when you want and where you want, full flexibility
  • Receive a steady flow of work- no more searching for jobs!
  • You always get paid on time. If clients don’t pay, that’s our problem
  • Our project managers handle the clients, you do what you do best
  • We treat people in a fair and friendly manner
  • We are building a community in which we work, learn and grow together
REQUIREMENTS

  • Past graphic design experience.
  • High personal standards for quality and dependability.
  • Excellent communication skills - You will need to be fluent in English with the ability to effectively explain your thought processes and perspectives behind each decision in both written and verbal communication.
  • Include your graphic design portfolio / work samples in your application
GENERAL TERMS

  • Time is logged hourly and paid out once per month.
  • We work using Slack.
  • When on a project, you must be available until completion.
If you think Konsus is the place for you, we would love to hear from you! Please note that we receive many applications for this position and reply times will therefore vary, but we screen applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to you if you look to be a great fit for Konsus.

To apply: Please apply via http://konsus.interviewed.com/?source=wwremotely

jobs.title: IT Team Leader - OBIEE
jobs.content:
Job Summary: Under limited supervision, oversees the installation, configuration, and support to a local area network, wide area network, internet system, computers, desktops and/or mobile devices. Recommends equipment improvement or replacement. Serves as highest advanced level subject matter expert, providing authoritative guidance for professional staff. May also serve in a lead role.

Job Specific Duties: Under limited supervision, manages the daily operations, personnel of the IT Enterprise Reporting Team within the Office of IT Applications. This position is responsible for maintaining the Enterprise and Ad Hoc reports using Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) for the Department; Managing customer requests for report revisions, or development of new reports; overseeing the development, testing and quality assurance processes of Enterprise Reporting Group; migrating reporting dependencies for new versions of IT Applications or new development projects,; Monitors and optimizes system performance, Controlling and monitoring user access to secure reports; Coordinating the development of data views or other data warehouse tables to support reporting. Provides customer support and systems administration; performs upgrades and enhances system. Provides team leadership and project management.

THIS IS AN UNCLASSIFIED POSITION.

THE SELECTED APPLICANT FOR THE POSITION WILL BE SUBJECT TO A REFERENCE AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK.

PLEASE INCLUDE ALL RELEVANT JOB INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION FOR CONSIDERATION.

Entry Qualification: Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Five years of related experience OR Associate’s degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Seven years of related experience OR Nine years of related experience OR Two years of experience at the lower level Systems Administrator 3 (ITP042) or position equivalent.

Agency Specific Qualification:

  • Extensive professional experience managing complex IT related projects or professional level IT personnel
  • Experience in one of the following areas: Business Intelligence, Report/Analytics Development, Project Management, Application Development, Data/Database Development/Administration or Software Engineering
  • Data management and data quality analysis skills
  • Uses imagination to develop new ideas, solutions, or methods.
  • Ability to identify problems and create the best-suited solutions/alternatives.
  • Ability to make sound, well-informed decisions.
  • Strong management skills.
  • Works well with others in achieving team projects.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Committed to providing quality customer service.
  • Possesses strong written and oral communication skills and expresses ideas and facts to groups and individuals effectively.
  • Ability to work after hours as needed for system maintenance/deployments etc.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Four-year degree in an IT related field
  • Two or more years of work experience in using Oracle BI Publisher, OBIEE, SAP (BO/WI), Crystal reports, or Microsoft (SSRS),
  • Completion of OBIEE training or Oracle/SQL Server certifications
  • Work experience in designing, developing, and configuration of enterprise analytics/reports within OBIEE RPD, BI Publisher
  • Experience with Oracle Exalytics/Exadata
  • Demonstrated experience managing IT professionals, specifically reporting or data developers
  • Demonstrated experience providing Enterprise Systems support.
  • Completion of a graduate or advanced degree in business administration, information technology, management information systems or related field from an accredited college or university.
  • Demonstrated experience working in the Transportation industry, private or government framework.

Salary:

$70,000 per year

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobs.title: IT Team Leader – GIS
jobs.content:
Job Summary: Under limited supervision, oversees the installation, configuration, and support to a local area network, wide area network, internet system, computers, desktops and/or mobile devices. Recommends equipment improvement or replacement. Serves as highest advanced level subject matter expert, providing authoritative guidance for professional staff. May also serve in a lead role. Job Specific Duties: Leads the enterprise geographic information system (GIS) team. Serves as IT technical lead and geospatial team leader. Develops, coaches, and trains team members. Responsible for managing Esri ArcGIS Server and geodatabase day-to-day operations. Provides system backup, recovery, and restoration of Department GIS. Provides end user and IT architect/developer customer support. Manages team assigned work tasks, reviews work products to meet IT specifications/standards, and delivers results on-time. Develops and upgrades GIS applications, Esri software/geodatabases. Ensures system jobs complete successfully. Performs geospatial data loading, migration, and integration with enterprise systems. Enforces geodatabase and application security. Maintains GIS architecture, licensing, business continuity/disaster recovery plans, completes patching/upgrades, monitors system performance, usage, and growth.

THIS IS AN UNCLASSIFIED POSITION.

THE SELECTED APPLICANT FOR THE POSITION WILL BE SUBJECT TO A REFERENCE AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECK.

PLEASE INCLUDE ALL RELEVANT JOB INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION FOR CONSIDERATION.

Entry Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Five years of related experience OR Associate’s degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Seven years of related experience OR Nine years of related experience OR Two years of experience at the lower level Systems Administrator 3 (ITP042) or position equivalent.

Agency Specific Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of ArcGIS Desktop mapping, data analysis, and data editing experience
  • 5+ years of ArcGIS Server administration
  • 3+ years of ArcGIS (SDE) geodatabase development/administration within multi-user versioned environment
  • 3+ years of Python scripting or similar scripting experience
  • 3+ years of software programming/development experience
  • PL/SQL, SQL Plus query skills
  • Experience with supporting ArcGIS Server editing and publication services
  • Able to develop and deploy Esri ArcGIS Server Services and OGC services
  • Extensive professional experience managing complex IT related projects or professional level IT personnel
  • Knowledge of Esri Roads and Highways, linear referencing, dynamic segmentation, geospatial and mapping concepts such as spatial analysis, map projections, etc.
  • Knowledge of IT security concepts and implementation patterns within ArcGIS Server
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and teamwork skills
  • Accountable and results oriented
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated experience delivering results within projected schedule, costs, or specification
  • Improving team productivity/efficiency to meet agency goals/objectives
  • Demonstrated ability to train, direct and evaluate team members; able to manage a diverse workforce, provide feedback, coach staff, and implement corrective action.
  • Is accountable for the operation, performance, and quality of the agency GIS
  • Exercises judgment in decision making and experienced in developing viable solutions within constraints
  • Ability to work on-call, after hours, or on weekends as required for system deployments, maintenance, or upgrades

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of ArcGIS (SDE) geodatabase development/administration within multi-user versioned environment
  • 3+ years Esri ArcGIS Server Javascript API development experience with HTML5 and SharePoint 2010/2013
  • Hands on work experience in installing, configuring, or supporting Esri Roads and Highways
  • Esri ArcGIS Desktop administration experience with Citrix
  • Four-year degree in an IT or GIS related field
  • Possession of GIS Professional (GISP) or Esri Technical Certifications

Special Qualifications:

  • ActiveBatch Job SchedulingIT T
  • Oracle database development/administration experience
  • GPS data collection experience
  • Oracle Spatial SDO Geometry experience

Salary:

$68,000 per year

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobs.title: Chief Technology Officer/Lead Developer growing into CTO
jobs.content:
We are looking for a CTO or Lead Engineer that is ambitious enough to spearhead new tech businesses in Asia that will help the underdogs, be better, faster and take down goliaths. You will start a tech team from scratch(you may bring your current team onboard), working on the programming efforts, setting the tech stack, coaching future tech talents, right up to designing their workstations and environment that the team will be working in, such as bringing back cubicles! (if you can get on board by 31st August).


We are a 50 odd year old family business in Singapore that specializes in air pollution control and have seen various economic cycles. We have transformed ourselves as a humble coffee machine roaster manufacturer in a small shophouse during the 1960s, to a well known and trusted environmental technology company in Asia.


Till date, most(or we dare say 90%) of the traditional coffee that Singaporeans drink are still roasted on our machines. This includes the 3 in 1 coffees. Our heritage is deep. You, as our CTO will be spearheading the transformation for the future together with the team. You will have the backing and support from the current business to enable your success.   


As our CTO, you will work together with the new generation of professionals in the family business to start new businesses in areas not limited to Fintech, Insurtech, Ai, Big Data, Analytics and IoT where the CTO and tech team will have shared equity in these new business. After completing the initial projects, the CTO and tech team can work together to propose your new businesses, which we can support or help find investors.  


Leading by example, you are able to inspire others and coach others to grow stronger and to seek continuous improvement, meeting the demands where teamwork, responsibility and integrity are maintained despite the challenges. You will be able to communicate and present effectively, internally and externally as you will be the face of our technology. 


Apart from writing high-quality, self-documenting code using test-driven development techniques, you will be required to produce budgets and expense controls for the tech department, hire and retain top tech talents who share our common purpose. 


Remuneration & benefits
The position includes a market-based salary, milestone bonus for the first year, insurance, health benefits and allowances for travel. You will have the freedom to define the dress code, work hours, select tools and systems. You will be a major influence on the team culture. 


If you need to relocate, we will provide the assistance to get the required work permit for you and advising you on good places to stay in Singapore. You will be family as time goes by. Did we say we that age is only a number? 


Questions?
Feel free to have a chat over hangout/skype/whatsapp/wechat to discuss more!

jobs.title: DataOps Engineer
jobs.content:
This is an opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial company in a quickly changing market.  East Daley Capital is a team of highly motivated professionals focused on using granular financial data as well as fundamental supply and demand data to identify over and under-valued assets in the North American Energy Sector.  We need an enthusiastic, creative and motivated individual to join our team and help make it happen.


East Daley Capital is looking for a DataOps Engineer to help drive innovative solutions to help the business collect, organize, visualize and deliver complex energy and financial data sets.  In this role you will be responsible for helping to develop an end to end process for a state of the art data center.  You will have the responsibility for the design, access, and implementation of East Daley’s extensive database.  To be successful you will need the ability to recognize trends and put puzzles together that are relevant to understanding value creation in the intersection of data sets.

jobs.title: Mobile Application Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a cross platform/Android developer to help us bring our open source geospatial platform to mobile users. 



The world is seeing an explosion in the amount and variety of location-based information. At the same time, open source software is making better analytical tools more widely available.



Boundless is at the intersection: we develop open source platforms that make it easier to manage and share geospatial data.



This is a great opportunity to join a growing business, solve interesting technical problems, and wear the mantle of Android ambassador in our fantastic team.



Responsibilities




  • Develop mobile components and applications that leverage the OpenGeo Suite

  • Work with customers to gather requirements and propose solutions

  • Participate in robust open source communities that reward great engineering

  • Create documentation and provide technical support, helping users get more out of Boundless software



You Offer




  • Outstanding engineering talent proven by great results and significant open source contributions

  • 3+ years of Android development experience, and in-depth understanding of the Android SDK and its apps development ecosystem, including subtle differences between OS versions and manufacturer implementations.

  • Ability to contribute in multiple languages. 

  • A working knowledge of SQLite

  • Hands-on experience developing and supporting reusable Android components. You write well-abstracted, reusable and efficient code.

  • Interest in teaching and training others on technical topics.



Nice to Have




  • Knowledge of GIS/geospatial software, particularly PostGIS, GeoServer, and/or OpenLayers

  • A familiarity with React/React Native

  • A knowledge of functional reactive programming (RxJS, RxJava, Reactive Cocoa)

  • Building low latency real time systems

  • A knowledge Objective-C, Swift, Java, Javascript with ES6, Clojure



We Offer



Competitive salaries, top-notch benefits (stock options, 3 weeks of vacation, medical/dental/vision, 401k with match), and fantastic colleagues. Our casual-yet-focused environment is a uniquely satisfying place for high performers. Most importantly, we offer the opportunity to help us build an innovative company that spreads and supports open source software and principles.



About Boundless



Boundless is a small but growing organization focused on bringing the best enterprise open source geospatial software to organizations and governments around the world. Our team is distributed from Austria to Argentina, with offices in Washington DC, New Orleans, St Louis, and Victoria, BC. For this position we will work with candidates near our office and remote.

jobs.title: Senior Software/Web Developer
jobs.content:
Berlin AI fintech company with beautiful lakeside office further builds out its team


SMACC is a technology company that helps small and medium enterprises master their financial processes with beautiful, intuitive software and superior customer service.


https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/28/goodbye-accountants-startup-builds-ai-to-automate-all-your-accounting/


We need your technical know-how to revolutionize the way businesses operate!


We are looking for an experienced Senior Software/Web Developer (m/f) who amazes us every day. It is not just about beautiful design but about implementing it in a technically brilliant way that is forward-looking and reliable.


Your Mission:



  • You want to be part of a development team that works closely with the product and UX team.

  • Your focus is on the implementation of high-performance multi-device web pages.

  • You keep an eye on new technologies and innovative approaches.

  • You have high security and quality standards in your applications.

  • You work fast with a lot of love to detail down to the last pixel.

  • You are an agile thinker and love clean structures and processes.


Your Profile:



  • University degree in computer science or training with the appropriate background.

  • Several years of experience in the implementation of complex cross-browser / device JavaScript applications.

  • You have expert knowledge of JavaScript front end and back end technologies, e.g. Ember, Angular JS, Sails.js, React, or similar technologies.

  • You have extensive practical knowledge of design interfaces for web and mobile.

  • You have many years of experience with continuous integration and delivery processes, their implementation in an agile environment. Experience with the Atlassian stack is a plus.


Your Motivation:



  • For you the fun starts with the details and development of perfect cross-browser / device applications.

  • You are excited about user interfaces and innovative, seamless user experience.

  • You are a creative and independent person with a structured yet flexible approach to tackle challenges.

  • You are excited about innovation and new perspectives.

  • You feel comfortable in an environment that appreciates your great problem solving skills and your attention to details.

  • You want to use both your analytical skills and your creative spirit.


Our Offer:



  • A creative corporate culture with a common and visionary goal.

  • A competitive compensation package composed of base salary and company stock participation.

  • A professional working atmosphere with a healthy dose of fun during and after work.

  • A learning environment which challenges and encourages you.

  • An interesting and challenging task with a high degree of autonomy.

  • And of course fresh fruits, the best craft beer and artisanal coffee.


Become part of our team. We're looking forward to meeting you!


Just send us your CV, a few sentences why we need you and work samples via email to career@smacc.io. You'll be hearing from us shortly.

jobs.title: Fullstack Developer / CTO
jobs.content:
PrintPeter brings companies and students together. With more than 1.5 million printed pages, 15.000 sign ups within the first month, and brands such as Microsoft, Lieferando or Amorelie, Printpeter has established itself as the leading platform for sponsoring students’ documents. Our service is a win-win, as it reduces student expenditures and gives brands a unique advertising possibility to a highly desired target group. Our system was developed over the course of 2 months by 2 freelance developers. Our product is BOTH digital & print, as our system connects both to a hybrid advertising space. Now we are looking for someone, who will take over the development in-house and continue the development journey of PrintPeter.

We are looking for a

Senior Backend / Frontend Developer (m/f)

Your tasks:

  • You will take over the full development of the System behind PrintPeter and will nurture and improve it
  • You will create new add-ons and integrate tools into our system in order to expand our functionalities
  • You will manage, organize and supervise all our data collection in the Backend

Your capabilities:

  • You know PHP / MySQL / HTML / CSS / Javascript / Larval / & more
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in the field
  • You have a precise and systematic workflow
  • You have a solution-orientated work ethic

Your benefits:

  • We offer a fair and considerable monthly pay with a performance based bonus system
  • You are able to work in an environment where your input is valued
  • You will be working in one of the most renowned working spaces - the factory Berlin
  • You will be part of a well-financed and ambitious Start Up

If you are interested in working with a motivated and driven team, appreciate a leveled hierarchy, and want to revolutionize a market, then send your application to jobs@printpeter.de.

If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact Charly: +49 / 30 692 007 842

jobs.content:
• Design, develop and maintain our platform

  • Dedicate yourself to build a well-tested and scalable web application

  • Planning, implementing and maintaining the API

  • Customizing the system in order to meet the business needs of the company

jobs.title: Developer
jobs.content:
The Retail Digital Channels team requires experienced software developers to lead in the delivery of software assets for the Retail Digital Channels portfolio. The candidate to fill this position should have experience integrating multiple applications in a microservices architecture and have hands-on experience using the following technologies:
*RESTful web services * SOAP * JSPONAPI's * JSON over HTTPS * JMS * Apache Fuse
The candidate will assist in the delivery of a number of strategic programs, enable communication between delivery units & management teams by their work predominately focused on software development. The candidate will be expected to manage high quality software delivery including the writing, agreeing with partners and successful delivery of Behavioural Driven Development (BDD) and Test Driven Development (TDD) automated test assets; as well as the coding of the implementation of those assets for Internet Banking, Mobile and other related channel software deliverables.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

* Lead teams of software engineers on large scale distributed solutions
* Mentor and role model both peer and junior developers
* Be willing to learn; to share and receive code reviews recommendations in a positive development spirit always working to improve yourself and your colleagues
* Take complex problems and find simple elegant solutions
* Write code that "humans can understand"
* Embrace DevOps principles and actively work to improve each stage of the delivery process
* Be Agile in a collaborative and creative environment
* Be able to manage creative and dynamic work in balance with the need to deliver in a disciplined manner within a strict regulatory environment
* Above all, be passionate about the software you write and be a person who loves technology, collaboration and positive change
Major programs - Digital Transformation (Strategic platform), Digital Transformation (Tactical solutions), regulatory work, Group Digital Experience and Proof of Concept projects.

Qualifications and Skills

* Bachelor of Computer Science or Computer Engineering
* Experience in delivering software in a regulated environment, ideally financial services
* Proven skills in co-ordination, staff management and leadership working with vendors and internal teams
* Software development predominately within a Java, OSGI, Micro-services based software stack
* Manage user story workflows and agreement/approvals with business/QA teams on quality standards
* Ability to successfully engage with and deliver for a diverse stakeholder community
* Automated testing (TDD/BDD), DevOps and Kanban/Scrum delivery, ideally with Cucumber/Ruby experience
Nice to have
* NoSQL experience in a technology such as HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc
* ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark, FluentD
* An API Gateway technology using json/json-api
* Experience delivering a real world microservices based solution

Diversity and Inclusion

Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Test and Delivery Engineering group is modernizing SCB's DevOps capability with a focus on efficiency, automation, and improved transparency. The new DevOps pipeline will run from requirement, user story, and task management in JIRA, through source control, to automated build and packaging, to automated provisioning of cloud-based environments, to automated deploy, and test execution. This is a challenging project that will have significant research, development, integration, and operations components.

The DevOps Early Adopter Programme is being formed to work with leading teams across the bank who have more advanced and urgent needs of the DevOps pipeline. It will embed DevOps engineers within each early adopter team to support them in their DevOps needs while staying aligned with the long term vision for the DevOps pipeline. This will be a cross-functional team with cross over between development and operations.

We are seeking talented and motivated individuals for the role of Senior DevOps Engineer. These persons will work with early adopter teams to define, implement, and roll out the DevOps components they need. They will be experienced DevOps professionals who have configured, deployed, and supported the components of a typical DevOps pipeline. They will be mature individuals who are comfortable working in an agile environment with critical peer review of design and code. They will have experience in working closely with the programmers to come up with the best solutions and systems.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

* Manage DevOps pipeline for early adopter teams
* Work with early adopter teams to identify their specific, unusual needs
* Work with core DevOps Engineering team to build solutions for early adopters
* Deploy and maintain custom, team-specific DevOps solutions for early adopters
* Maintain team-specific infrastructure for early adopter teams
* First level of debugging for systems and networking problems in the DevOps pipeline

Qualifications and Skills

Required
* Self-starter, capable of working without direction and able to deliver projects from scratch
* Strong DevOps toolchain experience: JIRA, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Artifactory
* Configuration and deployment tools experience - Ansible, SaltStack, Chef, or Puppet
* Strong scripting skills - Python, Ruby, or similar; Perl at a minimum
* Cloud deployment and systems management experience - AWS
* Strong knowledge of UNIX and TCP/IP - must understand strace and tcpdump output
* Undergraduate level qualification with Bachelor in Engineering or Computer Science
* Strong English communication skills

Highly Desirable
* Breadth of knowledge - operating systems, networking, distributed computing
* Prior experience in investment banking operations

How To Apply

You can search and view current opportunities across our organisation and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com and selecting Careers. To help speed up your application, please note the following:

- You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role

- Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information)
- We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application

It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience.

Closing Dates

The closing date for application is 31 July 2016. Please note all closing dates are given in Hong Kong Time (GMT + 8 hours). We aim to respond to successful applicants within four weeks and will keep a record or your application in our database so that we can contact you when suitable vacancies arise in future.

Diversity and Inclusion

Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

jobs.title: Campus Receptionist – East End, Immediate Opening
jobs.content:
The Campus Receptionist assists the YES Prep Campus through administrative, office support, and special projects. The Receptionist owns the office support piece on campus and facilitates an efficient work environment for all employees, in addition to serving as a translator for the administrative team. As a member of the Main Office Team, this position will manage the front desk and administer the daily functions of keeping the office operating efficiently.

ILLUSTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Greet and assist all incoming parents, students, and visitors
  • Maintain and administer the telephone system by answering and processing all incoming calls in an efficient and rapid manner; be solutions oriented in managing telephone system.
  • Maintain appealing physical environment including reception area, storage rooms, conference rooms, and other rooms as requested
    Assist in student attendance tracking
  • Provide support for teachers, staff, students and parents as requested
  • Filter and distribute office mail and faxes
  • Help manage and facilitate Main Office procedures such as supply requests, copy requests, laminating requests, and other requests as needed
  • Implement standards, policies, and procedures for filing, records maintenance, and other clerical services
  • Serve as the medical attendee for minor student issues and concerns as they arise on campus
  • Manage daily administrative operations including establishing work priorities, and resolving problems related to day-to-day operations of the office
  • Create school monthly calendars
  • Additional duties as assigned

PROFESSIONAL EXPECTATIONS:

  • Demonstrate behavior that is professional, ethical, and responsible;
  • Participate in workshops, seminars, and conferences to enhance knowledge and skills;
  • Demonstrate knowledge, and support of YES Prep Schools’ mission, values, standards, policies and procedures, confidentiality standards, Employee Field Guide expectations, and code of ethical behavior as stated in the Field Guide;
  • Ensure compliance with all state and federal laws, local board policies, administrative guidelines, and the Texas Educators’ Code of Ethics;
  • Serve as appropriate role model for YES Prep colleagues, students, staff, and parents;
  • Conduct self in a professional manner at all times;
  • Ability to perform a variety of tasks, often changing assignments on short notice, with little to no direction;
  • Ability to communicate effectively and appropriately with others.

QUALIFICATIONS:

The ideal candidate for this position will possess the following:

Education/Certification:

  • Associates Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Must have at least 2 years of an exemplary record working in a fast-paced office environment

Skills and Mindsets:

  • Bilingual in Spanish (required);
  • Excellent organizational skills including time management and follow-up;
  • Ability to anticipate and resolve problems;
  • Ability to analyze, develop, establish, and maintain efficient office work flow and administrative processes
  • Strong command of word processing including exemplary spelling and grammar skills
  • Excellent records maintenance skills
  • Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality
  • Willingness to participate in workshops, seminars, and conferences to enhance knowledge and skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Outlook (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Belief in and commitment to the mission and core value of YES Prep Public Schools;
  • Openness to giving and receiving frequent feedback;
  • Demonstrated ability to work on a team;
  • A dedication to learn, grow, and develop as a professional;
  • Belief that every student can and will achieve;
  • Ability to work urgently in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment;
  • Strong written communication skills;
  • Ability to juggle multiple tasks and initiatives at once;
  • Detail-oriented and self-directed;
  • Initiator, problem-solver, and creative thinker;
  • Ability to maintain emotional control under stress.
  • Physical Demands/Environmental Factors:
  • Frequent prolonged and irregular hours of duty
  • Some light manual labor
  • Endure inclement weather conditions to provide for student safety

COMMITMENT AND COMPENSATION:

Length of Work Year:

This is a full time, non-exempt, hourly position; evening and weekend commitments also may be required

Compensation and Benefits:

Compensation commensurate with experience; YES offers a friendly and committed team of colleagues, and a comprehensive benefits plan including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability, plus supplemental policies, and retirement programs, including the Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS) and a 401(k) plan.

  • The forgoing statements describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this job and are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills that may be required. YES Prep Public Schools is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, pregnancy, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Experienced C++ Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

jobs.title: Lead Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
The position is based in Palo Alto, California where you will be joining Data Theorem’s core team of engineers. The work atmosphere will be very relaxed but your work and contributions will have a tremendous *and* direct impact on the company.


The main responsibility for this position is to work on our customer-facing web portal, which helps mobile application developers understand and fix security and privacy issues found in their mobile Apps by our scanner. We want an engineer who can take the portal to the next level, making it better, faster, and more useful, regardless of the user's (reasonably recent) browser or OS. The portal is the main customer-facing interface of our product, and the better it is, the more security and privacy issues will get fixed within our customers' mobile applications.


Our backend services are running on Google Cloud (mainly Python on App Engine) and our frontend is written in AngularJS. This is a lead role so there is lot of flexibility and opportunity when it comes to choosing the tools and more generally the frontend stack. For example, if there are compelling reasons to do so, we could be convinced to switch away from Angular.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description



Are you an accomplished full stack software engineer who specializes in building usable, scalable and secure web applications? Are you willing to take ownership of big problems and drive creative solutions? Do you enjoy mentoring developers and helping to scale a successful organization? Do you want to apply your skills to revolutionize the clinical trial process and help bring new drugs to market faster? Through a combination of smart technology and unique relationships, DrugDev is transforming the way that clinical trials are run. 


As Senior Software Engineer, you will play an integral role as we evolve and expand the scope of our offering. 



We need someone who will:



  • Act as hands-on technical lead in driving design and development of new features and applications

  • Mentor technical resources and help us to continue to grow and recruit great people.

  • Provide technical thought leadership and help evaluate emerging technologies and 3rd party products

  • Identify opportunities for process and tooling improvements and drive implementation

  • Coordinate release management activities, including alignment with quality and validation processes



And is looking for an opportunity to:



  • Work with motivated, smart, efficient and committed people

  • See virtually all aspects of a growing, entrepreneurial company

  • Build expertise in an area that is essential to the health of society and critical to biopharma companies: clinical trials

  • Lead and assist with challenging projects critical to company success

jobs.title: C# Programmer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:




  • Design, develop and maintain software systems using C# and ASP.NET (MVC5) according to requirement specifications. 

  • Test the developed software to meet the data, logical, functional requirements, and document the test results according to Unit Test document

jobs.title: Geophysical Software Developer
jobs.content:
DownUnder GeoSolutions' reputation for excellence in seismic data processing and geophysical interpretation is in no small part due to a suite of powerful software developed by a small, nimble team of engineers. The DUG software team builds tools for a wide range of tasks from massively-parallel cluster computation to desktop 3D visualisation. The software is not only used by our internal team of geophysicists, but also sold commercially.

We're looking to add a few superstars to our team - the merely great need not apply. Superstars are analytical, focused, creative, and passionate about high-quality software. It doesn't matter if you have a degree, dropped out of school, or how much experience you have; if you're in the top 1% of your craft, you know who you are.

Your colleagues will be a small group of extremely smart, energetic, productive problem solvers. You would work on ambitious software challenges: large-scale data processing; on-the-fly manipulation and visualization; high-performance 3D graphics; design and development of tight, task-focused user interfaces. Whatever software challenges you're interested in solving, there's an excellent chance that you'll find them in what we do.

We feel that most of our competitors have lost their focus on their users, and on the rapid pace of scientific development in the community we serve. We offer a different type of solution, and a fully transparent pricing model. Our presence as a fast-moving, innovative upstart who focus entirely on our customers has been extremely well-received.

The requirements for the position are simple: excellence in critical thinking and problem solving; expertise developing software (in any form); good taste when it comes to software design; and being a great person we love working with. Let us know you read the whole job description by including the word ‘shibboleth’ in the subject of your email. Anything else is a bonus. Don't know anything about geoscience? Doesn't matter. You're a superstar, and you can learn.

So if you do in two hours what the rest of your team accomplishes in a week; if you taught yourself to write software; if you want to work with other superstars of your pedigree; if you want to topple dinosaurs; then we want to hear from you.



  • high- and detailed-level design of complex geophysical software,

  • implementation, testing, and maintenance of software in Java and/or C,

  • inspection and maintenance of software written by other members of the team,

  • becoming conversant in basic geophysics and petrophysics, common industry workflows, unique DUG algorithms, and competitors' technologies,

  • acting as 3rd-level technical support, for otherwise-unresolvable customer issues,

  • supporting internal users in the company's service divisions, often involving critical, time-sensitive issues,

  • providing and receiving regular, constructive feedback to and from your peers,

  • collaborating on priority and scheduling for rapid product iterations,

  • acting as mentor for an exceptional intern or junior developer.

jobs.title: Junior/Mid-Level Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Agencies please do not apply, we are not interested.  We are interested in U.S. residents only, this is full time remote work 9 to 5 type job.


Are you ready to work from home with a flexible schedule with a team of similarly motivated self starters?   Have direct responsibility to make an immediate difference?  See your code in action in days, not months or years? Work on interesting problems across a wide range of technologies and platforms and perhaps introduce some of your own?  Our 20 year old travel technology company with over a billion reservations to our credit needs a junior to mid level software engineer/developer. Duties include developing, collaborating, and working closely with others on our web-based business software to meet the needs of our closely coordinated business unit.


Responsibilities:



  • Serve as a developer implementing enterprise web applications using API driven .NET technologies (C# / VB.Net / JavaScript / AngularJS / Bootstrap) to deliver products to the travel industry as part of ongoing business initiatives

  • Enhance and support existing large, mission-critical .NET applications that support core functions of the business as needed

  • Assist in uncovering and implementing ways to improve the level of customer service, quality, and efficiency of the company

  • Develop new features and make modifications to existing features

  • Test and debug applications to ensure client needs are met

  • Various other duties as assigned
